05 February (on or before). A motor-taxi resisted a bribe to a police officer, who then attempted to seize the drivers' bike. At which time, other drivers reportedly threw stones at the police officer, who responded by shooting and killing the driver.
On Feb 5th, a man suspected of trafficking human organs was lynched by a mob in Messica. Police fired into the air and used tear gas to disperse the mob. Three people were seriously injured.
On Feb 5th, a mob lynched to death a suspected thief in Nyakabungo village near Muhanga (Rukiga distict, coordinates used). An accomplice escaped the mob. Police are investigating the incident.

On Feb 5 2019, a number of Palestinians were injured when they clashed with Israeli forces in the village of Abu Shukhaydim, northwest of Ramallah. Israeli forces used live fire, rubber-coated bullets and tear gas canisters to disperse the crowd.
On Feb 5 2019, two Palestinians were injured in the head and leg with rubber-coated bullets when Israeli forces clashed with Palestinians as they raided the town of Kobar, northwest of Ramallah.
On Feb 5 2019, rioters attacked settler vehicles in Bayt Ummar with stones.
On Feb 5, four activists were injured when rioting factions of BCL clashed at Chattogram College in Chittagong city over establishing supremacy at campus.

On 5 Feb, rioters vandalized Hindu temples and desecrated the idols in different villages under Besagarahalli police station limits (Mandya, Karnataka). They took away the idol of the goddess of the Pattaladamma temple and broke it into pieces. The head of the idol was found in a nearby agriculture field. In Pannedoddi village, culprits ransacked the sanctum sanctorums of Hanuman temples. In Hombalegowdanadoddi village, culprits made away with bronze statues of Lord Hanuman.

On 5 Feb, rioters vandalized four Hindu temples and desecrated the idols in different villages under Besagarahalli police station limits (Mandya, Karnataka). In Belatur village, culprits severely damaged the idol of the Jade Muneswara temple.
On 5 Feb, in Pune area (Pune, Maharastra), four unidentified assailants assaulted an NCP corporator for unknown reasons. No other information was provided.

On 5 February, at least 25 people attacked a young interfaith couple (Muslim girl, SC boy) who were living together against the wishes of their families in Barhara village. They left the village, and on arrival in Baidoula village (Siddharthnagar, Uttar Pradesh) they were assaulted by a mob and lewd comments were made, apparently without any provocation. The incident was filmed.

04 February (on or around). Eight men stoned three suspected burglars around Ga-Marishane village, leaving two killed.

On Feb 4th, residents of Lusaka's Chainda compound descended on a witch doctor who was accused of bewitching members of a family, some of whom had died. The mob tied tyres around the man with the intention of burning him to death, but police intervened. The man remained seriously injured and was left with a broken jaw.

YPG fighters raided the village of Khazouk in the vicinity of Tal Brak in Al-Hasakeh in search of deserters. YPG fighters left the village after skirmishes with the residents who took up sticks and stones as weapons. No injuries or fatalities reported.

On 4/2/2019, ahead of the 8th anniversary of Bahraini February 2011 uprising, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Diraz.

On Feb 4, activists of BCL attacked and injured quota reform movement leader at Dhaka University campus (Shahbagh, Dhaka). The attack happened when quota reform movement leader went to submit the petition to VC demanding establishment of polling centres at campus.

Around 4 February, in the aftermath of an argument between a BKU member farmer and his wife led to the man's inlaws and villagers beating up his son in his own home, in Bathinda (Bathinda, Punjab). No further details.

On 4 Feb, in Guntur city (Guntur, AP), rioters threw beer bottles at the recently inaugurated Jana Sena office at the Inner Ring Road for an unknown reason.

On 4 February, one person was killed and 5 injured in a clash between two communities in Chatrela village of Muzaffarnagar district (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh). The initial clash was over kite flying, but quickly escalated to a fight between over a dozen men of two families.

On February 4, locals vandalized windows and emergency room of Birta City Hospital in Birtamod city (Jhapa district, Mechi), alleging doctors of medical negligence in the death of a two year old. Police officers had to resort to firing tear gas shells to bring the situation under control.

On February 4, locals allegedly vandalized the Tehsil Municipal Authority's squad office and attacked personnel at the office in Sheikhupura city (assumed based on city line) (Sheikhupura, Punjab), injuring a squad member.

On 3 Feb, in Kaithoon area (Rajasthan), a constable died during a clash among his family members and another group over a road accident. The other group were armed with firearms and stones. At least 6 were injured, 4 in critical condition.

On Feb 3rd, a police officer shot and wounded two boda boda drivers as they (along with others) attempted to storm the police station at Kasingo (Hoima). The mob had been trying to reclaim their motorbikes, which had been impounded during an earlier street brawl which the police had dispersed.

On Feb 3 2019, a number of Palestinian youths suffered tear-gas suffocation after violent clashes with Israeli forces broke out in the village of al Khader, south of Bethlehem. Soldiers fired sound and tear gas canisters and rubber-coated metal bullets.

On Feb 3 2019, a Palestinian youth was injured when clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinian students and residents of al Lubban al Sharqiyah in the town. Soldiers chased students on their way home from school which provoked residents and led to clashes. Israeli forces fired rubber-coated steel bullets and tear gas canisters and blocked both the eastern and northern entrances to the village.

On Feb 3, at least 10 persons were injured at Jagannath University (JnU) in Suratpur, Dhaka and five University buses were vandalised during a clash on the university campus between two factions of JnU unit of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL). Rivalry and supremacy are being considered the reasons behind the clash.
On February 3, a CPI-M party office was burnt down by suspected BJP members in Srinagar village in Sabroom area (South Tripura, Tripura).
03 February. A woman was severely beaten by locals after she was accused of stealing potatoes in Biganda. The woman suffered a miscarriage as a result of the attack.

On Feb. 3 2019, there were clashes in Thessaloniki city centre between non-Greek nationals for unknown reasons that resulted in the injury of a 21-year-old Pakistani national. Police forces arrived at the scene, as well as an ambulance to transport him to the hospital.

On Feb 2 2019, a number of Palestinian youths suffered tear-gas suffocation after violent clashes with Israeli forces broke out in the village of al Khader, south of Bethlehem. Soldiers fired sound and tear gas canisters and rubber-coated metal bullets.
On Feb 2, a madrassa teacher and an imam of a mosque were beaten by a mob allegedly for preventing a child marriage at Hatia upazila (Noakhali, Chittagong).
On Feb 2, at least two people were beaten to death and two others injured by an angry mob on the suspicion of being thieves in Bariyabah area, Kaliakar upazila (Gazipur, Dhaka).
On Feb 2, following a heated argument over UP elections candidacy, two groups of nominees clashed in Bagharpara upazila (Jessore, Khulna) resulting in 10 people getting injured.

On 2 Feb, in Raipur city (Raipur, Chhattisgarh), a scuffle occurred among BJP members during a district level meeting of the party. A journalist sustained minor injuries as he was assaulted by the district president and 3 local office-bearers over recording a video of the scuffle. The rioters were later arrested.
On February 2, three persons assaulted a doctor and nurse staff of Chandbali Community Health Centre (CHC) in Chandbali city (Bhadrak, Odisha). The reason behind the attack is not reported.

On February 2, a clash broke out between two Muslim groups in Chakraghatta rural municipality near Malangwa area (Sarlahi district, Janakpur), over issues related to Islamic religious school's expenditures. Two persons sustained injuries following the incident.

On February 2, cadres of Nepal Student Union, the student wing of the main opposition party Nepali Congress, torched a government vehicle in Pokhara metropolis (Kaski district, Gandaki). Police have arrested five persons allegedly involved in the incident.
02 February. Two journalists covering a Lamuka rally were assaulted and injured by Lamuka supporters.

Traffic was disrupted. There were no injuries or arrests.
On 1 Feb, in Surat city (Surat, Gujarat), a clash involving sticks occurred between security guards and another group over parking vehicles in a limited space. Both groups suffered head injuries.
On Feb 1st, a citizen of about 40 years old was beaten to death by unknown individuals and abandoned on the public road in the city of Chimoio. The body showed signs of beating and strangulation.
On Feb 1 2019, Israeli forces clashed with Palestinian rioters in Leghmayer near Ramallah. Israeli soldiers fired tear gas and opened fire at the Palestinians who in turn threw rocks.

On February 1, activists of BJP and of the TMC clashed over the removal of posters, banners and placards of the Prime Minister in Durgapur city (Paschim Bardhaman, West Bengal), ahead of his visit to the city.
On February 1, a youth accused of raping a divyang (disabled) girl was beaten to death by locals, in Bamebari police station area (Keonjhar, Odisha). The police later detained five people.
On 1 February, unidentified people threw rocks at Train 18 near Shakurbasti in Delhi (Delhi) on its way to conduct a trial run. Police did not apprehend those responsible.

On 1 February, a pregnant woman's family allegedly beat her, attempting to cause a miscarriage and clashed with the police officers who responded to her emergency call, in Varyam Nagar village (Amritsar, Punjab). She said the assault was over a dowry demand.

On February 1, a group of suspected BJP members set on fire the house of a CPI-M leader in Santir Bazar city (Tripura), seriously burning his wife. She was sent to hospital for treatment. There have been ongoing attacks in the state against members of opposition parties.

On 1 February, three people were injured in a clash between Kisan Union farmers and UP housing & development employees in Sevai village near Lucknow (Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh). The farmers attacked the engineers with stones and wooden/iron rods, as well as setting two motorcycles on fire, in an attempt to prevent a construction project over a land dispute.

On February 1, a woman was killed by her nephew on the suspicion of witchcraft, in Jauliyaguri village under Sidli police station area (Chirang, Assam). The woman was visiting a relative's house, when the man followed her and killed her with a piece of wood. He claimed she was responsible for his wife illness. He was later arrested.
Assumed on 1 Feb, in Jaffna area, residents forcefully stopped a man from abducting a Tamil girl. The man was handed over to the police who admitted him to a hospital.
On February 1, a vehicle used for election campaign of HDP was attacked and damaged by unknown people in Van province.
On Jan 31 2019, Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian shepherds in the Al Farisiyah area in Tubas and chased them away by rock throwing. No injuries were reported.

Students burned tyres and threw rocks at soldiers, Israeli forces then fired live ammunition and tear gas at students to disperse them. Three students were injured, two are in critical condition and dozen others are suffering from tear-gas inhalation.
On Jan 31 2019, Israeli forces shot and detained a Palestinian youth near al-Khader village in southern Bethlehem as he was allegedly throwing a Molotov cocktail at an Israeli watchtower.
On Jan 31 2019, clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces. Israeli forces fired live bullets, tear and sound bombs at Palestinian rioters, wounding two of them.

On January 31, locals assaulted a school headmaster and tonsured him for misbehaving with three minor girl students, in Nuhamalia upper primary school in the village, under Morada block area (Mayurbhanj, Odisha).

On January 31, three brothers tortured and tried to kill a woman on the suspicion of being a witch, in No. 2 Premhara village in Barapathar police station area (Golaghat, Assam). They claimed the victim was behind the ill-health of their mother. The woman managed to escape and the attackers were later arrested.

On January 31, locals reportedly assaulted and held a team of Peshawar Electric Supply Company (PESCO) employees hostage in Badhber suburban area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP), while the team was on an operation to curb power theft.

actor2: Police Forces of Central African Republic (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: 31 January. During the night, 18 prisoners escaped from the Mbaiki prison.

On January 31, two groups of hawkers clashed in New Market area, Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), over the encroachment of pavements in the area. Police arrested several hawkers from both groups and later released them on bail.

On 31 Jan, in Karnataka state, Bajrang Dal men attacked elderly Muslim women over beef, in one of the many cases reported of cow lynching incidents the country. No further information was provided. [size=no report]

On Jan.31 2019, an unknown number of Pakistani and Afghan men clashed in Omonoia in Central Athens. 25 people have been detained. An Afghan national who was stabbed with a sharp object died in hospital and another five - two Pakistanis and one Afghan - were injured and hospitalised.

30 January (on or around). Residents from Masoyi outside Mbombela, Mpumalanga attacked an elderly couple for allegedly poisoning and killing their grandson. They set the couple on fire with a burning tyre, leaving them injured.
30 January. Community members burned the house in which an alleged rapist was staying in Tafelsig and pelted police who interevened with stones.
On Jan 30, Palestinians reportedly threw Molotov cocktails at settler vehicles near Hizma. No injuries were reported.

On 30 Jan 2019, in Kulai district, Johor state, three 20-year-olds allegedly attacked a police post at Felda Taib Andak settlement with hoes. It was believed to be a revenge attack on the policeman for the arrest of their friend. The police post was partly damaged and the three men were arrested.

On Jan 30, at least five activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured as two groups of the organisation clashed at a rally in the capital (Suratpur, Dhaka). The clash ensued following an altecation over holding 71th anniversary event.
On Jan 30, two robbers were lynched by a mob in Kaliganj (Gazipur, Dhaka) after they were caught committing robbery.
On 30 Jan, rioters allegedly clashed with police in Pulwama district town (J&K). It is unclear what prompted the clash.

29 January (on or around). Vigilantes from Motherwell, Port Elizabeth beat a man to death after a seven-year-old girl claimed that she had been raped by the man. They later realised that he was innocent.

On or around January 29th, demonstrators set fire to cars in El Sajana nieghbourhood of Khartoum. A group of masked men chased some of the demonstrators into a nearby house, where they beat them and the residents of the property.
29 January. Inmates attacked a British prisoner with razor blades in a Somali jail. He survived.

On 27 January, a group of villagers caught and held three kidnapping suspects before handing them over to police in Gadoli village in the Naraingarh area (Naraingarh, Ambala, Haryana). The three were part of a group of five who had attempted to kidnap a minor girl, before attempting to run over her father in a car when he intervened.

Around 29 January, a man was beaten by locals in Madhu Vihar in Palam area of east Delhi (Delhi) for raping and attempting to kill a young girl. She struggled and attracted attention of local residents, who caught and thrashed the man before delivering him to police.

The lawyer had stopped some people who were trying to enter with a truck in the area. Around 100 people later returned with sticks and attacked his house. On January 29, a youth was beaten by a mob until he lost consciousness, on charges of suspected theft of a motorbike, near Jangaliya chowk in Gopalganj city (Gopalganj, Bihar). The video of the incident went viral. The youth was later handed to the police.

On January 29, a clash erupted between two groups of youths at Dumurisahi village in Karanjia block area (Mayurbhanj, Odisha), over passing of objectionable comments after a football match. One youth died and another was critically injured.

On January 27, locals started beating four youths near Boula Chhak in Cuttack city (Cuttack, Odisha), on suspicion of cattle theft. The mob also set fire to a vehicle in the area. The victims were critically injured and were admitted to the local hospital for treatment.
On Jan 27 2019, rioters burned Jewish prayer books and sprayed the phrase "Hail Satan" on the walls of a synagogue in Netanya, Sharon.

On Jan. 27, 2019: Citizens from the Romani Stolipinovo neighborhood in Plovdiv and police clashed after a police raid, which lead to the arrest of four Roma drug dealers. Roma people from the neighborhood went out of their houses after they saw the arrests and tensions escalated. No injuries were reported, but some of the residents said police officers were violent and threw bottles at them.
On Jan 26, Palestinian youth reportedly threw stones at settler vehicles near Gush Etzion.
On January 26, in Khujner village in Rajgarh Tehsil (Rajgarh, MP), two groups clashed for unknown reasons during Republic Day celebrations, leaving two students injured.

As reported on January 26, locals attacked a police team to release a suspected drug peddler, in Budhla Sant village (Multan, Punjab). In the ensuing scuffle the suspected drug peddler was hit by a gun and died.
26 January. A man was killed in Gisuma (no coordinates available), in the Rugabano district. The attack is believed to be related to witchcraft accusations.
26 January. A mob destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft in the Gihwanya neighborhood of Rumonge.
On Jan 26, two activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured during a factional clash at Chittagong University (Chittagong city) over establishing supremacy on the campus.
On January 26, a CPI-M party office was burnt by suspected BJP activists at Sonaichari Bazar village in Sabroom area (South Tripura, Tripura), on the occasion of Republic Day.

On January 26, a journalist was beaten up inside a cinema hall in Bhubaneswar city (Khordha, Odisha), for opposing a group of Utkal University students who were passing vulgar remarks on women. The journalist sustained multiple injuries and was admitted to the hospital, and discharged on the same day after treatment.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Uganda); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Uganda); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On or before January 25th, two groups of boda boda (motorcycle taxi) operators clashed with clubs and stones at the Busega taxi stand on the outskirts of Kampala. Police and UPDF intervened to separate the groups, in a dispute which related to certain boda boda operators being relocated as part of road works.
On Jan 25, Israeli forces shot and killed a Palestinian minor and wounded another for allegedly throwing stones at traffic on highways 60 near Silwad.
On Jan 25, three Molotov cocktails were thrown by Palestinians at settler homes in Zeitim next to Silwan in East Jerusalem.

source: Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: On Jan 25, a group of Israeli settlers from Kiryat Arba attacked and injured Palestinians and also attacked Palestinian homes near the Ibrahimi Mosque in Hebron's Old City, by throwing stones at them.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Sri Lanka (2015-); UPFA: United People's Freedom Alliance
assoc_actor_2: Government of Sri Lanka (2015-); JVP: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna
notes: On 25 Jan, in Lahugala (Lahugala, Ampara), UPFA and JVP Pradeshiya Sabha members behaved aggressively which led to a brawl over allegations on the irregularity on the repair of light bulbs along a rural road in Hulannuge.

On January 25, Nepal Student Union, vandalized government-owned vehicles at New Baneshwor locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district, Bagmati), after the government endorsed the controversial Medical Education Bill. 58 people were also detained by the police following the incident.
On Jan 25, a Jubo League worker was killed and 10 others were injured in a clash between to rival groups over land dispute and supremacy at Hotel Nirala in Kishoreganj town (Kishoreganj, Dhaka).
On January 25, a BJP party office was burnt by suspected BJP members, in Arabindanagar village in Bishalgarh block area (Sepahijala, Tripura), due to an inner party clash.

On January 25, a tribal woman and her four children were killed on grounds that she was a witch who practised black magic, in Indupur village under Koida block area (Sundargarh, Odisha). Their bodies were found on a well close to their house. Six people were later arrested. One of the accused claimed the woman was casting spells on his family.

On January 25, police personnel clashed with a group of 500-600 people when they tried to stop gambling during patrol duty, in Nokatgre village in Salmanpara area (South West Garo Hills, Meghalaya). The mob attacked them with empty bottles and also pelted stones at the police vehicle, and some cops sustained minor injuries.
24 January. Residents of Agbarho set a suspected armed robber ablaze. The robber and his gang were accused of killing their victim. Two other gang members escaped unhurt.

On Jan 24, Israeli border police entered Shufat refugee camp to arrest young Palestinians who were throwing Molotov cocktails at a main road near the camp. Police shot one of the youth and arrested the two others, who are both minors.

On Jan 24, settlers from Shilo settlement vandalized three parked vehicles and spray-painted racist graffiti on walls after raiding the village of Turmus-Ayya, to the northeast of Ramallah. Price tag attacks are common in the West Bank.
Around 24 January, two groups clashed in Nabha district (Punjab) and attacked each other with iron bars, allegedly over pigeon racing. One person later died of his injuries.
On January 24, in Jabalpur town (Jabalpur, MP), two groups of defense employees who were striking as part of the nation-wide labor strike clashed with one another, leaving four people injured.
On January 24, a local family assaulted and locked two female polio workers in a room in Kot Raja area (District capital coded) (Sargodha, Sargodha, Punjab).

On January 24, two groups pelted stones at each other in Kendrapara city (Kendrapara, Odisha), during a curfew called by the police after a clash occurred between two groups on January 23, over arrangements for the celebration of the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. There were reports of people hurling petrol bombs. The police controlled the mob with lathi-charge.
On January 23, members of the Daguia community assaulted family members of a chieftain in Bol, two individuals were wounded in the confrontation.
During the week beginning January 21st, a mob formed and killed a police officer who shot dead his wife and child for unknown reasons. The mob torched the police station.
On Jan 23, an Israeli settler was lightly injured after Palestinian youths reportedly threw rocks at him in the southern West Bank district of Hebron.

Assumed on January 23, in Kolhapur town (Kolhapur, Maha), 20 members of the youth wing of Shiv Sena rioted and vandalized the Holy Cross Convent High School because parents were asked for an additional Rs 7,000 for each student in the junior kindergarten.

On January 23, a clash between RSS and Muslims took place at a high school ground in Ward-12 in Kendrapara city (Kendrapara, Odisha), during a cultural event on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. A few persons sustained injuries during the clash. Police personnel were deployed to control the situation.

On January 23, residents torched four shops in Tapsikhata village (Alipurduar, West Bengal), after a TMC worker was shot dead by a section of party workers for protesting the sale of illicit liquor and extortion, on January 23. The shops, where illicit liquor was sold, belonged to associates of the attacker.
Between 11 Jan to 2 Feb, in Hampi village (Bellari, Karnataka), three rioters damaged the pillars Vishnu Temple of Hampi UNESCO World Heritage Site which was captured on social media.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Greece (2015-); SYRIZA: Coalition of the Radical Left
notes: On Jan. 23 2019, just before 10 p.m., unknown individuals threw four petrol bombs at the house of Theodora Tzakri, a Pella MP of the ruling SYRIZA party, in Giannitsa causing minor damages in an attack related to the parliamentary debate on the ratification of the Prespes accord.
22 January. After a robber killed two children, local residents caught the robber and killed him.
22 January. Residents of Philippi set alight four men accused to be behind a spate of house robberies, murders, and stabbings in the community.
On Jan 22, Palestinians reportedly threw Molotov cocktails at passing vehicles near Gush Etzion, south of Bethlehem.
On Jan 22, BCL men and officials of Biswas Trade International entered in to a brawl over money matter leading to vandalism at office in Paltan, Dhaka.
On Jan 22, BCL men beat a police officer when police intercepted vandalism at an office in Paltan, Dhaka, by BCL activists.
On Jan 22, at least 25 people were injured after two groups of villagers clashed over the election of village council leader in Noagaon village, Baniachong upazila (Habiganj, Sylhet).
On Jan 22, forty people were injured in a clash between two groups over formation of a management committee at a school in Baniachong (Habiganj, Sylhet).

On 22 Jan, in Bandarawela DS (Badulla), a clash occurred between police and a group of youths. The police were deployed when spectators of a musical show started to throw stones and other objects towards the stage. Several police officers were injured. Musical equipment were damaged. 30 were arrested.

On January 22, a group of land revenue officials of Akbarpura Land Revenue Office reportedly assaulted a judge and Anti-Corruption Department officials in Akbarpura village (Nowshera, KP), when the judge led team raided the office to investigate a corruption complaint.

On January 22, a mob assaulted a pharmacist outside Jhanji Girls' High School in Jhanji village in Gaurisagar area (Sivasagar, Assam), after he was accused of sexually harassing three girls students during an eye check-up under the Rashtriya Bal Swastha Sewa Scheme.
21 January: In Dire Dawa city, youths threw stones at an Epiphany procession during Timket celebrations. Police intervened. Riots escalated over the next days.

21 January. A man was killed by an angry youth mob in Ado Ekiti for eating human faeces with bread. Youth of the area arrested, stripped and beaten him. His body was later found partly burnt and dead.

source: Jordan News Agency (Petra); Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Jan 21, a Palestinian youth was injured and dozens others suffered from tear gas in clashes with Israeli forces as hundreds of settlers stormed Joseph Tomb east of the West Bank city of Nablus. Two soldier were lightly injured and a Palestinian was shot and injured.
On Jan 21, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinian youth after Israeli forces stormed the village. The next day Israeli forces sealed off the main entrances to the village.

On Jan 21, a youth was killed in a clash between two groups over capturing an auto-rickshaw stand in Poilanpur area (Pabna, Rajshahi). Several shops and vehicles in the area were vandalised during the clash.

On January 21, in Peddavoora village in Peddavoora tehsil (Nalgonda, Telangana), TRS party and Congress activists clashed over a dispute concerning an arrest. Police attempted to disperse the activists.
On January 21, in Rajkot town (Rajkot, Gujarat), two groups of students clashed over the issue of being recorded by video on campus. Three people were injured, one seriously.
On January 21, in Parappana Agrahara village in Bengaluru South Tehsil (Bengaluru, Karnataka), two groups of prison inmates clashed over a dispute, leaving one person injured.

On January 21, a clash occurred between two groups of BJP activists at Battala area in Agartala city (West Tripura, Tripura), after around 24 people from BJP joined Unnoyon Mancha. A Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS) office was vandalized.
On January 21, a woman was assaulted and accused of being a witch by a vigilante near Chautara area of Chautara Sangachokgadhi Municipality (Sindhupalchok district, Bagmati).
21 January. Residents in the Birimba neighborhood of Rumonge, caught a robber and killed him. Three of the perpetrators were arrested.

On January 21, unidentified men tried to assault five youths from Assam, and vandalized their car, in Mawkma village under Sohra/Cherapunjee area (East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya). The reason behind the violence is unknown.

20 January. A riot breaks out in Monrovia in front of Ford Maiden Christian Academy on Smythe Road after the bodyguard of Montserrado County District #10 representative, Yekeh Kolubah, bites part of the ear off of a civilian. Rioters throw rocks before the police intervene, disperse the crowd and make 12 arrests.
On January 20, in Jhalod village in Jhalod Tehsil (Dohad, Gujarat), two rival groups clashed with each other and police during gram panchayat polling, leaving two policemen injured.

On January 20, election agents of political parties and candidates vandalized furniture at Don Bosco School in Haflong city (Dima Hasao, Assam), alleging rigging of votes by supporters of the ruling BJP during North Cachar Hills Autonomous Council elections. A LED display of CCTVs installed outside the strong room had been switched off, fuelling fear of rigging. The police intervened to control the mob.
On January 20, a number of flexes and flags of Trinamool Congress were damaged by unidentified men inside the Jadavpur University campus near gate number 4, in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal).

On January 20, two groups of over 30-35 people and slum dwellers, aligned to separate local clubs, clashed in Dover Terrace in Gariahat area in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal). The clash was prompted by youths had returning to the area drunk, raising protests from locals. Rioters were crudely armed with kitchen equipment, sticks and stones. The police intervened and five people were injured.

On 20 Jan, in Kolhapur city (Kolhapur, Maha), around 20 men from the Yuva Sena, the youth wing of the Shiv Sena, ransacked the school principal's office of the Holy Cross Convent High School after parents were asked for an additional Rs 7,000 per student in the junior kindergarten as building fund. 15 people were arrested.

source: Ekathimerini; I Avgi; To Pontiki; AMNA
notes: On Jan. 20 2019, in Athens, after the anti-nationalist rally at Propylaia was over a demonstrator with a Greek flag was stabbed on the thigh by a group of anarchists close to the site of the counter-demonstration and his motorcycle was set on fire.
19 January. PRP supporters and APC supporters clashed in Bauchi, after a PRP car broke down in front of the APC office. One person wounded.
On 19/1/2019, following the second anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Jidd Hafs.

On January 19, at least 12 police officers were injured during an anti-encroachment drive in Digha area in Patna city (Patna, Bihar). Local residents started pelting stones at the police and officials of the local administration, during the drive. The police fired tear gas, and later six people were arrested.
19 January (or around). Supporters of APC and PDP violently clashed in Etung LGA over the weekend. In the process, the house of state Commissioner for Water Resources was burnt in Etomi.

On January 19th, a mob attacked a UYD official in Kasaka parish (coordinates for Kirumba, Kyotera district, used). The UYD official had stolen the microphone from a Minister who was speaking at the event. There are conflicting accounts regarding the conduct of the Minister's bodyguards (recorded as soldiers), with one witness claiming they were beating the official. A bodyguard fired his gun into the air to disperse the mob.
On 19/1/2019, anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.

On Jan 19, Assistant Commissioner (land) of Rajshahi's Bagha upazila and three others were injured in an attack allegedly carried out by some sand lifters in a char of the Padma River in the upazila. The incident happened when AC received the complaint of sand lifting and reached the spot.

On 19 January, five people were injured in a clash between two groups, apparently over a property dispute, at Nayagaon in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh). One group attacked the other with sticks and an airsoft gun during a prearranged meeting (no further details).
On 19 January, a homeless man was beaten to death by residents of an area in Northwest Delhi (Delhi) who suspected him of stealing. He died of his injuries in hospital.

On January 19, family members assaulted a doctor and health staff and vandalized the Critical Care Unit (CCU) of Darjeeling Hospital in the city (Darjeeling, West Bengal), after news that a pregnant women and her baby died during birth. The police controlled the mob.

assoc_actor_1: INC: Indian National Congress; Government of India (2014-)
assoc_actor_2: INC: Indian National Congress; Government of India (2014-)
notes: On 19 Jan, in the outskirts of Bengaluru (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka), two MLA and INC members clashed leaving one of them injured. The source did not mention the reason for the clash.

source: Agence France Presse; Anadolu Agency (AA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Jan 18, Israeli forces demolished the home of a Palestinian accused of the fatal September stabbing of an Israeli-American. The demolition operation caused clashes to break out with locals in Yuta, near Hebron. The army blew up the house with dynamite.

On 18 June, villagers in Chahal village (Faridkot, Punjab) thrashed several drug dealers and handed them to police for dealing in the town. The villagers were suspicious of the unknown car, chased it, and discovered drugs inside before beating the three men and damaging their car.

On January 18, in Puthur town in Thrissur Tehsil (Thrissur, Kerala), rival Jacobite and Orthodox Church factions clashed in front St Mary's church over control of the church. The clash injured ten people.

On 18 January, residents of the Loahara Rd area in Ludhiana city (Ludhiana, Punjab) rioted after a bus struck and killed a 13 year old boy. They threw rocks at the bus, as well as clashing with police, who resorted to lathis to disperse the group.

On January 18, in Thiruvananthapuram town (Thiruvananthapuram Kerala), workers of the CPI(M) and Congress clashed during the election to the managing committee of an agricultural development society, leaving three Congress workers injured.

On January 18, around 17 people vandalized two vehicles of Lahore High Court (LHC) bailiff and held the bailiff officials hostage near Kamalpur-Motra village in Daska tehsil (tehsil capital coded) (Daska, Sialkot, Punjab), while the bailiff officials were on an operation to rescue illegally detained labourers.
On Jan 18th, a man was assaulted, disarmed and killed by a group of illegal immigrants he attempted to rob at gun point at the confluence of Umzingwane and Limpopo rivers.
On January 18, a trader was beaten up by Tai Ahom Yuva Parishad activists when he refused to give a donation for Rongpur Mela organised by them, in Sivasagar city (Sivasagar, Assam).
On January 18th, the mayor of Lira punched and pushed against a wall a journalist from Unity FM radio at the Municipal Council Chambers of the town. Police intervened to protect the journalist.

On Jan 17, two journalists of Jamuna Television were beaten up allegedly by a Jubo League activist and his accomplices in Maltinagar area of Bogra town (Bogra, Rajshahi). The incident happened when the journalists went for an investigative show on drugs and rehab.

On January 17, a mob lynched two men and left another one seriously injured on suspicion of being thieves in Baddi village (Gaya, Bihar). Local people saw five youths entering a house. A crowd surrounded them, and two escaped, but three were caught.

On 17 January, locals thrashed two undercover police officers from Haryana when they attempted to detain a young man in the Mohkampura locality of Amritsar city (Amritsar, Punjab). The officers apparently came to his home to summon him for court of a check bounce case, and beat him. The family gathered help from the area and the mob roughed up the cops.

On 17 January, two rival factions of Congress workers fought at a ceremony formalizing the takeover of the new party chief in the state, in Shimla city (Shimla, Himachal Pradesh), with rival supporters fighting and throwing chairs at one another inside the venue. At least one person was seriously injured in the clash.
On January 17, in Visakhapatnam town (Visakhapatnam, AP), unidentified actors assaulted a police unit and damaged their police cruisers because the police were allegedly behaving rudely to them.

On January 17, 2019, in Tanah Abang subdistrict (Central Jakarta, Jakarta), Public Order Agency (municipal police) members clashed with street vendors because the vendors were unwilling to be cleaned out of the public street. The number of injuries was not reported.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Indian Reserve Battalion
notes: On January 17, stall owners and IRB security personnel clashed in Jorethang city (South Sikkim, Sikkim), over the closing time of shops and bars during Maghey Mela festival. The police forces resorted to lathicharge and two rounds of tear gas shots. Police claimed people attacked the local police station.

On Jan. 17 2019, a group called "Anti-speciesist Subjects" vandalised two butcher shops and two fishmongers in Palaio Faliro in South Athens. In a statement taking responsibility they expressed their disgust to any animal hunter and called these shops dead body sellers. They also condemned all economic and political theories that are based on animal objectifying and exploitation.
16 January. Supporters of the APC and ADP clashed in Ogbomosho. An undisclosed number of people sustained injuries.
On 16/1/2019, following the anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Abu Saybi.
On Jan 16, a number of Palestinian youths suffered from tear gas after clashes broke out with Israeli forces in al-Khader town south of the West Bank city Bethlehem.

source: Anadolu Agency (AA); Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: On Jan 16, two Palestinians were injured in an Israeli raid in Enzah village. One Palestinian sustained gunshot wounds, while the second was injured by a rubber bullet in Enzah village. Clashes erupted between stone-throwing Palestinian youth and Israeli forces during the raid, during which Israeli soldiers used teargas, rubber bullets and live ammunition.
On Jan 16, a man was killed and six others were injured in a clash between two rival groups in Delduar upazila (Tangail, Dhaka) due to a previous enmity over irrigation machine.

On Jan 16, a man was killed and ten others injured in a clash over a land boundary demarcation at Khash Mouza village in Goainghat upazila, Sylhet. Following an altercation on land, both groups attacked each other.

On Jan 16, at least two activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured when two rioting factions clashed over establishing supremacy at Manikganj Government Devendra College campus in Manikganj, Dhaka.

On January 16, a youth was beaten to death by four persons at No 1 Bagrikhuti village under Nagrijuli police outpost area (Baksa, Assam), on the suspicion of being involved in a rape case of a 7 year old girl.

On 16 January, a man and his friends were apparently thrashed and received caste-based abuse from a mob after a religious ornament landed in his lap during a religious ceremony in the Thatibeed area of Banjar (Kull, Himachal Pradesh). As a member of a scheduled caste, he was required to pay an Rs. 11, 000 fine to compensate for the offense of touching the object.

Around 16 January, residents of Jalalpur-1 village in Panipat (Panipat, Haryana) attacked and held hostage two power corporation workers who were giving notice to a man with significant pending bills. The man's family took their IDs and phones and threatened to kill them, before police intervened and rescued the employees.
16 January. Angry residents in Butaganzwa beat a man to death with clubs. They believed he was responsible for stabbing two locals earlier in the day.

Within the month of Jan, in Munnad area (Kasaragod, Kerala), a group of Congress workers assaulted a CPM worker (Peethambaran) in connection with the issues at the People's Co-Operative Arts and Science College. No other information was provided. Other sources cited it happened on the first week of Feb.
On 15/1/2019, on of the second anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Sitrah.
On 15/1/2019, on the second anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.
On 15/1/2019, on of the second anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Bani Jamrah.
On Jan 15, clashes broke out between rioters and Israeli forces after the renewal of operations in Khader, south of Bethlehem.
On Jan 15, clashes broke out after Israeli forces raided Beituniya village near Ramallah.

On January 15, a group of eight persons lynched an elderly couple with sticks and clubs in Aie-Powali village (Chirang, Assam), near the Bhutan border, on the suspicion of being witches. The attackers included the son of the couple.
On 15 January, at least 9 people were injured in a clash between two rival groups in Ikolaha village (Khanna, Ludhiana), apparently over the recent panchayat elections. No further details.

On 15 January, illegal residents of a government property attacked Municipal Corporation vehicles in Jalandhar city (Jalandhar, Punjab) when the MC attempted to demolish the encroachments. Demonstrators threw bricks, lit tyres, and damaged the demolition machines. Police were unable to reign in the rioters.
On January 15, group of men assaulted a Gepco team, who were on an operation against alleged electricity theft in Ahmedabad village of Sambrial tehsil (tehsil capital coded) (Sialkot, Punjab).
On January 14-15, Pastoralist and farmer militias clashed on the river bank of Komadougou Yobe in the area of Chetimari, and unknown number of wounded, some severely.
On 15 January, three men suspected of committing several crimes have been stoned to death in Tshandama outside Thohoyandou in Limpopo.
On January 15th, a lynch mob killed an elderly man in Bunashimolo (Sironko, coordinates for Mafudu used) suspected of practicing withcraft. The circumstances described by the source are convoluted.

On 15 Jan, in Angadipuram town in Perintalmanna tehsil (Malappuram, Kerala), unidentified assailants beat a woman (Kanakadurga) up with a piece of wood, injuring her. The woman is one of the first childbearing women who entered the Sabarimala temple after the ban was lifted. The source did not mention the nature of injury. [size=no report]
On 14 January, a man was burnt to death and his friend severely injured after a mob severely assaulted and later set them alight in Hillbrow.
On 14/1/2019, on the eve of the second anniversary of the execution of three Shiite men, Shiite anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Abu Saybi.

On Jan 14, scuffles broke out at the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem's Old City after guards at the mosque refused to allow an Israeli policeman to enter for a security check because he was wearing a kippah. Dozens of worshippers clashed with police after the Waqf guards closed the doors to the mosque and barricaded themselves inside. The director of the mosque was lightly wounded.
On Jan 14, rioting workers of a garment factory vandalised a factory in Gazipur, Dhaka, rejecting the wage rates. Four workers of the factory were injured in vandalism.
On Jan 14, approx 12 people were injured in a clash between two rival groups of traders over sand trading in Mohipur bazar area (Kalapara, Patukhali).

On January 14, locals assaulted a man for making communal comments targeting a particular community, in Bakuloni village (Dibrugarh, Assam). The man said 'Assamese people will live in fear if the Citizenship Bill is passed and Bengalis will be safe'.
On January 14, lawyers representing Faisalabad Regional Police Officer assaulted a guarantor in a children's custody case in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab).
On Jan 14th, in Chokwe, three alleged robbers were lynched by a mob. Police intervened to disperse the mob.
On January 14-15, Pastoralist and farmer militias clashed on the river bank of Komadougou Yobe in the area of Chetimari, and unknown number of wounded, some severely.

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; Students (India)
notes: Assumed on 14 Jan, in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala), a clash occurred between the SFI and Kerala Students Union (KSU) at the CUSAT. The police had then registered a case of attempt to murder against 18 students involved in the incident. No other information was provided.
13 January. A group of youth in Mugoboka (no coordinates available, located in south Mutanga) accused a man, suffering from psychological problems, of being a rebel and beat him to death.
13 January. Two men were killed in Nyaruganda by locals (assumed unarmed) who suspected them of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.
On 13/1/2019, anti-regime rioters threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.
On Jan 13, Israeli forces raided several neighbourhoods in Ramallah overnight and clashed with Palestinians, causing injuries to at least 6 young Palestinians.

On 13 Jan, in Panadura area (Kalutara), commuters chased and caught a thief who snatched a smartphone of a Chinese national at a train station. The suspect was handed over to the station master's office.

On January 13, a youth and a girl were assaulted in Betbari No. 2 village under Panbari Polcie Station area (Chirang, Assam), for allegedly eloping and getting married. Locals also forced the couple to wear a garland of shoes.

As reported on January 13, two groups of lawyers clashed in Sialkot city (assumed based on city line) (Sialkot, Punjab), over disagreements regarding the voter list for the annual elections for Daska Bar Association. Three lawyers reportedly received minor injuries.

13 January. Three women accused of witchcraft and child kidnapping are led naked through the streets of Johnny Town of Kpanyan in Sinoe County of by an angry crowd of rioters. One woman is killed after rioters sexually assaulted the women with sticks.
On Jan 12, a group of Israeli settlers assaulted a Palestinian shepherd in Susiya.
On Jan 12, a group of Israeli settlers assaulted a Palestinian shepherd in Khirbet Tuba in southern Hebron.
On Jan 12, a group of Israeli settlers assaulted a Palestinian shepherd by releasing a dog at him. The man was bit and injured by the dog, causing him moderate injuries.

On Jan 12, settlers protected by a military escort threw stones at Palestinians' homes in the northeastern outskirts of Burqa. Local citizens forced them out of the village. No injuries or damages were reported.
On Jan 12, Israeli raids in Ramallah sparked clashes with locals in several locations in the city.

On January 12, a village-level worker (VLW) was detained by locals at the panchayat office in Badkhiladi village, in Kaptipada block (Mayurbhanj, Odisha), over allegations of misbehaving with a woman. Locals also gheraoed the panchayat office.
On January 12, in Hupari town in Hatkanangale tehsil (Kolhapur, Maha), farmers vandalized property and forced closure of operations because a sugar mill would not pay them their arrears.
On January 12, near Jadhavnagar town in Khanapur Tehsil (Sangli, Maha), farmers set a sugar mill factory on fire because they were not paid their arrears.
On January 12, near Karad village in Karad Tehsil (Satara, Maha), farmers set a sugar mill factory on fire because they were not paid their arrears.
On January 12, in Kurundwad town in Shirol tehsil (Kolhapur, Maha), farmers vandalized property and forced closure of operations because a sugar mill would not pay them their arrears.
On January 12, in Shirol town in Shirol tehsil (Kolhapur, Maha), farmers vandalized property and forced closure of operations because a sugar mill would not pay them their arrears.

On December 30, in Bagheri Khurd village in Kotkasim Tehsil (Alwar, Rajasthan), a mob of villagers attacked a cow smuggler for illegally transporting cows through the village. The smuggler was left hospitalized with serious injuries.

On 30 December, a voter was killed during a poll capture event in Lakhmir ke Uthar village, Mamdot area (Ferozepur, Punjab). 12-15 people allegedly stormed a polling booth there, stealing the ballot box and setting the ballots on fire. While escaping in an SUV, they struck an elderly voter who later died in hospital of his injuries. No group had yet been accused.

On 30 December, several residents of Jagdev Kalan village (Amritsar, Punjab) allegedly held and beat the polling agent at the booth there during local sarpanch/panchayat elections, as well as snatching his cash.

On 30 December, a group of people allegedly assaulted a resident of Ablu village near Nehiawala (Bathinda, Punjab) for supporting a rival candidate for sarpanch in the local sarpanch/panchayat elections. They surrounded him and beat him up after polling was completed on the 30th.
On 30 December, the new sarpanch and his supporters allegedly beat and abused a villager who supported the losing candidate, in Partap Singh Wala village (Ludhiana, Punjab).

On 30 December, several people were injured during a post-election celebration for a winning sarpanch candidate when supporters of the losing candidate attacked the party and beat supporters. The attack took place in an unidentified village in Fazilka district (Punjab).
On 30 December, the new sarpanch and his supporters allegedly beat and abused a villager who supported the losing candidate, in Bonkar Gujjaran village of Ludhiana tehsil (Ludhiana, Punjab).

On 30 December, locals attacked the SHO overseeing vote counting in Sahib Chand village in Gidderbaha area (Muktsar, Punjab), after polling in the local sarpanch / panchayat elections there. The SHO escaped unscathed but the mob vandalized his vehicle.

On 30 December, locals rioted, vandalized poll officers' vehicles, and threw stones after 'outsiders' apparently entered the polling station at Fatehpur Garhi village near Rajpura (Patiala, Punjab) during polling for the local sarpanch/panchayat elections. Police say the incident was caused by a clash between two groups and they had to use a lathi charge to restore order. Voting was interrupted for over an hour.

On 30 December, villagers attacked police outside the polling station (Rajpura 9) in Sarai Banjara Basti village of Rajpura block (Patiala, Punjab), during polling for local sarpanch/panchayat elections. Several people, including a constable, were injured though no reports on what started the clash. No further details.

On 30 December, villagers threw stones at police and polling staff in Fatehgarh Chhana village (Sangrur, Punjab) after results were announced in the local sarpanch/panchayat elections there. Villagers claimed the officers fired in the air. Another report says that the losing candidate threatened and attacked polling staff and police in an attempt to stop the officers from leaving town with the ballot boxes, and later snatched the ballots. Unclear if same or different events.
On 30 December, two police officers stationed a polling booth 160 in Dabbar Basti village of Ajnala (Amritsar, Punjab) were beaten by several local individuals. No further details.

On 30 December, locals attacked Tarn Taran Sadar police in an unidentified village of the district (Tarn Taran, Punjab) where they were investigating an attack on the Congress sarpanch candidate for the district. The locals apparently considered the police investigation 'politically motivated'.

On 30 December, supporters of a defeated sarpanch candidate allegedly beat up a police officer on duty at Deon village polling booth (Bathinda, Punjab), leaving him injured and disrupting vote counting.

On 30 December, a scuffle was reported between supporters of two rival candidates in Behramke village of Faridkot district (Punjab) during the local sarpanch/panchayat elections there. No further details.

On 30 December, four people were injured in a clash between supporters of rival candidates in Raipur Kalan village of Rupnagar tehsil (Rupnagar, Punjab). Both sides accuse the other of attacking them with sticks and rods, starting the fight.
On 30 December, Congress and AAP members clashed in Rure Assal village in Tarn Taran (Punjab) over the local sarpanch/panchayat elections. An AAP member was injured. No further details.

On December 30, in Bagheri Khurd village in Kotkasim Tehsil (Alwar, Rajasthan), a mob of villagers attacked a cow smuggler for illegally transporting cows through the village. The smuggler was left hospitalized with serious injuries.

On 30 December, unidentified individuals reportedly damaged a ballot box during panchayat and sarpanch polling in Jalalabad city (Fazilka, Punjab). No further details.

30 December. A CENI employee in Boma was attacked by a mob of voters when he went to replace a malfunctioning machine. The mob suspected him of bringing a fraudulent machine. Police intervened.
30 December. Voters in Kananga assaulted a CENI employee who wanted to take one of the voting machines out of a polling station.
30 December. A CENI employee was assaulted by a group of voters after he allowed candidate Bitika Pascal to enter a polling station in Kindu. Police intervened to stop the assault.
30 December. A mob of voters attacked a CENI employee who was trying to fix a machine in Mbandaka. The voters suspected the man of tampering with votes and injured him before the police intervened.
On 30/12/2018, Shiite anti-regime rioters in Eker set trash containers on fire and threw Molotov cocktails at security forces.
On Dec 30, dozens of Palestinian students were tear gassed during clashes with Israeli forces in Sebastia. Clashes broke out after Israeli forces raided the town.

On December 30, police forces intervened with a group of protesting Syrian refugees in Sehitkamil town of Gaziantep after a fight broke out between the refugees and a group of residents that resulted with the a person getting injured.

Assumed on 30 Dec, near Colombo city, a bus driver was assaulted on the Badulla-Colombo route by at least 15 private bus employees over a conflict between two groups of private bus employees about boarding of passengers.

30 December. Clashes occurred between FCC supporters and opposition party supporters in Ditunda in Kasai (no coordinates available). The clash began as opposition election observers were prevented by CENI officials from entering polling stations. Seven people were seriously injured and voting was suspended in the town.

30 December. Voters in Mbandaka assaulted a FCC supporter who was trying to buy votes for Shadary. Police used tear gas to disperse the mob.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

On December 29, an elderly tribal man was tortured to death in a village court for allegedly practicing witchcraft and black magic at Mahadev Tilla area in Dhalai district (Tripura). The man succumbed to his injuries in the Dhalai district government hospital on December 30.

On December 29, a former mukhiya (panchayat chief) was lynched by a mob on suspicion of cattle theft at Simarbani village under Sikti police station area (Araria, Bihar). On December 28, a senior leader and the state secretary of the CPI(M) was assaulted by suspected BJP activists at Bishalgarh city (Sipahijala, Tripura), one day after the polling for bye-election in municipal bodies. The attackers tried to stop his car and to pull him out but he escaped as the driver did not stop and speed away.
On 28 Dec, rioters clashed with state forces (assumed police) in Anantnag district town (J&K), as news spread of the death of an HM militant in the Renzipora village area (Pulwama).

On December 28, in Mudukulathur town (Ramanathapuram, TN), two DMK factions clashed over a dispute. The number of injuries was not reported.
On December 28, a mob set two trucks on fire near Shiv Temple chhak (Bolangir, Odisha), after the death of a local resident in a road accident. The mob of locals further clashed with the police.

On December 28, a youth was assaulted by the public for posing as a transgender in Saukuchi Tiniali in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam). The locals caught the youth when he was begging for donations. The locals alleged the youth was a fake transgender.

On December 28, a group of Bhutanese truckers who were legally transporting boulders to Bangladesh via Meghalaya were assaulted in Ampati area (South West Garo Hills, Meghalaya). The attackers and the reason behind the assault is unknown.

On December 28, a Dalit youth was beaten by the Ward Chairman, along with the villagers, in Bhrahmapuri rural municipality (Sarlahi district, Janakpur), for being in a relationship with a non-dalit person.
28 December (on or around). Hoodlums destroyed the car of an Alliance for Democracy candidate and attacked him. The candidate had to run inside his party office.

On December 28th, a mob killed two suspected thieves in Kiyana village. The suspects had been accused of stealing cattle; during the confrontation, the suspects threw bricks into the mob, injuring two teenagers, before the crowd killed them, using stones.

On Dec 28, settlers physically assaulted and injured a Palestinian youth in the neighborhood of Tal Rumeidah in Hebron city. 10 settlers assaulted and beat him up with their hands and legs, causing him to suffer bruises and pain throughout his body.
28 December: In likoni, Mombasa county, two men were killed by Bodaboda operators on suspicion of belonging to a criminal gang.

Around 27 Dec 2018, Dang Wangi in Kuala Lumpur (FT Kuala Lumpur), a group men, possibly security guards, beat two men who allegedly had sex in a car in what activists have called an instance anti-gay violence.

On 27 Dec, a Sadar upazila Kandigaon union Awami League supporter and Kuwait expatriate was beaten to death by BNP supporters over a political argument while he was out seeking votes in the Syhlet area.

On 27 Dec, a mob of 35 people attacked a BNP candidate during a election campaign rally in Burichong upazila (Comilla). His car was vandalised and 10 of his supporters beaten up. The police rescued the victim from the mob.
On 27 Dec, unidentified assailants hurled two crude bombs at the house of BNP Joint Secretary Abdul Awal Biswas at Bamundi village (Gangni upazila, Meherpur). No injuries reported.
On Dec 27, a number of locals alleged that ruling party men vandalised some 40 to 50 houses in at least five villages under Rajganj union (Begumganj upazila, Noakhali).
On December 27, a former Finance Minister was slapped at Bishalgarh city (Sipahijala, Tripura), during a CPI (M)-BJP clash while polling for by-election in municipal bodies was in progress.

On 27 December, several mining officers were attacked by residents of Bhaganda ghat in Kaushambi district (Kaushambi,Uttar Pradesh) during a soil sampling in the area. The villagers forcibly stopped the officers' vehicle and argued them, before assaulting them and leaving on seriously injured. No motive is known.

On December 27, a mob vandalized a private hospital in Barh city (Patna, Bihar), and abducted a nurse, as doctors and patients fled in panic. The police believe the attack was carried by friends and family of a hospital employee who was found dead on December 23, and that the nurse was involved in the incident.

On December 27, members of the Federation of Khasi-Jaintia and Garo People (FKJGP) beat an Assam trader to death at Rongsak Bazar village (East Garo Hills, Meghalaya), on the pretext of checking for trading licenses by non-tribal businessmen.
As reported on December 27, a local shopkeeper was torched by his fellow neighbour shopkeepers in Kotri town (Jamshoro, Sindh). As a result he sustained severe burn injuries.

On December 27, five locals assaulted a team of Lahore Electric Supply Company officials in Johar area of Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab) while the company officials were on outstanding payment recovery mission. One company official was injured.
27 December (on or around). Angry NPP party members stormed a meeting of Fomena NPP regional executives amid internal dissensions, injuring an MP, destroying his car and vandalising the office.

On December 27th, a mob killed two suspected motorbike thieves at an unspecified location in Luwero district (the source notes one of the attackers came from Koko village; accordingly coordinates for this location have been used at prec 2).
On 27/12/2018, anti-regime rioters in Daih threw Molotov cocktails at police vehicles.

On 26 Dec, at least seven members of Ganosanghati Andolan were injured in an attack by a group of AL party men armed with iron rods and sticks at Gymnasium of Dhaka University (Shabagh thana, Dhaka city).
On 26 Dec, an unidentified group hurled crude bombs and fired blank shots at the residence of BNP General Secretary Asaduzzaman Bablu at Chowgachha (Gangi upazila, Meherpur). No injuries reported.

assoc_actor_2: BNP: Bangladesh Nationalist Party; Labour Group (Bangladesh)
notes: On 26 Dec, suspected AL supporters set fire to at least two tea-stalls belonging to BNP supporters at Bhalam village (Paba, Rajshahi). AL men had been intimidating villagers to vote for their party.

On December 26, in Payyanur town (Kannur, Kerala), CPI(M) activists attacked a bus used by participants in the Ayyappa Jyothi campaign to shuttle people to Sabarimala temple. The bus was damaged and Hindu women were injured in the attack.

On December 26, a 40-year-old was attacked and killed by a group of 15-16 workers in Amtapoh in Amlarem civil sub-division (West Jaintia Hills, Meghalaya). The man was on his way to the workers' camp with the driver of a vehicle and three others. The accused were all workers of the NPP legislator from Umroi.

On December 26, two groups affiliated with Nepal Students Union (NSU) clashed in Birgunj city (Parsa district, Narayani), following disagreements over nomination of party representatives from the district chapter. Injuries were reported, and about 100 security personnel were deployed to the site to prevent further clashes.

On 26 Dec, in Mookalanhena (Bingiriya, Kurunegala), two students of the Wayamba University Faculty of Technology were seriously injured following an attack on them by a senior group of students over objections of the former to ragging.

source: Island (Sri Lanka); Colombo Gazette; Tamil Guardian
notes: Assumed on 26 Dec, in Mawanella, several Buddha statues have been vandalized by alleged Muslim rioters. The reason for vandalism is still unknown. Villagers apprehended one of the culprits and turned the culprit over to police.
December 25. Locals in Bagourain of Noun district beat to death two suspected Ambazonian separatists attacking the town for the second time in three days.
26 December: Oromo and Amhara students clashed in Bahir Dar after Amhara students attacked Oromo students for not joining them in the demonstration they planned. No casualties reported.

On December 26th, a lynch mob attempted to kill a suspected theif in Fort Portal (Kabarole). A nearby security guard intervened, firing two bullets into the crowd, wounding a student. The security guard has been arrested.

Clashes erupted in the village of Al-Qa'r in Al-Mashannah district of Ibb governorate, to the east of Ibb city, after a citizen was killed over a land dispute in the area. No casualties were reported in the clashes.

On December 26th, two groups clashed in the area of Kyangwali (Hoima), over a dispute regarding the resettlement of refugees. Following the event, police arrested several suspects, and were reported to have beaten/tortured them (recorded as a separate event).

On 25 December 2018, in Sappie Village, in Ann Township, in Rakhine State, a mob of 40 residents, led by 3 monks, stopped the construction of a pavilion for Christmas celebrations by a small community of Chin Christians. Fighting then broke out between the mob and the Chin which caused two Chin locals to be injured.

On 25 Dec, at least seven people were injured in a clash between the supporters of AL candidate Shajahan Khan and BNP candidate Milton Baidya at Amgram (Rajoir upazila, Madaripur). AL men also attacked Milton's residence.
On 25 Dec, at least 25 persons including a Jamaat leader were injured when a group of AL men attacked their election rally in Bagerhat district.
On 25 Dec, about 31 BNP activists were injured in a clash between BNP and AL supporters when people started pelting stones after two processions passed by each other at Chunkutia (Keraniganj, Dhaka).
On 25 Dec, supporters of Awami League-led grand alliance candidate Abu Hossain Babla and Oikyafront candidate Salah Uddin Ahmed clashed when their two processions met in Shyampur area of Dhaka city.
On 25 Dec, a group of ruling AL supporters vandalised the election office of an independent candidate in Faridpur (assumed district).
On 25 Dec, a group of stick-wielding AL activists attacked and vandalised the motorcade of BNP candidate Mianul Islam Khan Shanta during electioneering at Harirampur upazila (Manikganj).

On 25 Dec, a group of ruling AL supporters vandalised the election office of a Gonotantrik Biplobi Party candidate in Manikganj (assumed district).

Following an initiative by Akwa Ibom APC legislators to suspend 11 other members of the assembly, the Governor along with security personnel and PDP loyalist arrived at the assembly to force the APC legislators out. The security forces and PDP loyalist clashed with APC militias in police uniforms. No report of arms involved, though a vehicle was burned during the clash.

On November 27th, a lynch mob of around 100 people gathered at Atiak police station (Gulu) to lynch a truck driver who had hit and killed a child earlier that day. Police used tear gas and live ammunition to disperse the mob, wounding a mother and her child with gunshots in the process.

On Nov 27, the car of an Israeli civilian was pelted with rocks by Palestinians as he drove past the Palestinian town of Sinjil near Ramallah. The driver was lightly injured. This attack was earlier misreported as a shooting.

The violence started over a dispute over the relocation of the temple. A mob gathered at 1 am and torched the wreckage of two burnt cars and later damaged a fire engine. They attacked and severely injured a Fire and Rescue Department officer who was trying to put out vehicle fires. The fireman later died from his injuries. At 2 am, the group marched to One City Mall nearby and smashed glass panels and damaging another car.

On 26 Nov, in Kolonnawa DS (Colombo), residents forcefully stopped a train plying between Kolonnawa and Orugodawatta and went on to assault the driver and an assistant who was on board. The reason for the assault is unknown.

On November 26, in Brahmnoli village in Maval tehsil (Pune, Maha), villagers rioted, vandalized property, and assaulted two women over a land dispute.

On 17 November, a tanker driver was severely beaten by locals after he hit a car and allegedly a house in Azizganj village (Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh). The driver was severely injured and brought to the hospital by police.

On Nov 17, a Palestinian farmer and his family were attacked by settlers while they were picking olives in Jabal Jales area to the east of Hebron. Settlers assaulted the farmer and threw stones at his family.
On Nov 17, Palestinians threw stones at settler vehicles near the town of Bayt Hanina.

On November 17, a 55-year-old man was lynched by a mob after being branded as a wizard, in Disobai area (Karbi Anglong district, Assam). The police arrested 19 people for their involvement in the attack.

On 17 November, two groups of BJP supporters attacked each other with lathis on the Delhi-Pauri highway in Bijnor district (Uttar Pradesh) during the party's Kamal Samdesh bike rally, apparently over a minor bike accident.

On November 17th, supporters of the CDC and Unity Party clashed in Monrovia, causing several injuries. The incident occurred shortly before a by-election is scheduled to take place in District 13 (close to the capital).

On November 16th, a mob formed in the village of Enzeva (coordinates for Arivu, Arua used), after a coach reportedly hit a pedestrian. The group severely beat the conductor of the coach, though the driver and another member of staff escaped. The mob then set the bus on fire (the source is unclear as to whether the passengers were still on the bus at the time, though it reports that no passengers were injured).
On 16/11/2018, anti-regime rioters in Eker threw Molotov cocktails at police vehicles.

On Nov 16, at least 10 people were injured in a clash between two groups of indigenous people over a piece of disputed land at Baldipakur Balapara village in Mithapakur upazila in Rangpur. Report did not indicate the groups were armed.

assoc_actor_2: CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist); Forner Government of India (2014-)

On November 16, residents clashed with the police in Birsanagar area in Jamshedpur city (East Singhbhum district, Jharkhand), during an eviction drive. The locals started pelting stones on the police team from the top of the building, and the police resorted to lathicharge. Five people, including two women police constables, were injured.

Two rival groups were apparently trying to claim the land by installing statues, when police arrived to calm the situation the crowd threw stones at them. Police used lathis to disperse the crowd and removed both statues.

The mob clashed with the police, who resorted to lathi charge. Several cops were injured in the attack.

Five people have been arrested in connection with the case, though the officer responsible for shooting into the crowd is reported to be on the run from authorities.
On Nov 14, a group of settlers set a Palestinian vehicle on fire in the village of Urif. Settlers also sprayed racist graffiti and threw stones at passing Palestinian vehicles.
On Nov 14, a youth was killed following a mob beating in Chashara in Narayanganj. The victim was accused of a robbery.
On Nov 14, BNP activists and police clashed in front of the party's Nayapaltan central office in Dhaka city. 50 people, including 23 policemen were injured.

On November 14, family members and relatives of a healer who was under treatment at Malda Medical College and Hospital in Malda city (Malda district, West Bengal) vandalized the office of the patient assistance centre after the patient died.

On November 14, in Raghunadhapalem village in Mattam Palle Tehsil (Suryapet, Telangana), Congress and TRS workers clashed over the accidental death of a youth, leaving 20 people injured. Police intervened and took 25 persons into their custody.

On November 14, a group of 10-12 persons attacked police personnel in Kasipada village (Balasore district, Odisha), and freed two persons who were arrested by the cops during a liquor raid. The attackers assaulted the policemen with lathis and vandalized a vehicle. As many as three constables, including a woman, sustained injuries in the attack.
On November 14, in Kalyan city (Thane, Maha), a group of villagers attacked three Municipal Corporation officials over surveying disputed land, leaving the three officials injured.

On 14 November, unidentified individuals threw stones at former Sahibabad MLA Amarpal Sharma during a Chhath Puja ritual in Khora (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh). No one was injured and no reason was known for the incident.

On 14 Nov, in Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte city (Colombo), UPFA and UNP supporters clashed near the Parliament entry road as Parliament reconvenes and voted on the appointment of the new PM. Police were deployed to control the situation. The source did not mention weapons used in the clash.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Nepal (2015-); Vigilante Group (Nepal)

The woman's granddaughter claimed that the Nepal army soldier was the main instigator of the attack.
On Nov 13, three people were killed and seven others injured in a clash over a land-related dispute at Gilabari in Aditmari upazila in Lalmonirhat. Report does indicate if either group was armed.

assoc_actor_2: INC: Indian National Congress; Labour Group (India)

On Nov 11, clashes were reported between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Zbuba, northwest of Jenin.

On 11 November, two groups from the same (unidentified) community clashed in Kawal village (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh) over a minor issue. At least five people were injured in the fight, which involved lathis and stone throwing. Police intervened and calmed the situation.

source: Hiru News (Sri Lanka); Daily Mirror (Sri Lanka)

On 10 November, the son of a local farm leader was assaulted and robbed, and his car vandalised, by five unidentified persons at an unknown location in Tarn Taran district (Punjab).

On Nov 10, two groups pelted each other with stones in Korangi town (Karachi, Sindh) over the issue of a mosque's administration. 5 men were injured.

On November 9th, two Muslim groups clashed in Arua town (one faction was named as the Kibuli faction), prompting police intervention. During the clashes, two police officers were injured. It is unclear whether there were injuries on the side of the clashing groups.

On 9 Nov, rioters clashed with state forces (assumed police) in Tral town (Pulwama, J&K) as news spread of a deadly encounter between JeM militants and state forces in nearby Dar Gani Gund village.
On November 9, two groups of BJD clashed in Raghunathpur block area (Jagatsinghpur district, Odisha), during a meeting about local problems with the BDO.

On 9 Nov, in Bhimad (Tanahun, Gandaki), during the festival of Tihar, a clash between two groups performing Deusi and Bhailo traditional songs occurred leaving 6 injured. The reason for the clash and weapons used is unknown. Police detained four youths and impounded four motorcycles afterwards.

On November 9, a cancer patient, his wife and son and two of their neighbours were assaulted by some youths in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal), for opposing the playing of loud music and noisy fireworks late in the night, during the Kali Puja (Hindu religious festival) immersion procession.

On November 8, a rights activist and her associate were attacked and severely injured by a mob of 30-40 people (suspected illegal coal mining mafia) in Sohshrieh village (East Jaintia Hills district, Meghalaya), when they reportedly had gone to take photographs and videos of illegal coal mining in the district. On Nov 8, two unidentified groups clashed with sticks and clubs in Glanwala village (Chunian, Kasur, Punjab). 1 person was killed and 4 people, including 2 women, were injured.

On November 7, in Nellore district (AP), a mob attacked a police station in retribution for the police's severe interrogation of their relative being held by police. The mob attacked and injured the police.

On 7 Nov, in Kailali district (Seti), a woman was tortured again (first instance in March) by villagers over allegations of practicing witchcraft.

On 7 Nov, in Banke district (Bheri), during the festival of Tihar, a clash between two inebriated groups performing Deusi and Bhailo traditional songs occurred leaving 9 injured. The reason for the clash and weapons used is unknown.

On Nov 6, students, parents, and teachers stormed the administrative offices of a school in Baabda after discovering that the administration was considering renting out the campus. A deal was apparently reached that would rent out the school, lay off all the teachers and leave the students without a school. The rioters reportedly broke a window.

On Nov 6, 50 people were injured as the residents of Saatgaon and Khasgaon villages of Chhatak upazila in Sunamganj clashed during an arbitration meeting over possession of the Bhaterkhal River for fishing. Report does not indicate if the rioters were armed.

On November 6, in Rameswaram town (Rameswaram, TN), two unarmed groups clashed over a dispute. One woman was injured when a bottle of acid was thrown on her.

The cause of the assault was that these residents were not chosen for a new social housing project in the area.

On Nov 5, Brohi and Ahin communal men clashed with sticks and stones over a petty matter in Tando Adam town (Sanghar, Sindh). 1 man was killed and 4 were injured.
