The police retaliated first with teargas and lathicharge, but soon opened fire at the group, killing one person and injuring several. Policemen were also injured with batons, rods, and bricks.

On November 4, in Navi Mumbai town (Thane, Maha), taxi and bus drivers clashed with regional transport officers (RTOs) after several vehicle fitness test sites were closed. The number of injuries was not reported.

On November 4, two communities clashed during a 'kalash shoba yatra' (religious procession) at Patapol area (Cuttack district, Odisha). The groups pelted stones and hurled bottles at each other, but there were no reports of injured.
On November 3, two communities clashed over a land dispute at Nalapanga village under Pandapada area (Keonjhar district, Odisha).

On 3 Nov, in Katari (Udayapur, Sagarmatha), police charged batons to locals during a clash over transport of cement factory limestone. Both parties claimed the other party was inebriated. 4 were injured and were taken to the hospital.

On 3 Nov, in Kalikot district (Karnali), a 30-member team of Chapakot Municipality (Syangja) officials clashed with local tourists from Bhaktapur over rude remarks. Both parties were inebriated. 4 were injured, including a Mayor who needed stitches in his head.

On 3 Nov, in Trincomalee (Trincomalee Town and Gravets, Trincomalee), a scuffle broke out between the head monk of a nearby Buddhist vihara and his entourage who stormed a Muslim-owned shop and attempted to seize fabrics bearing prints of the Buddha's face and the shop owner who resisted. Police arrived at the scene and seized the fabrics.

On 3 November 2018, in Keningau city (Interior, Sabah), a riot broke out at a polling station between Rafizi Ramili, the PKR candidate, and his supporters and another group of PKR. The police intervened.

No serious injuries were reported.

On Nov 2, rioters hurled a Molotov cocktail at the Union Parishad (UP) office at Saidabad in Sadar upazila burning it down. No one was injured.

On November 2, rioters pelted stones at a bus carrying a marriage procession near Sarbhog village (Barpeta district, Assam), to enforce a bandh called by several organizations (including the All Assam Bengali Youth Students' Federation - AABYSF) in protest against the killing of five persons from the Bengali community in Tinsukia district on November 1.

On November 2, rioters attacked a mini truck in Koliabor area (Nagaon district, Assam), to enforce a bandh called by several organizations (including the All Assam Bengali Youth Students' Federation - AABYSF) in protest against the killing of five persons from the Bengali community in Tinsukia district on November 1.

On November 2, rioters attacked an ASTC bus at Samaguri village (Nagaon district, Assam), to enforce a bandh called by several organizations (including the All Assam Bengali Youth Students' Federation - AABYSF) in protest against the killing of five persons from the Bengali community in Tinsukia district on November 1.

On November 2, a dozen youths from three clubs organising a Kali Puja (Hindu festival) at Sadarghat in Burdwan town (Purba Bardhaman district, West Bengal) beat up a mini-truck driver and vandalized the vehicle after he refused to give a subscription.

Civilians in Khirbet Mousa in eastern al-Hasakeh countryside got in a physical fight with a QSD patrol which was attempting to conscript civilians. Several individuals from both sides were wounded and the patrol fled the village.
On November 2nd, two groups fought seemingly without arms at Diabugu village (Upper River Region) over case system tensions, resulting in a number of injuries, and five arrests by police forces.
On November 2, locals beat up a man after he molested and attempted to rape a minor girl in Nongpoh city (Ri Bhoi district, Meghalaya).
On Nov 2nd, following the raping and the killing of a young girl by a 44-year-old man, a group of people from Macuara tried to assault the man.

The attack was over a dispute over sewage - the farm owner had apparently blocked a sewage pipe, causing it to divert into the fields of a neighbour. At least 250 people have been booked in the attack.

Migrants spent the night at the border and hurled stones and glass at the police, trying to push through the police cordons. Three police officers and three migrants were injured.
23 October. An angry mob beat and then burned to death three men accused of attempted robbery in Uduk Usung.
On Oct 23, a number of Palestinian youths were wounded in clashes with Israeli forces east of the West Bank city of Hebron.

On Oct 23, a Palestinian youth was shot and injured with live fire during clashes that broke out with Israeli forces in the town of al-Dawha, west of Bethlehem, after Israeli forces raided the village.

On 23 Oct, rioting youths clashed with police at Kadalbal in Pampore tehsil (Pulwama, J&K). The street-fighting marked a second day of violence following a gunfight between JeM militants and government forces in Kulgam district, which left three militants and seven civilians dead. No group called for a shutdown.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 23 Oct, rioting youths clashed with police and CRPF troops at various locations in Srinagar city (J&K). The street-fighting marked a second day of violence in Srinagar city following a gunfight between JeM militants and government forces in Kulgam district, which left three militants and seven civilians dead. No group called for a shutdown.

On 23 Oct, rioting youths clashed with police at Wathoora in Chadoora tehsil (Budgam, J&K). The street-fighting marked a second day of violence following a gunfight between JeM militants and government forces in Kulgam district, which left three militants and seven civilians dead. No group called for a shutdown.

On October 23, in Jabalpur city (Jabalpur, MP), police clashed with some Hindu group members during a religious procession. Hindu group members attacked the police barricade, leaving 10 people injured.

assoc_actor_1: FSFN: Federal Socialist Forum, Nepal; RJP: Rastriya Janamukti Party; MNO: Mongol National Organization; Hindu Group (Nepal)
notes: On 23 Oct, in Dharan (Sunsari, Koshi), a clash involving stones and batons occurred between local youth groups over organising the Dashain (Hindu religious) celebrations. Police fired warning shots to contain the groups. 2 were injured. Members of FSFN, RJP, Mongol National Organization, Sanghiya Lumbuwan Manch, Dharan Ekata Samaj and Kirat Khumbuwan Sajha Party also vandalized the entrance gate.

Assumed on 23 Oct, in Saptari district (Sagarmatha), rioting villagers of Balan-Bihul rural municipality-5, Ramnagar Kodarkatti-5 clashed over the formation of Goddess Durga Puja Celebration Committee during Dashain (Hindu religious festival).
On Oct 23, 6 Palestinians were wounded in the central Gaza Strip, presumably at clashes between Israeli soldiers and rioters.
23 October. A man was killed by a vigilante group after stealing a goat in Senga.

On October 23, 2018, unknown perpetrators threw stones at a taxi vehicle driven by an Albanian driver in North Mitrovica, area of Kosovo populated largely by Serbian population. The attack is suspended to were ethnically motivated.
On Oct 22, unidentified rioters vandalised a Buddhist idol of Gautam Buddha at a Vihara in Khagrhachharhi's Guimara.

On October 22, a mob attacked the police and injured eight police personnel after a brick kiln owner was shot at and critically injured during a robbery attempt at Chaksikandar village under Bidupur police station (Vaishali district, Bihar).

assoc_actor_1: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; Hindu Group (India)
source: The Times of India - Kochi Edition
notes: On October 22, in Erumely town (Kottayam, Kerala), BJP workers and Hindu activists became violent during a demonstration against women entering the Sabarimala Temple. Police used force to intervene and ensure the safety of a woman trying to enter the temple.

On October 22, a clash broke out between the supporters of the BJD Khandapada MLA and supporters of a BJD MP, during Jana Sampark Padayatra (political pilgrimage) in Banamalipur Panchayat (Nayagarh district, Odisha), over accusations of corruption.
On October 22, in Pachal village in Namakkal Tehsil (Namakkal, Tamil Nadu), a mob entered a government school and assaulted a math teacher because he was sexually harassing one of his students.

On October 22, at least five policemen were injured in stone pelting while trying to prevent a mob from lynching an alleged criminal in Kalyanpur village in Bidupur police station area (Vaishali district, Bihar).

On 22 October, a man was shot and injured during a riot over court orders to evict a shop tenant on Malout Road in Muktsar (Muktsar, Punjab). The man was shot by a retired police officer during the riot, and a car was damaged by a group opposing the eviction. No further details.

On 22 Oct, in Piparpati Pacharauwa (Bara, Narayani), Benauli locals clashed with cadres of Federal Socialist Forum Nepal (FSFN) over the construction of a hospital. Police fired tear gas shells to contain the situation. The source did not mention weapons used. 2 were injured.
22 October. A man beat an eighty year-old to death, accusing him of witchcraft.

On October 21, locals beat up and detained an Assistant Conservator of Forest (ACF) in Tainsi village in Satkosia area (Angul district, Odisha), while he was investigating the death of a man on the same day by the Bengal tigress Sundari. The locals blocked a road and pelted stones at the police, who resorted to lathicharge.

On October 21, two groups from Arasahi and Harijanasahi villages pelted stones at each other and vandalized houses near Bhuban bus terminal in Bhuban city (Dhenkanal district, Odisha), after an argument over 'bhog' (Hindu religious food offering) during the bullock festival. The police resorted to lathicharge to disperse the locals.

On October 21, two groups clashed over a landlord-tenant dispute in Tollygunge Circular Road near New Alipore in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal). A 15-year-old disabled boy and two policemen were injured during the fight, as groups were using batons and bamboo poles.

On October 21, eight people were arrested for attacking police with lathi and iron rods and triggering a clash over playing loudspeaker inside a Puja pandal (temporary Hindu religious structure) at Moyda in Joynagar area (South 24 Parganas, West Bengal).

On 21 Oct, in Krishnanagar (Kapilbastu, Lumbini), police fired warning shots and lobbed tear gas canisters to contain clashing groups of young Muslims and Hindus fighting over the route of Durga idols for Dashain celebration (Hindu religious festival). The source did not mention weapons used. A curfew was enforced due to the situation.

As reported on Oct 21, a few days prior, the brothers of a murder victim chased down the gunman following the attack and hammered him to death in Wasayewala village (Okara, Sindh). The murder were caused by an old enmity between two families.
On Oct 21, violent confrontations between Palestinian rioters and Israeli soldiers were reported in Azzun.
On Oct 21, clashes between rioters and Israeli troops were reported to the east of Al Bureij refugee camp injuring 4 Palestinians.

On October 21st, two groups of MDC-Alliance fought at a shopping centre in Shurugwi (Midlands), over the decision to suspend certain members from the party for running as independents in the last election.
On October 21st, a lynch mob killed three suspected motorbike thieves in Hoima, setting fire to the corpse of one of the victims. Police are looking for those involved in the lynching.

On 21 Oct 2018, during the PKR division elections, two group of supporters clashed in front of the polling center at Subang Jaya Municipal (MPSJ) hall in Seri Kembangan, Selangor State. The Light Strike Force and police intervened.
On 21 Oct 2018, during the PKR division elections, a brawl between two groups took place at a voting center in Gombak District, Selangor State. The police intervened.
21 October. A vigilante group in Magbara village (no coordinates available- near Idi-Iroko) caught a man raping a young girl and severely beat him until the police arrived and arrested the man.
On 21 October, a large crowd of people set fire to several shops accused of being drug dens in Hillbrow' Johannesburg.

On October 21st, a riot broke out at a football match between two educational institutes, which was dispersed by police, who used tear gas and gunfire against the rioters (note that the source does not mention any casualties or fatalities). Two students were arrested by the riot police.

On 21 October 2018, after a Papuan student was killed suddenly in the street by a military office in Waroki village in Nabire regency, Papua province, a group of villagers found one of the four military members that was there during the student's death, and subsequently killed him in a mob attack, cutting his throat.
On Oct 20, dozens of Palestinians were injured during clashes with Israeli forces in Azzun after Israeli forces began a raid on the village.

On Oct 20, Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian farmers and olive harvesters in the Burin village, south of Nablus. A group of Israeli settlers threw rocks at Palestinian farmers while they were olive-picking in their lands in an attempt to force them to leave. The farmers tried to avoid the settlers. No serious injuries reported.
On Oct 20, a Palestinian family were seriously injuried when their vehicle was attacked by stones thrown by settlers while driving between Nablus and Qalqilya.

On 20 Oct, students of Jawahar Navodya Vidayala boarding school staged a violent demonstration at Kotranka village (Rajouri, J&K), accusing the school of providing them with substandard food and calling for the transfer of the school principal. Students allegedly attacked the vehicle of the school's principal and threw stones at his residence.
On 20 October, members of the Seshego community hunted down a murder suspect and killed him with various objects in a incidence of mob violence in Seshego, Limpopo.

On Oct 20, 25 activists of ruling Awami League (AL) and Jubo League were injured during a clash to establish supremacy at Bharol village in Mirpur upazila (Kushtia). Both factions pelted stones at each other and used sticks and iron rods.
On October 20, a 70-year-old woman's tongue was chopped off by villagers after she was accused of being a witch, in Radia village under Tilauthu police station (Rohtas district, Bihar).

On October 20, two groups clashed and pelted stones at each other in Sitamarhi city (Sitamarhi district, Bihar), after a dispute on the immersion of a Durga idol during a Hindu festival. The police fired shots in the air to disperse the mob. Later an 82-year-old man was found dead on a road in the city, with most parts of the body charred.

source: The Times of India - Jaipur Edition
notes: On October 20, in Jaipur city (Jaipur, Rajasthan), a mob of people beat a man to death because of his criminal record in the area.

On October 20, two groups clashed over Puja immersion (Hindu religious celebration) at Bandroni market area in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal). The police resorted to lathicharge to stop the mob, and at least five people were injured.

On 20 October, two communities (unidentified, at least one assumed to be Hindu) clashed in Baraw village near Colonelganj in Gonda district (Uttar Pradesh) during the Durga immersion celebrations, when one group wanted to take the procession through a different road. Several police officers and a district magistrate were injured when the sides started throwing stones, and police had to use a lathi charge to disperse the crowd.

On 20 October, two communities (unidentified, at least one assumed to be Hindu) threw stones and clashed during a Durga immersion procession at Khaira Bazan near Bahraich (Bahraich, Uttar Pradesh), apparently after one group sprayed colours at the minority group. Around 10 people were injured, and there was some looting in the market. Police pacified the situation seemingly without physical intervention. There has also been a case registered against some for shouting anti-national slogans.
On 20 October, two communities clashed in Siddharth Nagar district, Uttar Pradesh, over an idol immersion procession there. Two people were arrested. No further details.
On October 20, 2018, in Old Town Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, there was a massive brawl between migrants currently residing in Sarajevo. One person suffered serious injuries.
On Oct 19, a Palestinian was shot with live fire in the chest during clashes that broke out in Jabal al Tawil, east of Al Bireh. It is not clear what the reason for the clashes was.

The son of a qat merchant who had been killed by a soldier from the Giants Brigade (10th Brigade) in the western coast city of Tuhayta assaulted the soldier, managed to grab his weapon and killed him.

source: Indian Express; UNI (United News of India)
notes: On October 19, local tribal youths set fire to four houses of Muslims in Lalit Bazar area under Ranirbazar police station (West Tripura district, Tripura), after a clash allegedly broke out between two groups in connection with molestation case in the area. More than 70 Muslim families left their houses and took shelter at Ranirbazar police station.
On October 19, in Kochi town (Ernakulam, Kerala), unidentified actors attacked and threw stones at the house of a woman attempting to enter the Sabarimala temple. There were no injuries.

source: The Times of India - Kochi Edition
notes: On October 19, in Thiruvananthapuram city (Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala), unidentified actors attacked and threw stones at the house of a woman attempting to enter the Sabarimala temple. There were no injuries.
On October 19, a mob lynched a man at Moran police station area (Dibrugarh district, Assam). The victim was the brother of a man accused of killing a couple following a family dispute, on October 18.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On October 19, hundreds of people blocked roads and vandalized public property in Chitranjan road, Lakhisarai city (Lakhisarai district, Bihar), after 15-year-old girl was seriously injured when she leapt from a building and landed on high voltage wire, as she escaped a group who tried to rape her. The police resorted to lathicharge to stop the rioters.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On October 19, one person was killed and five were injured after a dispute over the route to carry out Durga immersion procession (Hindu religious festival) led to clashes in Chando village (Palamu district, Jharkhand). The mob pelted stoned and torched property and the police resorted to firing.
On October 19, two communities clashed in Bakoria village (Palamu district, Jharkhand), over a procession of Durga Puja (Hindu religious ceremony). Two people were arrested.

source: The Times of India - Kochi Edition
notes: On October 19, in Murukkumpuzha town (Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala), unidentified actors attacked and threw stones at the house of a woman attempting to enter the Sabarimala temple. There were no injuries.

On 19 October, there was a clash between police and Hindu devotees taking part in a Durga ritual immersion (Hindu ceremony) near Mayur Vihar in Trilokpuri area of East Delhi (Delhi). A group of devotees attempted to exit the immersion site through the entrance, which caused chaos, and turned violent when police tried to correct them. 8 officers were injured and the rioters damaged a police vehicle. 11 people were detained.

On 19 October, rioting groups of rice millers and farmers clashed in the grain market at Malout (Muktsar, Punjab) after the rice millers rejected a paddy transaction approved by government agents, claiming that the moisture content was too high. This led to a clash between the groups, with three farmers eventually being hospitalised.

On Oct 19, residents of Kirshan Kolhi village (Badin, Sindh) attacked police forces who raided the village and recovered thousands of litres of alcohol. The police baton-charged the villagers, injured 10 women, and arrested 8 men.

On 19 October, a mob threw stones at the house of councillor Vijay Madan in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab) after the train tragedy there. Madan had organized the Dashera celebration which was hit by trains.
On October 19, in Secunderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), a group of TRS activists clashed with a group of Congress activists over conflicting processions. The number of injuries was not reported.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of India (2014-); Police Forces of India (2014-) Home Guards
notes: On October 19, an ASI of West Bengal police, posted as a security guard, was beaten up and severely injured by youths, including a police sergeant, fire fighting staffers and a home guard, at the Tollygunge police housing estate in Kolkata city (West Bengal). The man had protested against people drinking alcohol inside the police quarters.

On October 19, locals attacked a truck driver's assistant after a road accident left three persons killed and five injured near Bandel city area (Hooghly district, West Bengal) . The police resorted to lathicharge to control the mob.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Government Railway Police
notes: On 19 October, local residents allegedly beat up two rail gate guards and damaged rail infrastructure in the immediate aftermath of the Amritsar rail accident, in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab). They held the gatemen partially responsible for the tragedy.

On 19 October, two groups clashed in Seelampur area of E. Delhi (Delhi) over ownership of a shop and theft of clothes from a warehouse in the area. The groups were both armed and threatened the others with sticks and guns, but there are no reports of firing. However, several people were injured in the physical fighting. Police were present at the brawl but did not intervene.

On 19 Oct, in Krishnanagar (Kapilbastu, Lumbini), rioters (assumed Muslim) threw stones from terraces of the houses near a mosque at a Hindu Durga idols procession in the town in celebration of Dashain (Hindu religious festival). The source did not mention the reason for the incident. One person was seriously injured.

assoc_actor_1: UNPD: United Party for National Development; Vigilante Group (Zambia)
notes: On October 18th, youths suspected to belong to the UNPD physically assaulted Chilufya Tayali (the leader of the Economic and Equity Party) as he left the magistrates court in Lusaka.
