On 18/10/2018, as part of the agitation led by February 14 Youth Coalition, anti-regime rioters in Karbabad threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas.

source: Jordan News Agency (Petra); Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Oct 18, 5 Palestinians were injured by Israeli gunfire during clashes in Urif. Clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces after more than 50 settlers stormed the village.

On October 18, in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru, Karnataka), a 30-person mob attacked a group of residents with lathis and vandalized property for organizing a traditional folk dance (Dandiya) party, leaving several of the residents injured.

source: The Times of India - Mumbai Edition
notes: On October 18, near Kanjirappally town in Kanjirappally tehsil (Kottayam, Kerala), Hindu activists staged demonstrations and threw stone at women walking toward the Sabarimala shrine during a hartal over women being allowed into the Sabarimala temple.

On October 18, labourers of a tea garden vandalized the residence and assaulted the father of a man accused of killing a couple following a family dispute, at Moran police station area (Dibrugarh district, Assam).

On 18 October, a police ASI was beaten by villagers in Rohno (Khanna, Ludhiana, Punjab) while detaining and frisking a man who interrupted a Ramlila function (Hindu ceremony) in the village. Some villagers opposed the frisking and attacked the officer, beating him and throwing his turban.
On Oct 18, two groups of the Bajkani community clashed with clubs, rocks, and iron rods in Rahamdil Bajkani village (Tangwani, Kashmore, Punjab). 6 people were hospitalized with injuries.

On Oct 18, enraged power customers attacked a team of the Hyderabad Electric Supply Co (Hesco) and injured 3 people in Christian Colony area of Mirpurkhas town (Sindh) after several days of a bad power supply from a broken transformer.

assoc_actor_1: PDCI: Democratic Party of Ivory Coast
notes: On October 17, clashes between supporters of the elected mayor, Fany Karim and Ginette Ross, PDCI candidate after electoral results in the city of Issia. Looting and massive destruction were reported.
On 17/10/2018, as part of the agitation led by February 14 Youth Coalition, anti-regime rioters in Nuwaidrat threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas.
On 17/10/2018, as part of the agitation led by February 14 Youth Coalition, anti-regime rioters in Buri threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas.

On Oct 17, Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian homes in the northern West Bank village of Urif, south of Nablus, sparking clashes with residents. They smashed windows of at least 3 homes and caused panic among the civilian population. Clashes broke out when locals tried to push the settlers out of the village.

On 17 Oct, after news of the deaths of LeT militants in a clash in the Fateh Kadal area spread, rioters took to the streets and clashed with government forces in various parts of Srinagar city (J&K), including the Fateh Kadal, Karfali Mohalla, Safa Kadal, Rajouri Kadal, Nowhatta, Khanyar, Rainawari and Eidgah areas. The clashes sparked a spontaneous shutdown in the city.

On October 17, near Sabrimala (Pathanamthitta, Kerala), police clashed with over 100 Hindu devotees who were prevented from gaining entry into the Lord Ayyappa temple. The number of injuries was not reported.

On October 17, three families were attacked by villagers at Aswastapada village (Nayagarh district, Odisha), after being ostracised by a kangaroo court following an altercation over flow of drainage water.

assoc_actor_2: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: On 17 Oct, in Bardibas (Mahottari, Janakpur), unidentified assailants set fire to the office of NCP UML.
On 17 Oct, in Bardiya district (Bheri), an elderly man was severely injured after being beaten by villagers over witchcraft allegations.
On 17 October, properties belonging to foreign nationals have been looted after a 26-year-old man was arrested for murder in Middelburg, Mpumalanga.
On 17 October, Mkhuhlu community members clashed with a pastor's supporters outside the Calcutta Magistrate's Court during a hearing.

On Oct 16, four people including a fisheries department officer were injured when fishermen attacked members of a mobile court while they were conducting a drive at Matlab Upazila on Meghna River over the ongoing Hilsa ban. Police fired blank rounds to control the situation. Report does not indicate whether the fishermen were armed.
On 16 Oct, rioters assaulted an independent candidate in the Nowshera area of Srinagar city (J&K) amid a JRL shutdown on the final day of municipal elections in J&K.

On October 16, a former JNU students union president's (Kanhaiya Kumar) convoy was attacked during a rally near Dahia village (Begusarai district, Bihar). The incident started after a fight broke out between the president supporters (affiliated to the AISF) and Bajrang Dal supporters. The vehicles were vandalized and at least six people were injured.
On 16 October, villagers from Batriana village (Sangrur, Punjab) assaulted two men and beat them severely, thinking they were thieves.

On 16 October, two youth were tied to a pole and beaten with belts by several villagers on suspicion of theft, in Loni village (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh). The boys were subsequently handed over to police.

On Oct 16, students and parents of the victims rioted after a passenger bus collided with a school van near the Salim Interchange near Bhalwal town (Sargodha, Punjab). They set the bus on fire, smashed the windows of other cars, and blocked the Sargodha-Gujrat road.

On Oct 16, two groups of PTI supporters (led by an MNA and MPA) brawled in the Taiser town area of Malir town (Karachi, Sindh) over accusations of supporting land encroachments in the area. No casualties reported.

On 16 Oct 2018, police officers in plain clothes and uniforms fired gunshots during an anti-drug raid in Prek Pra commune, Chbar Ampov district, Phnom Penh. An altercation between police and local residents occurred during the raid. Two women fainted and were sent to hospital.

On October 16, five police officers were attacked by hawkers using sticks in Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed region. The attack was believed to be about the destruction of illegal structures by local municipalities with the support of the police.

On October 15, devotees clashed with the police at the Nartiang Durga Temple in Nartiang village (West Jainia Hills district, Meghalaya) after an argument over the appointment of a priest. The group hurled stones at the police, burnt firewood and used sharp weapons, while the police resorted to lathicharge. Over 40 people were injured.
On 15 Oct, three were injured when rival groups of students clashed at the University of Jammu in Jammu city (J&K). It is unclear what prompted the clash.

source: The Times of India - Mumbai Edition
notes: On October 15, in Sama village in Vadodara Tehsil (Vadodara, Gujarat), local residents attacked seven non-Gujarat migrant workers, leaving them injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

On 15 October, two students were injured in a clash between groups of students at Jamia Millia Islamia in New Delhi (Delhi). The cause of the fight is unknown, but the groups seem to have been regional - Western UP students and outsiders attacking Mewati students, who took shelter in the university mosque. However, details in the reports are vague. Police were deployed but do not seem to have intervened.
On October 15, a man was assaulted by a mob after shooting another person over an argument at Budharaja daily market in Sambalpur city (Sambalpur district, Odisha).

On 15 October, a man fired and threw stones at a religious gathering in Sarai Maddu village (Mainpuri, Uttar Pradesh). A mob of villagers chased the attacker in anger, and eventually cornered him at a nearby ravine. The man fired at the crowd, hitting and killing a young Dalit man who was part of the mob.
14 October. An alleged highwayman died lynched by young people during the night time hours in Kakombe district.
On Oct 14, Israeli settlers threw stones at Palestinian vehicles near Huwwara junction, south of Nablus. It is not clear whether the vehicles were occupied.
On Oct 14, Jubo Dal members attacked the police when the latter tried to arrest a leader during a procession in Maulvibazar town. Four policemen were injured. The rioters used bricks and sticks.

On October 14, former JNU Students Union president (Kanhaiya Kumar) and around 100 others physically assaulted and threatened doctors at AIIMS in Patna city (Patna district, Bihar), when the group was visiting the president of All India Students Federation (AISF), who was admitted at the orthopaedics department.
On October 14, in Jabalpur town (Jabalpur, MP), relatives of a patient assaulted a doctor because he was from a lower caste.
On 14 Oct, youths clashed with security forces during a police CASO at Arihal village (Pulwama, J&K). Dozens of youths were arrested during the confrontation and on the day following.
On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers came to blows during by-election polling in NA-131 constituency (Lahore district, Punjab). No information on injuries; police reportedly arrested some PTI workers.
On Oct 14, two groups of PML-N supporters scuffled over the distribution of food in NA-131 constituency (Lahore district, Punjab). No information on casualties.
On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers got into a minor clash during by-election polling in the Nadirabad area of Cantonment (Lahore, Punjab). No information on injuries.

On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers got into a minor skirmish during by-election polling at Lalik Jan Chowk in Wagha town (Lahore, Punjab). Law enforcement controlled the situation. No information on injuries.

On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers clashed during by-election polling near Shamsabad police station in Rawalpindi town (Punjab). They also clashed with police. 3 people were injured. 1 PTI worker was arrested for also attacking police officials.

On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers got into a minor wrestling and shouting match during by-election polling at Govt High School near Sarae Kala chowk in Taxila town (Rawalpindi, Punjab) over accusations of rigging.

On Oct 14, PTI and PML-N workers got into a minor clash during by-election polling at 6 Number School, Basti in Wah town (Taxila, Rawalpindi, Punjab). Law enforcement controlled the situation. No information on injuries.
On Oct 14, two groups of the Golata community clashed with sticks and bricks in the Zor Garh area (near Kandhkot, Kashmore, Sindh). 15 men were injured and arrested after medical treatment.

13 October (on or around). Following the discovery of the body of a retired naval captain by police, local youth in Olomoro set fire to the building where the body had been kept. The deceased had been kidnapped by his nephew.

On Oct 13, an Israeli army force raided Balaa, near Tulkarm in the northern occupied West Bank, provoking clashes with residents. One demonstrator was seriously injured when he was hit in the eye with a rubber bullet.
On Oct 13, Israeli forces destroyed a water pipeline in Kafr Qaddum sparking clashes with locals. An elderly woman was reportedly injured when she was hit with a tear gas canister in her mouth.

On Oct 13, several Palestinians suffocated from inhaling tear gas during clashes that broke out between Israeli forces and residents in the village of al-Walaja. All injured were treated at the scene. The village has recently had many military raids.

assoc_actor_1: RHDP: Rally of Houphouetistes for Democracy and Peace
notes: In the night between Oct 13 and 14, supporters of the ruling RHDP coalition and supporters of Samy Merhy, the independent mayor of Lakota town clashed in Divo. Two injured.
On Oct 13, BCL members vandalised a counter of Hanif Paribahan in Chittagong city. Hanif Paribahan is absconding, he was given death penalty in the August 21 grenade attack case verdict.

On October 13, in Thane town (Thane, Maha), an unidentified group armed with sticks attacked the vehicle of a police informer and attempted to assault the informer. There were no injuries in the attack.

On October 13, two people from Assam were assaulted by villagers at Chimechamgre village (South West Garo Hills district, Meghalaya), on the suspicious of being border criminals. One of the men sustained a fractured leg during the beating.

On October 13, 2018, at Baru Beach in Srandakan district (Bantul, Yogyakarta), members the Islamic Jihadi Front (FJI) clashed with a group of fishermen who were holding a traditional Javanese ceremony, stating that the ceremony was blasphemous and antithetical to Islamic values.
On Oct 13, six pirates were beaten by fishermen and locals in Pachthakuri in Sadar upazila in Sirajganj. The pirates were later admitted to hospital by the police.
On 13 Oct 2018, in Kuala Lumpur, a group of men attacked a group of civilians with motorcycle locks during a religious ceremony near the Jinjang Selatan temple. Three men were injured.
On Oct 12, a Palestinian woman was killed and her husband was wounded when they were attacked by settlers who threw large rocks at their car. The woman was killed by a head wound.

Clashes erupted between Yemeni citizens of Hat district and Saudi forces after citizens removed cameras used by Saudi forces that overlooked their houses. Clashes ensued as Saudi forces attempted to enter the citizens' houses after they had removed the cameras.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
notes: On 12 Oct, rioters clashed with government forces during a joint army and SOG CASO at Naidgam village (Shopian, J&K). A cowshed caught fire during the clash when it was hit by a tear gas canister.
On 12 Oct, injuries were reported during a clash between rival groups of taxi drivers and hoteliers at Vinayak Bazar in Jammu city (J&K). It is unclear what prompted the confrontation.

On Oct 12, at least 20 people were injured in a clash between two factions of Awami League over establishing supremacy at Kesmatpur village in Harinakundu upazila. Report did not indicate whether the factions were armed.

On October 12th, a mob attacked journalists covering a trial involving a local businessman (who is also a head of department in a college) in Kitwe (Copperbelt). The attackers are believed to be supporters of the businessman, who is accused (along with one other man) of aggravated burglary.
On 12 Oct 2018, two robbery suspects were lynched by a mob in Kiptule area of Kericho West subcounty. The suspects were stoned to death after confessing their criminal activities.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Wavoora village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

11 October. An angry mob set a tanker on fire in Lagos. The incident occurred after the tanker hit a motorcyclist, killing the driver and one passenger. The driver of the truck escaped before the mob burned the vehicle.
On 11/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Aali.
On 11/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Karbabad.

On Oct 11, a large group of Israeli settlers threw stones at Palestinian vehicles as they drove by the intersection of Yitzhar settlement near the site of an earlier stabbing. A settler leader urged military reprisals against the PA.
On Oct 11, clashes were reported between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Asira al Qibliya.
On Oct 11, clashes were reported between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Azzun following an Israeli raid in the northern part of the village.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Bumhama village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Badibera village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Gung Bug village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Qalamabad village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Langate village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Kralgund village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Nutnusa village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Kupwara district town. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Khumriyal village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Cheeri Koot village. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 Oct, more than two dozen rioters were injured in clashes with security forces across various locations in Kupwara district (J&K), including Tekipora village, where rioters pelted an army camp with stones. The clashes came as news spread of the death of prominent HM commander Manan Bashir Wani during a CASO in Handwara tehsil.

On 11 October, residents of Budhana town (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh) rioted, throwing stones, attacking police and destroying vehicles over the attempted arrest of a trader in the town. Police say that the man had been harassing school girls, but locals say police were framing the shopkeeper and that police had harassed him over allegedly encroaching onto the road. Three police were damaged in the incident.

On 11 October, family members of an accused molester attacked police when they arrived to arrest him, in Loni area of Ghaziabad (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh). The family members tore officers' uniforms and threw stones at them.

On Oct 11, a mob of residents of the Mauza Mota Singh area (Lahore, Punjab) attacked a team of anti-encroachment officials when they arrived for an operation. They also broke the windows of their vehicles and damaged a crane.

On October 11th, renewed clashes took place between students supporting the NCP and those aligned with other political parties, at the University of El Gezira. A number of buildings at the University of El Gezira were set ablaze during the violence.
On 10/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.
On Oct 10, responding to stone throwing by Israeli settlers, students in Urif clashed with Israeli forces who were escorting the settlers.
On Oct 10, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinians in Kufr Nemeh. Several suffocation cases from tear gas were reported among Palestinians, including school students and women.
On Oct 10, clashes between Palestinians and Israeli forces broke out in Abu Qashsh during a raid.
On October 10, about 500 people attempted to lynch five Syrian nationals who were detained on account of sexual assault targeting children, after the trial in the Courthouse of Kale town, Denizli.
As reported on October 10, head of HDP Bursa Branch was beaten up by a group of 10 people in the city.

On October 10, in Morthala village of Chotila tehsil (Surendranagar, Gujarat), two groups of villagers clashed over two people from different communities eloping. Four people were injured and three houses were set on fire.

On October 10, two policemen were seriously injured in a clash with locals at Balitika-Konwarpur area (Lakhimpur district, Assam), when a police team from Dolaghat Police Outpost tried to arrest a man wanted for running a fake gold racket.

On October 10, in Vadodara city (Vadodara, Gujarat), a mob of locals clashed with group of non-Gujarati migrant labourers, leaving several people injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

assoc_actor_1: Hindu Group (India); Shiv Sena; VHP: Vishwa Hindu Parishad
notes: On 10 October, the Sanyunkt Hindu Sangharsh Samiti (which includes Shiv Sena and Vishwa Hindu Parishad) forcibly closed meat and non-vegetarian shops in Gurgaon (Gurgaon, Haryana) in observance of Navratri. The group claims to have 'firmly requested' the closure of 300 shops, but shopkeepers claimed they were intimidated, threatened, or physically assaulted. Some reports refer to this as a concerted effort to close shops, while others call it a demonstration.

On Oct 10, two factions of the Awami League clashed in Boalmari upazila in Faridpur injuring 12 people. Report did not mention if they were armed. The clash started after a goat owned by a member one faction strayed into a lady finger field owned by another.
On 10 October, 43 individuals allegedly harassed and 'manhandled' income tax officers during a site survey to textile businesses in Ludhiana (Ludhiana, Punjab).
On October 9th, students at El Gezira University (at Wad Madani, Al Jazirah) clashed with NCP students, in which the NCP students were driven from the dormitory.

On October 9, a tribal kangaroo court forced a farmer to chop off all fingers on his 66-year-old father's hands in Radhakrishnapur village (Birbhum district, West Bengal), before a crowd of 100 that included the village headman. The court accused the elderly man of witchcraft following claims he prayed 'moving his fingers on the floor".

On October 9, in Porsa village in Porsa tehsil (Morena, MP), a mob threw stones at a non-Gujarati migrant labourer, hitting him and leaving his property damaged. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

On 9 October, a group of at least three people attacked and beat four bailiffs with their belts in Cheecha Bhakna village under Gharinda police station (Amritsar, Punjab). The officials were taking possession of land per a court order after the resolution of a land dispute.
On 9 Oct, no injuries were reported when unknown persons pelted stones at the residence of a candidate at Giraj village (Ganderbal, J&K). The residence was damaged by the incident.

On October 9, a woman was killed at Sheohar village under Dumra police station area (Sitamarhi district, Bihar), on the suspicion of being a sorcerer. The victim's three brothers-in-law and a sister-in-law were arrested, accused of slitting open her throat. Another, who persuaded the family members that the woman should be killed because she was a witch, was also arrested.

On October 9, in Gulbarga city (Kalaburagi, Karnataka), a mob pelted a car and attempted to set it on fire after the driver accidentally killed a young woman. The police intervened and arrested seven of the rioters.
On Oct 9, two groups of students at the U of Agriculture in Faisalabad town (Punjab) clashed for unknown reasons, resulting in many injuries.

On October 8th, the leader of a mining gang was attacked and severely beaten by a rival gang, in Mbizo (Matabeleland North). He was staying at his girlfriend's abode at the time, and is reported to be in a critical condition in hospital.
On 8/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.

On 8 Oct, a local BJP candidate was hospitalised after rioters pelted him with stones after he voted in local elections at Dachigram (Bandipora, J&K). The violence occurred during a JRL shutdown across the Kashmir Valley, in protest against panchayat and municipal elections.

On October 8, in Pazhavilai village in Agasteeswaram tehsil (Kanyakumari, TN), two groups of administrators clashed over establishing control of Nadar Mahajana Sangam (NMS) Kamaraj Polytechnic College. Police intervened with lathi charge. Two people were injured.

On October 8, in Vaghodia tehsil (Vadodara, Gujarat), a mob attacked a group of non-Gujarati migrant labourers, leaving five of the labourers injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.
On 8 Oct, voters assaulted photojournalists at the Bemina polling station in Srinagar city (J&K), amid concerns about potential ramifications of voting in the heavily boycotted local elections.

assoc_actor_1: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; JKPDP: Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party
notes: On 8 Oct, police resorted to a baton charge to quell election violence between rival PDP and BJP activists in Poonch district town (J&K). During the clash, rival activists had beaten a BJP activists.

assoc_actor_1: MNS: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena; Vigilante Group (India)
notes: On October 8, in Thane town (Thane, Maha), MNS workers assaulted a north Indian man from Bihar because he was accused of sexually assaulting a young girl.
On 8 October, Gau Rakshak Dal members attacked and beat up two men for transporting 23 bulls, near Namaste Chowk in Karnal (Karnal, Haryana). The two men were handed to police and arrested.

actor2: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force; Police Forces of India (2014-)
notes: On 8 Oct, rioters clashed with government forces during a joint Rashtriya Rifles, police and CRPF CASO at Jalalabad village in Sopore tehsil (Baramulla, J&K).

On 8 October, a group of around 25 men allegedly attacked 4 students at Gandhi Mohamad Ali Memorial Inter College in Ballia district (Uttar Pradesh). The students claim they were attacked by men with lathis chanting pro-Pakistan slogans.

On Oct 8, two groups of Channa community men attacked each other with sticks over the ownership of agricultural land in Sehwan Sharif town (Sehwan, Jamshoro, Sindh). 1 man was severely injured and 3 people were arrested.
On 8 Oct, in Mainakaderi VDC area (Saptari, Sagarmatha), a woman was force fed human excrete by a villager on witch allegations.

On October 8th, two groups of illicit gold miners clashed at the unregistered mine of Vova outside of Gwanda (Matabeleland South), following the discovery of a gold strip at the site. One miner died in the clash, and five were wounded. Police have made six arrests.
08 October. Locals in Bukwavu caught a thief and tried to set him on fire. Police intervened.

actor1: Police Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina (2018-)
notes: On October 8, 2018 in Bihac, Bosnia and Herzegovina, there was a massive brawl among immigrants accommodated there. Police fired warning shots after it reportedly appeared that a group of imigrants was about to attack them. Several people were injured in the brawl among the migrants.

On October 7th, a vigilante mob beat and set fire to two civilians who had been mistaken for thieves, as they left a drinking establishment in Mombassa. Both men (who were relatives) were killed in the attack.

assoc_actor_2: FRELIMO: Liberation Front of Mozambique; Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-)
notes: On Oct 7, RENAMO and FRELIMO supporters clashed in Tete after their rallies converged. Police fired live shots in the air to disperse them. The RENAMO supporters allegedly beat and detained several FRELIMO supporters and burt the car of one of them.
On Oct 7, rallying Renamo supporters vandalized the headquarters the Frelimo office in Milange, Zambezia. A Frelimo member living nearby was injured and hospitalised.
On 7 October, a man died and two others were injured when a mob attacked them, accusing them of terrorising the community in Olievenhoutbosch, Centurion, Pretoria.
On 7/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.

On Oct 7, clashes broke out in Shuwaykah Sunday night as Israeli forces searched the village for the Palestinian gunman who killed two Israeli citizens and injured a third earlier in the day. Palestinians threw Molotov cocktails and rocks at Israeli troops.
On October 7, crude bombs were hurled at Gokha Sahi under Baseli police limits (Puri district, Odisha), over a land dispute. Two youths were suspected to be involved in the case.

On October 7, in Vaghasi village in Anand tehsil (Anand, Gujarat), a mob attacked a group of eight non-Gujarati migrant labourers, leaving the labourers injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

On October 7, in Vaghodia tehsil (Vadodara, Gujarat), a mob attacked a group of eight non-Gujarati migrant labourers, leaving the labourers injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

On 7 October, there was a clash between villagers and the security guards of BJP MLA Kulwant Bazigar in Theh Banera village (Kaithal, Haryana) during a public contact program. A young man was arguing with the MLA over a policy issue, which got heated and the security guard grabbed the man. Villagers supported him, leading to a clash and stone throwing before the MLA's caravan escaped - leaving two of the MLA's supporters injured.

source: The Times of India (TOI) - Ahmedabad Edition
notes: On October 7, in Sankarda in Vaghodia tehsil (Vadodara, Gujarat), a mob attacked two non-Gujarati migrant labourers, leaving the labourers injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

On 7 October, members of Hindu and Muslim communities in Bargadwa village (Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh) clashed over a flag flying in the area. Both groups were armed with sticks and threw stones. Police had to use force to disperse the fight.

On October 7, supporters of a BJP leader (under the Savarna Ekta Manch) clashed with supporters of BJD Bihar Chief minister at Gandhi Maida in Gaya city (Gaya district, Bihar). The groups were demonstrating at the venue when a fight started. Gunshots were heard. Activists of the Manch demonstrated alleged police atrocities on the upper caste people in the Belaganj police station area of the district during the September 6 anti-reservation bandh. They also demanded release of the upper caste men arrested during the bandh and withdrawal of cases.

On 7 Oct, in Kharang VDC (Sankhuwasabha, Koshi), bandh supporters vandalized a bus and injured a person on charge of defying bandh at Chainpur-11 called by the CPN Maoist cadres, demanding the release of their arrested leaders and cadres.
Assumed on 7 Oct, near Tripurakot (Dolpa, Karnali), a civilian was beaten by a villager over allegations of being a witch. The source did not mention the nature of the injury.
07 October. A woman was killed by unknown assailants in Mutaho. She had been accused of witchcraft.
On 7 October, an angry mob at Mbayani in Blantyre beat to death a 33-year-old man for hacking his ex-lover in an attempt to kill her.
On Oct 7, MDM supporters allegedly attacked a Frelimo member in Mueda, Cabo Delgado, tearing his t-shirt apart. MDM denied the event.
On Oct 7, the head of Renamo MDM's list declared they were attacked by Frelimo 'shock groups', without serious injury. However, a Renamo member fractured his arm as result of the attack.
On October 7, 2018 in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, there was a brawl among the migrants currently residing at the main Sarajevo train station.

On Oct 6, rioters exploded a crude bomb in front of Awami League office in Burichong district (Comill, Chittagong). Police recovered four crude bombs and four Molotov bomb-like objects from the scene. No reason stated in report.

actor2: Police Forces of Myanmar (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On 6 Oct 2018, Sittwe, Sittwe Township, Rakhine State, a riot broke out in the Sittwe prison after prison staff wanted to search two inmates for narcotic drugs. Some prison staff had minor injuries.

assoc_actor_2: IPFT: Indigenous Peoples Front of Tripura
notes: On October 6, BJP and IPFT workers clashed at Panboa village panchayat near Kamalpur city (Dhalai district, Tripura) over MGNREGA works. 11 BJP activists were injured, including six women.
Around 6 October, there was a clash between two groups of youth in Lucknow (Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh). No reason was given for the fight, but stones were thrown on both sides.
On 6/10/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Eker.

On October 6, in Sardarnagar and Ghatlodia areas of Ahmedabad city (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), a mob attacked a non-Gujarati migrant labourer in two separate attacks, leaving the labourers injured. Migrant labourers have been targeted after a 14-month-old girl from Himmatnagar in Sabarkantha was allegedly raped by a migrant labourer.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad
notes: On 6 October, a group of around 30 students - allegedly from ABVP - rioted, threw crude bombs, and set fire to the hostel where the new and former presidents of the Allahabad University Students' Union presidents (both from Samajwadi Chatra Sabha) live, in Allahabad (Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh), after split results for elections in the students' polls were announced.

On 6 Oct, in Bajura District (Seti), an unidentified group attacked a Chief Administrative Officer of Badimalika municipality allegedly over the latter's refusal to do a request for the ward chairman. The house of the ward chairman was also vandalized.

On Oct 6, dozens of PML-N workers besieged the armoured vehicle carrying detained party president Shehbaz Sharif outside of the National Accountability Bureau while he was on his way to court. They scuffled with police and climbed on top of vehicles. 1 PML-N worker was injured falling from a vehicle.
On 6 Oct, in Kilinochchi (Karachchi, Kilinochchi), rioters vandalized the Kanagapuram Velakanni church and stole a statue from the premises.
On Oct 5, residents of the Safi area (Mohmand, Khyber, KP) rioted and burned down 3 houses of the accused in the murder of an ANP leader the day before.

On Oct 5, a member of Ward 9 under Bashgari Union, Khabir Mridha was killed during a clash between opposing political factions in Madaripur town (Dhaka). Police fired hundreds of bullets and clashed with the rioters to bring the situation under control. Crude bombs were exploded, no other weapons were mentioned. 15 people and one policeman was injured.
05 October (on or around). An angry mob lynched a taxi driver in Rumonge. He died from his injuries at the hospital.
5 October 2018: An Al-Shabaab fighter was shot and killed with his own pistol after engaging in a fight with some youth in the Sagalaad village, Afgooye district. Approx location given.
On Oct 5, seven Palestinians were injured during clashes in Mazraa al Gharbiyeh. Dozens of Israeli settlers stormed the village leading to violent clashes between Israeli forces and Palestinians.

On 5 October, there was a clash between Sikhs aligned with SAD (Amritsar) and SAD members near the proposed rally site for an SAD leader (Parkash Singh Badal), in Talwandi Sabo area (Bathinda, Punjab). 3-4 people were injured. The SAD(A) members allegedly attacked a bus carrying the other SAD, with swords, rods, and sticks, though both sides accuse the other of violence.

assoc_actor_2: RENAMO: Mozambican National Resistance; MDM: Mozambique Democratic Movement
notes: On Oct 5, Frelimo supporters threw bottles containing alcoholic beverages against members of Renamo and MDM in Mandimba.

On 5 October, several men accosted Congress leader Jeet Singh Bhatia, slapping his face while he spoke with local media over a local infrastructure concern, in Mohkampura area of Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab).

assoc_actor_2: JKPDP: Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party
notes: Around 5 Oct, rival PDP and BJP activists clashed in Poonch district town (J&K) during campaigning for local elections.
Sometime between 24 Sep and 16 Oct, local residents assaulted health professionals carrying out measles/rubella vaccinations in the Loi Malhar area of Billawar tehsil (Kathua, J&K).
On Oct 5, Renamo supporters in Chimoio, capital of the central province of Manica, threw stones at the head of the Frelimo list.

On Oct. 5, 2018: A 32-year-old Iraqi national was hurt in a fight involving up to 60 migrants at the reception centre nearby Diavata, northern Greece. Authorities said the victim had been hit with a sharp object and was hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries.

On Oct 4, five people including a member of police were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) over formation of a committee at Chattogram College in Chittagong city.
On Oct 4, Israeli forces blocked roads leading to schools in Abu Dis. Students clashed with the soldiers, throwing stones and soldiers fired tear gas and rubber bullets.
On Oct 4, a Palestinian man threw a Molotov cocktail at Israeli soldiers in Qalailya causing no injuries. Israeli soldiers shot and wounded the assailant.

On Oct 4, a group of unidentified people attacked the house of Dr Ashikur Rahman Shanto, an Awami League nomination aspirant for Bhola 2 constituency, at Ukilpara area in Bhola town. They vandalised a number of vehicles and injuring 10-15 people. They report did not mention if the attackers were armed.

On Oct 4, in an internal clash between two rival groups of local Awami League at Charanchal Karimpur under sadar upazila of Narsingdi district two persons were killed and 10 others were critically injured. Report did not mention the use of weapons.

On Oct 4, activists of Chattogram Government College unit of Bangladesh Chhatra League clashed in Chittagong city over formation of the 25-member college committee. The rioters used sticks and rods and threw brickbats.
On October 4, two groups of students at MPC College in Baripada city (Mayurbhanj district, Odisha) clashed while some men lightened crackers. The authorities cancelled the students' union elections.
On 4 October, PTRC employees assaulted a group of people who had beaten a bus driver over a bag, in Bathinda (Bathinda, Punjab).

On 4 October, an unidentified mob attacked the caravan of SAD head Sukhbir Singh Badal in Sangrur (Sangrur, Punjab) over the Behbal Kalan firing. They attacked the car and threw shoes, before police detained them. Various sources accuse Congress, Sikh hardliners, alternative factions of SAD, and the police, but no responsibility is clear.

On 4 October, a youth was assaulted by activists of a saffron outfit (Hindu right wing group) in Varanasi city (UP) over allegations of propagating Christianity. This is the second such attack reported in the city within 48 hours.
On 4 Oct, in Barsain area (Saptari, Sagarmatha), a woman was severely beaten by her neighbours over allegations of being a witch and casting a spell on their buffalo.
On 4 Oct, unidentified persons set fire to the front gate of a BJP candidate's residence in Srinagar city (J&K) in the lead up to local elections.
04 October. A man in Kirambi was killed after being accused of witchcraft.
04 October. An angry crowd in Sosso Nakombo killed three Chinese nationals and injured at least one other. The attack followed the drowning of a local youth leader who worked for the foreigners.

Overnight on Oct 2, Israeli forces clashed with Palestinian locals as the army surveyed a house in Al Amari for demolition. Rioters threw stones and Molotov cocktails at security forces who responded with riot dispersal methods.
On October 3, two BJP groups clashed at Akhaura Integrated Check post in Agartala city (West Tripura district, Tripura), over the collection of subscription from the importers and exporters.

On October 3, in Ahmedabad city (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), activists who were demonstrating and vandalizing property against the rape of an infant attacked a rickshaw driver from Uttar Pradesh, leaving him injured. Demonstrators had threatened people from outside Gujarat state previously.

On 3 October, a boy was severely beaten by family and relatives of a Dalit girl who accused him of sexually assaulting a 15 year old girl, in Dosanjh village (Moga, Punjab). He died of his injuries in hospital.

On 3 October, a group of young men gheraoed and attacked the car of a BJP MP (Raj Kumar Saini) in Rupraka village of Hathin (Palwal, Haryana). The mob tried to get the MP out of the car, but police intervened and dispersed the crowd.
On 3 Oct, in Suryabinayak (Bhaktapur, Bagmati), police fired tear gas shells to disperse an angry mob who earlier set a tipper on fire after it hit a motorcycle.

On 3 Oct, unidentified persons burnt down the paddy crop of a BJP candidate in the Dooru Verinag area (Anantnag, J&K). The candidate's name was reportedly on a militant 'hit list' in the lead up to local elections.

03 October. A hot argument ensued between members of a political party who had come with militias at a PDP primary venue in Okehi and other supporters. The thugs fired shots to scare people away for 15 minutes.
On 2/10/2018, anti-regime rioters in Eker threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas. The riots were part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation.
On Oct 2, around 50 students were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), Jahangirnagar University (JU) unit at Savar in Dhaka over a stalking of female students.

On October 2, two TMC groups clashed near Nabanna area, in Howrah city (Howrah district, West Bengal), over control of the local toto vehicles. The police intervened and crude bombs were hurled by the rioters.

Assumed on October 2, in Thoppalakarai village in Aruppukkottai Tehsil (Virudhunagar, TN), two groups clashed over ownership rights of a local temple. Three people were injured in the clash and private property was damaged.

On 2 October, a group of youths from Hindu Yuva Shakti attacked St Thomas Church at Girjaghar crossing in Varanasi city (UP), after a person posing as its priest allegedly offered Rs 20,000 per month to a Hindu youth for converting to Christianity. The rioters were dispersed by the police.

On October 2, a woman was beaten up and her head tonsured after she stood up opposing the marriage of her minor child, at Baterhat village (Dhubri district, Assam). The victim's 19-year-old son was forcibly married off to a minor girl earlier by her second husband. Police have arrested three women in connection with the case.
On 1/10/2018, anti-regime rioters in Eker threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas. The riots were part of the Shiite-led February 14 agitation.
On Oct 1, clashes were reported after Israeli forces stormed the Palestinian neighborhood of Jabal al Mukabbir in East Jerusalem.

assoc_actor_1: AL: Bangladesh Awami League; JeI: Jamaat-e-Islami; ICS: Islami Chhatra Shibir; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On Oct 1, Awami League and Jamaat-Shibir men snatched a detained Jamaat leader from police custody in Sirajganj's Ullapara upazila during the arrest.
As reported on October 1, students clashed on the campus of Dhamnagar College, in Nilagiri city (Bhadrak district, Odisha), over union elections.

On October 1, two groups of BMS workers and leaders engaged in clashes in Madhabbari area, in Jirania (West Tripura district, Tripura), over a dispute over authorization of trucks to carry good and materials to different parts of the state from Madhabbari terminus.

On October 1, a large mob attacked a woman health worker and vandalized property at Pharmapar High School, near Lanka city (Hojai district, Assam), following a rumour that a student had died after being administered Measles Rubella (MR) vaccine. The women suffered serious injuries. The police intervened, and the group resorted to stone pelting.
As reported on October 1, students clashed and crude bombs were hurled on the campus of Nilgiri College, in Nilagiri city (Balasore district, Odisha), over union elections.

01 October. Supporters of APC candidates Lado Abubakar and Ardo Abubakar clashed in Suleja. The groups reportedly used knives, machetes, and daggers during the attack, which left three wounded. Vehicles were also damaged during the clash.
01 October. A man was killed by unknown assailants after he was accused of witchcraft.

End September/early October, a man was killed by an angry mob that attacked him near Sedumedi JSS after being found with electric cables inside his bag, which they alleged he had stolen from inside people's houses

On September 30, an altercation between a youth and a alcohol vendor led to street fighting between gangs in the Oued Ghenim area of Sousse, resulting in the death of one individual, groups of youth also attacked, ransacked and burned homes and shops.
On Sept 30, dozens of Haredi settlers clashed with Palestinians and damaged Palestinian owned vehicles in the Old City of Al Quds. One Israeli and 5 Palestinians were injured.
On Sept 30, Israeli forces searched several homes triggering clashes with residents in Nahhalin. One soldier was lightly injured.

On Sept 30, a Palestinian teenager was shot and injured during clashes with Israeli forces in Ain al Saltan refugee camp. Israeli settlers escorted by Israeli military raided the camp sparking the clashes.

source: Palestine News and Information Agency (WAFA); The Times of Israel
notes: On Sept 30, clashes broke out in Batn al Hawa area of Ramallah when Israeli forces stormed a medical warehouse. 6 Palestinians were injured including a cameraman working for Reuters who was shot and injured with a rubber-coated steel bullet. A number of employees of the warehouse were arrested.

On Sept 30, BNP activists were locked into a chase and counter-chase with the law enforcers in city's Matsya Bhaban in Dhaka city. Police tried to intercept a procession of ward 20 unit BNP under Shahbagh thana on its way to Suhrawardy Udyan to join the party rally. BNP activists threw water bottles and brick chips at police.
On 30 September, a man was killed in a dispute between him and others at Rayya grain market in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab). The dispute was over building a shed in a vacant lot in the market.
On September 30, TMC groups clashed in Canning area (South 24 Parganas district, West Bengal), during the board formation of Gram Panchayats.

On September 30, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), supporters of a former DMK leader burned down the house of an unidentified armed actor who was earlier hacked to death the former DMK over an unresolved dispute. There were no injuries.

On September 30, a suspected cattle thief was assaulted by a mob in Deona Gaon village (Darrang district, Assam). Three police personnel, who tried to rescue him, were also attacked. Five people were arrested.

On September 30, two groups of the BJD clashed near Tarpur bypass at Kujang city (Jagatsinghpur district, Odisha), during a Mahila Samavesh (women's meeting) organised by the party. The fight started after some members raised slogans against the BJD Tirtol MLA.
On September 30, there were reports of a clash between TMC groups in Malda district (West Bengal), during the board formation of Gram Panchayats.
30 September. A woman was beaten to death by her neighbor who accused her of witchcraft.

On 30 September, 2018, there was a fight among local residents in Baymaksky district of Bashkortostan and Chechen workers who arrived to the region for work. About 30 people participated in the street fight. Two persons were arrested and one person was admitted in the hospital for receiving a stab wound. 1 Casualty.
On 29/9/2018, to express their anger at killing of three Shiites by the Saudi police in Qatif, rioters in Diraz threw Molotov cocktails at security forces.

On September 29, a group of people gathered in Sanliurfa city and walked protesting the Syrian refugee settlement in the city by marching around the town. Some members of the group damaged the houses and shops of Syrians. Police Forces intervened and detained 20 people.

On September 29, in Kambia district (Northern), SLPP and APC groups clashed over political violence related to an ongoing by-election, leaving 1-5 people dead. The by-election was suspended as a result.
On Sept 29, a Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) activist was killed and two others were injured in a factional clash in Lalkhan Bazar area under Kulshi Police Station in Chittagong city.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Government Railway Police
notes: On 29 September, Government Railway Police are accused of assaulting a group of students travelling on the Banda-Jhansi train (location unclear, coded at Banda, Uttar Pradesh). The group argued with police over seating on the train, then resisted eviction from the train before the GPR allegedly assaulted them.

On September 29, a mob torched a van in Asurali village (Bhadrak district, Odisha), on the suspicion that cattle were being smuggled to West Bengal. The group also vandalized other vehicles and staged a road blockade.

On 29 September, a man was killed after being hit by a car during a clash between Congress and SAD members in Lehrakhana village (Bathinda, Punjab) over distribution of wheat to ration beneficiaries. The fatality seems to have occurred when a driverless car ran over a bystander.

29 September 2018: The editor of Awareness Times newspaper, John Korama was assaulted by vigilantes of the ruling SLPP in the full glare of the police and the Chairman of the SLPP, while he was covering a bye-election at mile-14 in Tonko Limba.
On Sept. 29, 2018: Bloody clashes between Afghans and Syrians at the Malakasa migrant camp, north Athens led to the death of a 31-year-old Syrian refugee and injured eight more refugees.

On Sept. 29, 2018: Afghan and Syrian refugees fought at a migrant camp in Malakassa in the municipality of Oropus. A Syrian man died and at least eight other migrants were injured. The cause of the fight remained unknown. Later, camera footage was released showing an axe-wielding Afghan killing the Syrian man.
On 28/9/2018, to express their anger at killing of three Shiites by the Saudi police in Qatif, rioters in Abus Aybi threw Molotov cocktails at security forces.

source: Agence France Presse; Arutz Sheva; Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Sept 28, violent clashes broke out across the Gaza Strip. Rioters threw Molotov cocktails, grenades, and stones at Israeli forces. They also burned tires. A 12 year old Palestinian was shot in the head by Israeli forces and killed during clashes east of Khan Yunis. 2 other men were also killed in east of Khan Yunis. No Israelis were injured.
On Sept 28, Israeli forces raided Yuta village, which resulted in clashes with residents. Injuries among the residents were reported.
On Sept 28, at least 25 people were injured in a clash between two clans over land dispute in Sadar Upazila in Gopalganj (Dhaka). Report did not mention the name of the village or clan.
On 28 September, 9 people were injured in a clash between two groups in Bhokaheri village (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh), apparently over a three year old marriage. No further details.

As reported on September 28, a team of Odiya students and teachers was assaulted by local students in Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan University, in Agartala city (West Tripura district, Tripura). The Odiya group had questioned the locals how the money given for Teachers Day celebrations on campus was spent.

source: Agence France Presse; Arutz Sheva; Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Sept 28, a 14 year old Palestinian was shot dead by Israeli forces during clashes east of Al Bureij.

source: Agence France Presse; Arutz Sheva; Ma'an News Agency
notes: On Sept 28, 3 residents of Gaza city were killed during clashes with Israeli forces in Gaza district.
On Sept 28, Israeli sources reported a clash between Israeli forces and Palestinian rioters in the area of Jalazon.
On 27 September, a teenager was lynched by family of the village pradhan, in Jatpura village (Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh) after being caught with his granddaughter.
On 27 September, a youth was tied to an electricity pole and beaten by a mob who accused him of having a relationship with a woman in the town, in Meeraganj (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh).
On 27 Sep, rioters clashed with government forces in the Dialgam area (Anantnag, J&K) in response to CASOs staged in the district.
On 27 Sep, rioters clashed with government forces in the Larkipora area (Anantnag, J&K) in response to CASOs staged in the district.

Around 27 September, two man who sexually harassed a girls in two separate cases in Muzaffarnagar town (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh) were beaten by a group of onlookers and later handed over to police.

assoc_actor_1: INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India)
notes: On 27 September, supporters of state INTUC president Hardeep Singh Bawa rioted and vandalized some vehicles after he was attacked by unidentified assailants earlier in the day, near Parwanoo (Solan, Himachal Pradesh).

On Sept 27, clashes broke out at Yousef's tomb near Nablus. Israeli settlers arrived to the religious site protected by Israeli forces sparking clashes with locals. Israeli forces used rioter dispersal means and injured more than 20 Palestinians, including 2 journalists.
On Sept 27, Palestinians prevented settlers from entering Al Aqsa mosque. Israeli forces intervened and sparked clashes which injured a number of Palestinians.
On Sept 27, Israeli forces raided a Palestinian high school for boys in the Einabous village, south of the northern West Bank city of Nablus, causing clashes to break out. No injuries were reported.
On 26 Sep, an infant girl was killed when two communal groups armed with lathis and stones clashed over a land dispute at Bela village (Rajouri, J&K).

On September 26, a group of tourists from West Bengal, including some women and children, were chased and beaten up by locals at Astia Chhak in Baripada city (Mayurbhanj district, Odisha), after some men from the group made comments at local women. The tourists sustained injuries, some serious, and were admitted to hospital.

On 26 September, families of two students from Bibi Sharan Kaur Khalsa College clashed in Chamkaur Sahib (Rupnagar, Punjab) after the girl accused a male student of harassing her. Four people were injured.

On September 26, a woman was tied to a tree and assaulted at Purba Rangamati (Gomati district, Tripura), for being accused of having an illicit relationship with a married neighbour. The woman was injured and sent to hospital.

On 26 September, at least one person was killed and several injured in a fight between two Dalit groups in Nagla Bajurg village near Muzaffarnagar (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh). It was apparently over a 'minor dispute' - no further details given.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Nepal (2015-) Armed Police Force
notes: On 26 Sept, in Garuda city (Rautahat, Narayani), police fired warning shots and teargas shells to disperse villagers clashing over cremation of a body on the river bank near Shreepur village. The APF were also deployed. 17 were injured, including 5 police. The source did not mention weapons used in the clash.

Assumed on 26 Sept, in Rupandehi district (Lumbini), Nepal Student Union members vandalized school furniture and set fire to furniture of Lumbini Commerce Campus Unit over the appointment of 11 teachers and staffers.

On Sep 26, activists of IJeT and the All Pakistan Muttahida Students Organization clashed with clubs and stones at the Dawood University of Engineering and Technology (DUET) in Jamshed town (Karachi, Sindh). 2 people sustained minor injuries.

On Sept 26, clashes involving sticks and stones erupted between Frelimo and Renamo supporters in Nhamayabue as the official campaign for Mozambique's municipal elections began. Six Frelimo supporters, including one woman, were seriously injured.
On Sept 26, RENAMO and FRELIMO supporters clashed in Dondo as the official campaign for Mozambique's municipal elections began. No injuries.

On September 26th, a group of around 30 demonstrators from Nakori attacked civilians who had arrived at a disputed piece of land in Wa municipality (Upper West). As police later webt to arrest some suspects (on the same day or in the next days), some area residents clashed with the police to free the suspects. Police arrested 35. Coded as two separate events.

On Sept 26, a group of young Israelis caused serious injuries to Palestinians who were sitting outside of a grocery store in Jerusalem. The Israelis threw stones, used stun guns, cursed at and beat the Palestinians. The attack was racially motivated.
26 September. Supporters of the local Queen and Chief clashed in Apremudo community using acid. A house in the village was set ablaze. 14 people injured.

On Sept 25, Israeli forces opened fire on rioters in the northern Gaza strip and east of Khan Yunis. Rioters lit tires on fire and threw fireworks toward Israeli forces. 5 Palestinians were injured by live fire.

On Sept 25, Israeli forces opened fire on rioters in the northern Gaza strip and east of Khan Yunis. Rioters lit tires on fire and threw fireworks toward Israeli forces. 5 Palestinians were injured by live fire.

On 25 September, Hindu worshipers clashed with police in Maudaha area of Hamirpur (Hamirpur, Uttar Pradesh) when the officers tried to change the traditional Kans Mela procession route towards a Muslim area. 10 officers were injured in the clash and police had to use lathis and tear gas to disperse the rioters.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); NSUI: National Students Union of India; ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad
notes: On September 25, cadres of NSUI and ABVP clashed in Hailakandi town (Hailakandi city, Assam), during the freshers' social programme of the local SS College. The police intervened, and the rioters pelted stones at the officials. Five students, one crew member of an electronic media house, and a Deputy Superintendent of Police were injured.

On September 25, two groups clashed in Sambalpur University, Sambalpur city (Sambalpur district, Odisha), following an argument between a professor of the Political Science department and an M.Phil student. Two persons were injured and admitted to Burla hospital.
On Sept 25, a number of Palestinians suffocated after inhaling tear gas fired at them by Israeli forces during clashes in Zaboba village west of Jenin.
On Sept 25, Israeli forces opened fire on rioters on the border at al Bureij as they set tires on fire.
On Sept 24, the headquarters of a party linked to the PKK was raided by around 50 unidentified people in the city of Sulaimaniyah and attacked some of their members, and destroyed some property.

On September 24, two groups clashed over using Disc Jockey (DJ) sound system during the immersion of idol following completion of 'Khudurukuni Osha', near Malda under Bhandari Pokhari police station (Bhadrak district, Odisha). The police intervened and used lathicharge, as some people pelted stones at the officials. At least four policemen were injured.
On Sep 24, two groups of the Chandio community clashed with sticks in Mansoor Colony near or in Mehar town (Sindh). 2 men were injured.
On September 24, protesters and agents of the National Office of Sanitation (ONAS) clashed in Nabeul, security forces intervened and dispersed the protesters.
24 September. Attackers burned down a home, while the owner was still inside. The man was seriously injured. The attackers reportedly believed the man was a witch.

On 24 September, two people were tied to a tree and beaten by a group of at least 6 people on accusations of having an illicit affair, in Nawabganj (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh). The incident included family members but seems to have included others too.

24 September (or around). Following the murder of resident, a mob torched down five houses believed to be owned by the suspect's family. The mob did not trust in police forces and decided to take action
On 24 September 2018 in Lviv, 20-far right vigilantes armed with bats and knifes attacked a group of 4 anarchists from Black Flag organisation. 4 were injured and hospitalized.
On Sept 23, at least 15 people were injured in a clash between two groups of villagers over land dispute at Pirgacha Char area in Kazipur Upazila, Sirajganj.
On September 23, two groups of local villagers, mostly women, clashed over the right to perform Puja at the Durga Temple at Nartiang city (West Jaintia Hills district, Meghalaya).

On September 23, in Jaipur city (Jaipur, Rajasthan), two groups of vendors vandalized property and clashed over a minor dispute. Police detained eight of the rioters and three of the rioters were injured in the clash.

On September 23, in Tharamangalam town (Salem, TN), Hindu temple officials clashed with journalists who were visiting the Kailasanathar temple after a dispute arose. The number of injuries was not reported.

assoc_actor_1: VHP: Vishwa Hindu Parishad; Police Forces of India (2014-); Vigilante Group (India)
notes: On 23 September, some people from Vishwa Hindu Parishad assaulted and dragged an inter-faith couple to the police station in Meerut (Meerut, Uttar Pradesh) on accusations of 'love jihad'. The couple were detained at the station by police for some time. The police also verbally and physically abused the couple.

On Sep 23, two groups of the Kalhoro community clashed over water drainage issues in Kholar (aka Panjal Kalhoro) village (Khairpur, Sindh). 1 man, who was also a lawyer, was killed. The Khairpur District Bar Association later went on strike in protest of this incident.
On Sep 23, Khokhar and Rind communal groups clashed over a long-standing business dispute in Noorpur Manjhuwala village (Rajanpur, Punjab). 1 man was killed and 3 were injured.

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 23 September. A member of the MRC assaulted an SDF supporter before a political rally, tearing his t-shirt apart.
On Sept 23, Israeli forces shot dead a Palestinian in clashes on the Gaza border east of Gaza City. The 21 year old was shot in the head.

actor2: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group; Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 22 Sep, local residents threw stones at government forces during a joint Rashtriya Rifles, SOG and CRPF CASO at Shirmal village (Shopian, J&K). Government forces responded with tear gas.

On 22 September, a woman and her disabled daughter were found murdered in their home in Mianwali Nagar / Nangloi Jat area of Delhi (Delhi). The motive seems to be in relation to the deceased husband who was accused of medical malpractice in relation to 5 deaths of ICU patients in 2013, and likely was perpetrated by people known to the victims. No further details.

assoc_actor_2: ABHM: Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha; Hindu Group (India)
notes: On 22 September, at least four people from Shernagar town in Muzaffarnagar district (Uttar Pradesh) assaulted members of Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha after the individuals had made comments about a couple's religion, apparently under the impression that the man was forcing himself on a girl from a different community.

On 22 Sept, in Rajbiraj city (Saptari, Sagarmatha), locals and family members vandalized the emergency ward of the Gajendranarayan Singh Sagarmatha Zonal Hospital over doctors allegedly pronouncing a live child dead.

On 22 Sept, in Rajbiraj (Saptari, Sagarmatha), a clash occurred between two Muslim groups which started when one of the two groups were pelted with stones during a festival celebration. At least 4 people sustained head injuries.
On Sep 22, two groups of Maachi community men clashed with sticks in a village along the Hyderabad-Tando Muhammad Khan Road (Sindh). A woman was killed and her daughter was injured.
On Sept 22, a pipe bomb was thrown by Palestinian rioters at Beit El settlement without causing any injuries or damages.
On Sept 22, clashes erupted in the Sabastiya town in northwestern Nablus after Israeli patrols raided the town. A fire broke out because of a tear gas canister.
On Sept 22, in the northern West Bank district of Jenin, several Palestinians suffered tear-gas inhalation during clashes that erupted at the Jabaa town crossroads in southern Jenin.

On September 22, the Head of Iyi Parti Malatya Branch, along with some members of the party were attacked by a group of 30-40 people when he went to report an assault targeting him that took place one day ago. Four people were injured in the attack as it became a fight shortly after.

On 22 September, a cab driver sparked a riot when he drove through a Ganesha immersion procession near Pandav Nagar bus stop in Rajendra Nagar locality of Delhi (Delhi). The man had tried to get through a gap in the procession but got stuck and his car was attacked and vandalised by angry marchers. When he tried to get away, he struck and killed one of the crowd.

On 21 September, at least one person was killed and seven injured in a clash between factions in the same caste group, in Tirnai Khijirpur village (Ballia, Uttar Pradesh). The clash was apparently sparked by a children's argument.

On 21 September, two groups of Muslim mourners clashed at Gorakhnath-Tarang crossing area of Gorakhpur (Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh) over which tazyia (Muslim passion play) would go first on the procession route.
On September 21, in Kamanamala village in Putlur tehsil (Anantapur, AP), two groups of villagers clashed over an ownership dispute, leaving one person dead.

On September 21, locals vandalized property, blocked roads and clashed with the police in Hajipur city (Vaishali district, Bihar), after a youth was shot dead and another two seriously injured during a clash between two groups. The dispute was over the leading of the Tazia procession to mark Muharram (Islamic festival).

On September 21, villagers attacked the house of the electricity department official and also vandalized his car in Nagaon district (Assam), after at least six fishermen were electrocuted to death and several injured after a live electric wire touched the water of a pond.

On September 21, the manager and the workers of Puropbari Tea Estate clashed at the premises of the estate, under Gohpur tehsil (Biswanath district, Assam). The labourers had been raising allegations against the management for not addressing their various demands, including benefits such as regular ration and sanitation.

On September 21, two groups of local villagers, mostly women, clashed over the right to perform Puja at the Durga Temple at Nartiang city (West Jaintia Hills district, Meghalaya). One women sustained minor injuries.
On 21 September, two Muslim groups clashed during the Muharram observations in Muftiganj town (Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh). 12 people were injured.

On 21 September, two individuals fought over which group's tazia (Muslim passion play) would get to go first in the procession, in Sarai Rohilla area of Sadar Bazar (North Delhi, Delhi). A verbal argument escalated to a knife attack, leaving a man and his brother injured.
On 21 September, there was a clash between two unidentified communities over the route to be taken by the Muharram (Muslim religious) procession, in Ballia area (Ballia, Uttar Pradesh).

assoc_actor_2: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; Government of India (2014-)
notes: On 21 September, there was a clash in Bareilly district (exact location unknown, Uttar Pradesh) when a group supporting the local BJP MLA prevented a Moharram (Muslim religious) procession from passing through an area. A case was brought against the MLA for instigating rioting. Details of the clash are unclear.
On 21 September, two groups of mourners clashed at Gorakhnath-Tarang crossing in Gorakhpur (Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh) over which tazyia (Muslim passion play) would go first on the procession route.

On 21 September, there was a clash between Sunni and Shia' groups in Jaunpur district (Uttar Pradesh) in relation to a minor dispute over the Karbala ground during Muharram commemorations. No further details.
On Sept 21, 2 Palestinians were injured with rubber-coated steel bullets fired by Israeli forces during clashes in the Kafr Qaddum village in the northern occupied West Bank district of Qalqiliya.

On September 21st, a Ugandan and Rwandan who were accused of robbery were attacked by a neighbourhood lynch mob in Kisoro, before police intervened to rescue the two. A third suspected robber fled the scene.

On September 21st, a mob descended on the house of the headman of Bundebunde village (coordinates for Mwense, Luapula province, used). The headman - who had been accused of witchcraft - was killed by the mob, who first burned his house down, and then threw stones at him as he fled the scene.
On 21 September. A man was arrested and a police officer was injured when community members turned on police during a joint police operation in Kensington in Cape Town.
On 21 September unidentified people were preventing the civic activists from attending the hearing regarding the environmental impact assessment in the Kudinovo, Moscow Oblast.
On September 20th, two youth groups clashed in the village of Odienne, killing one person and injuring two others.

20 September 2018: Non-licensed street merchants clashed with riot police. The police was attempting to enforce an eviction order linked to a cholera outbreak in Harare, when the vendors threw stones and other objects at them. Police fired teargas to disperse them.

On 20 Sep, a mob of Gujjars attacked a motorcyclist, leaving him with critical injuries after his motorbike collided with a Gujjar girl in the Gudwal area (Samba, J&K). The girl was critically injured in the collision.

On September 20, in Ottapalam town in Ottapalam tehsil (Palakkad, Kerala), unidentified actors threw stones at the house of an artist who depicted Hindu religious symbols in a painting meant to protest the Kathua rape case. There were no injuries.

On September 20, near Melavalavu village in Melur tehsil (Madurai, TN), two groups of students of Alagiripatti government school from different SC caste groups clashed for unknown reasons, leaving two injured.

On September 20, clashes took place between students and the state police in Imphal city (Imphal West district, Maniour), while the police entered the students' hostel in Manipur University to make arrests. At least 11 students were injured. The police arrested 89 students and six teachers, following a police complaint lodged by pro vice-chancellor.

On 20 September, family of a man accused of gang rape clashed with Haryana police, presumably when they came to arrest him assumed in the wider Gidderbaha area (Muktsar, Punjab). The man committed suicide that day over the allegations. A police vehicle was damaged, and family members reportedly were injured in the clash.
On Dec 20, it was reported that 2 months prior a Haredi yeshiva student was assaulted by Arab Israelis in Ramla.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 20 September. The body of an Imbonerakure member was found in Rusengo. The blood had been drained and the murder is believed to be linked to witchcraft.

On Sept 19, activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) attacked and vandalized the property in the residence of BNP leader Shahid Uddin Chowdhury Annie alleged in Lakshmipur district in Chittagong. BCL denied the allegation.

On Sept 19, activists of Chattogram Government College unit of Bangladesh Chhatra League clashed over formation of the 25-member college committee in Chittagong city for the second consecutive day. Both groups blasted several crude bombs, vandalised vehicles and shops.
On 19 September, there were reports of 'booth capturing' during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections, held throughout Punjab, in Muktsar, Bathinda, Moga, Patiala, and Ferozepur districts.
On 19 September, there were reports of 'booth capturing' during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections, held throughout Punjab, in Muktsar, Bathinda, Moga, Patiala, and Ferozepur districts.
On 19 September, there were reports of 'booth capturing' during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections, held throughout Punjab, in Muktsar, Bathinda, Moga, Patiala, and Ferozepur districts.
On 19 September, there were reports of 'booth capturing' during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections, held throughout Punjab, in Muktsar, Bathinda, Moga, Patiala, and Ferozepur districts.
On 19 September, there were reports of 'booth capturing' during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections, held throughout Punjab, in Muktsar, Bathinda, Moga, Patiala, and Ferozepur districts.
On 19 September, three of the voting booths in Mandi Killianwali (Muktsar, Punjab) were captured twice: Congress and SAD accused each other.

Other: On 19 September, there were voting irregularities in Bhitiwala village (Muktsar, Punjab) during the zila parishad elections. Congress workers allegedly stole two ballot boxes, and stuffed boxes in at another booth. There was also a firing incident reported, though no details.

On 19 September, unidentified individuals rioted and damaged furniture inside a polling booth in Lambi Dhabh village (Muktsar, Punjab) over the zila parishad / panchayat samiti elections. There was also a firing incident in which 3 shots were fired in the air.

On 19 September, Congress leaders and members allegedly tried to capture the ballot box and polling place at Jharo (Sangrur, Punjab). The Congress group fired 5 times, but the attack was apparently thwarted by AAP members and villagers. Congress said AAP members pelted stones at them.

On 19 September, around 100 individuals broke into the polling station at Chack Arniwala (also Kattianwali village) in Arniwala area (Fazilka, Punjab) and destroyed at least 15 ballots during voting in the zila parishad/panchayat samiti elections.

On September 19, a 65-year-old man was beaten to death with wooden sticks by a group of men in Madhulata village, Raniganj (Araria district, Bihar). The victim had taken his cattle to one of the attackers's agriculture field for grazing.

On 19 September, a group of youths (unidentified, no affiliation given) attempted to steal ballot boxes from a transport vehicle and from the sub-division HQ in Nihal Singh Wala town (Moga, Punjab). Police had to use a lathi charge to stop them and disperse the mob.
On 19 September, around 50 youths aligned with Congress attacked and tried to capture a voting booth in Machike village (Nihal Singh Wala, Moga, Punjab) but were stopped by villagers.

On 19 September, a SAD leader and several associates were arrested by police for capturing a poll booth in Kotbhai area of Gidderbaha (Muktsar, Punjab) and attempting to capture another, during the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections held that day.

On 19 September, Congress and SAD members fought with bricks and stones in Nave Nag village of Majitha constituency (Amritsar, Punjab), over the placement of a voting booth in the local elections. One SAD member suffered a head injury and had to be hospitalised.
On 19 September, five people attacked and beat an old man over accusations of rape near Barnala (Ambala, Punjab). He later died in the hospital of his injuries.

On 19 September, SAD and Congress workers clashed in Machaki Mal Sing village near Faridkot (Faridkot, Punjab), leaving three people with severe head injuries. The clash was sparked by a large group of people trying to enter the polling station after the designated time.

On 19 September, at least 36 people were injured in a series of clashes between Congress and SAD members in Ferozepur district (Ferozepur, Punjab) over the zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections.

On 19 September, SAD and Congress workers clashed in Aladinpur, Jhender, and Jeobala villages (Tarn Taran, Punjab) over irregularities in voting in the zila parishad/panchayat samiti elections. At least 5 SAD workers were injured in the clashes.

On 19 September, bodyguards and associates of Sukhbir Singh Badal (former deputy CM for SAD) beat up a Congress supporter at Mandi Killianwali in Lambi (Muktsar, Punjab) over the zila parishad/panchayat samiti elections.The man's car was damaged and SAD workers threw stones at him and his colleagues.

On 19 September, polling was suspended briefly after a clash between SAD and Congress members in Basti Gulab Singh Wali (Mamdot block, Ferozepur, Punjab) during zila parishad and panchayat samiti elections.

On September 18, a group clashed with the police after the officers tried to arrest a BJD supporter in Padna village under Ghasipura police station (Keonjhar district, Odisha). At least five officers sustained injuries.

On 13 September, several people were injured when two groups clashed in Kalayani area near Patparganj (East Delhi, Delhi). On Sep 13, 4 journalists clashed with doctors and paramedics at the taluka hospital in Thul town (Jacobabad, Sindh) after the journalists manhandled a storekeeper who refused to pay them extortion money. Several people suffered minor injuries.
