13 September. Youths fight over hanging of the opposition Oromo Liberation Front (OLF's) flag in the Asko area of Addis Abeba. Federal Police force intervened to prevent further clash.

On September 13th, a police officer beat a minibus driver with his rifle, killing the man. A mob formed and chased the police officer, lynching him, and another man (a boda boda driver) was killed in the violence. The events took place in the area of Kenyenya (Kisii), and a police Internal Affairs Unit has been dispatched to investigate.

13 September. Local youth in Ogu burned the car and other belongings of a local resident. The incident came after the resident called the police following a dispute with his neighbor. The neighbor was shot and killed by the police, sparking local youth to attack the man.

13 September 2018: Police forces opened fire at rioters throwing rocks at police officers in the town of El Wak, killing at least one person. Rioters then entered the hospital compound and attacked non-locals, killing two and seriously injuring a third. They were demonstrating against the death of three people who they said were killed by security officers a day before. Coded as two separate events, one riot and one VAC event.

On September 10, a 24-year-old man was lynched and killed by a mob near Ramnagar village, under Riga police station, Sitamarhi district, Bihar. The villagers killed him following allegation of a pick-up van driver that he had snatched money from the latter.

On 10 September, police clashed briefly with Congress supporter(s) after candidate papers for Gurbhej Singh Tibbi were rejected by the Deputy Commissioner's office in Ferozepur (Ferozepur, Punjab). On 10 September, SAD and Congress members clashed over election nominations at the BDPO office in Bhikhi town (Mansa, Punjab). Police intervened to separate the two sides.

On September 10, local villagers attacked a woman was attacked, stripped her rubbed chilli powder in her private parts, for selling illegal liquor in a tribal village in Nagra area, (Karimganj district, Assam).

On September 10, six houses of suspected CPM supporters were vandalized in Amdanga area (North 24 Parganas district, West Bengal) after a man who had been injured during the August 28 clashes in Taraberia village died from his injuries RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata.

On September 9th, two groups of students clashed at the University of Sennar at Singa (Blue Nile state). One group was in support of the Faculty of Education, and the other were supporters of the NCP. Five people were wounded, though it was uunclear which faction they belonged too. On 8 September, two men were severely beaten by a mob after they they attempted to steal a truck battery near New Janta Nagar in Ludhiana (Ludhiana, Punjab). The men had to be hospitalised overnight.
On Sep 8, two unidentified sub-clans clashed with automatic weapons for unknown reasons in the Bostan area (Pishin, Balochistan). 3 people were killed, including a woman.

On September 8, engineers and NGO workers working on the project Clean Village were assaulted by a mob of around 400 people, in Malangkona village, Kamrup district, Assam. No reason for the attack was given.
On September 8, locals pelted stones on the eviction team and blocked Station Road in Patna city, Bihar. The anti-encroachment team was in the area to evict footpath vendors and demolish their shops.

08 September. Violence broke out between PDP supporters at the PDP secretariat in Lokoja when members disputed delegation lists. Injuries were reported. Local police and civil defense members restored order.

On 8/9/18, 2 Palestinians were injured by Israeli forces during clashes that erupted following pre-dawn raids in Nablus. One injured with a rubber-coated steel bullet above his eye and was run over by an Israeli military vehicle.
On 7/9/18, clashes were reported in Bayt Ummar between Israeli forces and Palestinians during a raid in the village.
On 7/9/18, clashes between Palestinians and Israeli forces reignited along the border between Israel and Gaza. At least 45 people were injured by live fire across the Gaza strip.
On Sept 7, two suspected robbers were killed by a mob after they were caught by the locals at Pahartali (Chittagong).

On Sept 7, a man has been killed and at least seven people were injured in a clash between two rival groups in Khulshi (Chattogram, Chittagong). The identity of the groups is not clear. The clash was either a result of an argument over bribes or a power clash.

On September 7, a mob lynched and killed three armed men while they were fleeing after abducting an 11-year-old schoolgirl from a primary school in Narayan Pipar village, Chhorahi, Begusarai district, Bihar. The mob attacked them with bamboo sticks, bricks and iron rods.

On 7 September, police were attacked by local villagers in Kataiya village of Gopalganj (Bihar) when they chased a criminal from Deoria into Gopalganj. The police team was attacked, injured, and held hostage for a short time as locals helped the criminal to escape.

On September 7, near Sri Ganganagar town (Sri Ganganagar, Rajasthan), Congress workers and farmers clashed with police while the activists were waiting for a Chief Minister's arrival. Police used force to disperse the activists, leaving 14 people injured and 15 activists arrested.

On September 3, in Rajkot city (Rajkot, Gujarat), two groups clashed over a dispute during a Janmashtami Rath Yatra procession. Police intervened and the rioters threw stones at them. 15 people were injured, including three policemen. Police arrested 29 people.

On 3 September, a teenage boy was beaten to death by locals in Mukundpur area of Burari locality (North East Delhi, Delhi), having been caught attempting to break into a house and accused of theft.

On September 3, a man was assaulted, stripped half-naked and tonsured by several shopkeepers in Balasore city, Odisha. The incident occured after an argument between a shopkeeper and the victim over payment of change currency notes and coins for a LED bulb.

On September 3rd, a gang hired to evict a family (as part of a land dispute) were attacked by vigilantes, who killed one gang member. The incident took place at Kagumo-ini village (Muranga, coordinates for Kabati used).
On 3/9/18, a Palestinian youth was shot and injured by Israeli forces east of Khan Yunis. Israeli sources reported that Israeli forces opened fire at rioters.

On Sept. 3, 2018: A memorial on the island of Lesvos near the town of Mytilene, commemorating the hundreds of migrants who have died while attempting the crossing from Turkey to Greece, was demolished entirely down to its concrete base by vandals.
On 2/9/18, settlers targeted Palestinian vehicles with stones near the junction of Yitzhar, injuring 4 Palestinians who were admitted to the hospital.
On Sept 2, a man was beaten by mob allegedly for raping a 11-year-old girl in Lalkhan Motijhorna area under Khulshi Police Station in Chattogram.

On Sept 2, a clash broke out between locals and police over the arrest of a BNP-affiliated drug trader at Konabari Abongimor area of Gopalpur upazila (Tangail, Dhaka). 20 people were injured. No weapons mentioned.

On 2 September, a man was beaten and had his arms cut off in an argument over missing cows at an unidentified village in Raisen (Raisen, Madhya Pradesh). The man was accused by his neighbor of stealing cows, and the attack was apparently carried out by the neighbor's family.

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students Union of India; Students (India)

NSUI claims it was an individual altercation between two people, and the police treated the incident as a clash between two student groups.

On September 2, a contingent of policemen was attacked with crude bombs, as they were marching towards a village in Amdanga block, North 24 Parganas, West Bengal. The police had been doing raids following clashes in the area between political parties over the panchayat board formation.

Around 2 September, a Brahmin was attacked and beaten with sticks by Gau Rakshak vigilantes as he was walking his cow to a vet, in an unidentified village in Balrampur district (Uttar Pradesh). The mob also shaved his head, blacked his face, and paraded through the village over rumors that he was going to sell the cow to a Muslim.

02 September. Students of Polytechnic University in Bida clashed with commercial drivers from the Essor Motor Park after a payment issue. 'Scores' were injured and shops were damaged during the fighting. One fatality was confirmed.

On or before September 2nd, clashes between two South Sudanese clans took place in Nyumazi refugee camp (coordinates for Nyumazi town, Northern region, used), leaving 12 injured. The incident was sparked by a rumour started by the jealous ex-lover of a woman, which escalated into a larger altercation.
On 2/9/2018, rioters in Al Qadam threw molotov cocktails at security forces.

On Sept. 2, 2018: Syrian and Iraqi refugees clashed at a reception centre in Samos due to an alleged attempted rape of a 19-year-old Syrian refugee man by three Iraqi refugees. Five people were stabbed and taken to hospital, among them one of the three men accused of the attempted rape.

On September 1, in Maridasanahalli village in Turuvekere taluk (Tumakuru, Karnataka), upper caste activists beat five Dalit members for asking for food at a religious festival. A couple of the Dalit members were seriously injured.

On Sept 1, ten BNP activists were injured in a clash with police in front of the BNP office in the district town of Kedarganj (Chuadanga, Khulna). The clash occurred when the BNP tried to bring out a rally to mark their 40th anniversary and the police obstructed them.
On Sept 1, BNP activists threw a crude bomb at the police in Charghat upazila (Rajshahi) during a meeting marking their 40th anniversary.

On September 1st, a vigilante mob beat a suspected robber to death in the area of Mayobodo village (Matabeleland South province, coordinates for Mangwe used). Police later arrested 12 of the attackers.
On September 1, in Channarayapatna town (Hassan, Karnataka), Congress and the Janata Dal (Secular) members clashed over electoral tension. Several members from both sides were injured.
On September 1st, a group of MDC-Alliance supporters were alledged to have beaten a soldier in Kewkwe (Midlands), who they had accused of killing civilians in the aftermath of the election.

As reported on Sep 2, over approximately three days, locals burned down houses belonging to five alleged killers in Darya Galli village (Murree, Rawalpindi, Punjab) after the police failed to arrest them.

On 31 August, groups from two communities clashed after an argument between local youth escalated into fighting and stone throwing at Patta Mohalla of Ghanta Gar in Meerut city (Meerut, Uttar Pradesh). On 31 Aug, villagers near the Sinhala area of Mathavachchi threw stones at a train travelling from Kurunegala to Jaffna and seriously injured a Tamil elderly man, killing him. This is one of a series of train attacks targeting trains departing from Tamil areas.

On August 30, in Rajkot taluka (Rajkot, Gujarat), two rioting groups of BJP activists clashed over the allotment of a grant.

27 August, week of. During the week, four women were killed based on witchcraft allegations in Bouca. The perpetrators were not identified. The area is under Anti-Balak control. Coded as four separate events during the week of 27 August with fatalities spread over the four events.

notes: On August 28, members of the All Assam Students' Union (AASU) assaulted Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) activists in Dibrugarh city, Assam, during a college election campaign.
Residents of Ngoma area of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft on August 28, 2018. The family managed to escape.
On 28/8/18, clashes broke out in Kobar between locals and Israeli forces following the demolition of the family house of a Palestinian who carried out a deadly knife attack in July.
On 28/8/18, 5 Palestinians were injured by Israeli forces and 3 were detained when Israeli forces entered Ras Kakar to raze agricultural land. Residents confronted soldiers leading to clashes.
On 28/8/18, 4 Palestinians were arrested during clashes with Israeli police in Silwan and several others were injured.
On 28/8/18, dozens of Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli forces in Hebron.

On August 27, 2018, in Waena village, in Heram district (Jayapura, Papua), Papuan students got into an argument and threw stones at the police after the police refused to handover a suspected motorcycle thief to the students. Police detained and severly beat one student and shot another student who was running away in the shoulder. Two students were injured and 14 were arrested.

On August 27th, two groups clashed at the water plant in Muranga (coordinates for Muranga county used), with one group damaging the water supply at the plant. The dispute appears to centre around a grudge between the governor of Muranga County and the outgoing chairman of the water plant.

On 27/8/18, Israeli settlers under the protection of Israeli forces attempted to raid local homes in Aynabus, but locals fended off the attack. No injuries reported, but Israeli forces detained 1 local Palestinian.

On August 27, a youth of Bhekta village was stripped and beaten with a wooden plank by a group of of locals, in Talachua village, Kendrapara district, Odisha. The man had eloped with a businessman's daughter to Bhubaneswar.
On August 27, a woman was poisoned to death by two persons in Haradabahara village, near Ramachandrapur police station, Keonjhar district, Odisha, on the suspicion that she was practising witchcraft.

On August 27, a group of men entered into the Electricity Board control room in Puranigodam city, Nagaon district, Assam, and assaulted the officials there, leaving two seriously injured. It is being suspected that the attack was carried out over the constant daily load shedding of electricity in the region by the Electricity Board.
On August 27, Trinamul and BJP supporters clashed in Parongerpar panchayat, Falakata block, Alipurduar district, West Bengal, over the formation of the panchayat board.
On August 27, two groups of Trinamul supporters clashed in Rajabhatkhawa panchayat, Alipurduar district, West Bengal, over the formation of the panchayat board.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Bijbehara town (Anantnag, J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Kulgam district town (J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Qaimoh town (Kulgam, J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Kakapora town (Pulwama, J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Newa town (Pulwama, J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On 27 Aug, clashes between rioters and security forces were recorded in Rajpora town (Pulwama, J&K) following rumours that the Supreme Court was due to hear a petition challenging Article 35-A.
On August 27, a clash broke out between the CPI(M) and the ruling BJP in Khowai district, Tripura. The CPI(M) workers were collecting funds for the rain hit state of Kerala when they were attacked.
On August 27, a farmer was beaten to death and another middle-aged man was assaulted by a crowd on suspicion of them being thieves, in Chilkirhat, Cooch Behar district, West Bengal.
On Aug 27, members of the Nambardar and Malhi groups clashed in the Dargahi Wala area of Gujranwala town (Punjab) over an old enmity. 2 Nambardar men were killed.
On August 27, violence was reported in Deganga area, North 24 Parganas district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. No further information given.
On August 27, violence was reported in Canning area, South 24 Parganas district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. No further information given.

A man from Mugendo hill of Muhuta area in Rumonge province was stoned by residents of the hill on August 27, 2018. The assailants accused him of having killed a woman and her child through bewitchment.

27 August, week of. During the week, four women were killed based on witchcraft allegations in Bouca. The perpetrators were not identified. The area is under Anti-Balak control. Coded as four separate events during the week of 27 August with fatalities spread over the four events.
On Aug 26, a man was killed and 10 houses were burned down in a clash between two groups of villagers over a unspecified matter at Shorrabad Village in Belabo Upazila in Narsingdi.

On August 26, Congress workers and police clashed in Lakkhipur panchayat, Chopra, Uttar Dinajpur district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. Police used lathicharge to disperse the mob. Some policemen and women rioters were injured.
On 26 August, local residents of Bhalswa Dairy area of North Delhi (Delhi) beat a man who had earlier stabbed a security guard at a local housing facility and handed him to the police.

On 26 August, a Delhi police inspector and his son were attacked at Rambagh Square in Agra, (Agra, Uttar Pradesh) by a group of at least 15 men over a prior altercation with a young man and his sister. The officer's car was struck by a motorcycle, leading to an argument in which he hit the other driver with a stick. Friends of the driver arrived, beating the officer and his son and vandalizing the car.

On August 26, two groups of Trinamool supporters clashed, using bricks, stones, sticks and rods, in Panditpota 2 panchayat, Uttar Dinajpur district, West Bengal, over the selection of a party dissident as the pradhan. The police resorted to baton charge to disperse the mob, and arrested 12 people.

actor2: Police Forces of Sri Lanka (2015-) Department of Forest Conservation
notes: On 26 Aug, in Minneriya (Hingurakgoda, Polonnaruwa), villagers clashed with Minneriya Wildlife Department Officers over the latter's arrest of 2 fishermen for illegally fishing inside the Minneriya park. 3 officers were injured. Police controlled the situation. Source did not mention weapons used. 12 were arrested in this connection, including a councillor.
On August 26, Trinamool workers were beaten up and attacked with sticks by BJP supporters in Hooghly district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards.
On August 26, a mob beat up junior doctors at NRS Medical College and Hospital, in Kolkata city, West Bengal, alleging negligence after the death of a 37-year-old man.

An elderly farmer was killed by five men at his home on Rushanga hill in Mugera area of Bugendana commune in Gitega province on 26 August 2018. It is suspected that the case might be linked to accusations of witchcraft yet the motive was unconfirmed.
On 26 August, a man died following a mob assault at Newline Section, in the Maboloka village outside Brits. In a separate incident, another man was beatan for suspected crimes but survived.
On 26/8/2018, rioters in Maamir threw Molotov cocktails at security forces.

On Aug. 26, 2018: Members the anti-establishment group Rouvikonas attacked the headquarters of the Mytilineos business group in northern Athens. Four men wearing crash helmets to hide their faces smashed the glass door and windows of the building's facade and blamed the founder of the company for exploiting natural resources and laborers.

On August 25, villagers tied a young man with a rope to a cement pole and beat him up in Mundamala Sahi village, Chhendipada block, Angul district, Odisha, on the suspicion of harassing a woman. The man was injured and admitted to the Chhendipada Community Health Centre (CHC) for treatment.

On August 25, one Trinamool Congress (TMC) worker was killed in a clash between two factions of the party in Panditpota village, North Dinajpur district, West Bengal, following a discussion over the formation of the Panchayat board. Several people were injured in a bomb blast during the clash.

On 25/08/18, clashes broke out after 15 masked settlers attacked and injured 4 Israeli activists from Ta'ayush: Arab Jewish Partnership NGO near Susiyah and Mitzpe Yair settlement. The activists were taking photos of the area and the settlers threw stones, pushed them, broke their cameras and took their phones.
On Aug 25, a person was killed and five others were injured in a clash over a land dispute at Bazokpur village of Mithamoin upazila under Kishoreganj district.
On August 25, a man was beaten to death by four unidentified men at Govindpur area, Dhenkanal district, Odisha. The police is investigating the reason behind the killing as some past rivalry.

On August 25, two factions of the TMC armed with crude bombs clashed in Chandipur village, Nanoor, Birbhum district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. At least six housed were also vandalised.

On 24 or 25 August, rioting groups of Hindu and Sikh communities clashed in Banda area of Shahjahanpur district (Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh). The clash arose after a watchman apparently hit a young girl selling rakhis outside a gurdwara and rumours circulated on social media which escalated the incident. It apparently involved stone throwing and property destruction on both sides.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 August. Five people were wounded after supporters of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) who had come down to ransack their party headquarters in Gungu clashed with the police in Gungu. This followed the invalidation of Antoine Gizenga's and Muzito's files in the next presidential election.
On August 25, in Bawari village in Behror Tehsil (Alwar, Rajasthan), a group of Congress activists threw stones at a chief minister's vehicle (BJP) for differences in policy. There were no injuries.

On August 25, violence was reported in Pachagarh village, Cooch Behar district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. A large police contingent had to be deployed, but no specific information about the violence was given.
On August 25, a Trinamool party office was vandalised allegedly by BJP men at Bamangola town, Malda district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards.
On August 25, violence was reported in Araidanga village, Malda district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. A BJP member's house was set on fire.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
notes: On 24 Aug, three rioters were injured during a clash with government forces at Redwani Bala village in Kulgam district (J&K). The clash occurred during a joint SOG and army CASO in the area.

On 24 August, villagers attacked and clashed with an Excise Department team in Ukandwala village near Jaitu (Jaitu, Faridkot, Punjab), during a drive to seize illegal liquor on sale in the village. The villagers accused the team of harassment and the resulting clash left two of the team injured and damaged the vehicle.

assoc_actor_1: BMS: Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh; BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party
notes: On August 24, four persons were injured in a clash between Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS) and Sramik Unnayan Jagaran Mancha (faction of the ruling BJP) at Nagerjala Motorstand, Agartala city, Tripura. The police used lathis to end the clash and disperse the mob.
On or before Aug 24, suspected PPP workers pelted stones at the vehicle of a PTI MNA in Chor town (Umerkot tehsil/district, Sindh). No reported casualties.
On 24 August, angry youths burned down the Police Area Commander's Office in Iwo, Osun State, after a member of the anti-robbery squad killed a man.
On Aug 24, Israeli settlers threw rocks and bottles at Palestinian cars driving between Jenin and Nablus near the village of Silat al Dahr. Damages to the vehicles, but no injuries, were reported.
On Aug 24, one person was killed and 50 others were injured in a clash over a football match between two groups of villagers in Char Katkhal Village of Mithamoin Upazila, Kishoreganj.

On 24 August, villagers rioted during a police investigation into reports of cow slaughter in Nagaliya Aakil village (Rampur, Uttar Pradesh). Police attempted to take the cow carcass for as evidence in the investigation, but residents resisted, throwing stones and beating the officers. Three officers were injured and 3 persons arrested in the case.
On August 24, a mob beat up three men accused of gang-raping a 30-year-old mentally challenged woman, in Badasahi area, Mayurbhanj district, Odisha. The locals later handed them to the police.

On August 24, violence was reported in Gazole area, in Malda district, West Bengal, over the formation of panchayat boards. BJP workers were attacked with stones by Trinamool workers after reconstitution of board at Alal gram panchayat in Gazole block. One BJP member was injured.
On Aug 23, activists of the Awami League and BNP clashed at the Nandigram bus stand in Bogra city. 10 people were injured.
On 23 Aug, two rival groups spontaneously clashed at the Machail Shrine (Kishtwar, J&K) during the annual Machail Mata Yatra. Security forces acted to bring the clash under control.

On August 23, locals from Dangpara village clashed with the police at Maheshpur police station, Pakur district, Jharkhand. The villagers pelted stones and hurled crude bombs at the police, and the officials used lathis, tear gas, and fired shots in the air to stop the mob. Several people were injured. Earlier in the day, the police team had arrived at their village to stop cow slaughtering.
On August 23, in Malpura town (Tonk, Rajasthan), local residents clashed with kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims) over a dispute, leaving fifteen people injured.
On Aug 23, a Palestinian youth was injured after being attacked by Israeli settlers in Asira al Qibliya. The youth was struck in the head with a rock thrown by Israeli settlers.
On Aug 23, a young Israeli man and his friends physically assaulted 3 Arab-Israelis on Haifa beach. The 3 victims were taken to the hospital and they say the attack was nationalistically motivated.

On August 23, a mob comprising over 200 students from Bihar College of Engineering (BCE) stormed the college principal's official residence and vandalised it, in Bhagalpur city, Bihar. The students destroyed property and looted articles and cash. They claimed they did not like the principal.

The body of a man was found on Muruta hill in Muyange area of Gashoho commune in Muyinga province on August 23, 2018. The victim is a Twa who was lynched by people when he came to steal in a household.
Overnight on Aug 23, clashes broke out between Israeli police and Druze in Sajur during operations to confiscate weapons.
On Aug 22, a man was killed and five others injured in a clash between two groups over the selection of a slaughter place at Ratanpur village in Mehendiganj upazila in Barisal during Eid.

On August 22, a women was lynched to death at Ugara Bigha (Ugra) village, in Rohtas district, Bihar. The accused, from Gangoli village, attacked her under the suspicion of her involvement with witchcraft.

On August 22, local residents pelted stones at the police, damaging a police vehicle, at Morcha Road in Patna city, Bihar, after a correctional home for children was raided by the officials. The police used lathis to stop the mob.
On August 22, in Jamkunaria village of Bhuj, (Kachchh, Gujarat) two groups of villagers clashed over a previous dispute, leaving nine people injured.
On 22 August, two groups of young men clashed outside MCM DAV College for Women in sector 36 of Chandigarh city (Chandigarh). There was no reason given for the clash.

On August 22, two local groups attacked each other with sticks and rods at Mathpara village, Nadia district, West Bengal, over the circulation of altered pictures of few local women. Several houses at the village were vandalized and several crude bombs were hurled, injuring more than 20 people.

On 22 Aug, in Loharpatti (Mahottari, Janakpur), a clash occurred between Muslim groups in Mahadaiya-Tapanpur-3 over which Mawalvi to preside in Namaj prayers for Bakr-Eid. Police fired shots in the air to disperse the mob. 10 were injured, 4 in critical condition.

On Aug 22, a mob of about 1,500 residents of the Warsak Road area on the outskirts of Peshawar ransacked the local power grid station and damaged the equipment as a response to extended load shedding on the Eid holidays. The same (or a different) group also blocked traffic on Baghwanan Road and may have damaged vehicles there.
On 22 August, a 30-year-old man was beaten and stoned to death, allegedly for stealing washing powder at a local store at the KwaMashu hostel.
On 22 August, about 40 residents in Mandalay stoned three men to death after they were caught breaking into a house.

On 22 August, villagers from Titoli village (Rohtak, Haryana) attacked the house of a young Muslim man accused of killing a calf in celebration of Eid. The man and his family fled the house in fear when the villagers approached.

On August 22, members of two Deshi community (Muslim) families were assaulted by members of a students' organisation, in Tukrerchara Part IV village, Dhubri district, Assam, on the issue of re-construction of a century-old mosque belonging to the Deshi community.
On 22 August, a couple were travelling on the R558 from Azaadville to Lenasia, Gauteng, when they were attacked by an angry mob. Their vehicle was stoned and they sustained minor injuries.

On August 22nd, a fight between youth groups broke out in and around the UNMISS PoC site. One person was reported to have been killed, and dozens injured (including children who were reported to have been playing with an unexploded grenade thrown during the clashes). The fight was reportedly in response to an attack on women from the PoC site who had left the compound to harvest food.

On Aug 22, Israeli forces shot and injured a Palestinian shepherd with rubber-coated bullets during clashes with locals in Madama after Israeli settlers raided homes in the village and set fire to a farmer's field.

On Aug 21, one man was killed and at 15 others injured during a clash between two villager groups from the Awami League in Anantarampur village in Narsingdi's Sadar upazila over a longstanding issue about supremacy in the area.

assoc_actor_2: BJP-MM: Bharatiya Janata Party Mahila Morcha
notes: On August 21, local BJP leaders attacked a group of Mahila Morcha (women's wing of BJP) women, at Laljuri village, North Tripura district, Tripura. The women were opposing the creation of a new Mahila Morcha unit during a party meeting when they were assaulted. At least eight women were injured, some severely.

On 21 August, a man was shot and injured in Garurpura area of Deoria town (Deoria, Uttar Pradesh) by unknown attackers. It may have been due to his whistle-blowing against fraudulent dentists in the area.

On 21 August, police and vendors clashed in Gweru. The police attempted to clear the city of vendors following a cholera outbreak. The vendors responded by throwing stones and chasing away the police.
On 21 August, mourners at the funeral of a protester killed by a police bullet on 19 Aug rioted and threw rocks at the Assistant Police Commissioner, who tried to attend the funeral in Mityana.
On August 21, villagers in Dohoun killed another villager and wounded two others severely for having ransacked and stolen village protection artifacts.
On August 21, a mob demolished the house of a man suspected of killing a girl at Khergao, in Imphal city, Manipur.
On August 20, in Kathda village in Mandvi taluka (Kachchh, Gujarat), two communal groups spontaneously clashed over the rendering of azaan at a mosque.
On August 20, in Bhubaneswar city (Khordha, Odisha), two groups of students of BJB Autonomous College clashed over forthcoming student union elections, leaving five students injured.

On 20 August, villagers in Turmatkheri villagers (Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh) killed one man and severely injured another who were accused of shooting at the home of a key murder witness in a gang case, injuring a minor.

On 20 Aug, Kathmandu city (Kathmandu, Bagmati), vegetable traders obstructed and manhandled a government team who were investigating high prices of vegetables at the Kalimati Fruits and Vegetable Market. Police arrested the Federation of Fruit and Vegetable Entrepreneurs general secretary and 1 other during the incident.

On Aug 20, locals attacked a team of the Capital Development Authority (CDA) in the Bari Imam area of Islamabad (Federal Capital) while they were carrying out an anti-encroachment operation. The rioters broke windows of their vehicles and pelted them with stones. No reported casualties.
On 20 August, PDP and APC supporters clashed in Twon Brass, Bayelsa State: three persons dead.

On August 20, the office of Fishery department at Tuibong neighbourhood was set ablaze and a group of people attempted to burn the office of Sub-Divisional Officer, both at Churachandpur city, Manipur. The acts were part of a shutdown of all government offices called by Thadou Kuki Students' Union (TKSU).

On 20 August, a group of Gau Rakshak beat two Muslim youth in Adarsh Mandi area of Shamli (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh), accusing them of cow slaughtering. Police eventually intervened and rescued them.

On or before August 20th, a vigilante mob attempted to attack a man at Luombwa Compound (coordinates for Kalulushi, Copperbelt province, used), on suspicion of witchcraft. Police were able to disperse the mob before they could attack the accused.

On 20 August, APC youths in Irrua, Edo Central Senatorial District, attacked the convoy of Governor Godwin Obaseki. They pelted the convoy with sachet water, as the governor's alleged insistence that he was in the area to meet with party leaders and not the youths.

On or before August 20th, a confrontation broke out between the crowd and police at a funeral for the driver of an MP (who was targeted in an assasination attempt on August 12th, when his driver was killed), after a County executive made an unwelcome appearence. Five were injured, including two bodyguards of other MPs and a local politician.
On 19 August, cow vigilantes burnt a truck and beat up the truck driver on the Agra-Delhi highway near Mathura area (Mathura, Uttar Pradesh) on suspicions of cow smuggling.

On 19 August, villagers from Sultanpur (Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh) lynched two people after a failed robbery attempt. At least 5 people attempted to rob the local pradhan, two of whom were caught and beat to death by villagers.
On 19 August, villagers from Paniya village in Pauri district (Uttarakhand) attacked and beat a vegetable seller on suspicion of 'eve teasing' (cat calling).
On 19 August, two United Transformation Movement (UTM) vehicles were damaged in Mangochi in what appears to be a case of political sabotage.
On Aug 19, around 15 masked Israeli settlers threw stones and glass bottles at a Palestinian vehicle near Yitzhar, injuring three Palestinians, including two children.

assoc_actor_1: BJYM: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha; Vigilante Group (India)
notes: On August 19, members of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha blackened the signboard and damaged the wooden facade of Nav Jyoti Opticals clinic in Bokaro city, Jharkhand. The clinic was being run from a portion of the house from where two siblings were rescued on August 13, with signs of torture.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure member was beaten and gravely wounded by clients of a local bar in Bubezi hill of Kayanza area, commune and province on August 19, 2018 while on his nightly patrol. The owner of the bar was later arrested.
On Aug 19, Israeli forces clashed with local Palestinians when Israeli settlers began razing lands in Ras Karkar.
On Aug 18, a Union Parishad member assaulted a school teacher who was hospitalised. Reason for attack suspected to be political.
On Aug 18, members of Jamaat-e-Islami pelted stones at the police during a drive to arrest them in Chauddagram upazila in Comila. Two police personnel were injured.
On August 18, a 54-year-old tribal farmer was beaten to death on the suspicion of practising witchcraft, by five fellow villagers, also tribal, at Garhwat village, Palamu district, Jharkhand.

On 18 Aug, a policeman was injured during a clash with rioters in Murran village (Pulwama, J&K). During the clash, police responded to stone throwing with teargas. Rioters attacked the police vehicle while it was on its way to another village.

On 18 August, two factions of the BJP fought in Ahmadgarh Darewala village near Dabwali (Sirsa, Haryana). The reason for the clash is unclear, but may have been due to an individual disrupting a rally and speaking ill of Devi Lal, a former DPM from the area.

On 18 August, locals in Kala Tibba village near Hanumangarh (Abohar, Fazilka, Punjab) resisted the police who attempted to arrest an alleged cow smuggler. The man had apparently been recently identified by cow vigilantes, though none were involved in the altercation.
On 18 August, a professor at Mahatma Gandhi Central University was beaten up at his home in Motihari town (Purba Champaran, Bihar) over a post on Facebook which opposed former PM Vajpayee.

On August 17, a professor from the Mahatma Gandhi University was beaten by a mob at Motihari city, Bihar. The professor had posted a comment on a social media platform criticising former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee. The man was later taken to Patna's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) for advanced medical treatment.

On 17 August, family and villagers, associated with a man arrested by police over a stabbing in Ranipur in July, attacked police in Ranjitpur village (Jagadhri, Yamaunanagar, Haryana), with stones and sticks in an attempt to free the accused.

On 17 August, villagers and police clashed in Punnawal village (Nabha, Patiala, Punjab) when police allegedly assaulted a Dalit woman and her family. Villagers heard and attempted to assist the family, leading to a clash.

Tegani and Bijrani tribes clashed for two hours in Kandhkot on Aug 17 after a Bijrani farmer was kidnapped and murdered by the Tegani earlier that day. Casualties unknown, kidnapping and killing coded separately.
On Aug 17, clashes broke out along Gaza's borders with Israel. At least 270 Palestinians were injured. Israeli sources reported that rioters threw molotovs.
On Aug 17, a Palestinian man was shot dead during clashes with Israeli forces near Rafah.

On August 17, villagers fired at and injured a police officer when a police team came to the village to recover the body of a murder victim assumed at Bajaria village, Sahar Block, Bhojpur district, Bihar. Earlier, villagers also attacked the house of a man accused of murder and set it on fire.

assoc_actor_1: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; Shiv Sena
assoc_actor_2: AIMIM: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen; Government of India (2014-)
notes: On 17 or 18 August, BJP and Shiv Sena members beat up a Majlis-e-Ittehad-ul Muslimeen member of the municipal corporation in Aurangabad (Aurangabad, Bihar) who had opposed a resolution in the assembly honoring former PM Vajpayee.
On 17 August, a group of villagers rioted and attacked the home and property of a man accused of killing the son of a village homeguard, in Bajeriyan village in Bhojpur district (Bhojpur, Bihar).

On 17 August, individuals believed to be associated with the BJP harrassed and chased Swami Agnivesh when he attempted to visit BJP HQ in New Delhi (New Delhi, Delhi) for the vigil over former PM Vajpayee.
On Aug 17, a Palestinian man was shot dead during clashes with Israeli forces near Al Bureij.

On 16 August, AAP members clashed with the police assumed at Jagadhri town (Yamunanagar, Haryana) in an attempt to free a person (Sumit Kumar) jailed in connection with a stabbing incident. The police arrested the rioters.
Neighbors clashed over the issue of sewage water in the street in Gujranwala City on Aug 16 and attacked each other with bricks and batons. 7 people were hospitalized.
On 16 August, the commissioning of a Polyclinic at Ajumako, Central Region, turned chaotic when NPP and NDC supporters clashed pelting stones at each other.
On 16 August, a man was killed by a mob in Mampikony district.
16 August. A suspected ritualist is beaten to coma by a vigilante mob at Shasha community in Akure, Ondo State capital.

actor2: Police Forces of South Africa (1994-) Anti-Land Invasion Unit
notes: On 16 August, eThekwini land invasion unit demolished 15 shacks and clashed with the occupiers in Verulam. Rubber bullets were fired, injuring two people, including a young woman.
On 16/8/2018, rioters in Abu Saybi threw molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas.
On Aug 16, rioters threw a Molotov cocktail at Israeli forces on the Jerusalem-Gush Etzion road.

On August 16, a mob set on fire a police outpost in Bishanpur city, Kishanganj district, Bihar, where some members of a rival group had taken shelter following an earlier clash between the groups when one of them claimed the animals in a cattle market were being sold for slaughtering.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The house of the deputy head of Rukago hill in Gohombo area and commune of Kayanza province was torched by unknown assailants on 16 August 2018. The deputy head, a CNDD-FDD member, was accused of being an accomplice in a clandestine abortion, hence she became the target of people's anger.
On Aug 16, Israeli settlers damaged some 40 Palestinian vehicles by throwing stones and empty glass bottles at the Nablus-Tulkarem road, Huwwara and Zaatara checkpoints in the area of Eli settlement.

On Aug 16, Israeli settlers damaged some 40 Palestinian vehicles by throwing stones and empty glass bottles at the Nablus-Tulkarem road, Huwwara and Zaatara checkpoints in the area of Eli settlement. The settlers riots are thought to be in response to a hit and run that was wrongly reported as a car ramming.
On Aug 16, Israeli settlers burned down an excavator belonging to a Palestinian after they raided a stone factory in Urif village.
On Aug 16, Israeli settlers damaged some 40 Palestinian vehicles by throwing stones and empty glass bottles at the Nablus-Tulkarem road, Huwwara and Zaatara checkpoints in the area of Eli settlement.

On Aug 16, dozens of Israeli settlers attempted to set fire to a Palestinian house before locals prevented them. Israeli forces arrived to escort the settlers away and Israeli forces clashed with Palestinian locals.

Within the month of Aug 2018, in Saligramam (Chennai, TN), at least seven DMK workers attacked a hotel staff after their demand for free biryani for 30 DMK workers was turned down. Three people were injured. The DMK workers were later arrested and suspended. No further information was given. [size=7]
On August 15, two rioting groups clashed at a cattle market in Bishanpur town, Kishanganj district, Bihar, when a group claimed the animals were being sold for slaughtering.

On August 15, a mob lynched and injured a mentally challenged man at Barapalasi railway station, Bara village, Dumka district, Jharkhand, on the suspicion of his involvement in the rape and murder of a seven-year old girl. The police intervened to rescue the victim.
On 15 August, a young man was beaten to death in Kundli locality (Sonipat, Haryana) by a group of around 20 individuals after he intervened, attempting to pacify a quarrel over a motorcycle.

On 15 August, youth belonging to two different communities (unnamed) clashed in Vishwas Nagar area of East Delhi (Delhi) before the fight was broken up by police. The two groups were throwing stones and fighting over a kite flying dispute.

On 15 August, locals rioted in response to the killings of two sadhus in nearby Bhayanak Nath temple in Kudarkot area of Bidhuna (Auraiya, Uttar Pradesh). The mob set fire to shops in Bidhuna area and threw stones at police, who fired in the air to control the situation. Two policemen were injured in the clash.
On 15 August, 3 suspected gang member were attacked and set alight by vigilantes in Daveyton. 2 died.
On 15 August, supporters of Wadri, an independent candidate in the Arua by election, rioted and smashed the windscreen of a municipality official's car. The police intervened.
On Aug 15, clashes erupted in Hebron during an Israeli military raid. During the clashes, Israeli settlers reportedly assaulted a Palestinian woman.
Week of 15 August. APC members fight with one another during a meeting in Birnin-Kudu of Birni Kudu LGA, killing 2 people.
On 14 Aug, locals assaulted a youth when he attempted to hoist the Indian flag at the Clock Tower at Lal Chowk in Srinagar city (J&K). The police intervened and rescued the victim.
On 14/8/2018, rioters in Abu Saybi started a fire in a street and threw molotov cocktails at security forces.

On August 14, the local population in Tenkodogo ransacked and burned the Koglweogo headquarters and motorbikes belonging to the group. They were denouncing the failure of autorities to punish the group in public after they stole goats.

On August 14, over two dozen milkmen were beaten up at Santipur city, Nadia district, by residents who accused them of adulterating milk with chemicals. The locals also pulled out over 100 milk cans and drained them after collecting samples for tests.

Unknown assailants burned the house of an elderly woman of Nyagumba hill in Masango area of Bukinanyana commune on August 14, 2018. No-one was hurt as the woman did not spend the night at home. The motive for the attack was a land dispute between the woman and her neighbour.

Unknown persons destroyed a house under construction in Murwi town of Cibitoke province on August 14, 2018. The inhabitants did not want the owner, who had been accused of witchcraft, to move to this hill.

assoc_actor_1: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
assoc_actor_2: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
notes: 14 August. Factions of RTEAN clash over a leadership disagreement in Ado Ekiti.
On Aug 14, a Palestinian was shot and injured by Israeli forces in Dheisheh refugee camp as clashes broke out following an Israeli raid of the camp.

On 13 August, an unidentified group of men attacked and killed the principal of Shivalik Science School Bhagat Ram Saini, in his home in Kharuni area of Nalagarh (Solan, Himachal Pradesh). The man had been accused of sexual harrassment by a group of female students. His wife was also injured. The link to the assault case was unclear, and alternative sources suggest it may have been a robbery.
On 13 August, an elderly couple was beaten up by a mob in Chambishi, Kalulushi, on suspicion of practising witchcraft.

On August 13th, two groups of IDP's clashed in site 3 of the UNMISS Protection of Civilians camp in Juba (Central Equatoria). Between 150 and 160 people may have been injured in the violence, although few (if any) were seriously injured. The causes of the fighting are unclear, although the two groups were said to be members of different Nuer sub-clans.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group; Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 12 Aug, four rioters were injured when government forces clashed with rioters during a joint army, SOG and CRPF CASO in Sirnoo village (Pulwama, J&K). Government forces fired pellets and tear gas after heavy stone pelting by rioters.

On 12 August, a group of kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims)attacked a truck driver and vandalized his truck after the man apparently knocked over one of their water pots at Lorry Road in Beliaghata area of Kolkata (Kolkata, West Bengal). Police rescued the driver and took him to the hospital, but no arrests were made.

On August 12th, a lynch-mob attacked a civilian and allegedly set him on fire, before torching his vehicle, following false rumours that he was planning to bomb a large rally in Shashamane (West Arsi zone) where known activist Jawar Mohammad was speaking at. The victim later died of his injuries. Several suspects have been arrested.

assoc_actor_1: CHADEMA: Party for Democracy and Progress; CCM: Chama Cha Mashinani
notes: On August 12 violent clashes have been reported in Arusha between supporters of Chadema and the ruling party CCM and people close to the Member of Parliament for Arusha Urban, Mr Godbless Lema. Lema was beaten and another person stubbed during the clashes.
On 12 August 2018, Hinywet Village, Ann Township, Rakhine State, a mob of about 30 people attacked a Christian pastor with sticks and fists. He was rendered unconscious and treated in hospital.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A CNDD-FDD party member from Kigozi Hill in Bikanka area of Mukike commune in Bujumbura-rural province was beaten and seriously wounded by a group of young men armed with stones and clubs on 12 August 2018. The perpetrators are unknown and it is unclear whether the attack was motivated by the victim's political affiliation.

Unidentified assailants attacked and destroyed an entire house of an elderly man of Kiramira neighbourhood of Murwi town and commune in Cibitoke province on 12 August. The man and his family were able to flee. The victim had previously been accused of witchcraft.
On Aug 11, a member of the Jatiyatabadi Chhatradal was killed and two activists injured in a factional clash in Kumarpara area of Sylhet city.

On 11 August, two factions of the Himachal Congress party fought each other during a party rally with AICC member Rajni Patil in Behdala town (Una, Himachal Pradesh). An argument between supporters of an Una legislator and previously expelled party/NSUI members turned into a brawl.

On 11 August, two groups (no affiliation given) clashed, throwing stones and fighting, over an argument revolving around an ill cow in Khichripur area near Patparganj (Delhi, East Delhi, Delhi). Police detained 12 people and took the cow to a shelter; 6 people were injured.

A clash broke out between two groups of dealers at the Naag Shah cattle market in Multan on Aug 11; they hit each other with bricks and sticks. 2 people were killed while 3 people were injured and hospitalized. The same groups clashed again in the emergency ward of Nishtar Hospital later once the dead and injured were brought there.
In the week of 11 August, a crowd of people mobbed a thief in Katabi, in Entebbe. A soldier tried to intervene, and was also attacked and beaten.
11 August. A man is lynched by vigilantes in Lokoja after he was suspected of stealing ballot boxes. A second man was lynched under similar circumstances on the same day elsewhere in the city.
On Aug 11, Israeli forces shot and injured four Palestinians during clashes that erupted after the forces raided the town of Beit Ummar, near Hebron city in southern West Bank.
On Aug 10, two groups of villagers clashed over a land dispute at Dudshar village under Shailakupa upazila in Jhenidah, leaving 10 men injured.

On 10 Aug, a youth received a bullet wound to his abdomen, when government forces fired during a clash with rioters in Tukroo village (Shopian, J&K). Government forces had been attempting to conduct a CASO at the time.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 10 Aug, three rioters suffered pellet wounds when youths clashed with police and CRPF in Srinagar city (J&K) following Friday prayers. No reason was reported for the clash.

On 10 August, a group of students preparing for the UPSC exams clashed with property dealers over high rent prices in Nehru Vihar area of Mustafabad neighborhood (North East Delhi, Delhi). The groups threw stones at each other, damaging several cars and leaving 3 students injured. Police broke up the clash.
On 10 August, a man was lynched by a mob in Bijopura village (Muzaffarnagar, UP) on suspiciouns of theft which later turned out to be unfounded. 100 people were charged with murder over the attack.

On 10 August, a group of lawyers attacked a rape victim when she attempted to record her statement in court at Hapur town (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh). The perpetrator was a lawyer and the group was trying to intimidate her into dropping the plaint. She was unharmed.

On 10 August, members of a mosque denied entry to and attacked a Muslim man in a village near Baghpat (Baghpat, Uttar Pradesh). The man had undertaken the Kanwar Yatra pilgrimage, and was apparently drunk and abusive when trying to entry. It is unclear what level of force was used against the man.
On August 10, a mob set fire to three buses in Muzaffarpur-Sitamarhi road, near Jhapahan chowk, Ahiyapur, Muzaffarpur district, Bihar, after a speeding truck crushed a man to death.
On Aug 10, a Palestinian was shot and critically injured during clashes with Israeli forces in Tuqu village.
On Aug 9, a man was assaulted and burnt to death by villagers after the victim killed a van puller at Jagodal Dangapara in Birganj upazila (Dinajpur, Rangpur).

On Aug 9, 10 activists were injured in a clash between rioting activists of Awami League (AL) and its youth wing Jubo League at Mahajanpur village in Mujibnagar upazila of Meherpur district. Bamboo sticks and wooden logs were used in the clash. The clash occurred over a victory in the local election.
A clash erupted between two groups of the Soomro community in Bozdar Wada, Khairpur on Aug 9 over a land dispute. They attacked each other with sticks and metal rods; 3 women and 2 men were injured.
On 9 August, a young thief has been lynched by a mob after he had stolen a mobile phone. They hit him with stones which led to his death.
On August 8, a group of men assaulted the driver and cleaner of a vehicle in Bhojpur district, Bihar, on the suspicion of carrying beef.
During the week of 8 August, rioters stoned a soldier's house in Chitungwiza.
During the week of 8 August, rioters stoned a soldier's house in Mabvuku.
On Aug 8, clashes were reported between Israeli forces and Palestinians in Kafr Qaddum.

On August 8, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader was assaulted and his car was vandalized in Chakdaha area, Nadia district, West Bengal. The politician claimed the attackers were Trinamool Congress (TMC) supporters.

On 8 August, Manenberg police came under attack by residents while raiding the house of an alleged drug merchant and member of the Hard Livings gang. They pelted police with stones and damaged two police vehicles as they arrested the man for possession of tik worth R5 000.

On 7 Aug, Kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims) vandalized a car in Moti Nagar area of Delhi, Delhi after it allegedly hit one of the pilgrims. The group destroyed the car, attempted to set it on fire, and threw stones at the drivers.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
notes: On 7 Aug, rioting youths clashed with government forces during a joint army and SOG CASO at Gudoora village (Pulwama, J&K). Government forces responded to stone pelting with tear gas during the encounter.
On August 7, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), two groups of DMK clashed over the burial of a DMK leader. Police intervened using baton charge. One person died and 25 people were injured.

On 7 Aug, Kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims) resorted to rioting and attacking a police van in Bulandshahr city, Uttar Pradesh. The group seems to have spontaneously attacked the van when it arrived to intervene in a personal dispute.
On 7 Aug, there was a clash between two groups of the same community in Rehakda, Muzaffarnagar district, Uttar Pradesh, allegedly over a minor dispute (reason unclear).

Nadeem Jat and Muhammad Asif communal groups clashed in the Gojra Tehsil Headquarter Hospital on Aug 7 over the possession of state land. They also broke windowpanes, cabins, and computers; 8 people were arrested.

assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On August 7, police fired teargas at stone-throwing supporters of opposition leader Felix Tshisekedi in Kinshasa as he drove to the electoral commission to file his candidacy for president.
On 7 August, a suspected thief has been lynched by a mob after he had broken into a house and stole a laptop and two mobile phones. The mob beat him up and set him on fire.

On August 7, the pro-vice chancellor of Bhupendra Narayan Mandal University (BNMU) was assaulted by students, in Madhepura city, Bihar over an altercation about allegations over the recruitment process of drivers and computer operators.

On August 7, attendants of a 70-year-old woman patient assaulted doctors at the Nalanda Medical College and Hospital (NMCH), in Patna city, Bihar, after the doctors declared her dead. The group also vandalized hospital property.
On 7 Augl, 17 people assaulted a group of kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims) in Gujarhatti village, Nalagarh, Solan, Himachal Pradesh. No reason was given for the attack.
On 7 August, a pastor was lynched and killed by a mob in Pagirinya, Adjumani. She was accused of practising witchcraft.
08 June. A vigilante mob at Nangili market in Likuyani lynched a motorcycle thief.

location: Chak Three Hundred Seventy-two Gugera Branch
notes: Nadeem Jat and Muhammad Asif communal groups clashed in Chak 372-GB village, Gojra Tehsil over the possession of state land around Aug 6. They beat each other with sticks and bricks; 6 people were injured.

Qambrani and Marfani tribesmen clashed over an old enmity at Dakhan Naka near Shahi Bazaar in Ghari Yasin, a town in Shikarpur District, as reported on Aug 6. 1 man was killed and the attackers fled. The tribes have been at war for 15 years.
Rioting erupted between two groups after an argument over a minor issue in the Marriabad area of Quetta City on Aug 6. 2 people were injured.

6 August 2018: A crowd gathered at the scene of a fire in Jayga village neighbourhood, in Wadajir district of the capital, Mogadishu, and began throwing stones at fire fighting vehicles for arriving late. Somali National Army forces arrived to the scene and opened fire, injuring two rioters.
On 6 August, students at a school in Omel, Gulu county, rioted and attacked the headmaster to protest the failure to release results. The headmaster was hospitalised with severe injuries.
On or before Aug 6, 20 lawyers assaulted a traffic warden and detained him for hours after he issued a ticket to one of them in Jhang district headquarters (Punjab).
On Aug 6, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinians in Ya'bad to the west of Jenin. Israeli forces used rubber coated bullets, tear gas, and stun grenades.
On 5 Aug, two rioting groups clashed in Govindpuri transit camp in South Delhi, Delhi, over a criminal case that had been filed several months before. Three men were injured.
On 5 Aug, rioters clashed with security forces at Khur Batpora village (Kulgam, J&K) during a CASO. Security forces fired in the air in response to stone throwing by rioters.
On 5 Aug, BJP MLA Prakash was injured when stones were thrown at his car in Jamunapur area of Mathura city, Uttar Pradesh.
On August 5, two communities clashed in Maganpur village, Jharkhand, over construction of a disputed road passing through a place of worship. At least 10 people were injured.
Around Aug 5, two rival groups in the Gharibabad area of Dalbandin district clashed; 1 person was killed and 1 policeman was injured. No weapons mentioned in the source.

A mob of drivers surrounded and beat a traffic warden, along with other wardens who tried to help him, at Sunny Bank Chowk in Murree City on Aug 5 after the warden issues a ticket to an illegally parked vehicle.
On 5 August, a suspected thief was lynched in a mob attack in Antsohihy.
On 5 August, a 33-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by an angry mob in Port Elizabeth.

On August 5, relatives of a patient assaulted a doctor at a health centre in Hemtabad city, North Dianjpur district, West Bengal, claiming that delay in treatment had led to her death. The group also vandalized hospital property.

On or before August 5th, ten people were killed in Dire Dawa city, whilst an unspecified number were injured, and property destroyed in suspected riots. It was reported that violence involved members of the Somali and Oromo ethnic groups, but the idendity of the attackers and victims is unclear. A subsequent report has identified six of the deceased as being nationals of Djibouti.

On 4 Aug, at least 26 youths were hospitalised following clashes with police in the Yanar area of Pahalgam (Anantnag, J&K). The rioting was prompted by the death of a local militant in an earlier clash with government forces.
On 4 Aug, a mob attacked and beat 7 individuals in Aligarh area, Uttar Pradesh, accusing them of taking stray cows to the slaughterhouse.
On August 4, a group of people assaulted a mentally challenged man accusing him of being a child-lifter, in Khagenhat village, Alipurduar district, West Bengal.

Two rival groups clashed over a petty dispute in the Dehi Bagel Para Lodhi village, Mangal area of Abbottabad on the evening of Aug 4. 2 people were killed, 2 were injured, and 7 people were arrested. No weapons mentioned in the source.
On 4 August, a man was beaten to death in what is believed to be a mob justice attack in Port Elizabeth.

On or before August 4th, a man was killed by a vigilante mob at an unspecified location in Masaiti district (Copperbelt province), after having been accused of bewitching his daughter (who had died recently).

On August 4, locals clashed with the police, hurling stones and bricks, at Khagenhat village, Alipurduar district, West Bengal. The group attacked the police team that arrived to rescue a man who was being beaten up by a mob over suspicion of being a child-lifter.
On 3 Aug, cow vigilantes beat to death a man in Palwal district, Haryana, over allegations that he was a cow smuggler.

actor2: NDFB-P: National Democratic Front of Boroland-Progressive
notes: On August 3, a militant of the NDFB who had escaped a police firing was caught and severely assaulted by a mob of villagers in Baringgre village, East Garo Hills, Meghalaya. The suspected rebel was later arrested by the police.
On Aug 3, a Dalit man was set on fire by two men in Sapoha village in Mathura city (Mathura, UP) after he refused to share a packet of gutkha. The victim sustained burn injuries.
On 3 August, attendees at a public event in Arua became rowdy as they started to loot equipment and block roads. The police fired teargas and bullets into the crowd. 2 people were hospitalised.
On 3 August, angry people threw stones at the house of a soldier in Seke.
On August 3, 3 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli forces in Hizma and Anata, near Ramallah.
On 3/8/2018, rioters in Eshtehard threw rocks at a Shiite Muslim seminary and broke its windows. The police interfered to disperse the rioters and arrested a few people.

On 3 Aug, rioting kanwariyas (Hindu pilgrims) vandalized property and set fire to a vehicle belonging to the Provincial Armed Constabulary in Chaubla village, Meerut, Uttar Pradesh. The van had apparently hit two kanwariyas earlier that day on the way to Haridwar.
On August 3, 3 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli forces in Hizma and Anata, near Ramallah. Two youth were reportedly injured by live fire in Hazma.

Skirmishes took place between demonstrators who took up sticks as weapons and Peoples Protection Units patrol in Hajiyah village south of Quamishli in Al-Hasakeh following a raid by YPG on the village. No injuries or fatalities reported.

On August 2, All India Trinamool Congress (AITMC) Member of Parliament (MP) Mahua Moitra assaulted a lady constable who restrained her at the Silchar airport, Silchar city, Cachar district, Assam. The delegation of the AITMC had been stopped at the Silchar Airport due to imposition of Section 144 in Assam (unlawful assembly).

On 2 Aug, clashes were reported between rioters and security forces in Cheeri Koot village (Kupwara, J&K), following a gunfight between militants and security forces in nearby Khumriyal village that left two militants dead.

On 2 Aug, clashes were reported between rioters and security forces in Kalaroos village (Kupwara, J&K), following a gunfight between militants and security forces in nearby Khumriyal village that left two militants dead.

On 2 Aug, a civilian received bullet injuries to his arm and abdomen when military forces fired on rioters in Krusan village (Kupwara, J&K), following a gunfight between militants and security forces in nearby Khumriyal village that left two militants dead.

On 2 Aug, clashes were reported between rioters and security forces in Chaiwan village (Kupwara, J&K), following a gunfight between militants and security forces in nearby Khumriyal village that left two militants dead.

On 2 Aug, clashes were reported between rioters and security forces in Shat Muqam village (Kupwara, J&K), following a gunfight between militants and security forces in nearby Khumriyal village that left two militants dead.

On August 2, in Boripardhi village in Daund tehsil (Pune, Maha), police intervened in a clash between two groups. The groups pelted stones at the police, leaving one policeman injured. (The reason for the clash is unclear.)

Up to 200 people, including members and leaders of the Bar Association and Municipal Committee, rioted in Minchinabad during the recount of election ballots. They assaulted their rivals, including PTI workers, and damaged some vehicles. 200 of them were later booked.

On 2 August, during a traditional ceremony in Wailawa, Lau, clashes erupted between leaders and settlers. Two people were wounded. Police brought the situation under control. Unclear level of organisation of the actors - coded as herders and communal militias.

On August 2, clashes broke out at Joseph's tomb between Israeli forces and Palestinians. Israeli forces were escorting Israeli settlers to the site. Palestinians reportedly threw stones and empty bottles and Israeli forces responded with tear gas and rubber bullets injuring a number of Palestinians.
On August 2, in Ahmedabad city (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), police clashed with a group of rioters who attacked the staff at a cattle impounding event.
A man from Kahirwa hill in Buhindo area of Murwi commune of Cibitoke province beat up and critically wounded his neighbour on 2 August 2018. He accused the victim of witchcraft.

On August 2, two hundred members of Romani community in Belgorod region (Urazovo, Sobolevka villages) fled from their homes, fearing of revenge from ethnic Russian natives for a crime commited by a member of the community. During the night, several houses were burnt down or damaged another way. No causalties were reported.
On August 1, near Ahmedabad city (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), two rioting groups of Dalits and other communal members clashed over an unknown dispute, leaving five people injured.

On 1 August, a gendarme shot and killed a civilian after he refused to stop at a checkpoint near Mbouda between Batcham and Balenssing, Bamboutos. The residents then attacked the police post in Batcham to find the gendarme and avenge their friend.
On 1 August, residents from Chiradzulu have demolished three houses after guards at Chikale Estate killed a man over cutting trees.
On August 1, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinians when Israeli forces stormed the Ad Dahiya area of Nablus city.

On July 31, a Bajrang Dal member and 20 others supporters beat up three men suspected of transporting cattle for slaughter, at Hajipur city, Vaishali district, Bihar. The victims were sent to hospital for treatment and the police lodged a case against the attackers.

On July 31, villagers beat up a man after he was caught molesting his minor step daughter in Nameram village, Kharkutta, Meghalaya. The accused was later handed over to the Dainadubi police outpost of the same district.

A clash broke out between two group of PML-N workers at Tiba Zahir Pir, Sadiqabad, RY Khan, Punjab as reported on July 31 over the cleaning of sewerage pipes in the locality. 6 people were injured and taken to the hospital.
On July 31, clashes were reported in Sebastia, north of Nablus, between Palestinian locals and Israeli forces who fired tear gas, live fire and stun grenades.

A woman from Murehe Hill in Nyabitsinda area and commune of Ruyigi province was nearly killed on 31 July 2018 by her former neighbours who accused her of witchcraft. The incident occurred as the victim was returning from Tanzania on a UNHCR bus that was targeted with stones by the perpetrators. The victim has previously fled a popular justice act when her neighbours buried her alive.

On 31 July 2018, a prison warden shot and wounded an inspectorate officer in Mombasa. The perpetrator became hostile after he committed a traffic offense in busy traffic, shooting the officer. The public retaliated by lynching the perpetrator.
Early July 31st, Israeli forces and Palestinians clashed in Mukhayyam ad Duhayshah refugee camp. An Israeli soldier was injured by a Molotov cocktail.
On July 31, Israeli forces clashed with Palestinians in Hebron. Locals threw stones and military forces responded with tear gas and sound bombs.

Reported on July 30, in Sylhet city (Sylhet, Sylhet), supporters of different political candidates in the Syhlet city polls clashed in several areas of the city. At least three people were wounded after police opened fire to control the clashes. (Party affiliation of rioting groups not mentioned.)

On Jul 30, a mob severely assaulted a Muslim boy after he was found in a hotel room with a girl from the Hindu community in the Ghansali area of Tehri district (TG, Uttar) and then paraded him around the area. The mob also damaged shops and kiosks belonging to the Muslim community.
Dendar and Warriach communal group members clashed on July 30 in Kalaske, a city in Gujranwala, over an old enmity. 3 people were killed.
On 30/7/2018, rioters in Eker threw molotov cocktails at security forces.

On July 30, BJP leader (Pradip Patri) was assaulted by BJD workers at Dharakot village panchayat samiti office, Aska, Ganjam district, Orissa, during a public hearing. He was reportedly attacked for opposing corruption in construction of toilets in Bahadaguda village. The victim suffered minor injuries.

source: Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: On July 30, Palestinian sources reported that 2 Palestinians were shot and injured by live fire when Israeli forces opened fire on a group of Palestinian youth who had destroyed part of the Israeli security fence east of Gaza city.
On July 29, a youth was beaten to death by a mob under Ahiyapur police station area, Muzaffarpur district, Bihar, over allegations of stealing a mobile phone.
29 July. Angered over recent bandit attacks, youths in Zurmi town set the local police station alight, demanding they release 3 held suspects of the attacks.
On July 29, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), DMK members vandalized a restaurant after they were refused free food.
On July 29, in Thanjavur city (Thanjavur, TN), groups of DMK members started rioting and threw stones at buses following rumours on the poor health condition of the DMK president.
29 July. Vigilantes torture a man to death in Ado-Ekiti, reasons unknown. Seven suspected were later arrested.

On 28th or 29th July, a lynch mob killed a man suspected to be a current or past member of the (now defunt) Flying Squad Police Unit at Natete (Wakiso) on the outskirts of Kampala. The man had a track record of extorting civilians in the areas he was stationed and was found with looted items.
On July 29, Israeli forces had fireworks thrown at them by unidentified persons in the area of Tekoa.
On July 28, in Kali Mahudi village in Jhalod Taluka (Dahod, Gujarat), a mob of people beat a thief to death.
On July 28, a young man was lynched to death by a mob and another injured in Jagdamba Nagar, Muzaffarpur city, Bihar, over accusations of cell phone theft.
On July 28, the police clashed with ISKCON followers during the demolition of a memorial (samadhi peeth) installed at an encroached area in front of the temple, in Bhubaneswar city, Odisha.
Clashes erupted between Palestinians and Israeli forces on July 28 in and around Kobar village as Israeli forces continue to intensively raid the area. 5 Palestinians were injured by live fire.

A group of settlers assaulted on July 28 a 60-year-old Palestinian man in the southern West Bank city of Hebron. The man said the settlers threw stones at him and his children while they were in their home. He was admitted to hospital in Hebron, where he was reported in stable condition.
On July 28, a mentally challenged man was beaten to death by a mob in Kondekera village, Gumla district, Jharkhand, after he had killed a woman and her two children.
On July 28, a young man was assaulted by a mob after raping a 12-year-old girl in a forest in Bamberi, Keonjhar district, Odisha. The accused, who suffered multiple injuries, was sent to hospital.

PTI MPA-elect Nadeem Bara and some of his supporters assaulted police officers at his guesthouse in the Hanjarwal area of Lahore [Iqbal] on July 28. 2 policemen were hospitalized. A case was registered against 50 people; 21 were arrested and the politician turned himself in. He claimed the police had assaulted his supporters and raided without verification.

28 July, on or about. Youths in Ilara Mokin (adjacent to Ipogun), Ifedore council area of Ondo State assaulted the Divisional Police Officer DPO following the death of two members of the community by a bus.

On July 28, rioters pelted rocks at an advocate' s (Huidrom Kenajit Singh) residence in Imphal city, Manipur. The lawyer was representing a man accused of murder, and the rioters were members of the deceased man's family.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A CNDD-FDD member from Kahirwa hill in Buhindo area of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province beat up and seriously wounded his neighbour on 28 July 2018. The CNDD-FDD member accused the victim of witchcraft.

Three Palestinian youth on July 28 were shot and injured by Israeli soldiers during clashes that erupted as Israeli forces raided the town of Beit Ummar to the north of the southern West Bank district of Hebron.
Seven Palestinians including a photographer were reportedly injured by Israeli forces during clashes in Kufr Qaddu m on July 28.

On July 27, villagers broke into the house of a Dalit family, threatened the family and vandalised their house in Deuli village (Nuagon block, Nayagarh district, Orissa) in an attempt to grab the land, as the Dalit family lived on government land.

27 July. The mother of a Kenyan man, who allegedly mutilated his wife, is stoned to death by a mob in Jerusalem village of Kirinyaga County. The woman was targeted the vigilantes suspected she was hiding her son.

On July 27, a mob attacked police in Jiribam district (Jiribam, Manipur) in which 4 police personnel and 6 rioters were injured. The rioters threw stones at the police who retaliated with tear gas and rubber bullets. This was in reaction to the recently passed Manipur People's Protection Bill 2018.
On July 27, in Ahmedabad city (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), Chhara communal members clashed with police after police raids on Chhara businesses. Police arrested 29 Chhara involved in the clash.
A clash broke out between supporters of an independent candidate (Nisar) and PTI candidate Sarwar at Sihal Bus Terminal in Rawalpindi on July 27. 1 person was injured.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: Former ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
