assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 27 July, ZANU youths and MDC youths clashed for 2 hours at a shopping centre in Zhombe. Both parties were armed with machetes, bricks, and axes.
Israeli forces shot a middle aged man in the head killing him during border confrontations east of Khan Yunis on July 27.
An improvised grenade was thrown at Israel forces in the area of ??the fence opposite al-Bureij in the central Gaza Strip on July 27. There are no casualties.
Clashes reported between Israeli forces and Palestinian youth in downtown Hebron on July 27.
Clashes between Israeli forces and Palestinians were reported in Birzayt on July 27.
Israeli police closed Al Aqsa mosque for several hours after clashes broke out between worshipers and police on July 27.
Scores of rioting PTI workers vandalized the car of the area's PML-N MLA-elect on July 27 in an incident of post-polling violence.

On July 26, a group of villagers assaulted a Block Chairman from Baripada and forced her to wear a garland of shoes in Nuadihi village, Mayurbhanj district, Odisha. The Chairman had supported a youth who abducted a minor girl from the village.

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students Union of India; Students (India)
notes: On July 26, 4 NSUI members were injured during a clash between the NSUI and SOI at the Post-Graduate Government College, Sector 46, in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh, Chandigarh) after a heated argument over party stickers became a clash.

PTI and JUI-F activists clashed outside of the Judicial Complex where they had gathered to get information on the election in Bannu on July 26. The two sides exchanged blows and pelted stones. Several people were injured. The police arrived and fired into the air to disperse the crowd.
On 26/67/2018, rioters in Abu Saybi threw Molotov cocktails at security forces as part of the continued February 14 2011 agitation
On July 26, PML-N and PTI activists clashed over the results of the general elections in Dhodial village (Mansehra, KP) in NA-13 constituency. 1 PTI worker was killed and 12 people were injured.
On 26 July, a Buffalo City Metro councillor's house was torched as she slept in Mdantsane.

source: Liveuamap; Ukrayinska Pravda; Ukraine General Newswire
notes: On Jul. 26 2018, supporters and opponents of the city mayor started fighting during the city council meeting in Konotop, Sumy. Police officers stood between the two groups to prevent further clashes. 50 people were arrested, four policemen got injured.

source: The Express Tribune; Daily Pakistan Today; The Frontier Star
notes: Clashes occurred between PML-N and PTI workers in Mohammad Pur village, NA-148, Sahiwal on election day, July 25. 1 PTI worker died and 4 other people were injured.
On July 25, two Hindus and two Muslims were attacked by a vigilante militia while transporting a dead buffalo in Hathras district (Hathras, UP) and were saved by the intervention of the police.

On July 25, four people have been injured in Mahmoodabad area of Chaman after workers of two political parties clashed. Police said workers of PkMAP and an independent candidate clashed after levelling allegations of rigging against each other.
On July 25, five people injured after workers of two political parties clash in Ghotki's PS-21 constituency, according to the police.
On July 25, workers of the PTI and PML-N clashed in Hazro tehsil of Attock district.

On July 25, a clash was reported in the Mol Dino Rajar and Pir Bux Rajar villages, Khipro area's Yamin Hingorjo women's polling station between GDA and PPP workers. 7 to dozens of people were injured, one person critically.
On July 25, polling was temporarily stopped after a clash between PTI and PML-N workers in NA-123 Lahore.
On July 25, members of two unnamed political parties clashed in Multan's NA-155 constituency.
On July 25, PTI and PML-N workers clashed outside Government Postgraduate College in Rawalpindi's Satellite Town (around 17:20). Elsewhere, the same groups clashed on Railway Station Road.

On July 25, 4 people were injured during a clash between two rival politicla groups inside a woman's polling station in the NA215 and PS-41 constituencies, in the Tando Mitha Khan area. A PPP polling agent was injured.
A clash occurred between PTI and BAP workers in the Bhatti Mohalla area of Jaffarabad District on election day, July 25. 15 people were injured.
Minor scuffles between unspecified political groups were reported in Chaman and Duki Districts, Balochistan Province on election day, July 25. 8 people were injured.
Minor scuffles between unspecified political groups were reported in Chaman and Duki Districts, Balochistan Province on election day, July 25. 8 people were injured.
Minor clashes between unspecified groups were reported in the PK-42 constituency of Ghazi tehsil, Haripur District on election day, July 25. No info on casualties.

source: Daily Pakistan Today; Dawn (Pakistan); The News International
notes: A clash occurred between the supporters of two independent candidates at Batera area of Kohistan on election day, July 25. 12 people were injured, 2 critically, when they fought with clubs and daggers over allowing someone to vote out of turn. In a separate clash between supporters of two other candidates, 8 people were injured after the rioters fought with bricks and sticks. Police interfered to settle the situation.

source: The Express Tribune; The News International
notes: Clashes occurred between PTI and PPP workers near a polling station in Zaryab Colony, Faqirabad, and Sarki Gate, Peshawar on election day, July 25. No reported casualties. Police dispersed the crowds in Zaryab; at Sarki, there was aerial firing.
Clashes occurred between unnamed groups in Chiniot District on election day, July 25. Casualties unknown.
A clash occurred between PTI and PML-N workers in Gujranwala on election day, July 25. No information on casualties.
Minor clashes occurred between PTI and PML-N groups in Kasur District on election day, July 25. No fatalities; no information on injuries.
A clash occurred between two unspecified political parties in NA-93, Khushab District on election day, July 25. No information on casualties.
Small scuffles occurred between PTI and PML-N activists in Manga Mandi, Iqbal, Lahore on election day, July 25 because of a big rush of voters.

Small scuffles occurred between PTI and PML-N activists in the NFC Society and Sher Shah Colony of Nishtar, Lahore on election day, July 25 because of a big rush of voters. Police intervened but did not manage the situation well.
A clash occurred between PTI and PML-N workers in Shahdara area of Lahore [Ravi] on election day, July 25. No information on casualties.
A scuffle erupted between PTI and PML-N workers in the Shamsabad area of Multan town on election day, July 25. Extra police were called in to handle the situation. No casualties reported.
A clash occurred between PTI and PML-N workers in NA-145/146 in Pakpattan District on election day, July 25. No information on casualties.

A clash occurred between PTI and PML-N workers in Rajanpur District, Punjab Province on election day, July 25. Several people were injured and police were later in the area to prevent violence after the incident occurred.

PTI and PML-N workers clashed at a men's polling station in Dhoke Hassu, NA-62 and PP-18 near Rawalpindi on election day, July 25. The men pelted stones. Police, army, and Dolphin forces were deployed and controlled the situation. No info on casualties.
Supporters of a PML-N nominee clashed with PML-N activists in Gojra's NA-111 constituency in Toba Tek Singh on election day, July 25. 4 were injured.
Supporters of a PTI and an independent candidate clashed in the PP-123 zone of Pir Mahal, Toba Tek Singh on election day, July 25. 3 from each side were injured.

A clash broke out between supporters of an independent candidate and PML-N workers in Chak 493/EB of NA-162, Burewala tehsil on election day, July 25. Police pacified the situation. No info on casualties.
A clash occurred between PPP and GDA workers near Golarchi town, Badin District on election day, July 25. 5-6 people were injured. Army personnel intervened to help contain the tension.
In Karak village, Khairpur Nathan Shah tehsil, Dadu, PTI and PPP activists fought with fists over the casting of votes. No major injuries reported. 7 of the rioters were arrested.
A clash occurred between voters of the Jatoi and Mahar communal groups in Nimro, Sindh Province on election day, July 25. 8 people were injured.

Clashes occurred between ANP and Rah-i-Haq (a cover name for the banned ASWJ group) party activists in the Landhi area of Karachi on election day, July 25. Casualties unknown. Pak Rangers intervened to pacify the situation.
Clashes occurred outside of a polling station in NA-219 Dighri area, Mirpurkhas, Sindh on election day, July 25. 1 person was killed.

Shaikh community members and Brohi tribal members clashed outside of a polling station in Shikarpur District on election day, July 25. 4 people were injured. One PPP candidate and one GDA candidate were briefly detained in connection to the event. Not clear what their association was or if they were directly involved.

On Jul 25, election day, a group of people attacked and ransacked a women's polling station in the PK-80 constituency of Kohat District. They broke ballot boxes and scattered the ballots on the ground, making them uncountable. On Sep 16, the police nominated PTI workers for the attack.

assoc_actor_1: INC: Indian National Congress; Government of India (2014-); Labour Group (India)
notes: On July 25, a demolition drive by a team from the Municipal Corporation was aborted after shopkeepers and Congress councillors stopped them in Jalandhar city (Jalandhar, Punjab).

On July 25, senior students of the Chandra Shekhar Azad University of Agriculture Technology forcibly entered a hostel and attacked junior students in Kanpur (KN, UP) injuring over a dozen students and two security guards.
On July 24, a Muslim man was attacked by a mob formed from the surrounding crowd when he tried to marry a Hindu girl at court in Ghaziabad city (Ghaziabad, UP).

assoc_actor_2: Shiv Sena; INC: Indian National Congress; Government of India (2014-)
notes: On July 24, a Shiv Sena and Congress MP were manhandled during the last rites for a protester, Shinde, who jumped to his death from a bridge, in Aurangabad district (Aurangabad, Maha).

On July 23, a mob of people tried to set a luxury car involved in an accident on fire, on the Dambulla-Habarana main road in Pelwehera village, Dambulla, Central. While trying to stop the mob, a police officer was attacked with a machete.

On 23 Jul, 26 people were injured, including one seriously, when government forces fired pellets and tear gas at rioters in the Lone Mohalla area of Khudwani (Kulgam, J&K). The clash occurred as youths took to the streets in response to a CASO launched to catch militants in the area.

On 23 Jul, security forces fired shots into the air to disperse rioters as they threw stones at them in Rathsuna village in Tral tehsil (Pulwama, J&K). The rioters had taken to the streets to disrupt a CASO targeting militants alleged to be in the area.
On July 23, four women were beaten up and stripped by a huge mob in Daukimari village, Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. The women were accused to be child-lifters.
On July 23, six persons were injured in a clash between the supporters of two PML-N candidates in the Tibba Zahir Pir area in Sadiqabad.

On July 23, a scuffle broke out Monday night between the supporters of two political parties in Hajipura (Sialkot district) at one of the group's electoral halls. The scuffle was reportedly between the PTI and PML-N. 5 people were seriously injured.
Clashes broke out in Tulkarem after Israeli forces raided the villages on July 23. A number of Palestinians suffered from tear gas inhalation but no serious injuries were reported.
Clashes broke out at a home demolition in Sakhnin on July 23. Israeli police injured 5 Palestinian citizens of Israel when clashes broke out at a home demolition in the Arab village in Israel.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 23 July, a FNL supporter and her workers fought with the chief of the Nzibariba hill and two Imbonerakure who had come to extort her money for the 2020 elections. Police fined her for her behaviour.
On 23 July, students at the Unyama National Teachers College in Gulu rioted when student guild elections were postponed. 22 students were injured in the clashes between competing student groups.
Israeli forces shot dead a Palestinian 15 year old after clashes broke out following a raid in Dheisheh refugee camp on July 23. A number of others were injured.

On July 23, during an anti-encroachment drive in Krishna Square a scuffle occurred between Municipal Corporation employees and residents resisting the drive in Amritsar city (Amritsar, Punjab). One shop owner alleged that he was assaulted in the process.

On July 22, a mob vandalised police vehicles and attacked policemen and security personnel in Mumbai city (Mumbai City, Maha) after a 17-year-old boy died at the Sion Hospital. 2 police and 3 personnel were injured.

On July 22, 7 people were injured when two rival political groups (supporters of an independent and PTI candidates) scuffled over the arrangement of a corner meeting in the Lakhkar area of Landi Kotal.
On 22 July 2018, a group of four men beat to death a senior citizen for allegedly trying to steal oil palm fruits in Letir, Sitiawan in Lumut town (Manjung, Perak).
Clashes erupted in Bayt Ummar after an Israeli raid in the village on July 22. Scores of Palestinians suffered tear gas inhalation.

On July 22, 2018: Members of the anarchist group Rouvikonas threw paint at the Greek Foreign Ministry in downtown Athens hours after attacking a tax office in North Athens. Rouvikonas said in a web post that their action was in solidarity with the Palestinian people and in opposition to Greece's warming relations with Israel.

On July 22, 2018: Members of the anarchist group Rouvikonas attacked the tax office of Psychico, an affluent suburb in North Athens in protest against foreclosures being pushed by Prime Minister and SYRIZA leader Alexis Tsipras. Rouvikonas released a video of the attack showing men wearing helmets to hide their faces smashing windows on the building's facade and splashing paint.

On July 21, IPFT members stormed a local level meeting of BJP, pelted stones and vandalised property in Gamchakobra village under Lefunga police station of Mohanpur in North of Agartala (Tripura). One person was injured.
On July 21, unidentified actors set fire to an AL candidate's electoral camp in Sylhet city, no injuries reported.
On July 21, a mob attacked and killed a mentally-ill women suspected of being a child-lifter in Badgad village (Singrauli, MP).
On July 21, a clash erupted between two groups led by Haider Khan and Sk Akil over an old rivalry, at Selim math in Topsia, Kolkata city, West Bengal. Five people were arrested.

On July 21, PML-N activists in and around the courtroom in Rawalpindi where Hanif Abbasi (ex-MNA and current PML-N candidate in the election) was sentenced to life in jail rioted, smashing windowpanes with stones and clashing with police and Anti-Narcotics Force (ANF) officers. At one point they tried to freew Abbasi from ANF custody before he was taken to Adiala Jail.

assoc_actor_2: SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India
notes: On July 20, in Perambra town (Kozhikode, Kerala), CPI(M) threw bombs at the house of SDPI workers in retaliation for an earlier SDPI attack on a CPI(M) house. There were no injuries.

assoc_actor_1: SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India
notes: On July 20, in Perambra town (Kozhikode, Kerala), SDPI threw bombs at the house of CPI(M) workers. No injuries reported.

On July 20, a mob of right wing activists stopped independent candidate Jibran Nasir from conducting his door-to-door campaign in Bazarta Line area in Karachi city, Sindh. The rioters pelted stones, tore down posters and allegedly assualted Nasir's supporters.

On July 20, at least seven people sustained critical injuries when Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf leaders and workers pelted a public gathering of former prime minister and PML-N candidate from NA-57 Shahid Khaqan Abbasi with stones at Kakrai Kahuti Village of Union Council Gehel, Murree (Rawalpindi, Punjab).
On July 20, an independent candidate for PS-99 got into a "brawl" with a PTI candidate. He was later arrested in hospital where he had been admitted after the fight.
On July 20, an independent candidate for PS-99 got into a "brawl" with a PTI candidate. He was later arrested in hospital where he had been admitted after the fight.

20 July. Several students of Kanjuri Boys High School in Mathira, Nyeri were injured during a confrontation with villagers and police who thwarted their attempt to burn a school building. The students were possibly angered over the arraignment of several other protesting students.

On July 19, in Pillaiyarkulam village in Narikudi Block (Virudhunagar, TN), two groups clashed with one another over a municipal dispute. Police intervened and arrested seven people. Several people were injured.

source: Tribal News Network; The Balochistan Times (AsiaNet)
notes: On July 19, four people were injured in a clash between the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) and the Awami National Party (ANP) workers in Sodher area of Swabi. The rioters clashed over a flag hoisting in the area.
On July 19, MMA supporters and workers attacked officials in Islamabad who were removing banners that had violated the elections code of conduct.
On July 19, MMA supporters and workers attacked officials in Islamabad who were removing banners that had violated the elections code of conduct.

On 19th July, a mob attacked journalists travelling to Addis Ababa, at Mieso woreda (West Hararge zone), accusing them of being spies. The driver of their vehicle died later in hospital, and five other crew were injured. Nobody has been arrested.
On 19-July-2018 3 Palestinian individuals were wounded during a clash with Israeli Military forces in the Jenin Refugee Camp, Jenin, West Bank. The injured were in critical condition.

On 19 July, two shamans were beaten by about 30 villagers in Ganga Jamuna rural municipality, Dhading district, Central. The victims died a day later from the injuries. 31 persons were arrested. It was not clear why the shamans were attacked.

assoc_actor_1: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
notes: On July 18, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), supporters of Independent MLA and AMMK Founder T T V Dhinakaran and supporters from AIADMK clashed over Dhinakaran's visit to the area. Police had to use lathi charge to disperse the two groups. A police officer sustained injuries.
On July 18, at least 10 activists of PML-N and PTI sustained injuries when the rioting groups scuffled at Farooq-e-Azam Chowk, Hafizabad, Punjab.

On July 18th, activists of Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) and Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) clashed with each other in the Shahdara area of Lahore (Ravi) over the placement of posters and banners.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 18 July, an MDC Alliance supporter attacked a ZANU PF supporter for wearing a party t-shirt in Mutasa, tearing his shirt apart and threatening him with a wooden bench.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 18 July, ZANU youths attacked an MDC Alliance rally. There were clashes between the party supporters. 2 MDC Alliance activists were hospitalised.

assoc_actor_1: JEEMA: Justice, Education, Economic Revitalization, Morality and African Unity
notes: On 18 July, police officers fired after JEEMA supporters at a rally threw stones at them. 1 person was killed by the gunshots.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Palestine (1994-) Gaza Strip
notes: A border officer was hurt in clashes between settlers and Palestinians in Yitzhar on July 18. She suffered a head injury when she was hit by stones thrown by settlers.
Settlers on July 18 raided homes in Asira al Qibliya and set fire to farm lands during a riot, which sparked clashes between Palestinians and Israeli forces.
Clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces on July 18 following a raid and property destruction by settlers in Asira al Qibliya.
On 18 July, some shacks in Brakpan belonging to new occupiers who had rebuilt after Metro police had demolished them were reportedly burnt by community members.
17 July. A vigilante group shot and killed two suspected thieves in Nakuru.
17 July. Students of Kirimara Boys High School in Nyeri pelted teachers with stones in protest of an exam. Several injuries reported.
On 17 July, police officers were investigating a robbery in a village in Gisoro. A crowd of villagers rioted, so the police opened fire. 1 villager was killed and 2 were injured.

While settlers were setting fire to crops in Assra al Qibilya, local Palestinians rushed to defend their homes and land on July 17. Israeli soldiers who were defending the settlers opened fire on the residents resulting in clashes between locals and the military as well as settlers.
On July 17, BJP supporters attacked civil police volunteers in Kharagpur in West Bengal's Paschim Midnapore when they could not reach the venue of the Prime Minister Modi's rally.
On July 17, in Kodungallur city (Thrissur, Kerala), two rival groups of students clashed with each other over a dispute. Several students including a teacher were injured.
On July 17, a clash took place between rioting activists of PTI and MQM during an election rally in Gulshan, Karachi. No one was seriously injured.

On July 17, unidentified men armed with sticks stormed the office of a former Jamait Ulema-i-Islam-Fazl, now independent, candidate in Banda Daud Shah tehsil of Karak district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. They set fire to flags and forced the candidates supporters to leave. No injuries were reported.
On July 17th, PML-N and PTI workers clashed over an election issue in Nawan Kot, Layyah district. No injuries reported.
17 July. Church members and villagers nearly lynch a pastor accused of sex crimes in Nzawa before police intervene.
17 July. A vigilante mob lynched a suspected motorcycle thief in Mumias.

On July 17, a 79-year-old social activist (Swami Agnivesh) was beaten by a mob that included BJYM activists, when he was on his way to Litipada Block, in Pakur district, Jharkhand. He was later taken to a local hospital for medical treatment.
Settlers attacked Palestinian homes and set fire to farmland during a riot on July 17 in Assira al Qibilya.

On Jul. 17 2018, a group of people gathered around employees of the local municipal services who were demolishing unlawfully erected constructions in Dnipro, Ukraine. The rioters threw stones at them, used clubs and set tires on fire.

16 July. Rampaging youths in Jalingo pelted Taraba Commissioner of Police, Mr David Akinremi, with stones, injuring him on the head. The youth unrest began the previous day for unknown reason. Several civilians were also attack by the rioters. 60 arrests reported.
On 16 July, MDC Alliance youths beat a journalist who was taking pictures in Chitungwiza, breaking his glasses.

assoc_actor_1: DYFI: Democratic Youth Federation of India
notes: On July 16, in Periyattadukkam village in Kanhangad Block (Kasaragod, Kerala), DYFI and IUML members clashed over the writing on a poster. Three DYFI activists sustained injuries.
Mid-July, three people were killed in mob justice attacks in separate incidencts in Dunoon. Coded as three separate incidents.
On 16 July, 2 people were killed and three injured in Betafo as angry people clashed with police. Property was damaged in the violence.
Clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinians as Israeli soldiers and setters stormed Joseph's tomb near Nablus on July 16. A number of Palestinians were injured.
Israeli settlers threw stones and caused damage to Palestinian houses in Hebron on July 16.
On 15 July, angry community members in Chitipa set on fire a councillor's vehicle after the politician hit a cyclist dead.

On July 15, in Salem city (Salem, TN), BJP and Congress members clashed during the birth anniversary celebrations of a deceased Tamil Nadu leader. The Congress alleged BJP were "appropriating" the late Congress icon, K Kamaraj. The police broke up the clash. The number of injuries was not reported.

On July 15, rioting activists and supporters of independent candidate Sardar Mir Taimoor Khan Panhwar clashed with the caravan of Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) candidate Rafiq Ahmed Jamali in Malooja Panhwar village near Khudabad town of Dadu taluka, Sindh. No injuries were reported.
Mid-July, three people were killed in mob justice attacks in separate incidencts in Dunoon. Coded as three separate incidents.
15 July. Youths riot in Jalingo for unknown reason. Several civilians report being attacked.
Israeli forces shot and injured 9 Palestinians during clashes that broke out during predawn raids in Jalazun refugee camp near Ramalla hon July 15.
On July 14, in Khalilpur Union of Maulvibazar Sadar Upazila (Maulvibazar, Sylhet), two rival communal groups clashed over a land dispute. Two people were killed and 40 were seriously injured.

On July 14, three workers of Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) were injured when two rioting TLP factions clashed near Kamal Chisti Mor, Kasur, Punjab. The scuffle erupted after candidate Mufti Farooqul Hassan and his workers argued over the choice of song for their campaign.
Mid-July, three people were killed in mob justice attacks in separate incidencts in Dunoon. Coded as three separate incidents.
14 July. A vigilante mob in Kinondo village, Kwale County lynched a police officer on suspicion of being a thief. Two others escaped.
Israeli settlers set 2 cars on fire on July 13 during a riot in Urif village.

PML-N activists and police forces clashed on July 13 as the plane carrying party leaders Nawaz and Maryam Sharif landed in the Lahore airport. The clashes occurred at unspecified places in Punjab Province. Police used teargas to disperse the crowds; the rioters pelted bricks and stones. 3 policemen were injured at Ravi toll plaza just outside of Lahore. 12 rioters were arrested.
On 13 July, a crowd of angry residents attacked and looted the house of an army officer. The army officer killed one of the rioters and was subsequently detained by security forces.
On 13 July, angry residents destroyed shacks belonging to community leaders and robbed them of their belongings in Siyahlala informal settlement, Khayelitsha.
On 13 July, the premier of the Western Cape was pelted with stones when attempting to address angry residents in Zwelihle.
13 July. Residents pelt police officers with stones while they were responding to a property dispute call in Rongo. One injury reported.
On July 13, rioters attacked Al Fatih coalition office in Missan province, southern Iraq, burning it.
On July 12, clashes occurred in al Huwayr area between rioters and security forces, injuring 7 people (among them an officer).
On July 12, local vigilantes attacked 2 addicts found consuming intoxicants before bringing them to the police in Sataur village (Hoshiarpur, Punjab).

On July 12, villagers in Bariatu village in Latehar district (Jharkhand) beat a Naxal to death when the latter demanded money as extortion. The villagers gathered and beaten a group of five Naxals after they had beaten a local for denying giving them money.

On July 12, in Thiruvananthapuram city (Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala), taxi drivers of two associations clashed with one another over a decision of the association to deny them their benefits. Police had to intervene, but did not use force. There were no reported injuries.
On July 12, a youth was found murdered by a group of persons on suspicion of being a vehicle lifter in Amritsar city (Amritsar, Punjab).

On 12 July, a Burundian man was assaulted to death and later his body set on fire in Ntcheu by angry mob who suspected him and other business persons of buying human body parts for cultism to acquire wealth in the area.
On 12 July, one person was burnt in a mob justice attack at Yomelela Street in Dunoon. Another 3 people were killed in similar circumstances mid-July in Dunoon.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On July 11, after the killing of civilians in Lubumbashi by unknown gunmen, youth came to the streets and attacked the police station. 2 policemen were taken hostages and one was burned alive. Hundreds of policemen from the National Legion for Intervention (LENI, an elite unit within the police) were deployed to Lubumbashi the following day.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 11 July, ZANU PF supporters travelling to a funeral in Chitungwiza, saw MDC Alliance posters. They rampaged through the neighbourhood, burning property, beating residents and threatening to kill people who vote for the opposition.
On 11 Jul, one youth was killed and another injured when soldiers fired on a group of youths throwing stones at their cavalcade as they passed through Trehgam (Kupwara, J&K).

On July 11, residents of Bhabat and Shivalik Vihar villages clashed over the laying of pipelines and connection of the sewage systems between their villages in Zirakpur city (SASN, Punjab). No serious injuries were mentioned.
On 11 July, angry residents destroyed shacks belonging to community leaders and robbed them of their belongings in Siyahlala informal settlement, Khayelitsha.

On 11 July 2018, four Chinese security guards at the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park (MCKIP) were injured after being attacked by a mob of more than 50 people in Gebeng town (Kuantan, Pahang) which was incited by a false allegation that a local lorry driver was beaten to death in the area on July 10.
On 11/7/2018, following an oil tanker collision with a bus that kills at least 13 in Sanandaj, rioters clashed with the police, destroying a police vehicle.

Rioters crowded the halls of the Lady Reading Hospital following a fatal suicide attack in Peshawar on the night of July 11. The rioters broke doors, glass, and medical equipment. The hospital director estimated at least 4 patients that died could have been saved in the absence of the rioters.

On July 11, 2018: A Holocaust memorial was vandalized in Thessaloniki, presumably by a nationalist group. Assailants sprayed blue paint and a symbol spelling out "Christ the Victor" on one of the monument's plaques, which according to a police source, was popular with Greek and Serb Orthodox extreme nationalists.
10 July. A man was killed by a mob after allegedly killing his mother in-law in Kebbi State. The incident occurred at Bangu village in Mahuta town of Fakai Local Government Area of Kebbi State.
Settlers from Har Bracha and Givat Ronen descended on Burin village on July 10, throwing stones at Palestinian locals. No injuries were reported.
On 10 Jul, a junior engineer was assaulted by a local mob when he was sent to investigate the electrocution of a resident who had been fixing an appliance at home in Bani tehsil (Kathua, J&K).
On July 10, unidentified men threw a petrol bomb at the office of the Meghalaya Public Service Commission in Shillong (Meghalaya).

On 10 July 2018, Pade Kyaw Village, Ann Township, Rakhine State, about 200 locals led by a monk abbot attacked two Chin nursery school teachers. The two women were pulled out of the house and beaten. One of them suffered an injury.

On 10 July, during LC1 elections, violence broke out in Kawempe village. Voters believed that a candidate had ferried extra supporters from other villages. They rioted and began beating up the electoral officials when they were rescued by police.
10 July. A group of Kisumu students burn their school to avoid taking an exam. 22 were arrested the following day.
Clashes broke out in Hebron following arrest raids carried out by Israeli forces on July 10. One Palestinian was shot and injured.
On 9/7/2018, rioters in Eker threw molotov cocktails at security forces.
On 9 Jul, stone throwing was recorded as security forces undertook a CASO in Hajan town (Bandipora, J&K).

They were interrupted by security personnel who entered the premises and forced the participants to leave. They seized their bags, mobile phones, laptops and other electronic items inside the house. Members of mass organisations (ormas) meanwhile vandalized the house. They subsequently collectively attacked and insulted the students, making racist comments. Police officers failed to protect the students from the mob attack. 7 Papuan students sustained injuries.

On June 16, a group of rioters pelted stones at a procession being carried out in Shajapur city (Shajapur, MP) and they torched vehicles and vandalised stores. The police lathicharged and lobbed tear gas shells to control the situation.

Over 13-15 June, riots reported between the Sidama and Wolaita groups in Hawassa town following the kidnapping and killing of two people and violence at a new year festival. Residences were burnt and ransacked. Total of 10 people killed from 13-15 June.

The leader of Masama hill in Mubavu area of Bweru commune in Ruyigi province tortured a woman by throwing boiling water at her and beating her with clubs in June 2018. The victim had been accused of witchcraft. The assailant disappeared to an unknown location in August 2018 in order to escape the police.

A police chase followed in the streets of Exarchia and 11 suspects, nine Greek and two foreign nationals, were arrested. One of the suspects was a 41-year-old Parliament employee and three were minors.

On June 14, in Ratlam (Ratlam, MP), villagers set the vehicle afire and pelted stones at other passenger vehicles moving on Ratlam-Raoti because they were angry over the death of two persons, including a four-year-old boy, in an accident with a bus.

Reported on Thursday, 14 June 2018: A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked an HDP campaign booth in Golcuk district of Kocaeli province. 5 HDP members were injured during the incident, several of whom required hospitalization for broken bones.

Reported on Thursday, 14 June 2018: A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked an HDP campaign booth in Hekimhan district of Malatya province. 7 HDP members were injured during the incident, some of whom required hospitalization.

On June 13, a clash occurred between the Parwanoo Cooperative Transport Society and the Canter Union in Parwanoo town (Solan, HP) after four the Canter Union's vehicles were damaged by the rival group resulting in the injuring of 7 people.

On June 13, a riot broke out in Hoshangabad town (Hoshangabad, MP) after a sand-land dumper ran over a farmer in the nearby Gujjarwada village. Rioters torched 24 dumpers and one man was found burnt to death the next day.
An mob lynched 2 Muslim men accused of stealing cattle in Bankatti, an area in Godda district, Jharkhand, on 13 May.
On June 13, a disabled youth was mistaken to be a child lifter and was attacked by locals of Aghanashini village (UK, Karnataka) before being rescued by police.

Over 13-15 June, riots reported between the Sidama and Wolaita groups in Hawassa town following the kidnapping and killing of two people and violence at a new year festival. Residences were burnt and ransacked. Total of 10 people killed from 13-15 June.
13 June. A vigilante mob beats a suspected thief in Lagos.
A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked the CHP's election coordination center in Konya city on Wednesday, 13 June 2018. 3 CHP members were injured during the incident.0
Two groups of Hindu attacked each other with sticks and punches in the Suhbatpur area of Jaffarabad District on June 13. 6 people were injured.

Rioters who supported a PTI candidate that did not receive a ticket for the upcoming election ransacked the office of another person who did receive a ticket and broke the windows of a nearby hall where a PTI meeting was in progress in Toba Tek Singh, as reported on June 12. A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked the HDP's campaign vehicle as well as the members of the party in Kadirli district of Osmaniye province on Tuesday, 12 June 2018. The members and the vehicle were later taken to a police station.

On June 11, a clash broke out between Congress and SAD workers in Bhai Rupa village (Bathinda, Punjab) when both factions resorted to stone pelting during elections to the agriculture cooperative society. 6 people were injured including members from both parties and a journalist.
A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked the HDP's election office in Marmaris district of Mugla province on Monday, 11 June 2018.

They did not enter the actual HAU offices and they were all detained. The embassy of the United States condemned the attack and a similar one at the HAU offices in Athens.
As reported on June 10, a group of people armed with makeshift weapons attacked the HDP election office in Yenisehir district of Mersin province.
BJYM activists clashed with locals in Ranchi city, Jharkhand, on 10 June, during a BJYM march to celebrate the BJP government. Police stopped the clash from escalating.

On June 10, two groups resorted to stone pelting over a property issue in Hanuman Ghat in Jaunpur district (Jaunpur, UP) during which at least 4 people were injured.

10 June. Youths and security forces attached to Presco Oil Plc. clashed after the youths attacked a police officer in Eku. The motive of the attack is not known, though likely related to area oil production.
A group of people armed with makeshift weapons attacked the HDP election office in Buca district of Izmir province on Saturday, 9 June 2018.
On June 9, a mob of villagers attacked and lynched two men suspected of child trafficking at Panjuri village (Karbi Anglong, Assam). Both men died on the way to the hospital.'

A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked the HDP's campaign vehicle and building in Konak district of Izmir province on Saturday, 9 June 2018.

A group of locals armed with makeshift weapons attacked the members of the HDP during their election campaign in Eryaman region of Ankara's Etimesgut district on Saturday, 9 June 2018. 3 HDP members were injured.
Rioters stoned vehicles in Birbhum district, West Bengal, on 9 June, following the death of 2 people who were stuck by a bus.

On June 9, in Ernakulam (Ernakulam, Kerala), workers of the CPM-led Student Federation of India (SFI) vandalized the Youth Congress Bhavan near St. Albert's college. Ten masked-men came into the office and attacked three youth congress workers and damaged chairs and flex boards kept inside.
A number of Palestinian youth were injured June 9 in clashes that erupted after Israeli forces raided Beit Ummar near Hebron. A number of Palestinians were injured.

On June 8, a clash occurred between two communal groups in Tughlaqabad village in Delhi-Tughlaqabad (South Delhi, NCT of Delhi) over a land dispute resulting in the death of a man who was attacked with sticks.

Minor clashes occurred throughout Lebanon on May 6 in the first parliamentary election in 9 years. Clashes broke out between Palestinian youth and Israeli forces in Wadi Kteila, near Hebron, on June 4.

On June 4, in Runija town of Sitamau tehsil (Mandsaur, MP), people started rioting, setting kiosks on fire, prompting police to use mild force to disperse the crowd. The violence broke out following rumors of cows' slaughter. The number of injuries was not reported.

On June 3, a confrontation occurred between farmers and milkmen in Deon village (Bathinda, Punjab) after a heated exchange over milk supply. A group of milkmen allegedly assaulted a farmer outside his house who had to be admitted to Bathinda civil hospital.

On June 3, a clash occurred between members of two political parties, CPI(M) and Trinamool Congress workers, in the Jamaldaha village area (Cooch Behar, WB) during which one CPI(M) supporter was killed and many people were injured. The CPI(M) alleged that it began when TMC workers tried to set the house of Islam on fire which was resisted by CPI(M) activists. This is denied by the TMC.
A number of Palestinian youth were injured, early Sunday, June 3, in clashes that erupted after Israeli forces raided Beit Rima village northeast of Ramallah in the West Bank.
Palestinians clashed with Israeli forces in Shufat refugee camp on June 3. No injuries were reported.

On 2 June, MDCT supporters clashed in St Marys, when one faction disrupted the Alliance primary elections.
On 2 June, MDCT supporters clashed with MDCT supporters during the Alliance primary elections in Dangamvura. A former MP was injured in the clashes.

Arson attacks and crude bomb attacks were reported in Shillong city, Meghalaya, on 2 June. The attacks are related to ongoing violence in the city which started with a clash between bus drivers and residents in an area of Shillong city.
On June 2, farmers forcibly closed shops at the vegetable market in Patiala town (Patiala, Punjab) as a part of their nationwide protest for fair compensation for their produce.
Non-tribal villagers were assaulted by an unidentified group at Nongjiri, a village in South West Khasi Hills district, Meghalaya, on 2 June. The attacks is related to ongoing violence in the state.

On May 31, youths threw stones and molotov cocktails against security forces in a popular neighborhood in downtown Tunis, 13 were arrested.

Arrests: On May 31, 3 Ugandan soldiers crossed into DRC through Tako village, in Beni. They were chased by civilians, who captured 1 of them and handed him to the Kasindi rural commune.

On May 31, officials of the district town planner's enforcement team were attacked by locals with stones when they were carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Bhondsi (Gurgaon, Haryana). No one was injured.
On May 31, a group of rioters entered a mosque in Karnal city (Karnal, Haryana) and vandalized the mosque, breaking speakers and attacking those offering Namaz. No injuries reported.
A number of Palestinians were lightly injured during clashes with Israeli forces on May 31 in Kafr Dan. Israeli forces fired tear gas.
Israeli settlers assaulted two farmers as they were trying to reach their land in Al Khadir on May 30. No major injuries reported.
Around the 27 May - 2 June week, three people were lynched in Gasorwe commune. Another 3 were lynched on 31 May in Masasi locality of Gasorwe.
On 30 May, an angry mob in the commercial city of Blantyre has demolished eight houses belonging to murder suspects.

During the week of 30 May, a Christian group held a meeting at Kigobero Grounds, in Iganga town. Muslims and Christians at the meeting clashed when Muslims accused the Christian pastors of demoralising Islam. The police intervened to break up the riots.
On 29 May (date is uncertain), Military Forces of South Sudan clashed with residents during the disarmament process in East Tonj county, Warrap. Three soldiers were killed and a resident was injured.
On May 29, Indwar Village in Manpur Tehsil (Umaria, MP), two communal groups fought with each other over who will take water first. Three people were injured.

On 29 May, residents of Mukiga sub-locality in Bumba locality killed a man that was caught burgling from a household. This incident came after recent remarks made by the governor of Cankuzo province and the deputy commissioner of the judicial police who said that it is normal for the population to kill a thief caught in an obvious offence.
Railway passengers rioted at a station in Manpur town, Gaya, Bihar, on 29 May, against the extended stoppage of a train.
Assumed on May 28, near Bhopal (Bhopal, MP), two communal groups fought with each other over who will take water first. Number of deaths/injuries was not reported.
On May 28, a poll-related clash occurred between supporters of RLD and BJP in Bhura village (Muzzaffarnagar, UP) after which two persons were taken into custody.

notes: On 28 May, 5 MDCAlliance youths threw stones at 2 ZANU PF youths, who were walking to a party rally.

They were upset that raided homes and that the power utility never listened to their complaints. Police later rescued the hostages.

On May 28, 2018 a local healthcare facility in Suhodoll, Kosovo, was pelted with stones in an alledged attempt by Albanians to prevent Serbs to access to healthcare, according to the facility's director and Serbian media.

On May 27, near Porbandar (Porbandar, Gujarat), rioting members of two communities clashed following an alleged incident of harassment. Police intervened with teargas and two policemen and some locals were injured.

3 INC workers were beaten by rioters in Bollongitok, an area in Meghalaya state, on 27 May.
On 27 May, several people, mostly dressed in EFF T-shirts and berets, picked up stones and threw them at each other in Pretoria. The dispute was over leadership contentions in the province.
A vineyard in Meshek Achiya near Shiloh settlement was reportedly set on fire by Palestinians on May 27 in an exchange of arson attacks between settlers and local Palestinians.

Between 27-28 May 2018, near Thenmala in Pathanapuram tehsil (Kollam, Kerala), in a case of honour killing, a mob of 14 people abducted a man. The man was killed by drowning and his body was found near a canal near Thenmala. [size=14]

On May 26, in Bhubaneswar (Khordha, Odisha), two persons threw crude bombs at BJP party office less than an hour after PM Narendra Modi's rally in Cuttack to mark the fourth anniversary of NDA government. No one was injured in the incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 26, a clash broke out between miners and security forces in Banalia. The artisanal miners were informed that they had to pay an institutional tax in order to exploit the resources and were obliged by the forces to do so, which they refused. What ensued was a coleric mob trying to break through the police barrier that prevented the access to the mines. One miner was injured.
On May 26, 4 prisoners were killed and 45 others were injured in a prison riot in Zerka prison in central Dahuk, also three halls inside the prison were burned down in the riots.
26 May. More than 350 traders in Watamu burnt down three villas worth millions of shillings in retaliation to demolition of their kiosks.

On May 26 2018, Kurds and Arab asylum seekers at the Moria registration centre on Lesvos continued their violent fights which led authorities to move about 120 Kurdish refugees, mainly families with children, to the PIKPA camp, while more than 300 migrants left Moria to move to Mytilene town. In the following days another 900 left the migrant camp and refused to return fearing for their safety. Of those 450 moved to PIKPA and another 250 to the UN-run camp in Skala Sykamnias. Hundreds more are camping in local squares and parks.

On 25 May, police clashed with residents in Arbaminch town in Southern Ethiopia as authorities demolished thousands of houses that they said were illegaly built. Over 20 people were reported injured. On the same day police shot and killed a man in Burie who intervened to stop a staff member breaking down houses. 4,000 people reportedly detained.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.

notes: Clashes broke out between rioters and police/CRPF forces in the Nowhatta area of Srinagar City after Friday prayers on May 25. Hundreds of youth pelted stones; police used teargas and pellet guns. Two dozen to 100 people were injured, including dozens of policemen and 2 photojournalists.

Police officers were attacked by locals in Rahat on May 25. The police were pursuing a man who had been driving without a license when they were attacked by residents of the Bedouin township. Police used a taser to quell the riot and two attackers were arrested. The officers are in the hospital with fractures in various parts of their bodies.

notes: On May 25 2018, late at night a group of anarchists showered a riot police unit in Exarchia with Molotov cocktails cocktails and rocks. The ensuing clashes lasted for about two hours and the area remained closed.

On May 25 2018, violent fights between Kurds and Arab asylum seekers at the Moria registration centre on Lesvos resulted in six people getting injured. Rescue units provided first aid to some of the migrants, while others were transferred to Mytilene Hospital. Migrants themselves were also transferring the injured to the hospital in private cars. Riot police arrived later and restored order in the camp, but tension continued for hours.
24 May. Gunfire in Kano Court as police confronted angry supporters of several PDP politicians accused on money laundering. Several injuries reported.

On May 24, in Jaipur (Jaipur, Rajasthan), clashes between two groups of youths over a religious dispute turned against police as they tried to quell the clashes. The number of injuries was not reported.

On May 24, clashes took place between students and taxi moto drivers in Malemba. The clashes started because a student who was on a taxi moto started an argument with the driver. The argument quickly turned violent, with students and other drivers joining the conflict, both sides pelting stones, and leading to injuries on both sides. During the clash, 4 houses were ransacked. Police intervened to disperse the parties.
On 24 May, angry commercial motocyclists clashed with police in a stone throwing battle, as one of their collegues was killed by police earlier this months. Three wounded.

An Israeli soldier was critically injured and later succumbed to wounds sustained during clashes in Al Amari refugee camp, south of Ramallah, on May 24. The soldier was hit by a stone block thrown at him.
Clashes were reported in Azun town near Qalqilya between Palestinian youth and Israeli forces on May 24. A number of locals suffered from tear gas inhalation.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces

The RSF killed three and injured 12 displaced people during the two shootings on 22-23 May.

On May 23, a clash occurred between villagers and a group of unidentified persons armed with sticks in Sabapur village (Yamunanagar, Haryana) over plying of heavy vehicles, resulting in the injuring of 4 people.

A Palestinian was injured on May 23 during clashes that broke out between Palestinian locals and Israeli forces during a raid in Nablus' old town.

On May 22, in Payyannur (Kannur, AP), CPI(M) and the BJP engaged in clashes, injuring two people. As part of the clashes, a crude bomb was hurled at a BJP office there, but there were no injuries from the bomb being thrown.

On 19 May 2018, the Ahmadiyya religious minority was targeted in attacks against their community in Gereneng village, East Sakra, East Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara, by those from their same and neighbouring villages. Dozens of people destroyed altogether 8 houses, 4 motorcycles, a local store and household equipment. They took people's jewelry and money, with the primary victims of the attacks being women and children. Later that day 30 more people arrived to destroy more property with bricks and stones but were stopped by police and military personnel. 23 members of the Ahmadiyya community were then evacuated by police to another town. [size=dozens]

Two student groups clashed outside of their school in Narela (New Delhi) on May 10. Some students sustained stab wounds, no fatalities reported.

On May 10, in Mangaluru (Dakshina Kannada, AP), Congress and BJP activists clashed at B.C. Road after the election campaigning came to an end. There were no reported injuries.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.

On 9 May, residents at Bolero in Rumphi damaged shops and property owned by foreign nationals after a Rwandan shop owner strangled his watchman to death. Police rushed to the scene to control the riots and during their operation nine police officers sustained various injuries.
On 9 May, municipal workers blockaded roads in the Ladysmith CBD and allegedly assaulted a municipal official after embarking on a wildcat strike.
Stone-pelting rioters targeted a train and the signaling system between Bijbehara and Panzgam stations in Anantnag District on May 9. 1 boy was injured and the train services were suspended.

On May 9, in Nandavara village in Bantwal taluka (Dakshina Kannada, Karnataka), two groups of BJP and Congress workers clashed during an attempted campaign session by BJP. Police arrested four people.

On May 9, in Kebayoran (South Jakarta, Jakarta), there was a clash between Jakarta Military Command (Kodam) personnel who were forcefully trying to evict residents of the Tanah Kusir housing complex. Residents threw rocks at KODAM and burnt tires to try to block them.
A border officer was injured by a rock thrown at her during a riot in Abu Dis on May 9.
Two Palestinians were arrested outside Beitunia on May 9 for throwing stones at Israeli forces.
Rioters and police forces clashed on May 9 in Kazerun, Fars Province when some rioters tried to break into the place where 15 of the arrested rioters were arrested. Police shot at them.

On 8 May, police in Karonga district rescued a man when a mob wanted to kill him on witchcraft suspicion.
In an incident of Panchayat election violence, 3 TMC workers were injured in a clash between TMC and BJP activists in Gosaba village, West Bengal, on 8 May.

A district judge visiting with her family from Bengaluru was attacked by stone-pelters in the Narbal area of Budgam District on May 7 (coded as a separate event) and May 8. No reported injuries.

Reports of clashes between rioters (assumed) and security forces (assumed police) in which the rioters were injured with pellet firing, some time between May 6 and 10 in Sumbal town, Sonawari tehsil, Bandipora district. 1 man was critically injured in the eye.

Students from Birla nad LBS hostels clashed on Banadas Hindu University campus in Varanasi (Uttar Pradesh) on May 8, hurling petrol bombs and setting many two-wheelers on fire. On April 17, an unidentified group attacked the residence of a journalist in Shillong city, Meghalaya. No casualties reported.

Residents of the area surrounding Argash Mountain (closest city: Varzaneh) in Isfahan Province rioted on the evening of Apr 17 and destroyed a pumping system that diverted water to other areas instead of to nearby farmland. Water shortages have led to the targeting of water redistribution systems by farmers.

The civilians of Kafrsajna expelled HTS from the village after its raid on the village in Idleb countryside where HTS arrested 1 civilian and shot another civilian, which led to his injury. No fatalities were reported.
On 16 April, angry residents of Caldwell Township in Montserrado county mob to death a notorious armed robber.
On 16 April, students from the University of Ghana and Nkrumah University clashed in Accra. The reasons are unknown. One student wounded.
A clash broke out April 16 in Beirut's Caracas area between supporters of al-Mustaqbal Movement (Freedom Movement) and others loyal to rival Beirut parliamentary candidate Nabil Bader.

A group clash erupted in Kharinda village (Kurukshetra, Haryana) on April 16 over possession of a burial ground at the village. One person was killed and others injured.

On April 16, in Kasaragod (Kasaragod, Kerala), stones were pelted at buses and 10 persons were taken into custody. On April 16, in Balaramapuram (Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala), people vandalized three auto rickshaws during a hartal called by a social media collective to demonstrate against the rape and killing of an eight-year-old girl in Jammu and Kashmir. Police arrested the agitators.

On April 16, in Ambawadi in Ahmedabad (Ahmedabad, Gujarat), an altercation between local residents and a group of students snowballed into arson and stone-pelting. The clash was sparked by the alleged molestation of a local girl. Rioters torched about 15 motorcycles and police lobbed 20 teargas shells to disperse the crowd after heavy stone-pelting was witnessed.

On April 16, at Dhaka University in Kotwali in Dhaka city (Dhaka), there were riots and six leaders and activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League were injured in a clash on the Dhaka University campus over their upcoming national council.
16 April. A mob attacked and killed two suspected cultists and robbers in Abbi and Adani in Uzo-Uwani.
On 16 April, protesting students clashed with the police at Makerere University. The police arrested 6 students.
16 April. A mob attacked and killed two suspected cultists and robbers in Abbi and Adani in Uzo-Uwani.

On April 15, near Rajkot (Gujarat), laborers at Alang ship breaking yard went on a rampage, vandalizing office of plot number-2 after a laborer died in an accident. The laborers went on a flash strike and started vandalizing the office.
15 April. A vigilante mob beat a police officer into a coma after it was learned the officer shot a man. The events leading to the first shooting are not clear.
Settlers near Itamar on April 14 threw stones at Israeli soldiers. Soldiers used tear gas to disperse the settlers.

On April 14, in Quepem (South Goa, Goa), a 200-person mob went on a rampage, breaking tables and setting ablaze three scrap transformers of the electricity department because they were angry over a total blackout in the town and surrounding areas for 24 hours.
On April 14, Punjab Shiv Sena leader Rajesh Patla was attacked by a group of unidentified rioters. The rioters also pelted stones on the police in Phagwara town (Punjab).
On April 13, a number of Palestinians were injured during clashes outside Madama village near Nablus. Clashes began when residents tried to remove an Israeli roadblock at the entrance of the village.

BJP District President Udhampur and his associates turned violent during a news debate on Apr 13 in Udhampur City and beat up an activist for his support for punishing those involved in the Asifa rape-and-murder case.
13 April. A suspected thief was beaten to death by a mob after a failed attempt to flee with a stolen motorcycle in Akuru, Oluyole LGA. The victim was caught by some commercial motorcyclists.
On April 13th, at least 12 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli forces at the entrance to al Bireh.
On April 13th, seven Palestinians including a paramedic were injured in clashes with Israeli forces in Abu Dis.
On 13 April, violentclashes erupted between police and taxi drivers in Mthatha. No casualties were reported.

On 13 April 2018, close to the Parliament building in Kiev, about 36 people wearing patches on their clothing of C14 (Sich) and Right Sector, splashed red paint on the monument to Nikolai Vatutin, a Soviet Army general killed during WW II. They also engaged in scuffles with Soviet army veterans and supporters of an opposition party who attempted to lay flowers at the monument. Police moved in to end the brawl, detaining one person.

The villagers also burned the commisary building and recovered the body of their dead companion.

6 people, including 3 police officers, were injured when a mob clashed with police in Silchar town, Assam, on 12 April. The mob assembled due to communal tension in the area.
Reports of clashes on Apr 12 between rioters and government forces (assumed police) in the Drugmulla (Kupwara tehsil) and Bumhama areas of Kupwara District. No information on casualties.

On 12 April, a petrol bomb was thrown and numerous vehicles damaged during a political meeting in Port Elizabeth when residents disrupted the meeting.
08-14 April. Vigilantes "last week" (source dated 16 April) attacked and nearly killed a suspected domestic abuser in Akala, Lagos State.
During the week of 11 April, residents of Mukoko village attacked and killed a man who was suspected of attacking and robbing people.
CPN(M) activists vandalized a statue in Likhu Tamakoshi Rural Municipality-4 in Ramechhap district on 11 April.
Two Palestinians were injured in clashes east of Gaza city with Israeli forces on April 11.
Israeli forces on April 11th raided Sebastia to provide protection for settlers triggering clashes with residents.

On 10 April, the body of a 70 year old was found in a bush at Village 5 in Gihanga Commune in Bubanza Province. They were reportedly killed because of accusations of witchcraft. The victim received several blows from their attackers before being strangled.
10 April. Residents of Nyalenda lynch a man they suspect of murder.
10 April. Scores injured when supporters of Kitui Governor Charity Ngilu (NARC) and those of Mwingi Central MP Gideon Mulyungi (WDM) clash in Mwingi town. One arrest reported.

Union Minister Upendra Kushwaha from the Rashtriya Lok Samta Party was attacked en route to PM Modi's function at Motihari in East Champaran, Bihar on April 10. He was detained and assualted near Hajipur.

Opponents of the Bharat Bandh called by groups opposed to caste-based reservations, attacked and injured a reporter in Muzaffarpur city, Bihar, on 10 April. The reporter was admitted to a hospital in a serious condition.

Two Palestinians were shot and injured in clashes with Israeli forces to the east of Khan Yonis on April 8.
Haredi youth gathered outside a bookstore in Mea Shearim on April 8 yelling at a Haredi soldier in the bookstore and then threw garbage at him. The police were called to escort the soldier out.

In an incident of pre-panchayat election violence, BJP activists attacked the house of a TMC leader in Kaliaganj city, West Bengal, on 7 April.

Clashes erupted in the village of Mazraa al-Gharbiya north of Ramallah in the central West Bank.

Riots were reported in Halhul between Palestinians and Israeli military forces after Israeli forces raided a local house.

On 5 Feb, unidentified assailants set ablaze the gate of a place of worship at Kasganj town (UP). The town recently saw communal violence.

On February 5th, mob justice was exerted on a man who was trying to rob a bodaboda motocycle. The same man is believed to have murdered a police officer last year in Mbarara. Residents of Keihangara Sub County in Ibanda district beat the man to death after he was found with an AK-47, despite having no rounds.

BJP workers attacked and vandalized Qila police station in Bareilly city (UP) on February 3 after the police refused to release an arrested BJP worker.

An IDF soldier was lightly injured on Sunday evening when rocks were thrown at a bus that was traveling from Meitar to Be'er Sheva in southern Israel. Arabs attacked a bus belonging to the Dan company as it travelled on Highway 60, near Abu Kaf.

The Ashanti Regional Security Council (REGSEC), has deployed a combined team of the police and military to restore order at Ahwiaa near Kumasi. This is to stem the destruction of property, following violent clash between some youth groups in the area on Saturday morning.

Israeli settlers attacked on Saturday Palestinian farmers in the town of Beit Ummar, north of Hebron in the occupied West Bank. Rioters clashed with police in Kolkata on 3 February 2018 following the death of 2 pedestrians who were struck by a bus.

On February 3, in Johar Baru, two students died from multiple stab wounds after reportedly getting involved in a brawl. The students allegedly attacked a rival group over turf in Johar Baru, Central Jakarta.

A Palestinian man was shot dead in clashes with the Israeli army on Saturday during a raid in the occupied West Bank. The man was shot in the head after fighting broke out during an Israeli army incursion into the village of Burqin in the northern West Bank. 4 others were injured.

Believing them Fulanis, a vigilante group attacks passengers at a bus depot, setting them alight. Causalities/injuries not known. Police had instituted a curfew due to the threat of Fulani violence before the incident.

Many Palestinians Wednesday suffocated from tear gas during overnight clashes with Israeli forces in Deir Nitham village.

Port Elizabeth police arrested three people for armed robbery and saved their lives from a vigilante community mob in Motherwell. 150 people were assaulting the suspects who they alleged were street robbers in the area.

On January 30, in Chennai, students of two city colleges clashed on a moving train. One group chased the other with long knives on the platform of the Pattaravakkam station.
On January 30, rioters damaged the boundary wall of a religious place in Amapur area and a cosmetic shop was torched on the Mall Godam Road, both in Kasanganj (UP).

Vigilantes attack and kill a suspected thief in Ughelli.
