Israeli soldiers Wednesday shot a Palestinian teen during clashes at the entrance to a village north of Nablus. Israeli soldiers shot 16-year-old Muhyi al-Din Salah in his neck during clashesat the entrance to Burqa village.

On January 24, groups of sword-wielding men vandalized two malls, PVS Mall and Shopprix Mall, which were to hold advance screenings of the movie Padmaavat in Meerut. The men pelted stones at the mall buildings here despite heavy police force.
Clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Bab al-Zawyeh area, in central Hebron, and in the town of Sair to the north.

The students of the Pouytenga County High School kidnapped their headmaster. They demanded teachers of Physics and Chemistry (CP) who are lacking since the beginning of the school year. On the sidelines of protests over the crisis in the education system, LDP students raised their voice at the lack of PC teachers in their school. They locked up the headmaster in his office, for three hours, to solve the problem of the lack of teachers of PC which they thought was too long.
A woman living in the village of Nanzembe, escaped the popular rally organized by local youth. She is suspected of witchcraft according to a village source.

8 people were killed in community-based violence in Alindao. Originally, a supposed thief was lynched by locals. As retaliation, young people from the victim's community attacked people who were gathered around the City Hall.

On January 23rd, police arrested at least 80 students belonging to the Pukhtun and Baloch Council and Islami Jamiat Tulba (IJT) after the two sides engaged in minor clashes on Punjab University New Campus, Lahore. The day before, several students and police were injured in more intense clashes at the University.

When police came to arrest people from Kizina village, in Gihanga, the villagers surrounded the area and refused to allow the police in. Once the police had left, they attacked the people who they believed had informed the police, damaging their houses and beating them. The village is part of a land dispute.
Clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Bab al-Zawyeh area, in central Hebron, and in the town of Sair to the north.
Israeli forces detained two Palestinian minors during clashes with local Palestinians in Aida refugee camp in Bethlehem in the southern West Bank.
A section of labourers and workers associated with transportation of coal turned into a mob and attacked enforcement staff in Jogighopa on 22 January 2018 when they detained four trucks there.
Munsieville police came under attack from angry residents who torched vehicles and also tried to burn the police station. Police had to disperse the crowds with rubber bullets and teargas.

Some irate youth highly suspected to be members of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) in Wa have attacked the residence of the municipal chief executive, Issahaku Tahiru Moomin, over matters believed to be related to the polling station elections within the party. They reportedly attacked a second house belonging to Mr Moomen, but there the timely intervention of security personnel quelled further damage.

On January 22nd, young people in Mbandaka burned a civilian alive - mob justice. The victim had tried to dismantle a solar panel at the Basoko market when he was suprised by a group of young people. They then took him to the front of the Basoko police station, where they burned him alive.

Several dozen Israeli worshipers who visited an ancient tombs in Awarta, near Nablus, overnight between Saturday and Sunday, began throwing stones at Palestinian homes and vehicles nearby, causing property damage. Security forces intervened and stopped the attack. No people were hurt.
South African Police Service (SAPS) officers and paramedics have rescued two men after they were seriously assaulted and thrown into a deep water hole in an apparent mob justice in Polokwane.
On January 21, in Hathzari, two students were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League(BCL) at Chittagong University.

A group of prisoners and their guards clashed at the Office of the Governor. One prisoner was shot and wounded, three others escaped and the rest were successfully captured by police. The prisoners were in the office of the Governor where traditional elders and Islamic clerks were hearing their cases when arguments and misunderstandings occurred leading into a turmoil.
A number of Palestinians were injured early Sunday in clashes that erupted with the Israeli forces in Salah Eddin street in East Jerusalem.
Rioters attacked police in Kataragama on 20 January 2018 following the death of a motorcyclist in a police shooting. Police fired tear gas to disperse the mob.

Some youth of Hohoe and Buem clashed at the Nsuta Buem Catholic Secretariat over the creation of a proposed Oti Region out of the Volta Region. The youth from Hohoe who accompanied Togbe Gabusu VII, Paramount Chief of Gbi Traditional area to the public hearing on the creation of the new region stormed the event venue with placards some of which read "no racial tattoos", "Hohoedisintegrated" which angered the youth of Buem resulting in the clashes.

On January 20th, security forces launched a cordon and search of Redwani village, Kulgam tehsil and district, and clashed with locals. Residents allege police vandalised their homes and beat them, while police say they were attacked by rioters during the search.
Several Palestinians Saturday suffocated after inhaling tear gas fired at them by Israeli forces during clashes that erupted in the town of Jaba to the south of Jenin.
Rioters clashed with police to prevent autopsy of haredi male found dead in youth hostel.
On Jan. 20, 2018: Unknown individuals attacked the Embassy of Ukraine in Athens by throwing Molotov cocktails at the building. Allegedly, three cars near the embassy were also set on fire.

Serious rioting broke out after the lynchings took place in Chongoene on January 19th. Hoping to seize and kill the third victim, the mob marched to the police station and raided the police offices and the administrative post, ransacked residencies and burned 2 vechiles. 5 houses, 3 of them owned by the suspected thieves, were burned down. The Riot Intervention Police was forced to intervene.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Rioters clashed with police in Silgarhi on 19 January 2018 over the issue of the appointment of provincial capitals. 24 people were injured including a CPN-UML leader.

Aden police fired at a group of people in Al Maalla in Aden on January 19, injuring 3. It was reported that the security forces were trying to arrest two people who were fighting at that time. A crowd prevented police officers from arresting the individuals, after which the security force left the area and fired at the crowd from a distance of 40 meters. It was not mentioned what prompted the police to fire at the crowd.

assoc_actor_1: CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist); BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party
notes: 4 people were injured in clashes between CPI(M) and BJP workers in Kamalpur on 19 January 2018. Police fired tear gas to control the situation.
On Jan 19, local youth pelted stones at a police team cordoning off the area following a grenade attack on a police station in Pulwama City, capital of Pulwama tehsil and district.

On 19 January 2018, a mob attacked a man along the Lebuhraya Damansara Puchong highway near Petaling Jaya city (Petaling, Selangor) after the man was in an a car accident with a motorcycle. The man had to seek medical attention.
On Friday 19th, two out of three people perceived to be criminals were lynched in Chongoene administrative post by a mob who decided to take justice upon their hands.
At least two Palestinians were shot and injured with live bullets and others suffocated duringclashesthat erupted Friday in multiple locations alongGazaborders.
A Nepali Congress leader was injured while driving an ambulance in Morang on 18 January 2018 during clashes over the appointment of provincial capitals.
Residents of Madanchowk, Dhankuta clashed with police on 18 January 2018 over the issue of the appointments of provincial capitals.

actor1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: On 18 January, students clashed with police officers who used tear gas after the funeral of a student from their college in Dolisie. Several students were arrested.
1 person was injured in Chandrapur on 18 January 2018 when he was assaulted by CPI(M) workers.

actor2: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
notes: Assumed on Jan 18, local youths pelted stones at a patrolling party from 62 Rashtriya Rifles of Indian Army at Pinjora area of South Kashmir's Shopian district. The Army resorted to aerial firing.
Around 17 January, in Kasaragod, six persons were injured in a clash involving Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) and Communist Party of India (Marxist) [CPI(M)] activists.
A mob attacked a Chandigarh Police party and vandalised vehicles and a hotel in Sector 52 in which the police team had taken shelter on Jan 17, after the police team had arrested a local criminal.

Students of the University of Liberia barricaded their president, Dr. Ophelia Inez Weeks, in the auditorium of the Capitol Hill campus for nearly seven hours for ignoring their call to let the registration process continue.
On January 17, 2018 in Rijeka, Croatia, two fractions of workers' union representatives clashed over legitimacy of each fraction, to which the police intervened.
A mob lynched and burned three men in Siaya County on Tuesday on suspicion that they were part of a notorious gang in Siaya. The men were attacked at Malunga Village in West Gem.

On January 16, in Narayanganj, at least 50 people, including Narayanganj City Corporation (NCC) Mayor Dr Selina Hayat Ivy, were injured, five of them critically, when clashes took place between two rival groups-local lawmaker Shamim Osman backed hawkers and followers of the mayor-centering hawkers eviction at Chashara.
Police and vendors clashed in Harare in the early evening. Tear gas was used to break up the running battles.
Clashes erupted between BJP and Congress workers at Gauriganj (Amethi, UP) on Jan 16 during Congress president Rahul Gandhi's road show.
A Dalit family was assaulted by people from an upper caste at Meeva village (Meerut, UP) on Jan 16 over the issue of right of way on a narrow village road.
3 people were injured in a clash following a TMC attack on a BJYM cycle rally in Palashi, Nadia, on 16 January 2018. Police officers were manhandled while trying to separate the clashing groups.

On Jan 16, communal violence erupted between members of Christian and Hindu communities at Naushera city (capital of Naushera tehsil, Rajouri district, J&K) over the last rites of a woman who was married in an inter-faith marriage. Police resorted to fire teargas shells to disperse the mob. Around a dozen persons, including some policemen, were injured and several shops and vehicles were set ablaze.

A number of Palestinians were injured and suffered suffocation early Wednesday in clashes with Israeli forces as dozens of settlers tried to break into the Azzun town east of Qalqilya, in the West Bank.

A number of Palestinian citizens early Monday suffered suffocations due to inhaling tear gas fired at them by Israeli forces at the entrance of Al-Lubban al-Sharqiya village, near Nablus city in theWest Bank. after clasheserupted between the inhabitants of the village and the Israeli soldiers, who closed the main entrance leading to the village and forced Palestinian drivers to use other roads.
A Palestinian was shot dead duringclasheswith Israeli forces in Jayyous near Qalqilya, close to the separation fence betweenIsrael and the West Bank.

assoc_actor_1: SRKS: Shri Rajput Karni Sena; Rajput Caste Group (India)
notes: On January 15, in Jaora, Karni Sena (a fringe Rajput group) vandalized the campus of a private school in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam district when students were performing the Ghoomar song from the controversy-marred Padmaavat movie. Nearly a dozen activists allegedly threatened the school administration, created ruckus and vandalized property.
TMC activists clashed with BJP activists in Uluberia on 15 January 2018. Both sides threw bricks and petrol bombs at each other, and houses were set ablaze during the clash.
Clashes erupted between BJP and Congress workers at Salon (Raebareli, UP) on Jan 15 during a visit of Congress President Rahul Gandhi.
An angry mob vandalised a cancer hospital in Kolkata on 15 January 2018 following the death of a patient.

On Jan 15, security forces resorted to aerial firing after their vehicle was pelted with stones by a group of youth in southern Pulwama township (J&K) during a cordon and search operation in Batengoo area of Anantnag.
A number of Palestinians suffered on Monday from suffocation duringclashesthat broke out with Israeli forces in the town of Qabatiya, to the south of Jenin.

A Dalit youth was assaulted by of a right-wing Hindu group at Megha-Shikarpur village in west Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Jan 11 for leading a group of Dalits planning to convert to Buddhism and had removed portraits of Hindu deities from their homes.
A mob of people who burnt down four houses of villagers whom they accuse of practising witchcraft at Ntswaneng village outside Burgersfort in Limpopo.

Six members of Kwankwasiyya and Gandujiyya groups were injured in Gwale LGA, Kano following a clash between the two political groups. According to the witness, some members of the two groups were at the area to attend two separate weddings when the incident happened.
Israeli settlers attacked the village of Urif, to the south of Nablus, on Sunday resulting in clasheswith local villagers.
A man was burnt to death in Zoeknog Trust, Acornhoek, in an apparent mob justice attack.

Brong Ahafo Regional Youth Organiser of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) was assaulted at Atebubu where he was scheduled to meet with some executive members of the party. The controversial NPP executive member was pounced on by some angry members of his party over some unpalatable comments he made. After beating him, the angry party supporters vandalised his vehicle.

Vendors in Harare clashed with police officers who were attempting to remove them from the streets. The vendors chased after the police attempting to remove them from the street. 6 police officers were injured.
Three Muslim men accompanying a Hindu woman were assaulted by Vishwa Hindu Parishad workers in a lawyer's chamber at Baghpat (Uttar Pradesh) on Jan 13.

Two group of BJP supporters - one supporting MP Rekha Arun Verma and the other one MLA Shashank Trivedi - clashed with each other over a confrontation between two leaders over mismanagement during a blanket distribution programme in Sitapur's Maholi area (Uttar Pradesh) on Jan 13.
Settlerattackstook place in multiple regions of the occupiedWest Bank, including Hamra check-point. Nobody was injured in theattacks.
Settlers attacked two residents of Beit Daja after spraying pepper gas in their vehicle at Beit Furik checkpoint.
A group of settlers used stones toattackvehicles belonging to Palestinians in Nablus city's Havara check-point in West Bankon Friday.
In Hebron, three Palestinians were injured by live ammunition -- including one who is now in critical condition -- while another 22 suffered excessive teargas inhalation.

assoc_actor_2: BJYM: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha; BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party
notes: BJP and BJYM activists clashed with TMC activists in Kolkata on 12 January 2018 during the BJP and BJYM 'Protirodh Sankalp Abhiyan'.

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command
assoc_actor_2: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
notes: The Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command shut down proceedings at the University of South Africa's Sunnyside campus. ANC youth and EFF students allegedly clashed at the campus.

A Palestinian has been killed duringclasheswith Israeli soldiers after settlers attempted to enter a village in theWest Bank. The sixteen-year-old was shot in the head duringclasheswhen locals tried to prevent settlers from entering the village of Iraq Burin to the south of Nablus.

Borama local government, supported by SLP in Borama, conducted an operation to remove illegal structures using Borama municipality tractors in order to open the road in Borama. The illegal street vendors stoned the police. Two people were injured and three others were arrested.
Locals pelted stones at a police party at Sanghe village (Tarn Taran, Punjab) on Jan 11. The policemen had gone to help the panchayat secretary get installed a gate on a street in the village.

On Jan 11, locals pelted stones at security forces during a Cordoned and Search Operation (CASO) at Samboora area in south Kashmir's Pampore tehsil, Pulwama District. Security forces burst teargas shells.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2016-) Border Guard Force
assoc_actor_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2011-2016)

In Qalqilya, Israeli settlers attacked the residents of the town of Far'ata east of Qalqiliya on Thursday evening and clashed with residents as they resisted them and prevented them from attacking their property. Israeli soldiers fired sound bombs and tear gas at Palestinian civilians, wounding dozens.

assoc_actor_2: APRC: Alliance for Patriotic Re-orientation and Construction

Mob justice occurred at Chakuma Village in the area of Senior Chief Chikumbu in Mulanje.
A Jewish school was attacked by young rioters wearing hoods. A witness said the rapid intervention of the police managed to avoid deterioration of the situation. No injuries were reported.

At least five persons have been killed and property worth millions of naira destroyed by "rampaging youths" who are fighting over the leadership tussle in Uvwue Local Government Area of Delta State. Sources said the armed youths are at logger head with members of the Community Development Committee of Effurun. The violence may have occurred over several days as the source claims "two [were killed] on Wednesday."
Stone-throwing incidents were reported in the villages of Asira al-Qibliya, Jalud and Burin. Four Palestinians were lightly wounded by the rocks.
A physical altercation was reported between members of the government and opposition parties during a Parliamentary session in Colombo on 10 January 2017.

Following the release by QSD of over 400 former IS fighters to their villages of origin in northeast Syria, several areas of Deir-ez-Zor witnessed attacks by residents on the former IS members, with skirmishes taking place as residents sought retribution for crimes committed by these members and by IS in general and expressed concern that they would form new IS sleeper cells. No fatalities reported.

One man was shot dead at Saypur village (assumed under at Sar Mathura police station, Dholpur, Rajasthan) when a team of Uttar Pradesh Police opened fire at stone-pelting locals during a raid looking for cattle thieves on Jan 10.

Dozens of Israeli settlers destroyed Palestinian property in several villages in the northernWest Bankcity of Nablus, where settlers destroyed property belonging to residents of the village of Burin and Asira al-Qibliya.

Dozens of Israeli settlers destroyed Palestinian property in several villages in the northernWest Bankcity of Nablus, where settlers destroyed property belonging to residents of the village of Burin and Asira al-Qibliya.
Hundreds of settlers gathered at the Huwwara junction, rioting and shouting racist slogans against Palestinians and Arabs.

source: Jordan News Agency (Petra); Ma'an News Agency

Israeli soldiers fired live rounds, rubber coated bullets as well as tear gas canisters. Two Palestinian youths were injured with live ammunition as Israeli forces conducted predawn detention raids in several districts across the West Bank.
Settlers broke the cars of Palestinian citizens at Shilo Elyah settlement junction and at Yitzhar and Hawara checkpoints.
Two molotov cocktails were throwns at the entrance of two Talmudic schools in Houmt Souk on Djerba. Interiors were not damaged.

On Jan 9, massive clashes between locals and security forces were reported from Kokernag tehsil, Anantnag district, J&K, where demonstrators tried to break the security cordon and march towards an encounter site between militants and security forces.

Two Palestinians were shot and injured with live ammunition by Israeli forces duringclashesin the occupiedWest Bankand besiegedGazaStrip. In the southernWest Bankdistrict of Bethlehem, a young Palestinian man was shot in the leg by Israeli forces duringclashesthat erupted in the town of Tuqu, during which forces fired tear gas, soundbombs,and rubber-coated steel bullets at Palestinians.
Clashes erupted in the village of Tal near Nablus between youth and Israeli Security Forces on January 9.

assoc_actor_2: APRC: Alliance for Patriotic Re-orientation and Construction
notes: Three supporters of the opposition Alliance for Patriotic Reorientation and Construction (APRC) have sustained injuries as their convoy coming from Basse heading to Jarra Soma was attacked at Mankamankunda, the home village of President Adama Barrow.
On January 8, in Mymensingh, activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League, Bangladesh Agricultural University unit, drove out a student from Begum Rokeya Hall for her refusal to take part in procession.

On January 8, in Usmani Nagar, at least 25 people were reportedly injured during a clash between two factions of Awami League. The clash originated after Manjur and Hannan, two AL leaders belonging to rival camps within the party, locked into an altercation and at one stage Hannan thrashed Manjur at Tazpur Degree College compound.

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), and Samajwadi Party workers clashed over the singing of the national song Vande Mataram during the first Board meeting in Meerut City (UP) on Jan 8.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On Jan 8, locals pelted stones at a joint team of army, SOG and CRPF forces at Chadoora area in central Kashmir's Chadoora tehsil, Budgam district during an encounter with militants. Police and security forces fired pellets and smoke shells to disperse the demonstrators, who pelted stones. Two persons sustained pellet injuries.

On Jan 8, clashes erupted after rumors spread in the town that a couple of militants are trapped in Tahab village of Pulwama tehsil and district. Youth pelted stones at a police station and security forces lobbed tear smoke shells.

After the Luwero town issued a notice for the relocation of Binyonyi farmers market from Luwero-Kiwoto to Kiyenje, traders did not comply. They set up their market on January 8th, and reportedly pelted the police with stones, In retaliation, the police dispersed them by resorting to tear gas. 3 traders were arrested for inciting violence.

Three Palestinians were injured early Monday, one critically, afterviolent confrontations erupted with Israeli soldiers, who stormed al-Mazra'a al-Ghrabiyya village close to theWest Bankcity of Ramallah.
Clashes erupted in Al-Ram villages between Israeli Security Forces and Palestinian Youth when the latter started to throw rocks, on January 9.
An Israeli soldier was lightly wounded after a group of ultra-Orthodox men allegedly threw rocks and garbage at his car in the central Israeli city of Beit Shemesh, causing him to crash.

Uneasy calm is slowly returning to St Mary's Mission Hospital in Gilgil, Nakuru County, after days of tension and violent confrontations due to a property ownership battle. The confrontations saw a vehicle torched and operations paralysed at the institution
A Palestinian man was injured after being shot with a rubber-coated bullet during clasheswith the Israeli forces near the Birzeit University in northern Ramallah on Sunday.

Family and friends of an inmate who was reportedly tortured to death clashed with police forces outside the police station in Muqattam. Rioters threw stones at police forces and vehicles. Police responded violently which led to 20 arrests and nine others injured.
Angry boda boda riders in Malindi on Saturday burnt down a Simba Coach bus after it hit and killed one of them along the Mombasa-Malindi highway
A person accused of witchcraft was tortured and died on the PK3 PDI site.

source: PalestineNews & Information Agency (WAFA); Middle East Monitor
notes: A young Palestinian was wounded during violent clashes in Qaddura camp after a group of young men confronted the Israeli troops in response to the raids.
On January 5, in Comilla, a clash between two groups of BCL activists broke out around 2 am over establishing supremacy on the Comilla Medical College campus. There were multiple injuries.
A man suspected to have raped a nine-year-old girl in Tafelsig, Mitchells Plain, was beaten by residents but survived.
Violent clashes broke out in Beit Furik, in eastern Nablus, between the Israelis and Palestinian youths after the town was hit by reinforcements for the security forces.

Violence erupted between two groups over a property dispute at Bargarchomukh village, Howrah district, West Benagl on Jan 5. The intervening police team from Shyampur police station was also attacked by the mob, leaving two policemen injured.

Around 200 workers of the of EC Tools and Blades Pvt Ltd factory in Dera Bassi, Punjab vandalised the security guard office on Jan 4 following an incident were a security guard had slapped a worker. Labourers also pelted stones at the police and vandalised one of the police vehicles.

On Jan 5, clashes erupted after government forces launched a cordon and search operation in Check Mohalla Karimabad village in Pulwama tehsil and district of South Kashmir. Locals pelted stones and forces lobbed tear gas shells.
Clashes broke out in Sabzeh Ghaba neighborhood of Dezful between rioters and police
In Ahwaz, rioters in the Shadegan region confronted the attacks of anti-riot guards by throwing stones.
Palestinian youths reportedly threw Molotov cocktails at an Israeli settler bus near the al-Fuwwar refugee camp in the southern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Hebron late Thursday night.

On January 4, in Hathazari, at least two student were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), Chittagong University unit at a programmed marking its 70th founding anniversary on the campus.
A 32-year-old man was lynched by a mob after he killed his girlfriend following a domestic dispute in Kirindinyi Village, Voi in Taita Taveta County.
On January 4, in Dindoli locality of Surat city, unidentified persons pelted stones at a city bus near Udhna Bridge at around 4pm. The front glass of the bus was damaged but no one was injured.
Locals resorted to rioting at Baansdih Road police station area in Ballia on Jan 4, following the death of a minor boy in an accident. The police intervened.

On January 4, in Banda, Indonesian security forces have retaken control of a prison in the country's west following a riot that began when three inmates refused to be transferred to another prison. Angered inmates torched the Banda Aceh prison.
A quarrel reportedly broke out between political detainees and criminal inmates in Kerdasa police station in Giza which led to at least one dead and several injured.

A Palestinian youth was critically injured after being shot in the head by Israeli forces during clashes that erupted following the funeral of Palestinian teenager Musaab Firas al-Tamimi, 16, in the Deir Nitham village, northwest of Ramallah.

source: Anadolu Agency (AA); Ma'an News Agency; The Times of Israel
notes: At least 10 Palestinians were injured and hospitalized on Thursday inclasheswith Israeli army troops in the southernWest Bank. The clashes erupted at the Dheisheh refugee camp near Bethlehem after it was stormed by an Israeli military force. 2 were critically injured.
A suspected criminal was lynchd to death by a mob in an unknown location in Madagascar.

source: Agence France Presse; Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: Israeli troops shot dead a Palestinian teenager suspected of having a gun in clashes on Wednesday in Deir Nizam. Clashes intensified following the death of the teenager.

Rioting between two families erupted at the Indira Colony locality of Rohtak town, Haryana on Dec 3 night, leaving one infant dead and several persons injured. Stones, bricks and even firearms were used in the clash.

On January 3, in Kolhapur, police resorted to teargas near Chhatrapati Pramila Raje (CPR) hospital in Town Hall area and disperse the violent Hindutvawadi mob, staying in the area near Siddharth Nagar, which was trying to enter in the Dalit vasahat in Maharashtra.

"Youths" or "hoodlums" from Foko and Itamaya areas of Ibadan clash over two days in the Oke Ado area of the city. A high value of property was reported destroyed. The reasons leading to the clash are not known. Police made 14 arrests.

A traditional leader, Abang Ashu, was hanged by the people, following suspicions that he was providing information to the military about the positions and activities of English-speaking secessionists.
The residents of Karambo beat a man to death. They accused him of stealing. The police have taken no action against the vigilantes.
A number of Israeli settlers, early Thursday, targeted a Palestinian vehicle on the road between the villages of Asira al-Qibliya and Areef, near the West Bank city of Nablus.
On January 2, in Tejgaon, at least 13 students received bullet injuries in a clash with police at Tejgaon Polytechnic Institute in the city. The reason for the clash is unknown.
Police baton charged rioters in Malda on 2 January 2018. Rioters attacked the police following the death of 2 people who were struck by a truck.

On Jan 2, locals pelted stones at army officers in Shahgund Hajin area of North Kashmir's Sonawari tehsil, Bandipora district after which army officers allegedly assaulted two teachers at a local tuition center.

A Palestinian Tuesday was injured by bullet shrapnel during clashes that broke out with Israeli soldiers in Salem village. Forces reportedly opened fire and used tear gas canisters against the village residents, causing several suffocation cases among them.

In the city of Takestan in northern Qazvin Province, the rioters raided the seminary center and the office of the Friday Prayer leader and Islamic advertising. They broke the buildings' windows, damaged public property and set fire to a car and three motorbikes.
Fighting erupted between security forces in Rabat and dozens of African migrants near the 'Gammera' station after that hundreds of Africans had been camping in the'Gammera' forest for months.

"Youths" or "hoodlums" from Foko and Itamaya areas of Ibadan clash over two days in the Oke Ado area of the city. A high value of property was reported destroyed. The reasons leading to the clash are not known. Police made 14 arrests.

One report says the IDPs beat and injured the RSF militiamen, arrested them and handed them over to the authorities; other report says RSF opened fire on people when an IDP confronted them after they raided the Komboi market, seriously injuring two.
Three farmers allegedly lynched a Dalit labourer on the suspicion of paddy theft in a village of Ratia sub-division of Fatehabad, Haryana on the intervening night of Jan 1 and Jan 2.

On January 1, near Muzhakkunnu, a car and a two-wheeler parked in the compound of the house of Congress activist Kunnummal Jibin at Thillankeri, under the Muzhakkunnu police station limits, were set afire by unidentified persons.

On January 1, in Koregaon Bhima, two groups clashed and pelted stones at each other over an altercation regarding the 200 years victory anniversary of a battle between Peshwas and Soldiers of East India Company consisting soldiers largely from Dalit community. One person, member of the Dalit community, died in the rioting.

On Jan 1, local youth pelted stones at security forces near Drangbal, Pampore tehsil, Pulwama district (J&K) following a battle between security forces and JeM militants at Lethipora that left 8 people dead.
On Jan 1, a youth was hit by bullets during clashes between local youth and security forces at Drobgam area of Pulwama tehsil and district (J&K) during the funeral of a slain JeM militant.
A policeman was victim of mob justice on January 1st, in the Makindye Division, in Kampala. The motive for the killing is alledgedly that the officer was involved in a motocycle robbery.

On 1 January 2018, a group of friends went to a military outpost in Kenyam district, Nduga Regency, Papua province, to purchase a motorcycle. A dispute escalated into a brawl when a Papuan tried to enter the military post and the members pushed him outside. He then reportedly picked up a machete and injured one military officer's hand. He was then beaten by other military officers and one released a shot and injured one of the friends. Six members dragged the Papuan in to further torture him. After severe beatings he was pronounced dead.

Israeli troops raided al-Khader Boys Secondary School and fired soundbombsand teargas canisters, coinciding with the second term finals, causing panic and fear among the students. As the students left the school,clasheserupted with the Israeli soldiers where students hurled stones and Israeli soldiers fired teargas and rubber-coated steel bullets.

Rioters in Shaihnshahr engaged in clashes with police forces. Three people were reportedly killed according to police reports.
Riots took place in Shahreza. Clashes between rioters and security forces were reported
Christians and Muslims clash at the New Year's carnival in Taiwo area of Ilorin. Several serious injuries reported. A number of arrests were made the following day.

Israeli forces shut down the northern entrance to the cities of Ramallah and al-Bireh on Sunday with cement cubes the northern entrance, which leads to Ramallah and al-Bireh, provoking clashes with teenagers.

Israeli forces shut down the northern entrance to the cities of Ramallah and al-Bireh on Sunday with cement cubes the northern entrance, which leads to Ramallah and al-Bireh, provoking clashes with teenagers.
On Sunday morning, a police car was burnt by rioters
On the fourth day of riots in Iran, police forces and rioters clashed around Ferdowsi square in Tehran
Social media reports show clashes between rioters and police in Hamadan. There are no reports of casualties on Sunday.

Rioters attacked a Bank Sepah branch in Nahavand and broke its glasses

Two Palestinians were arrested earlier this week, on suspicion they assaulted two haredi youths over the weekend. The incident occurred early Saturday morning as the two men made their way to the Shiloach Pool near the historic City of David in the Shiloach (Silwan) neighborhood of eastern Jerusalem. The two haredi men were accosted by a pair of local Arabs who blocked their path, shoved them, and began to curse them. The assailants then beat the two haredi men, before fleeing the scene.
In the Gohardasht neighbourhood of Karaj a motorcycle belonging to security forces was burnt
In Arak rioters attacked a police car and reportedly stormed the governor's compound. Around 100 rioters were arrested in Arak.
Riots took in one of Tehran's squares and some rioters were arrested
Rioters in Kermanshahd clashed with secuirty forces and some rioters were arrested.

During the raid, clashes erupted between local youth who threw stones and Israeli forces who fired tear gas into the town, causing several people to suffer from severe tear gas inhalation.

The hearing of a petition challenging the election of Homa Bay Governor Cyprian Awiti was adjourned for more than 30 minutes after supporters of two opposing groups clashed. Governor Awiti's supporters of and those of former Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga fought outside the Homa Bay High Court Tuesday morning.
There were running battles between the vendors and the police in Harare. A vendor was injured when a stone hit him.
A female train driver on the Durban/Stanger route was left traumatized on after commuters who were late for work reportedly threw stones at her when she refused to proceed past a red stop signal.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Mohamed Ali and Qasabka polling stations in Burao town whereby both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. Police fired warning shot in the air to disperse the crowds. The administration in Burao intervened and resumed the voting process at those polling stations after an hour. There were no reports of casualties.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Daamurka polling stations in Borama town after both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. SLP at the polling stations dispersed both groups and resumed normal functions at the polling station.
Settlers attacked farmers tending their land in Kufr Qalil village, to the south of Nablus near the checkpoint. Noinjurieswere reported.

source: PalestineNews & Information Agency (WAFA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: Israeli settlers Monday attacked Palestinian vehicles passing near Huwwara Israeli military checkpoint with stones, injuring two people.
3 students were injured during a clash between students of a Muslim school in Hemmathagama on 13 November 2017. Police intervention was required to control the situation.
A woman was injured in a stoning attack near the village of Deir Nizam, on November 13, 2017.
Wadani supporters assaulted an officer who was representing Kulmiye party at the polling station in Iskudar village (c. 56 km North of Oodweyne). Police intervened and dispersed the attackers.
Crowd burned a Presidential Guard's vehicle after the Guard shot accidentally a youngster following a dispute about a car accident.

At least one person was injured and multiple cars damaged Sunday night in a series of stone-throwingattacksby Palestinian residents on Israeli vehicles outside of the predominantly haredi city of Beitar Illit south of Jerusalem.
Battle Churchgoers clashed police and metro officers in Hillbrow because they towed away an illegally parked car, one cop badly hurt.
In Mitchells Plain, residents clashed with police after news spread that a teenage boy had raped a 6-year-old girl. They pelted police officers with rocks and burnt tyres on the road.
A number of Palestinian citizens were injured and suffered suffocation, early Sunday, duringclasheswith Israeli occupation forces in the Dheisheh refugee camp south of theWest Bank city of Bethlehem.
A man accused of stealing bananas in Kinyonga was beaten to death by members of the community.

On November 11, at least 20 people, including three policemen, were injured as a factional clash between two groups of Jubo League broke out during a rally marking the 45th founding anniversary of the pro-Awami League youth body in Hatia of Noakhali.

ClashesSaturday broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces in Bab al-Zawyeh area, in central Hebron city, in the southernWest Bank. Forces fired a barrage of stun grenades toward residents in the area, however, noinjurieswere reported.

On November 10, one person was killed when police opened fire to ward off a Muslim mob that turned violent and launched an arson attack on Hindu houses at Thakurpara village in Rangpur Sadar upazila. At least five more people were severely injured as police fired rounds of rubber bullets and tear gas shells at the angry crowd.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(MC): Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre); CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Two persons were injured in a clash that broke out between the cadres of Nepali Congress (NC) and left alliance (CPN-MC and CPN-UML) in Sotang of Solukhubmu on 11/10/2017.

On November 10th, locals clashed with security forces after the latter launched a cordon and search in the Hajan area of Bandipora. Security forces fired tear gas to disperse the rioters, who threw stones.
On November 10th, a police officer was injured when locals attacked the residence of a sitting MLA with stones in Shopian town.

source: Congress of South African Trade Unions (Johannesburg)
notes: The house of a NUM youth leader was burnt down by alleged Amcu members in Orange Farm.
A woman who stabbed her boyfriend to death after a dispute over a phone was lynched by a mob in Murang'a Thursday morning.

Armed supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at a roundabout near the local government in Burao. Police intervened and dispersed the supporters. There were no reports of casualties.
Students threw stones at buses in Silchar on 9 November 2017 following the student elections at a local university.

assoc_actor_1: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
notes: Armed supporters of UCID and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at Ahmed Dhagah district in Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and the two groups escaped from the area. There were no reports of arrests.
An individual who killed his mother with a knife resisted an arrest attempt by a policeman in Kairouan and heavily injured the policeman who had to be hospitalised.

The belief in vampires led to rioting in which the Cuamba district secretary of the Mozambique Youth Organisation (OJM), the youth wing of the ruling Frelimo Party, and a community leader in Mepica locality were accused of protecting the vampires. The police have arrested eight people for spreading rumours about vampires, which prevented the mob from lynching their two intended victims.

A number of Palestinians threw stones at a group of Israelis, after which the authorities responded by closing the Temple Mount to Muslims. The area was reopened to Muslims later that day, and was open for visitors and Muslim worshippers alike on Monday.
On 06-November-2017, in Hpakant, Kachin, a clash between prospective miners and police led to two deaths. 2 fatalities.

Violence broke out on Monday in the central Freetown between supporters of the opposition Sierra Leone Peoples Party (SLPP) and the ruling All Peoples Congress (APC) over a radio talk show. The fight started after opposition supporters claimed they were marginalized in the talk show at Sierra LeoneBroadcasting Corporation (SLBC).
The regional offices of the FFS in Ait Abdelmouemen were ravaged by unknown men.
A electoral candidate of the FFS was physically agressed in his home in Tizgirt by unknown men.
A dispute between two individuals resulted in a knife fight between two clans in Dar Chaabene Fehri, Nabeul. Two persons were injured.

A number of Palestinian youths on Sunday were suffocated after inhaling tear gas fired at them by Israeli occupation forces duringclasheserupted in Beit Ummar town, northern theWest Bankcity of Hebron.

On November 5th, security forces clashed with stone pelters after the latter came out to disrupt a cordon and search launched by forces in Manghama village of Pulwama district. Security forces fired tear gas in an attempt to disperse the rioters.
Unknown men ravaged the regional offices of the RND-party in Mekla.

Dozens of settlers attacked Palestinians picking olives in an Israeli military approved harvest near Hawara on Sunday morning. Theviolentconfrontation between the settlers of the nearby settlement of Yitzhar and the Palestinians who were joined by activists from the NGO Rabbis for Human Rights, was stopped byIsraelDefense Force troops.
After Okello Tango was hit in the head, police was forced to intervene with live bullets and teargas.

The Member of Parliament for Kioga County in Amolatar district, Anthony Okello Tango was on Saturday afternoon stoned on the head with a brick by youths against the controversial presidential age limit. The youths demanded to know whether he was in support of the age limit bill. He was also questioned about the 29 million given to each MP to consult on the age limit bill. All MPs not supporting the Bill have been returning the money Okello Tango had not.
A vigilante group attacks and kills a suspected kidnapper in Ibadan.
A mob of people in Gahwazi rioted and chased a man down the street until the chief of the hill intervened and stopped them. The man was accused of witchcraft.

SLP arrested seven youngsters for creating a "public disturbance" in Galjano, Hargeysa. The youngsters confronted the police and the police resulted in firing warning shots. Two youngsters were slightly injured. It is not known if the disturbance is related to unrest between Kulmiye and Wadani.
Supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Hargeisa stadium during Kulmiye political rally. SLP dispersed the two groups. There were no reports of arrest or casualties.
Israeli settlers Friday attacked a Palestinian farmer while he was tending his land in Sakout area, in the northern Jordan Valley.
A youth was injured after getting shot during clashes that broke out along the borders to the east of al-Bureij refugee camp, in the middle of the Gaza Strip between Israeli military and youth.
A BJP office was vandalised in Marachara, in Dhalai district, on 3 November 2017 by suspected CPI(M) activists.

On November 3rd, minor clashes erupted in Pulwama town between youths and security forces after a JeM militant was killed in the district the day before. Youths pelted stones on police, who fired tear gas.

A rally organized by Kulmiye political party was dispersed by police as a group of youngsters stoned the Horn Star music band performing at the rally. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd.
BJP offices were vandalised at Shivbari and Nagbanshi, in Dhalai district, on 3 November 2017 by suspected CPI(M) activists.
A youth was shot by a rubber-coated steel bullet during clashes that broke out along the borders to the northeast Ash-Shajaiyeh neighborhood between youth and Israeli military forces.
16 people were arrested in Chakdah following a clash between TMC activists on 2 November 2017. 1 police officer was injured in the incident.

Member of Parliament Mangowd El Hawary had his car attacked and smashed by Fayoum University students after he physically assaulted a female security guard who asked his daughter to show her university ID to enter university.

Angry villagers in Silobela rioted and chased away the ZANU PF MP, who they accused of attempting to interfere with the distribution of government-sourced agricultural inputs. He later returned with the Riot Police to control the situation.
A man was beaten but left alive in Umhlatuzana, Chatsworth by an angry mob.
On 01-November-2017, in Naungcho township, Shan state, a land rights activist was beaten to death by a group of 20 locals. 1 fatality.
On November 1st, 3 police personnel were injured when locals of Ladote-Jamola village in Rajouri district pelted stones on police forces who had arrived in the area to make arrests.
A mob at Nkhoma in Lilongwe has killed a man for torturing his houseboy to death.
Manzou villagers fought running battles with the police who had come again to attempt to evict them from land claimed by Grace Mugabe.
At least six Palestinian minors Wednesday sustained rubber-coated steel bulletwoundsduringclashesthat erupted during an Israeli policeraidinto Jerusalem's Shu'faat refugee camp

source: PalestineNews & Information Agency (WAFA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: Two Palestinians were injured on Wednesday duringclashesthat broke out with Israeli forces outside Joseph's Tomb.

2 journalists were assaulted by youth during a NASA Parliamentary Group meeting at the Wiper headquarters in Nairobi. The journalist, who had already been verbally assaulted before the attack, were singled out due to working for Citizen, NTV, KBC and therefore were seen as being biased and leaning towards the re-election of the President Uhuru Kenyatta. Mr. Gachuri was forcedully evicted while Mrs. Gatwiri was slapped in the face.

On October 31, unidentified actors hurled petrol bombs on two empty parked buses while the motorcade of BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia coming from Chittagong was crossing Dhaka-Chittagong highway at Mohipal in Feni district.
On October 31, at Comilla Medical College, two factions of BCL- one led by 8th batch student Palash and and another by 2nd batch student Hannan- locked into a clash, leaving five students injured.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Jah Prayzah, a musician believed to be aligned to a ZANU PF faction, was chased and manhandled by mourners at a funeral, who are believed to be aligned to the other ZANU PF faction.

assoc_actor_1: NAVUZ: National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe
notes: There were running battles between the police and the newspaper vendors in Gweru.

assoc_actor_1: NAVUZ: National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe
notes: The police attempted to block a Vendors' Union meeting in the Harare cathedral, but were chased away by the angry vendors.
Clashesin Jabaa town, southwest of Jenin, erupted between Palestinians and Israeli forces following an Israeli raid.

Local youth clashed with soldier at Qalandiya refugee camp. Three Palestinians were injured, one with a rubber-coated steel bullet in the head and the others with live rounds in their lower extremities.

Three are dead and several others wounded in Nekemt after rumours of an illegally owned firearm by a civilian. Two of the dead are Amhara and one is Oromo. It is believed the protests are related to the wider unrest in the region. Other 2 fatalities recorded in event on 29/10.
An Eastern Cape university student has been beaten to death, allegedly by fellow students in Mthatha.

source: MENA English; Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: A number of Palestinians were wounded early Monday duringclasheswith Israeli forces in the northernWest Bankcity of Jenin.

In Nairobi, several groups of supporters marched through the city's main streets singing and chanting to celebrate the win of newly-confirmed President Kenyatta. The same happened in other locations. In Narok, however, two men from different communities clashed, leaving 5 people injured.
A 70-year-old man was killed and his wife seriously injured on October 30 in a clash between two groups over a land dispute in Rajasthan's Dagariya village under the Hindoli police station.

On October 30th, locals threw stones on security forces in Mehmoodabad village of Anantnag as they were engaged in a search and cordon of the area. However, forces managed to keep rioters out of the area long enough to finish their search.
AAP workers clashed and scuffled over the mayorial seat candidate in Lucknow on October 30.
A vigilante group attack and kills three suspected motorcycle thieves.

Three are dead and several others wounded in Nekemt after rumours of an illegally owned firearm by a civilian. Two of the dead are Amhara and one is Oromo. It is believed the protests are related to the wider unrest in the region. Other fatality recorded in event on 30/10.
Supporters of Barzani's Kurdistan Democratic Party set fire to headquarters belonging to the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan, the Gorran Movement and PUK's Radio Ashti in the city of Zakho.
A village in Mdantsane went on the rampage and burnt a police bakkie as they tried to attack suspected criminals. Police dispersed the angry community with rubber rounds.
Three Islamist 'extremists' assaulted a young man in Kairouan because of his un-Islamic behaviour. The young man had to be hospitalised.

On October 29th, hundreds of locals, mostly youths, of Hajan Bandipora, pelted stones on security forces who were engaged with militants at Mir Mohalla, in an attempt to help the militants escape. Forces fired back with tear gas and pellets.

On Sunday, police lobbed 33 tear gas shells and fired five rounds in the air as violence erupted between mobs of Ahir and Sidi communities near Talala town of Gir-Somnath district. At least 12 people, including four policemen, were injured in the clashes which were a fallout of a fight between youngsters from both communities over some communal issues.

On October 29, in Vashi, members of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) damaged the merchandise of eight to 10 roadside hawkers outside Vashi railway station after repair requests to the station were not honored.

On October 28, near Feni town, the convoy of BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia, came under attack at Mohammad Ali Bazar. When Khaleda Zia's vehicle crossed the bazaar around, a group of people attacked the vehicles of her convoy. Some BNP were injured in the attack.

On October 28, in Mirsarai, Bruling party actors (Awami) attacked BNP party activists at different points, saying that ruling party men also attacked some vehicles carrying their party leaders, including the vice-chairman Barkatullah Bulu and microbus of private TV channel NTV in Mirsarai.
On Saturday afternoon in Malad Mumbai, four MNS workers were assaulted by hawkers outside Malad (West) station after a protest rally.

Students started a riot, turning on each other, over the dispute of 2 male students who were competing for a girl who had recently moved to the school. The situation got out of control and turned out, with one house being vandalised.

Security forces imposed a lock-down and made some arrests after skirmishes with residents in al-Hoceima on the day of the anniversary of Mouhcine Fikri's death. Two brothers of the dead Fikri were reportedly arrested during the riots.
Israeli settlers threw stones on Saturday at homes of Palestinians in the Masafer Yatta Bedouin community of Umm al-Khair, south of Hebron, causing panic and damage.
Residents of Howrah rioted on 28 October 2017 against the parking of a hearse in their area. The rioters attacked the hearse driver and a police officer.

A man was shot dead while two others suffered gunshot wounds last Friday when they attempted to torch Mr Rege's home in Pala Village in Karachuonyo Constituency. Mr Rege confided to journalists that he suspected the MCAs were behind the plans to torch his home over allegations that there were ballot papers in his home marked in favour of President Uhuru Kenyatta.
A Palestinian youth was injured on Friday duringclasheswith Israeli forces alongGazaborders to the east of al-Bureij refugee camp.
Clashes between students of different schools when some refused to leave classrooms.

On October 23, at Dhaka University, at least five students were injured in a clash between the activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), Zahurul Haque hall unit of Dhaka University (DU) and Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (Buet).

assoc_actor_2: YSRCP: Yuvajana, Sramika, Rythu Congress Party
notes: On Friday, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) and the opposition YSR Congress (YSRC) activists clashed at the local municipal office in Hyderabad two hours ahead of the election schedule of the municipal chairman on Friday .

Trade unions of the CPM and the BJP at North Tripura's Dharmanagar locality clashed 10/27/2017 over which vehicles would ply passengers from the interstate bus terminus leaving least 15 people injured, including one a local TV journalist.

Coptic inhabitants of Ezbet Zakariya in Minya, some 250km south of Cairo, were attacked by a Muslim mob because they were praying in a de facto church in the village. They threw stones at the Copts and broke the doors to their homes, wounding a Coptic woman. Police swiftly secured the scene and closed to church for fear of further unrest. Noone was arrested since the mob had dispersed quickly.
Youth attacked election officials at Bogwo polling station in Muhoroni. They also attacked and beat voters.

In North Karachuonyo, youths were repulsed after attempting to enter the home of former MP James Rege. Police say there were no injuries but reports indicate a man was shot and two others injured during the incident. One of them died of his wounds.
A Returning Officer was attacked by demonstrators in Migori town on his way to the polling centre. He sustained slight injuries and lost a number of his personal items.

"Barbed men" attacked a bar in Al Jorf in Derba after it had reopened after a long period of restauration. They occupied the bar and sent home the costumers. Security forces intervened to sort out the situation.
Youths use bees to keep voters away from Matsakha polling station and are eventually dispersed by police.

A group of about 200 rowdy youths from neighbouring Siaya County attacked a polling station by throwing stones. In the process, one ballot box containing ballot papers was destroyed. Police moved in quickly and restored order.

Communal violence broke out in Harduaganj area of Aligarh after two families from different communities pelted each other with stones and also opened fire following an altercation at a barbershop over who would get a shave first.

On Thursday, a person was killed in police firing after a clash broke out in Gadbada Tehsil area of Gujarat's Dahod district on Thursday. The violence had erupted between the locals and the police over the death of a person during police interrogation.
Rioters/youth clash with police in Kakamega town. During the riots, a police officer mistakenly shot a National Youth Service officer in Kakamega.
Within Murumba market, youths attacked an army truck that was ferrying goods from the Hakati Army Camp. The army officers fired in the air dispersing the youths.

Rioters firebomb a church in Mathare and barricade roads leading to poll stations with rocks. After anti-riot police was deployed, the situation was controlled. The director of the hospital of Drugnet told the AFP that there was 1 killed though.
Members of a community allegedly stoned a 50-year-old man to death in Rabokala near Brits.
In St. Marys Bangladesh, rowdy youths blocked the entrance to the polling centre forcing the IEBC officials to suspend the exercise while arrangements were made to manage the situation.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Prison Guards
notes: A prison warder was injured in North Rachuonyo North after he was hit by a stone as he cleared a barricaded road.
Angry villagers who saw that a teacher had marked ballot papers gathered to set fire to his house. The civilian had already sought refuge.

At Mugai Primary School, an assistant chief was chased away by angry locals who accused him of dishing handouts to coerce people to vote. Locals said the officer was giving people perceived to be Jubilee supporters Sh50 and directing them to the polling station to cast their ballots.

In Busia, a group of boda boda drivers stormed a polling station and burnt ballot boxes, forms 32A, 33, 34A, 41, supervisor validation forms, ballot papers, IEBC stamps, badges and reflector jackets, and stole two gas lanterns and cylinders.

Supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties clashed near Burao local government building during a Kulmiye rally. Police intervened to disperse the groups. There were no reports of arrests and casualties.

Israeli settlers Wednesday hurled stones at Palestinian farmers while they were harvesting olives in Deir Nezam village, near theWest Bankdistrict of Ramallah. Israeli soldiers stood by while settlers from Halamish attacked.

Some irate youth in Karaga in the Northern Region, believed to be sympathizers of the New Patriotic Party (NPP), have reportedly invaded a police station, and freed some NPP members who were in police custody. A Citi News source who was close to the scene, said the youth acted in that manner because the District Chief Executive of Karaga, Alhassan Yabdoo, allegedly caused the arrest of some NPP communicators.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A group of Chitungwiza residents attacked a local ZANU PF leader, who had been responsible for directing the attacks on MDCT supporters in recent weeks.

On October 25th, clashes erupted after local youth pelted stones on security forces who were conducting a search and cordon in Below village, Pulwama district. Forces responded by firing tear gas, and later called off the operation.

On October 25th, clashes erupted after local youth pelted stones on security forces who were conducting a search and cordon in the Chandgam/Babgam area of Pulwama. Forces responded by firing tear gas, and later called off the operation.

An angry mob raids the home of John Peter Ematu, the North Kyoga regional police commander, accusing him of brutalising MPs while pelting his house with stones. This event came after police used teargas as real bullets to disperse a consultative meeting on the presidential age limit organised by the Lira Woman MP.

On October 25, in Mumbai, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) and Congress party workers clashed in Kandivali (East) over the issue of hawker eviction. The clashes erupted after a meeting held by Congress city chief Sanjay Nirupam on Akurli Road.
On October 24, in Birampur upazila, at least 11 people were injured in a clash between two groups of Chowgharia village over harvesting paddy on disputed land.

Violence broke out between two groups of female undergraduate students at the Pulathisipura National College of Education in Polonnaruwa assumed on Oct 24. The police had to intervene to prevent injuries or property damage.
On October 24, in Indore, two factions of the Congress party clashed with each other over sharing dais with Kapoor and shouted slogans in support of their respective leaders.
A mob lynched four criminals who were trying to escape after firing at a businessman in Rohtas district of southwest Bihar on 10/24/2017.
In the locality of Morrua, a mob attacked the home of a community leader and tried, without success, to vandalise the police station after rumours of vampires were spreading.

The vehicle belonging to the deputy governor of Awdal was stoned by teenagers supporting Wadani political party as he drove past a Wadani rally at Borama Liberty Garden. Police arrested two youngsters.
A man alleged to have attempted to rape a young girl has been stoned to death by angry residents from an informal settlement in Clare Estate, Durban.
Vendors in Gweru barricaded the roads and pelted the police with stones to resist the police attempts to clear the vendors from the streets. A police officer was injured.

On October 23rd, several people were injured when clashes erupted in Wagad village of Tral township after locals gathered and pelted stones on security forces who the night before had allegedly thrashed the father of a suspected militant while they raided his house. Security forces attacked with batons and smashed property in return.
Rioters who tried to disrupt a NASA rally in Keroka were beaten and chased away by NASA supporters.
An angry mob attacked a man and his family in Kolkata on 23 October 2017 over allegations of eve-teasing.
On 23/10/2017, angry rioters clashed with the police and set fire to a primary school in Orumiyeh, following reports that a 12-year student had been sexually abused by the school janitor.
The seat of the local chapter of the 'Front des Forces Socialistes' in Yakouren was ravaged by unknown individuals.
A mob lynched three community leaders accused of witchcraft in Macanga, Chidzolomondo.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi militants and anti-riot forces have stormed the central prison, transferring dozens of detainees to secret locations. According to eyewitnesses, Houthi militants fired on prisoners who resisted the transfer, resulting in a number of injuries.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF youth attacked a group of MDCT activists who were carrying out voter registration training in Chitungwiza. Several youth from the parties were injured in the clashes.
A physically challenged man was beaten to death for allegedly stealing a cauliflower from an agricultural filed in Sitamarhi district of north Bihar on 10/22/2017.
On October 22nd, youth hurled stones on police who had arrived in Rajpora Chowk following a grenade attack on a beauty parlour. They returned fire with tear gas cannisters.

Tens of civilians looted a warehouse in the Al-Rahman Corps-controlled town of Hamouriya in the Eastern Ghota, where over 80 tons of sugar was being stored, a staple that is almost completely absent from local markets. This comes as food aid has not entered the besieged area in around 3 months.

On October 22, in Shivamogga, four police personnel were injured in an attack by an irate mob when they tried to stop 'AoHori Habba'Ao, the bull-taming event at Jade village in Sorab taluk and Harnahalli village on Sunday.

On October 22, in Santa Cruz, a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers vandalized illegal stalls and forcibly evicted hawkers in other parts of the state, the party vandalised stalls outside Santa Cruz station.
On October 22, a number of Congress members assaulted men affiliated to the SAD in Malout resulting in a number of injuries. It is reported to be case of old political rivalry.
One killed and shops burnt as Muslim and Christian youth clash at Dan Anacha in Taraba following a confrontation over blasphemy.

Israeli settlers raided Palestinian properties in Hebron, threw rocks, broke the windows, and threatened residents. The settlers renewed demands to close the Youth Against Settlements headquarters in the area, accusing the movement of being the main instigator of the attacks on settlers.

On October 21st, 4 people were injured, including 1 police officer, when police attempted to break up a riot between traders and students, who were throwing stones at each other, in Lahore. Students had allegedly attempted to shut down the traders' shops after they did not pay their rent. They also blocked the road outside Mansoora College.

On October 21st, clashes erupted when youth started hurling stones on security forces who were conducting a cordon and search of the area. Security forces returned fire with tear gas cannisters and pellets.

On October 21, in Thane, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers vandalised the stalls of hawkers near several railway stations in retaliation to the vendors' disregard for MNS chief Raj Thackeray's warning earlier in the month.

On October 21, in Mumbai, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers vandalised the stalls of hawkers near several railway stations in retaliation to the vendors' disregard for MNS chief Raj Thackeray's warning earlier in the month.

Several people from the Dalit community were injured in a clash over burning of firecrackers at Muzaffarnagar's Charthawal town on October 21. The incident occurred over the opposition of burning fire crackers. Possible case of caste violence.
On Thursday in Dhaka, pro-BNP lawyers engaged in a physical scuffle to get centre stage before television cameras during a media briefing soon after Khaleda left the court area.
On October 20th, an angry mob attacked and severely injured a mentally challenged man in Sopore on the suspicion that he was a braid chopper.

Around 200 civilians looted a warehouse belonging to the Unified Relief Office in the Al-Rahman Corps-controlled town of Hamouriya in the Eastern Ghota, taking over a ton and a half of the food stored there. This comes as food aid has not entered the besieged area in around 3 months.
Police teargassed angry youths who stormed Jinja East Municipality MP Mr Nathan Igeme Nabeta's home with the aim of setting it on fire on.
36 students were arrested on the Bloemfontein campus late after a group of students clashed with members of the private security company and the South African Police Service (SAPS).

A mob, believing that local officials were working for the vampires, burned down the homes of community leaders and the home of the director of the district prison.They also vandalised the police offices.
On October 19th, clashes broke out in Tral town between locals and security forces after the latter allegedly vandalised the house of a local HM leader.
A teacher was beaten when a mob tried to stop an IEBC training in Homa Bay.
In Blantyre a 22-year-old man, was torched and another was stoned to death following suspicion of sucking people's blood, Malawi Police confirmed.

During a Wednesday night operation in the town of Dheisheh near Bethlehem, one IDF soldier was lightly injured in the operation by a rock-throwing Arab. The soldier was treated at the scene and transferred to the hospital.
On 18 October 18, 3 plain clothes army officers were seriously injured after a group of locals attacked them in Baramulla district (J&K) on the suspicion that they were braid choppers.

On 18-October-2017, in Hpakant township, Kachin state, a group of 600 people attacked police blocking a plot of land owned by the 111 company. Police fired on the crowd, killing 5 and injuring 25. 5 fatalities.

Protesters stormed the Huduma Centre in Kisumu city threw chairs and destroyed tents where a training camp was being set up for officials to prepare for this month's presidential election. The youths also roughed up a woman the commission had contracted to provide the tents and chairs.
Clashes between government party supporters and the supporters of 15 dissidents MPs were reported: 4 wounded.

source: Associated Press International; The Daily Monitor; Chimp Reports
notes: Police shot dead between one and two people at a political rally. Police blocked hundreds of opposition supporters from entering a stadium in Rukungiri on 18 October. During the standoff, some opposition supporters pelted police with stones.

Seven young people with knives invaded the CEM Maaroufi Salah in Sidi El Bashir neighbourhood in Oran, threatening teachers and students. Motives are unknown. No injuries or clashes were reported. The attackers fled soon after police was informed.

When police attempted to prevent a traditional burial practice, the mourners turned on the police officers and stoned and burned down the Mufumbwe police station.

The police opened fire on rioters in Mandimba, killing four of them in Madimba, Niassa. The rioters set the house of the district police manager on fire, burning also his car and that of the local head of the traffic police.

SLP conducted a security operation at Sheedaha neighbourhood where they clashed with youngsters who were fighting each other. The reason for the unrest is not known. SLP fired warning shots to disperse the youngsters. Five youngsters were arrested.
A mob attacked a taxi vehicle at the corner of Symphony Way and Stellenbosch Arterial Road in Cape Town.

Two families who had a quarrel during a wedding went to the hospital to be treated. After having to wait too long, the two families started to riot, fight against each other and ravaging the hospital. This is one of several incidents in which people started to riot in hospitals.

Clash between the family of a displaced deceased girl and members attending her burial near the Bindisi camp in Central Darfur. The family claimed the girl had been raped before dying while doctors said she had been struck by lightning. The clash left one killed and another wounded. This is believed to have led to a retaliatory attack the following day, as tribesmen abducted seven in the camp. The gunmen allegedly set fire to houses and stole camp resident's properties. The abductees were released a few days later.

Violent clasheserupted early Tuesday between Palestinian youths and Israeli occupation forces in Badu village. A number of Palestinians were injured during the clashes after Israeli soldiers opened fired and rubber bullets as well as toxic tear gas canisters against them.

A man was dragged from his shack, beaten in the street and killed by vigilantes in Phillipi. His shack was set alight, 50m from where he was killed.
A University of Jos student, mistaken for Igbo, is attacked and killed by a group of anti-IPOB protesters.
On Sept 14, 2-3 brothers were killed by a Shiite mob who accused them of being IS members in Al-Sukkar area (al-Hadbaa district), Mosul

The traditional ruler of Obollo autonomous community in Isiala Mbano Local Government Area of Imo State is attacked and nearly lynched after a unfavourable political appointment was made on the ruler's behalf.
Security forces "foil" an attempt by suspected Biafran secessionists to burn a market and police station. Extent of damage not known. The perpetrators continued violence the following day.
Civilians burnt several houses belonging to Ethiopian nationals from Oromo ethnicity following the killing of several Somali nationals by Ethiopian forces in Oromo region.
A number of Palestinians on Wednesday were suffocated due to inhaling tear gas fired at them by Israeli forces duringclasheserupted in Abu Dis town.
A situation between two youngsters triggered some clashes between autochthonous and non-native communities. People of both parts were wounded, and some houses were burnt down.

A Palestinian youth was wounded early Wednesday after violent confrontations erupted with Israeli forces, who stormed the West Bank town of Tubas. Israeli soldiers opened fire against the Palestinians, leaving a young man injured in his foot.

Police in Mwingi shot in the air to disperse angry residents whom had turned against Jubilee Party members on a campaign trail. The group, which carried Raila Odinga and Kalonzo Musyoka's posters, hurled stones at the motorcade smashing windows of several cars.
A mob opens fire on convoy transporting Khat in El Dahir neighbourhood. One Puntland soldier escorting the convoy killed. It is not clear if the perpetrators were rioters or organized.
Residents of Marikana informal settlement in Philippi necklaced three suspected robbers to bring the government's attention to the spike in crime in their area.
Three people were wounded Saturday evening when a bus came under stone-throwing attack after a demonstration in Wadi Ara against American recognition of Jerusalem asIsrael'scapital.
Unidentified assailants hurled a crude bomb near Jayshree cinema hall at Badambadi in Odisha's Cuttack city on Sept. 12.
Youngsters attacked the Foumbadou police station: local inspector was heavily wounded, and several motorcycles were seized.
Israeli forces shot and injured a young Palestinian man with a rubber-coated steel bullet duringclashesMonday night in the village Tuqu.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

On September 11, in Shiralakoppa, unidentified persons hurled a petrol bomb at the residence of Manchi Shivanand, president of the Shiralakoppa town unit of Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).
Alleged TMC workers assaulted BJP activists in Kolkata on 11 September 2017.

On September 11th, clashes erupted in Lalchowk area of Anantnag town after news about the killing of two militants in Khudwani, Kulgam spread in the area. Youth pelted stones on police and other forces deployed in the area, who retaliated.
Squatters in Patna rioted against police and municipal officials on 11 September 2017 during an anti-encroachment drive.

In East Shewam Walanchite city, a Tigray man was accused by a crowd of "spying" on people in the area. He was also accused of killing an Oromo man by the name of Bakala Babsa, and wounding his brother. The crowd lynched the man, burning his body in the main street.
After a restaurant patron dies of food poisoning a "mob" gathers outside the establishment before they were dispersed by police.
On 10 September, a man was lynched by the crowd after he killed the village chief in Larba, Hina.

Violence erupted n Busei, Iganga District when supporters of a Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) candidate were attacked by thugs affilaited with NRM who were armed with pangas and sticks, leaving them with several wounds.

On September 10, in Jaipur, in four police station areas of the city there were violent clashes between local residents and policemen that continued without any relaxation for the second day. There was a deadlock over post-mortem of the 22-year-old man who was allegedly killed in the police firing on Friday night.
A standoff between Haredi and secular residents of the southern Israeli city of Arad on Saturday night evolved into aviolentaltercation that resulted in the summoning of security forces to the area.

On 8 Sept, a country made bomb was hurled at two Communist Party of India-Marxist (CPI-M) cadres in Koothparambu district in Kannur on Friday. The bomb was thrown at them when they were on a bike. The culprits are suspected to be RSS.
An RSS worker was injured after a clash erupted between CPI (M) and BJP workers in Koothparambu on Friday.
Clashes between rioters and Israeli forces erupted in the Balata refugee camp in Nablus governorate on September 7.
Clashes between rioters and Israeli forces erupted in the Ayidah refugee camp in Bethleham governorate on September 7.

2 policemen and 6 villagers were injured in Sheohar on 7 September 2017 when flood victims rioted against the non-distribution of relief materials. Rioters threw stones at police who responded with a baton charge.
Six people, including four CPI(M) and two BJP activists, were injured in a clash between them at Kudakadavu near Edakkad during the Muzhupilanghad beach fest near Kannur on Thursday.
Three cars were torched in a Johannesburg business district on Thursday in the latest clash between drivers with ride-hailing service Uber and traditional cabbies.
Unknown people have torched the offices of Homa Bay Governor on Thursday night. Police arrested one person following the incident
10 Palestinians suffered from suffocation after Israeli forces fired tear gas canisters against them during clashes in Abu Dis town east of Jerusalem.
