Clashes between rioters and Israeli forces erupted in Sawahira, Al Quds, on September 7.
Clashes between rioters and Israeli forces erupted in the city of Al Bireh, Ramallah, on September 7.
Angry villagers killed a suspected pyromance in Sakoamadinika.
12 Nepali Congress activists were injured when two factions of the party clashed in Siraha on 6 September 2017. The clash had erupted over ticket distribution for the September 18 local polls.

At least 10 people were injured in a clash between supporters of Awami League (AL) and Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) over establishing supremacy in the area at Sreekol Bazar in Sreepur upazila on Wednesday evening.

On September 6, some youths of the upper-caste Rajput community reportedly sexually harassed young women of the Dalit community leading to clashes between both caste groups in Bhoopkheda village in Muzaffarnagar.
Sub-saharan Migrants were fighting with residents of Tangiers Masnana neighbourhood. Security forces intervened after they were informed about the clashes. The migrants were later deported.
In a mob attack, in Nsanje the local community has killed a suspected criminal by beating and burning him.
President Hassan Rouhani's campaign centre in Tajrish, north of Tehran, was also attacked yesterday, 9 May, by a group of people, who had used pepper spray and then fled the scene.

On September 5th, fierce clashes erupted between security forces and youth in Karimabad village, Pulwama district, after the former laid a siege to the village following information about the presence of militants. Youth pelted stones on forces, who fired tear gas.

On September 5th, two youth were injured when they clashed with security forces in Delow village, Pulwama district, after forces cordoned off the area in search of militants. Youth resorted to stone pelting at forces, who in retaliation lobbed tearsmoke shells and fired bullets and pellets.
More than 20 persons were injured when a mob clashed with police during an anti-encroachment drive at Ghurdaur Road in Rajiv Nagar locality on the north western region of Patna on Tuesday.
A vigilante mob beats a 70-year-old to death for alleged witchcraft on 05/09.
Police officers shot dead a motorcyclist who resisted an attempt to confiscate the motorcycle, sparking a riot from other motorcyclists, who threw stones.

SSFN activists locked their party's central vice-chairperson inside her house in Rajbiraj of Saptari on 4 September 2017 after she made unnecessary interventions while picking election candidates. Activists also pelted the house with stones and attempted to set it on fire.
Tricycle (Keke) operators clash with military forces in Umuahia for unknown reason. Several of the Keke operators were later arrested and charged with riotous assembly.
On September 4, in Tirupati, mild tension prevailed at the Sri Venkateswara University'' (SVU) College of Engineering as two sections of students clashed with one another on the college premises.
Clashesbroke out in the village of Nabi Salih north of Ramallah after the Israeli forces stormed into the village and closed the gates leading to Bani Zeid villages.
A physical altercation broke out between a group of sub-Saharan migrants and members a Moroccan family in the Masnana neighbourhood in Tangier.

The medical staff of the regional hospital of Jbeniana was assaulted following the death of two young people,that died in a road accident. The families of the victims also broke the hospital equipment.

Unknown rioters threw molotov cocktails on a Russian tourist bus that was on its way from Douz to Tozeur. Noone was injured.

30 gold panners raided a gold mine in Chakari and then attacked 6 people, including the owner of the mine.
A 'lunatic,' suspected member of a kidnap and ritualist gang was set ablaze by a mob, following the discovery of the gang's den in Mushin area of Lagos. Five were later arrested.

A simple dispute between three individuals in a cafe in the town of Tataouine turned into a fight and tribal conflict, when the belligerents called for members of their families to join them. The two tribes clashed extensively, on Wednesday night, with swords, clubs and other projectiles, causing many wounded on both sides. The police had to resort to tear gas to separate the two clans. Two of the three individuals responsible for the fighting were arrested and detained at Harboub prison.

After gunmen killed a youth chairman of the Ohoghobi community, villagers protest violently, burning the place of the local traditional ruler. A source said the villagers suspected the monarch to be the mastermind of the killing, as he had threatened him previously.
"Pandemoum" as youths and traders fight on 22/08 in Isolo. Details not known.
On August 21, in Tirupati, two factional groups of students attacked each other with sticks and rods at the I-Block hostel on Sri Venkateswara University campus.
On August 21, a number of Dalit students were attacked by a number of teachers and members of other backward classes in Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University in Lucknow.
A person was stoned and set alight with flammable substances and tyres in a street in Jijana grounds (Zwide). He died as a result of the attack.
On August 20th, Christian teenager was brutally beaten up by a mob in Jhamkay town of Wazirabad tehsil, Gujranwala district, over accusations of burning a Quran.
On August 20, in Virudhunagar, unidentified persons hurled a petrol bomb at a TASMAC shop at Watrap in the district. However, no one was injured or no material in the shop damaged in the attack.

Skirmishes between Christians and Muslims took place in Ezbat al Forn, Abu Qurqas. According to the head of Abu Qurqas city council fights broke out on Sunday after some Coptic citizens tried to pray at the house of a citizen under the guidance of a priest, prompting some Muslims to intercept for not possessing a license. Some suspects were arrested.

On August 20th, two groups of alleged Trinamool supporters clashed in Kasba following a dispute over the sharing of spoils from a syndicate business. A club in the locality was vandalised and two of its walls were damaged.

On August 19th, a mob in Radhanagar, Sahibganj district, lynched a woman on suspicion of her involvement in chopping off a local girl's braid. Villagers attacked the woman and 3 other beggers near her, including her young son, with stones, alleging witchcraft. The boy was taken to hospital in critical condition.
Three workers of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) were seriously injured, following Congress leader Hridaypal Singh Dhindsa's attack on them at Phullanwal village on August 19.

On August 19th, supporters of estranged JD(U) leader Mr Yadav, attacked leaders and workers of JD(U) who were waiting outside 1 Anne Marg in Patna, where a national executive meeting of JD(U) was under progress. Police arrived soon after to take control of the situation.
Rioters torched a bungalow in Kalimpong as part of the ongoing GJM agitation in the Darjeeling Hills.
At Jijana Grounds in Soweto-on-sea (Zwide) a person was attacked and killed by a group of about 100 people.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(MC): Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre)

A group of Israeli settlers from Kiryat Arba settlement in the southern occupied West Bank threw rocks at several Palestinian homes in Hebron city on Friday night -- the latest in a marked increase of settler attacks on Palestinians in the district.

On August 18th, clashes occurred between rioters and security forces in Hajan town after Friday prayers. Police and security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi-charge to disperse rioters, who were pelting stones.

On August 18th, clashes occurred between rioters and security forces in Sopore after Friday prayers. Police and security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi-charge to disperse rioters, who were pelting stones.

On August 18th, clashes occurred between rioters and security forces at Nowhatta, Srinigar after Friday prayers. Police and security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi-charge to disperse rioters, who were pelting stones.

On August 18, in Chennai, a group of students jumped off an MTC bus, wielding knifes and rods, in pursuit of another group. This happened when the bus stopped at the Sharma Nagarbus terminus in Vyasarpadi.
Two Palestinians were detained on Friday during clashes that erupted at the northern entrance of the West Bank district of Qalqilia.

Clashes erupted in several other areas of the Gaza Strip, with locals reporting clashes near the Nahal Oz military post near northern Gaza, east of al-Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza, and east of Khan Yunis and Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip.

Violent riots broke out in several areas along the Israel-Gaza border. According to local sources, Israeli forces stationed at military watchtowers on the border line east of Jabaliya in the northern Gaza Strip opened fire at a group of Palestinian youths as they approached the border fence, causing the injury of one youth in his chest with a live bullet.

Violent riots broke out in several areas along the Israel-Gaza border. According to local sources, Israeli forces stationed at military watchtowers on the border line east of Jabaliya in the northern Gaza Strip opened fire at a group of Palestinian youths as they approached the border fence, causing the injury of one youth in his chest with a live bullet.
Violent clashes erupted in the Jenin camp during the raid. Locals told Ma'an that three Palestinian youths were injured with Israeli-fired live ammunition.

One PML-N worker was killed, and two others injured in a clash between workers of the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) and Pakistan Tehreeke Insaf (PTI) in Khanewal. The clash occurred during an Independence Day rally near Al Hadees chowk on August 17th.
On 17 Aug, unidentified rioters threw a bomb near a police station in Sukhia Pokhari (Darjeeling, WB), damaging a parked car.

Members of the Independent People of Biafra (IPOB) clashed with the police in Ekwulobia, Aguata Local Council of Anambra State. The incident followed an earlier plan by the leader of IPOB, Nnamdi Kanu, to hold a rally at Ekwulobia as part of his campaign to stop Anambra State gubernatorial election.
On August 16, in Hiramandalam, thirty persons were injured when villagers clashed with police personnel at Padali village.

The police on August 16 detained some senior Samajwadi leaders after party supporters turned violent for not being allowed to accompany their candidate for the district panchayat chairperson's post to the nomination room in the collectorate in Auraiya. The police cane charged the workers.
A mob of five lynch a suspected kidnapper in Oshodi. The perpetrators were later arrested.

Israeli forces shot and injured a Palestinian man during clashes in al-Duheisha refugee camp on Wednesday morning. Clashes broke out during the military raid, during which an al-Duheisha resident identified as Raed al-Salihi was shot and injured.

A suspected cattle raider was attacked and killed by residents at Mwamabasabi Street in Nyankumbu ward. Properties belonging to the suspected cattle rustler were last week destroyed by the residents during the attack in which they also killed 13 cattle.
A group of strangers attacked the office of Slim Riahi, president of the UPL-party, on Tuesday, August 15, 2017.

Four men have been lynched by youths at Tella in Gassol Local Government of Taraba State. Eyewitnesses said the deceased were suspected kidnappers.
2 people were killed in a clash on 14 August 2017 between villagers in Mugkandi, Bahubal, over changing the committee and imam of a mosque.

After a soldier hit a street trader with a motorbike, a vigilante group attacked the trooper killing him. Police made several arrests.

A young man was lynched by Esiro residents for allegedly stealing a coffee table in Yambio. He later died of his injuries. Police arrested some of the people involved in the beating.

A day after communal clash in the old city area of Vadodara on Thursday, police on Friday booked 2,700 people for rioting and also planned a public rally in the presence of MoS Home Pradeepsinh Jadeja to instil "a sense of law and order" among the public. Unidentified persons pelted stones from Masum Chamber Lane on a Ganesh procession on Mandvi-Panigate road, which triggered the clash. Police said the dispute was over playing loudspeaker in the procession.

A Jubo League leader was killed in a clash between two groups of Awami League supporters at Naria Upazila in Shariatpur district on Friday. The clash took place in the late afternoon, injuring 25 more workers.

A long-running land dispute turned violent as villagers in Kampot province's Decho Aphivat commune clashed with representatives of an agricultural company that had been ordered to tear down their homes. The company's representatives were tearing down half-built homes when villagers pulled a worker off of his motorbike and beat him, and also broke the windshield of a company car.
Since 11 August, Nyanza [western Kenya] experienced a breakout of violence, where rioters engaged the police after the announcement of the presidential elections results.

On August 11, in Vadodara, four police personnel and five civilians were injured, and vehicles and one shop were torched in communal riots that erupted following an incident where stones were thrown at a Ganesh idol procession in the communally-sensitive Mandavi area.

Several activists of Telangana Political Joint Action Committee were injured after they were attacked allegedly by TRS workers who objected to Amara Veerula Spoorthi Yatra of TJAC Chairman Prof. M. Kodandaram at Baswapur in Kamareddy district on Friday.
A vigilante mob set two scavengers ablaze mistaking them for ritualists. The attack took place at Zik bus stop in Ikeja.
In Migori, an opposition stronghold, youths engaged police in running battles. A body was later found in the area
Four people are killed in the context of riots in Kawangwere on 11 Aug.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit

Five Palestinians were injured with live fire during clashes that erupted Thursday evening [10 August] in the Beit Rima town in northern Ramallah between Palestinian youths and Israeli undercover forces that raided a house in the town.

source: Agence France Presse; Palestine News Network (PNN)

A police officer who harassed a taxi driver was attacked by the taxi driver and a crowd of people wielding iron bars, who gathered to support the taxi driver.

Drama ensued in Lamu West after the returning officer was prevented from announcing the final results for the parliamentary seat. Return was not possible because chaos erupted when the RO and the candidate began fighting, breaking ballot boxes in the process. A number of injuries were reported.

Two people from rival political groups fought at Nduru Girls' Secondary School, a tallying centre in South Mugirango constituency.
There were riots in Kisumu, which were heavily suppressed by the police.
Work was paraylsed at Nakaseke Hospital after residents of Nongo village; Kyikamuli Sub-county Nakaseke stormed the facility, seeking answers over the death of a prisoner.

Three people die in riots/clashes with police the day after polling in Kawangware.
Several people were injured when a clash erupted between police and people who came to the Khairpur jail for a meeting with their imprisoned relatives.
Clashes broke out between forces and youth during a cordon and search operation in Quimoh township of Kulgam district. The operation was called off following the clash.

On August 9, 15 Palestinians were injured with live and rubber-coated steel bullets while tens of others suffered from tear gas inhalation during clashes with Israeli Army in the village of Kobar, northeast of Ramallah in the central West Bank.

Six people were arrested from Saadatganj on August 9 after alleged harassment of a woman led to communal tension in the area. According to reports both sides indulged in heavy stone-pelting and around half a dozen people sustained minor injuries.

During the Gorkhaland agitation, a vehicle carrying newspapers from Siliguri to Darjeeling was torched at Zero Point in Kurseong. There was also an attempt to attack another vehicle with newspapers at the same spot, but the driver managed to speed away.

The director of the 'STEG' (electricity)-branch in Bouhajla and a guard were violently assaulted by two individuals from rioters who allege that they were deprived of electricity.
A Palestinian young man was injured by a rubber bullet to the head during confrontations with Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank, injuring 9 more in Kobar.
Rioters clash with police as Defense Minister's motorcade enters a Haredi neighborhood. An 8-year-old girl was injured by a rock hurled by a rioter.
Voters in Kitui beat up the county official who was attempting to buy votes for his candidate.

Supporters of the ODM and Jubilee candidates in Chonyi, Kilifi, clashed at 3am on voting day. 1 person was killed.

Five suspected kidnappers were lynched by a vigilante mob in Tela. A sixth escaped.
Residents of Baria, south of Kassala, clashed with members of an anti-smuggling force who raided the house of a suspected smuggler during the week of 7 August.
186 sub-Saharan African migrants stormed the border bost in Ceuta and were successful in crossing it. Four rioters were taken to the hospital for injuries. One police officer was also injured.
A middle aged man was attacked by young Palestinians on his way to Yeshiva.

The students of various schools in Srinagar clashed with police in city centre Lal Chowk following the killing of a civilian and two militants, including LeT commander Abu Dujana, in an encounter in Pulwama. Students threw stones at police, who fired tear gas.

Over 30 policemen were injured in Tripurawhen when hundreds of Indigenous People's Front of Tripura (IPFT) attacked them with stones and sticks at Bodhjungnagar, alleging a woman has been abducted. Police used a lathi charge and fired tear gas to disperse the rioters.
Suspected pro-Gorkhaland activists torched a food-laden vehicle in front of Darjeeling railway station.

10 people were allegedly injured in Gorkhaland related violence, in addition to several cases of arson. Suspected pro-Gorkhaland activists set afire a house, two trucks, a Nano car, and a two-wheeler in the Dooars area of Bagracote, Jalpaiguri district.
