Authorities arrested 150 refugees during or after the riot and accused SPLA of being behind the riot after finding a card belonging to an officer.
Five women were killed in Undomo village after being accused of being witches. They were beaten to death and their bodies burned.
Clashes erupted between rioters and Government forces on Monday in the Keller area of Shopian after forces launched search operation in the area.

On July 31, Muslims and Hindus clashed over a rape case Tissa sub-division of Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district. Five police personnel, including assistant superintendent of police (ASP) Virender Thakur, were injured after a mob pelted them with stones as the police resorted to lathicharge to disperse them.

assoc_actor_1: AITYC: All India Trinamool Youth Congress
assoc_actor_2: AITYC: All India Trinamool Youth Congress
notes: In Jaipuria College, Kolkata, two students were injured when two factions of Trinamool Chhatra Parishad (TMCP) clashed with each other over territorial control and allegedly verbally assaulted their teachers and principal over their demands to allow "outsiders" enter the college and review the verification process for new admissions.

6 demonstrators were injured after clashes erupted with security forces in the Tahab area of Pulwama following an encounter between security forces and HM militants. Security personnel lobbed tear gas shells and fired a few shots in the air to restore order.

Police arrested 19 persons after two groups set vehicles afire and vandalized public property during a clash in a Bakshi ka Talab village in Lucknow on July 30. The clash erupted over the auction of a pond.
A number of Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian locals from Khirbet Umm al-Kheir east of Yatta in the southern occupiedWest Bankby throwing rocks at them Saturday night.
One person was killed and 12 others were wounded after supporters of rival candidates in the election of head of Puncak Jaya district in the Indonesian eastern province of Papua clashed on Saturday.
A violent clash between Sikhs and Christians left three from both sides injured on the premises of the Valtoha police station, on July 29.
A suspected armed robber has been killed by community members and three others have been arrested following an armed robbery at a liquor outlet in Apel, Limpopo.
A militaryraidin Jenin refugee camp in the northern occupiedWest Banksparkedclashes,and that Israeli forces shot and injured two Palestinian minors with live bullets.
Community members kidnapped and killed two suspected criminals and attempted to kill two others in Polokwane.

Israeli forces injured at least three Palestinians with live ammunition and rubber-coated steel bullets on Friday in Hebron city and Beit Ummar village in the southernWest Bank. Two other Palestinians were injured with rubber-coated steel bullets during clashes that erupted in the village of Beit Ummar in the Hebron district, al-Jabari said.
Following a deadly car accident at a police checkpoint at a location between Owerri-Onitsha, a vigilante mob, blaming police insecurity for the crash, attacked and lynched two police officers.

Israeli forces injured at least two Palestinians with live ammunition on Friday, one of whom has been reported in critical condition, after clashes erupted in the town of al-Ram north of Jerusalem in the occupied West Bank over Israel's restrictions at Al-Aqsa Mosque compound.
Clashes erupted between youth and forces in Sopore town after the Friday congregational prayers ended. The youths pelted stones at police, who fired tear gas.

Clashes erupted between the BJP and the CPI(M) in Thiruvananthapuram as a state committee office of the BJP, residence of CPI(M) state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan and several houses of party workers came under attack on Friday. At least six cars, including that of BJP state president Kummanam Rajasekharan, were damaged by a group of people, allegedly CPI(M) workers, who barged into the state committee office.
On July 28, Akali activists at Phase 3B1 Mohali in front of the office of the SAD clashed amongst themselves.
Suspected Gorkha activists burnt down a panchayat office at Pulbazar.

Israeli forces clashed with Palestinians in the southern occupiedWest Bankcity of Bethlehem on Friday afternoon, injuring several Palestinians, including one with live fire, shortly after Friday prayers.

Ambulance crews had transferred a Palestinian to a hospital after he was shot with a live bullet duringclashesthat erupted with Israeli forces in the Bab al-Zawiya area of Hebron city. Two other Palestinians were injured with rubber-coated steel bullets during clashes that erupted in the village of Beit Ummar in the Hebron district.
Four of the seven injured were wounded with live ammunition duringclashesthat had erupted east of the Jabaliya refugee camp north ofGazacity.
At least one was injured inclasheseast of Khan Yunis city in the southernGazaStrip.

source: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Israeli troops shot dead a Palestinian teenager and wounded seven others Friday duringclashesnear the border fence inGaza. Abdulrahman Abu Hmeisa, 16, was killed in theclasheseast of the Al-Bureij refugee camp in the centralGaza Strip.

On 28 July 2017, in Po commune, Tbeng Meanchey province, a mob of villagers attacked environmental officials following a logging bust. About 300-400 villagers were present during the skirmish. It was unclear whether the officials who were attacked were members of a security force or civilian government workers.

A bus was attacked and burned in Ambo. A second vehicle marked as a health minister's vehicle was also targeted and burned. Opposition leaders (unknown identity; possibly EDP) claim that the government was using these vehicles to transport troops in the area. Perpetrators not known. No causalities.

Israeli forces conducted a series of raids Thursday evening in and around the town of Tuqu, southeast of Bethlehem in the southern West Bank, after an Israeli settler was allegedly injured after a rocks were thrown at his vehicle.
A mob chased and beat a 22-year-old man to death on charges of theft in northwest Delhi's at Azadpur mandi in Adarsh Nagar locality on July 27 evening.

On Thursday evening, BLF (Black First Land First) supporters disrupted a debate about state capture and the Gupta emails, hosted by the amaBhungane Centre for Investigative Journalism. A person attending the event was reportedly punched during the altercation.
A meeting organised by Nairobi Women in Nairobi was disrupted by rowdy youth, who stormed the church and broke up the meeting

assoc_actor_1: MPLA: Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola
assoc_actor_2: UNITA: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola
notes: A group of UNITA activists were attacked by MPLA militants on the road between Ganda and Cubal. The MPLA militants had been mobilised by a local chief. The chief and three of the UNITA activists were injured in the clash.
7 police officers were injured in clashes between police and street traders in Kasserine, during a police campaign to clear up illegal street trading.
Palestinians were injured by rubber-coated steel rounds and teargas duringclasheswith Israeli forces in Qalqilia city.
Supporters of the two candidates in Marsabit threw stones at each other in Marsabit where President Kenyatta was expected to rally on wedsnesday.

Amor shepherds ordered Echorfa shepherds to remove their animals, prompting a violent confrontation between the two groups. More people from each group flocked to join the confrontation, using clubs and stones. 8 people were injured.

People around Dyeratu area in Malawi's Shire Valley district of Chikhwawa have destroyed property belonging to Prophet Shepherd Bushiri's Enlightened Christian Gathering (ECG) church's home cell leader.

Violent clashes between students of St Geralds Secondary school Nyakibaale and Makobore High school Kinyasano in Rukungiri. Police fired tear gas and live bullets in the air and arrested some of the students.
25-year-old Muhammad Kanaan succumbed to hiswoundsThursday night, days after he was shot in the head by Israeli forces duringclashesin his hometown of Hizma.
Four youth were injured in clashes between youths and police in Thokarpora village of Pulwama district.
Clashes erupted between youths and police in Rahmoo village of Pulwama district.
A mob in Lilongwe killed a woman after community members accused her of killing a 10-year-old boy through witchcraft.
A man in Nega Village, Muchinga, was hacked to death by villagers wielding machetes, who accused him of practising witchcraft.

source: MENA English (Middle East and North Africa Financial Network)
notes: Some 16 Palestinian citizens early Tuesday were injured inclasheswith Israeli occupation forces near the Bab Al-Asbat and Wadi al Jawz in the occupied Jerusalem.
A Palestinian was shot and seriously injured in the head with live fire by Israeli forces duringclashesthat erupted Monday evening in the town of Hizma.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Sri Lanka (2015-) Special Task Force; Military Forces of Sri Lanka (2015-)
notes: Residents of Karadiyanaru in Batticaloa detained a Police Special Task Force officer on July 24 after a shooting incident that led to the death of a local youth during a raid of illegal sand mining in the lagoon. Police, STF and Army rescued the officer from the captivity of the residents. Six Special Task Force (STF) officers were also hospitalized following a clash with the villagers.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF supporters burned down the huts of a kraal head who supports the MDC-T in Mazowe.

source: PalestineNews & Information Agency (WAFA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: Soldiers clashed with Palestinian residents of the town of al-Khader, south of Bethlehem.

Clashesbroke out on Monday night between Israeli forces and Palestinians in Sair and al-Khader. In Sair, Israeli forces stormed the al-Duwwara area of the town, prompting young men to throw stones at them. Israeli forces fired tear gas and rubber-coated steel bullets at the Palestinians.
A man in Muhanga was beaten to death by a group who accused him of stealing a lemonade.
Rocks were thrown towards Israeli vehicles on the Husan Bypass Road. There were no injuries in any of the attacks, but some of the vehicles sustained damage.
Two Border Police officers were lightly wounded on Sunday evening in a rock-throwingattackin the Qalqiliya area.

Overnight Saturday, Israeli settlers protested near Halamish as scores of Israeli settlers marched in multiple locations, many of them attacking Palestinians in the presence of Israeli forces, though no attacks were reported near Halamish specifically.

assoc_actor_1: ANTUF: All Nepal Trade Union Federation (Revolutionary)
notes: Maoist trade union workers used violence to disrupt the distribution of The Himalayan Times (THT) and the Annapurna Post (AP), and clashed with police. The Maoists landed early morning at Sama Printers (printers of THT and AP) at Bhaisepati, Lalitpur, and forcibly took control of the vehicles loaded with newspapers. The police escorted the vehicles to the main distribution point at Bhugol Park and a clash ensued when the police attempted to recover the newspapers from the delivery boys, who had taken control of the distribution vehicles.

Israeli settlers closed road leading to to the village of Shufa near Tulkarem city, and also closed Route 60 at the entrance of the village of al-Lubban al-Sharqiya. Palestinians said Israelis opened fire on locals and also fired tear gas at Palestinian homes in the village.

Four persons were injured in a clash that broke out between CPI (M) and BJP activists at Powdikonam, near Thiruvananthapuram. The activists engaged in an altercation over flagpoles that had been erected by both the parties in the areas.
Clashes between locals and police erupted in Nidura Nilow village of Kulgam district after forces launched an operation and allegedly began ransacking homes.
On July 23, five people were beaten up by alleged Hindu activists in Aligarh for transporting buffaloes in a "cruel manner".

In the southern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Hebron, Israeli settlers launched a march from the illegal Kiryat Arba settlement and closed the adjacent bypass road. Another group of settlers from Kiryat Arba gathered at the entrances to the Beit Einun village and threw rocks at Palestinian vehicles, with Israeli forces providing protection to the settlers.
Palestinians reportedly threw firebombs near the Giti Avisar junction and near Givat Assaf in Binyamin.
23-year-old Yousef Abbas Kashur, from the town of al-Izariyeh to the east of occupied Jerusalem, was killed duringclasheswith Israeli police.
Dozens of Palestinians were injured on Sunday duringclashesthat broke out with Israeli army forces in the village of Kobar.
Israeli settlers also attacked Palestinian homes in Asira al-Qibliya in the Nablus district.
Israeli settlers also closed the road connecting the village of Huwwara toIsrael'sHuwwara military checkpoint near the illegal Yitzhar settlement south of Nablus city.
Eyewitnesses said that a group of Israeli settlers from the Otniel settlement south of Hebron threw rocks at Palestinian vehicles.

In the southern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Hebron, Israeli settlers launched a march from the illegal Kiryat Arba settlement and closed the adjacent bypass road. Another group of settlers from Kiryat Arba gathered at the entrances to the Beit Einun village and threw rocks at Palestinian vehicles, with Israeli forces providing protection to the settlers.
Tens of Israeli settlers threw rocks at Palestinian vehicles at the entrance of Sarra west of Nablus.
Israeli settlers gathered at the main road near the town of Silwad throwing rocks at Palestinian vehicles.

In Jerusalem, dozens of Palestinians rioted in the Old City and threw rocks at police forces. The offices dispersed the rioters using crowd dispersal measures.Israeli forces injured at least 21 Palestinians on Sunday. 15 of whom were hit by rubber-coated bullets, while at least six were injured after being hit with batons.

source: Ma'an News Agency; The Times of Israel
notes: A Palestinian was lightly hurt by a rubber-coated steel bullet fired by Israeli forces in clashes that took place in Kobar village north of Ramallah in the central occupiedWest Bank, which has been under military closure since one of its residents carried out the deadly stabbingattackat a nearby illegal Israeli settlement the previous night.
A Palestinian was reportedly shot with live ammunition duringclashesthat erupted in the town of al-Mughayyir to the east of Ramallah. He was transferred to hospital for medical treatment.

Israeli settlers from the West Bank settlement of Beit El Saturday night attacked Palestinian-registered vehicles passing near the settlement, with stones. Settler attacks were witnessed in more than one location along the settlement and nearby streets, particularly close to the DCO checkpoint and at Ramallah-Jalazone road. No one was injured in theattacks,however, several cars were reportedly damaged.

source: Agence France Presse; Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: At the Qalandiya crossing between theWest Bankand Jerusalem, at least eight Palestinians were wounded in clashes with Israeli forces. Forces reportedly took over the rooftops of several Palestinian homes near the checkpoint and turned them into military outposts.
At least 20 people were injured on Saturday afternoon in a clash between two supporters' groups of ruling Awami League over establishing supremacy in Tikorpara area of Alinagar union in the upazila.
On July 22, two men allegedly stripped and assaulted a 17-year-old Dalit boy after they were "offended" by his passing their fields in a case of caste violence in Ghirai village of Hisar district.

Jubilee Party campaigns in Mandera turned chaotic after two rival camps clashed at Moi stadium ahead of a rally led by President Uhuru Kenyatta. The two camps, Jubilee supporters and those from the Economic Freedom Party (EFP), hurled stones at each other.
Another Palestinian, 18, died nearby during a clash with Israeli military when a petrol bomb exploded prematurely.

Clashesbetween Palestinians and security forces were renewed Saturday evening when several masked perpetrators hurled rocks at policemen in A-Tur in east Jerusalem. Forces responded with riotdispersal means.
Police said that masked rioters hurled rocks and threw a burning tire down the road in the Jerusalem neighborhood of Isawiya.
A Palestinian was shot and injured during clashes to the east of Khan Younis area, in the southernGazaStrip. The severity of hisinjuryis still unknown.

source: Agence France Presse; Ma'an News Agency
notes: A Palestinian died of wounds suffered in clashes east of Jerusalem. 17-year-old Oday Nawajaa was hit by Israeli live fire at Al-Azariya.
Hundreds of East Jerusalem residents clashed with dozens of armed border guards and police officers in Wadi Joz. Tensions have run high following last week's attack on 2 Israeli police officers.
A Palestinian was reportedly shot in the head with a live bullet in clashes east of al-Bureij refugee camp.

In the Bethlehem-area village of Tuqu, where a Palestinian was killed by Israeli forces on Thursday, several Palestinians were reportedly injured by rubber-coated steel bullets and others suffered of excessive tear gas inhalation during clashes with Israeli forces.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
notes: An 18-year-old was killed in firing after an army patrol mistook a firecracker for a grenade and opened fire on a rioting crowd which was engaged with police in Beerwah. According to the police, the soldiers from 53 Rashtrya Rifles were on foot patrol duties in the Kund village in Beerwah area when at a short distance from their camp they confronted a mob which was engaged in post Friday prayer clashes with paramilitary forces and police. One other person received bullet wounds.
Clashes broke out in some parts of the old city Srinagar between rioters and police after Friday prayers.

On July 21, 24 Kawariyas, four Indo Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel and two police personnel were injured after members of the Muslim community pelted stones on the group of devotees of in the Khallam village of Aliganj Thana region in Bareilly.
Five people are injured in a clash between supporters of Mandago and those of Buzeki. The violence is related to an upcoming campaign.

The Palestinian Red Crescent reported that its medics treated at least 53 Palestinians inclashesin the town of al-Eizariya -- two who were shot with live bullets, 10 who were injured by rubber-coated steel bullets, one who suffered from burns, and 40 who suffered from severe tear gas inhalation.
A Palestinian teenager was killed during clashes in Ras al-Amoud. Witnesses said that the youth was shot by an Israeli settler.
The Palestinian Red Crescent reported that at least five Palestinians were wounded during clashes in the villages of Kafr Qaddum and Jayyus, two of whom were hit with rubber-coated steel bullets.
Clashes also erupted in al-Arrub refugee camp, where Israeli forces reportedly fired tear gas and rubber-coated bullets at Palestinians, who responded by throwing stones.

The Palestinian Red Crescent reported that at least six Palestinians suffered from excessive tear gas inhalation and one suffered from burns inclashesin Tulkarem city. Some 30 Palestinians threw Molotov cocktails in Tulkarem.

At least five people were injured in a factional clash over distributing dormitory seats at Begum Rokeya University Rangpur (BRUR) on Thursday. Supporters of the university's BCL secretary general Kamrul Hasan Nobel and BCL president Imtiaz Basunia locked into clash over the issue, leaving five students injured.

A group of Turkish individuals kicked and threw rocks at a synagogue in the Istanbul province's Beyoglu district to protest Israeli restrictions on Palestinians' entry to the Al-Aqsa Mosque. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
Pro-Gorkhaland agitators burnt down two government offices at Lamahatta in Darjeeling, amid withdrawal of the Army from the Hills on the state government's request.

source: Anadolu Agency (AA); Arutz Sheva; Associated Press International
notes: 36 were injured by rubber bullets inclasheswith Israeli forces Thursday in East Jerusalem.
The death of a Palestinian in Tuqu on Thursday afternoon sparked clashesin which at least one Palestinian was injured.
A man from Muriza was killed for witchcraft.
On 19 July, the head of the faculty of medical technology in Emsalata was attacked. The perpetrators of the attack and the reason behind it were not disclosed.
The "Mankoo Taxawu Senegaal" (MTS) claimed its caravan was attacked by unnamed actors.

Police raided the DRC Mining settlement in Mazowe to round up illegal gold panners. The miners retaliated and attacked the police officers with stones and mining tools. Police officers and miners were injured in the skirmishes.
In a instance of vigilante justice, members of a gang were attacked by an angry crowd. One of the members was killed and 2 injured.
A group of police officers attempted to impound a minibus at a road block, so a group of minibus touts attacked and beat 3 police officers.

At least 7 were injured when a clash between the members of two parties took place in Chailengta after a BJP supporter was assaulted by CPI(M) supporters. With the spread of the news, a large number of BJP supporters rushed to the market and started searching for the CPI(M) supporters, leading to a clash.

A 45-yr-old teacher was killed after being stuck in a political clash between the BJP and the CPM at Chailengta market. The deceased, Babul Majumdar, was returning home from the market when a mob attacked him and killed him on spot. CPM claimed Babul to be a supporter of their party.
An unidentified group set fire to the house of a ward member in Lamkichuha on 18 July 2017. No casualties reported.
Skirmishes took place between police and vendors, who had been evicted from Sidi Boumendil in Tunis. The vendors stoned the police, injuring 2 officers.
Clashes between Palestinians and Israeli Army were reported in Ar-Ram, Abu Dis, Silwan, and Issawiya.
Clashes between Palestinians and Israeli Army were reported in Ar-Ram, Abu Dis, Silwan, and Issawiya.

Resident of Atail and Gandhra villages attacked discom officials at their office in Sampla township, Rohtak district on July 18 over erratic power supply. Some discom officials were injured in the incident.

Communal tension flared up in Aligarh after a group belonging to a minority community attacked and torched the house of a man from the other community in which four women were badly burnt. Villagers clashed with the attackers forcing them to flee on July 18.
A Trinamul office, which had earlier been vandalised in Darjeeling town, was set on fire again by GJM supporters.

A British-era community hall was torched by suspected Gorkhaland supporters in Kurseong, as part of the ongoing violence. They also tried to burn a lodge belonging to the state tourist department, but the flames were doused.

14 Palestinians were wounded in clashes between worshipers and the Israeli forces after the evening prayers in Bab al-Asbat gate on Tuesday. One is reportedly in a serious condition. A stampede occured during the clashes where rubber bullets and sound bombs were used.

source: MENA English (Middle East and North Africa Financial Network); Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: Violent clasheserupted early Tuesday between Palestinians and Israeli occupation forces in Beit Ummar town north of theWest Bankcity of Hebron. A number of the town's citizens suffered suffocation due to inhaling tear gas fired by the occupation forces.
Clashes between Palestinians and Israeli Army were reported in Ar-Ram, Abu Dis, Silwan, and Issawiya.
Clashes between Palestinians and Israeli Army were reported in Ar-Ram, Abu Dis, Silwan, and Issawiya.
Scuffles broke out at the Musenyi market, when the police tried to shut down the stalls. A mob of traders tore the uniform of the police chief.
In Siqalo informal settlement near Mitchells Plain two people who were stoned to death for allegedly stealing a cellphone.
Police said Monday evening that some 200 Palestinians tried to block an Old City road and threw stones at officers who dispersed them.
Villagers attacked a team of discom officials who had gone to Kheri Meham, Meham town of Rohtak district on July 17 to investigate power theft.

One civilian was injured, and later died, when army men allegedly opened fire during an altercation between army personnel and stone-pelting shopkeepers over the assault of a motorcyclist in Goriwan market of Bijbehara.
When a police officer at a roadblock caused a minibus to crash, angry pedestrians attacked and beat the police officer.
Irate villagers set several poultry shops ablaze in Keswari on 17 July 2017 following the desecration of temples in the area.

Violence erupted when a BSES team, accompanied by the police, went to Jhuljhuli village, near Najafgarh in south west Delhi, on July 17 to investigate power theft. While the police kept the rioting villagers under control a mob armed with rods and hockey sticks chased the BSES team, leading to an accident that killed an engineer and injured three others.
Gorkhaland protesters torched a forest rest house at Gorubathan after a GJM member was killed in police firing in Mirik.
Gorkhaland protesters torched a Land Revenue office at Kalimpong after a GJM member was killed in police firing in Mirik.
Clashes broke out at Mirik between TMC and Gorkha Janmukti Morcha supporters. Police arrived later and arrest 1 GJM member involved in the clashes.

Following a suicide blast against a Maiduguri mosque, youths in the area, angered by recent bombings protest, attacked officials of the Borno State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), who were on rescue mission at the scene of a suicide bomb attack in Maiduguri. The youths believed the group had not done enough to provide adequate security to the area. No injuries reported
Two groups of youths clashed at a displaced persons camp in Bentiu "recently." Source dated 17/07. Twenty injured. The nature of the unrest is not known.
Karoi residents rioted and destroyed the shop of a Karoi businessman who had paid a man to behead his sister. The police intervened to protect the businessman.
More clashes were reported in Issawiya and Silwan. The Palestinian Red Crescent said that at least 50 were injured.
More clashes were reported in Issawiya and Silwan. The Palestinian Red Crescent said that at least 50 were injured.

An angry mob of believers attacked a police station in Fateh Jang, Punjab to free a spiritual healer after he was arrested by the law enforcers on Sunday. They burnt documents and threatened to burn the entire building if their leader was not released.
On 16 July in al-Warraq, one person was killed when security forces clashed with squatters as they tried to evict them from 'unlicensed buildings'. 56 people were injured, including 37 policemen.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU-PF supporters stoned a truck carrying MDCT support to a rally in Epworth. 2 MDCT supporters were injured.

assoc_actor_1: UFDG: Union of Democratic Forces of Guinea
notes: Clashes are reported between presidential and opposition supporters.

Israeli forces blocked off the main entrances to the villages of Beit Einon and Sair east of Hebron city Sunday night, after a Molotov cocktail was reportedly thrown at the main road near the Beit Einon junction.

source: Agence France Presse; Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA)
notes: Israelreopen Al Aqsa Sunday but the Waqf called for a boycott of the new security measures resulting in hundreds gathering outside of the mosque. Violent clashes broke out injuring 4 people. Israeli police have banned since Sunday the entry of Islamic Waqf personnel to the al-Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem.
3 people were injured when a clash erupted between two groups of Chandio community women over a petty matter in Absani village, near Bhan Syedabad.
9 were injured after a clash erupted between two groups of the Malik community over a matrimonial issue in Hamid Malik village, near Ubauro. Both sides used crude weapons in the clash.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
The car of the ODM governor of Mombasa was attacked by a mob of people. One of the ODM supporters in the car was attacked and kicked by the rioters. As the car drove away it was pelted with stones.

Six persons were injured and several vehicles were damaged in stone pelting during a clash between Hindu and Muslim groups over ownership of a disputed land near a mosque in Varanasi on July 15. Police cane charged the clashing groups and used tear gas.

Violence continued in the Hills, with Gorkhaland supporters attacking a police convoy of three vehicles in Mirik's Gayabari. While two vehicles were damaged extensively and the assailants doused one with petrol, they didn't succeed in setting it ablaze.
Violence continued in the Hills, with Gorkhaland supporters setting ablaze a panchayat office in Singringtam in the Rangli Rangliot block.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front; Government of Zimbabwe (1987-)
notes: A group of ZANU youths, led by the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Mbwembwe, stormed Chipunga Farm, near Marondera, to evict the farmer.
Israeli settlers threw stones Friday at Palestinian registered cars passing by the village of al-Fardis to the east of Bethlehem. No injuries were reported.
Three youth were injured while fourteen others were detained on Friday during clashes in old town area of Anantnag after Friday prayers.
Clashes erupted in the Chatapora area of Pulwama town between youths and police after Friday prayers.
Many were injured when clashes erupted in multiple places in Srinigar between youths and police after Friday prayers.
On Jul. 14, two workers of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) were attacked, allegedly by a group of CPI(M) workers, at Kannambathukarayil in Thiruvallur district.

On Jul. 14, in response to the attack, the day before between CPI (M) and the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML), four motorbikes belonging to the CPI (M) were also set ablaze on Jul. 15, at least 25 vehicles including cars and motorbikes were damaged in the violence between the hostile parties.
At least 5 ABVP supporters were injured after a clash between the ABVP and left backed student wing SFI supporters at Bir Bikram Memorial College of Agartala.
A Palestinian was killed Friday duringclasheswith Israeli forces in Dheisheh refugee camp. He was shot in the chest during the clashes.

Israeli forces injured more than 20 Palestinians on Friday night in the town of Abu Dis in the occupiedWest Bank'sJerusalem district afterclasheserupted between Palestinians and Israeli forces during araid.

Two student groups clashed at the Hardy Advanced Technological Institute in Ampara on July 13, after a group of students had barricaded the Hardy College Director's office for several hours preventing him from leaving. Several students injured during the clash had been admitted to hospital. The Police had been called to disperse the students and rescue the Director.

On July 13, a group of Kshatriyas clashed with people from Bharwads community at Soladi in Surendranagar district leaving one dead in the caste clash. The violence was related to killing of Indrasinh Zala, a former president of Dharngadhra nagarpalika.
2 journalists were attacked by an unidentified group in Jorabat on 13 July 2017.

At least two persons killed and five seriously injured in Morbi district of Gujarat following a clash between Rajput and Bharwad castes on Thursday night. Even after a day of the incident, tension still prevailed at Shaktinagar village near Halvad town situated in Morbi district.
On July 13, members of the SAD and the Congress were involved in a clash that left 5 people with burn and sharp weapon injuries.

On July 13, in Chennai, in a shocking incident, unidentified actors hurled a petrol bomb at a police station in Chennai in the early hours. Police sources said the unidentified actors, who were said to have come in a two-wheeler, hurled the bomb at the parking lot of the Teynampet Police station on the arterial Anna Salai in the city. There were no injuries.
Police officers used tear gas canisters to disperse youths who were throwing stones at a NASA convoy during a rally in Thika.
NASA leaders were attacked by Jubilee supportes who threw stones at their convoy in Githurai during a NASA rally. Some bodyguards shoot in the air to disperse the youths before driving off.

Hundreds of mourners gathered to pay respects to a seven year-old girl who was raped and killed in an act of violence. As soon as the identity of the suspect was disclosed to the public, angry people gathered outside the suspect's shop (where he had kidnapped the victim) and set fire to the property.

In an alleged incidence of communal violence a Muslim family of 10 (comprising women, children, elderly and a teenager with disability) was assaulted and abused by a mob on board the Shikohabad-Kasganj passenger train near Mainpuri late on July 12. Many of the victims suffered severe injuries.

"Some days ago [from 16/07]," a vigilante mob of Kadara youths attacked and killed a suspected criminal at Banono. The victim was Fulani, and the attack launched a larger communal conflict in the following week.

assoc_actor_2: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; RSS: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh
notes: Hours after workers belonging to the Communist Party of India-Marxist (CPM) were injured in a bomb attack in Kerala's Kannur district, the BJP committee office and RSS Karyalaya was set on fire by CPM in Kakkampara. Time precision 2 because an exact date was not specified.

A Jubilee candidate running for Kirimari Ward seat in Embu County was admitted to hospital when he fell unconscious minutes after he was hit with a microphone by a supporter of his rival. This was after a group of about 10 people, carrying posters of the rival candidate shouted at the Jubilee candidate .

Residents at Sh Osman neighbourhood and municipal police briefly clashed as a result of a municipal operation that cleared a road that was partially blocked by temporary structures. There were no reports of casualties during the incident.

Clashesbroke out late Monday night between young Palestinian men and Israeli forces who stormed the village of Kifl Haris in central occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Salfit to escort hundreds of Israeli settlers on a visit to pray at a Jewish holy site.
Palestinians threw rocks at an Israeli bus passing by a West Bank village of Luban Ash-Sharqiya. No one was injured, but that the window of the bus was shattered.
Unknown people set fire to an old woman's home in Mairo residential area of Torit. The motives are unclear.
Some leaders of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) beat up the Rajshahi University (RU) correspondent of a an English daily in a violent attack in front of the university on Monday.
A man from Isiolo was attacked by a mob at a market near Maua. The police intervened, but he died shortly afterwards.
Residents of Kiderege gathered with machetes to protest the land distribution between residents and returnees. The crowd clashed with returnees, and had to be broken up by the police.
A Muslim man was attacked by Buddhist nationalists in Meikhtila township after he was overheard in his home discussing religious issues. A crowd of extremist Buddhist monks then attacked him.
A mob in Limbe has killed a man who masqueraded as a prostitute to rob people.

On Jul. 10, 2 groups clash in Kannankurichi area in Salem city, over the issue of fireworks during a funeral procession; 3 vehicles were damaged in stone pelting, while also the mourners attacked a shop owner and his sons.

A group of students identifying themselves as members of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) allegedly beat up the principal of Alokdia Amaresh Basu College and ransacked the office in Sadar upazila demanding a large sum of money on Sunday.

Clashes erupted between the works of the PPP and Muttahida Qaumi Movement-Pakistan at a public school in Chanesar Goth, Karachi, when a PPP candidate was refused entry into a polling station despite 'having an EPC letter'.

Communal tension gripped Satpuli town, Uttarakhand on July 9 as activists of Bajrang Dal and other right-wing organisations vandalised a vegetable shop belonging to the family of a minor who allegedly posted an 'offensive' picture of the Kedarnath shrine on Facebook.
Fresh attacks on public property were reported in the Darjeeling hills as rioters torched an abandoned police outpost and barracks as part of the ongoing violence.

A 13-year-old Palestinian from the occupied East Jerusalem neighborhood of Issawiya lost his eye on Sunday after Israeli forces fired a sponge-tipped bullet at the teenager duringclashesbetween Palestinians and Israeli forces in the neighborhood.

In Kotowali, one person has been killed in a clash between two groups of illegal occupiers of Bangladesh Railway (BR) lands, who have constructed slums on the lands they have occupied, here in the port city. The clash occurred over dispute with regard to giving power connections to the illegal slums on Sunday night.
A 30-year-old man, accused of raping a minor girl in Meghalaya, was lynched to death by a mob in Nongkseh village of Shillong.

The service held at Ssebaanas ancestral home in Luweero district was interrupted by fights between warring factions of the Democratic Party, one that pays allegiance to the party president Norbert Mao and another aligned to Kampala Lord Mayor Erias Lukwago.
One person died during a clash between some supporters of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and National Democratic Party (NDC) on Saturday at Sankore. Two people were arrested .
Clashes between sector 5 and sector 1 youngsters were reported: prompted by the undressing of a traditional "mask", violence erupted triggering significant material damages.

source: Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA); Ma'an News Agency
notes: Israeli settlers Friday attacked Palestinians passing through Barta military checkpoint, west of Jenin and broke the windshield of one car.
Clashes were reported from Anantnag after Friday prayers. The rioters pelted stones on security forces, who burst smoke shells and resorted to a lathi-charge.

On 7 July 2017, Teetaw (Tei Taw) Village, Sagaing Region, a mob attacked Christians for about four hours after they had refused to re-convert to Buddhism. The police intervened. Two houses, two motorcycles and bicycles were damaged. Twelve people fled the village. Four people were injured.

Supporters of the Samajwadi Party (SP) and the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) clashed in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur on July 7 after a small dispute on right of way escalated into violent clash. Police baton charged the rioters.

Israeli forces injured two Palestinians, one of whom was shot with live fire, on Friday in the besieged Gaza Strip after clashes erupted near the border with Israel east of the town of Jabalia in the northern part of Gaza.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: After a leadership struggle in a housing cooperative, a faction of ZANU PF youths demolished all of the structures built by members of the other faction.
A vigilante mob tortured to death an alleged motorcycle thief in Gujranwala.

Hindu mobs attacked a dargah and vandalised shops with Muslim owners, forcing the police to resort to caning and firing tear gas shells. Local sources said some Hindus were angered by alleged vandalism on a temple in the area a day ago.

A scuffle broke out between BJP workers and Trinamool supporters at the RG Kar Hospital premises, Kolkata, with the Trinamool workers bent on preventing BJP workers and leaders from meeting the family members of a man killed in the mob unrest.

actor2: Police Forces of South Africa (1994-) Prison Guards
notes: The Department of Correctional Services (DCS) says a Kgosi Mampuru II official and a prisoner were injured after violence erupted at the correctional facility.
One Rohingya man was killed and six wounded when they were attacked by Rakhine Buddhists with bricks in Sittwe.

Violent clashes erupted Monday morning between illegal merchants on the road at Al Kherba Square on Al Jazeera Street and law enforcement agencies to prevent them from occupying public space. Rioters threw stones while the police answered with teargas. 47 rioters were arrested.

10 were injured when a clash erupted between two groups of Khaskheli and Sehto communities in Talti on Monday. In the clash people of both groups attacked each other with the sticks and metal rods which resulted in severe injuries to ten men.
At least two rioters were hit with bullets after forces opened fire to disperse the stone pelting rioters near an encounter site at Bahmnoo village of Pulwama district.
On July 3, Officials of the Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN), including an SDO, were assaulted by a local BJP leader after they detected power theft at his house.

On July 3, in Darjeeling, unidentified persons used a petrol bomb to set ablaze a parked police van at 6th Mile in Darjeeling, as part of ongoing violence in the area. Police later arrested four GJM supporters at Kurseong.
A physical fight between the two Democratic Party groups was engaged at Ssebaana's vigil, prompting the Makindye Mayor to order police and some DP youths to drive them out of the vicinity.

Communal clashes broke out in Baduria, North 24 Paraganas district over an "objectionable" Hindu post on Facebook. Angry mobs vandalised Hindu homes and shops at Baduria, set fire to vehicles, and blockaded major roads. They also set the police station on fire.
Angry Muslim mobs set fire to shops and houses belonging to Hindus in Golabari following an "objectionable" Hindu post by a local on Facebook.
Angry Muslim mobs set fire to shops and houses belonging to Hindus in Swarupnagar, following an "objectionable" Hindu post by a local on Facebook.
Angry Muslim mobs set fire to shops and houses belonging to Hindus in Taki, following an "objectionable" Hindu post by a local on Facebook.
Angry Muslim mobs set fire to shops and houses belonging to Hindus in Tentulia following an "objectionable" Hindu post by a local on Facebook.

Locals came out on roads and attacked security forces with stones after the latter cordoned off Malangpora village during a search operation for militants. Police retaliated with smoke shells. Reports say that the militants managed to escape thanks to the riots.
A few Palestinians threw stones at a car, injuring the Israeli driver, on Arabs on Highway 60 near Hebron on July 2.
Suspected Gorkha activists torched Kami development board in Kalimpong as part of the ongoing unrest in the area.

source: Ma'an News Agency; The Times of Israel
notes: Dozens of Palestinians were injured, at least one seriously, on Sunday evening in occupied East Jerusalem when the funeral for a Palestinian who drowned three days earlier devolved intoclashes.
An angry crowd attacked a killed a man accused of raping a girl in the district of Antsiranana II.

At least 19 people were injured in a clash between two groups of villagers at Sarole village in Lohagara upazila on Saturday night. Police said two groups of villagers -- one led by Alam and the other led by Khokan -- had been at loggerheads over establishing dominance in the area.

Two demonstrators were shot dead after hundreds of them moved towards and ongoing encounter site between LeT militants and security forces in Brenti-Batpora village in Dialgam, Anantnag. It is unclear whether they were killed in the cross fire, or shot by police as they pelted stones on them.
A clash broke out between Dalits and upper cast Darbars at Gadhsisa town of Mandvi taluka in Kutch on July 1 over some issue.

A clash broke out between Dalits and upper cast Darbars at Gadhsisa town of Mandvi taluka in Kutch on Saturday afternoon over some issue. A couple of shops and vehicles were torched and houses damaged in the town. The dispute began with altercation between students from both communities and later escalated to rioting by mobs from both groups. Police rushed to the spot to control the situation.
On Jul. 01, as many as 4 civilians suffered injuries in a clash over earmarking a road for a Dalit colony at Gaddebindenahalli in Channarayapatna Taluk.

In Patiala a mob on July 1 went on a rampage in the home district of chief minister Captain Amarinder Singh, after a man who was injured in a clash between two groups, died at a hospital. The police used a baton charge to control the rioters.
Vigilantes kill a man they suspect of being involved in gang activity.

A clash between residents of the village of Aliouat and employees of the delegation of Jelma on Friday at the headquarters of the delegation, caused thirteen wounded. The inhabitants of Aliouat came to demand the restoration of electricity in their village. Discussions escalated between staff and protestors who verbally and physically assaulted three employees, ransacked equipment and threatened to burn the premises. The assaulted employees called their relatives to help them, which led to a general fight.
Scores of youth clashes with security forces in the main bazaar of Sopore town after Friday congregational prayers.
A clash between two groups broke out at Deeru ki Majri locality of Patiala City on June 30, leading to the death of a youth.
On May 30, Gurjars were preparing to attack the Dalits in Loiya village in the Daurala area and used mild force to make people stay indoors.

Youths injured an NTV cameraman and stoned vehicles after a rally addressed by Nasa leader Raila Odinga in Migori town ended. At least 10 vehicles were pelted with stones, including one belonging to the Nation Media Group. The youths barricaded the road at Posta roundabout and attacked motorists on the highway. Police used teargas to disperse them.
Israeli bulldozers entered Jenin to remove a memorial to a a high profile Palestinian fighter, sparkingclashesin which six Palestinians were wounded.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.
Rioters invaded the seat of the local government in Sbiba and damaged some cars. The police used teargas to dispere the rioters and arrested 8 of them.

source: Jordan News Agency (Petra); Ma'an News Agency
notes: Dozens of settlers on Thursday stormed "Joseph Tomb" east of theWest Bankcity of Nablus, under heavy protection of the Israeli forces. Confrontations burst out in the area between the Israeli soldiers and young Palestinians.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.
Two brothers and suspected thieves who belonged to the Mahadalit community, were beaten to death by about 20 people at Basdiha village under Kochas police station in Rohtas district.
A man was lynched in Thadihat village under Ramgarh police station in Dumka district for allegedly raping and murdering an 8-year-old girl. He was tied to a tree and beat to death.

Villagers assaulted a team of from BSES Rajdhani Power Limited villagers in outer Delhi's Mundka on June 29 where they had gone to check instances of power theft. Three BSES officials and one Delhi Police sub-inspector were injured and scores of vehicles damaged in the incident.

A group of army soldiers raped a number of women who were collecting water at a well near Golo in Rokoro locality, Central Darfur. People in the area rushed to the scene and beat the rapists with sticks and stones, killing one of them, and wounding others. The soldiers retreated to the military garrison of Golo but later besieged the area, firing bullets that reportedly killed 11 people, raiding houses, shops and markets, and robbing people of their belongings.

Israeli forces shot and injured at least three young Palestinians with rubber-coated steel bullets during dawnraidsin two separate occupiedWest Bankvillages on Thursday. In Beit Ummar, a tear gas canister ignited a fire just outside a residential home sparking clashes.
An Israeli armyraidin the Ramallah-area village of Bilin on Thursday morning also led toclashes, in which two Palestinians were injured.
Students attacked and killed a person on campus in Mahajanga suspected of thievry.
A suspected street gang member is attacked and killed by a group of vigilantes "earlier this week," source dated 01/07.
The family of a young guy who was arrested by the police attacked the police station using stones et al. Two policemen were injured during the clashes.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: A dispute between the cadres of the Nepali Congress and CPN-UML at a voting centre in Jay Prithivi Bahadur Municipality-3 of Bajhang district turned into a violent clash, leading to at least one injury and the suspension of voting.

A fight over public urination snowballed into communal clashes between people from two communities in Akota, Vadodara on June 28. At least three persons were injured in the stone-pelting and 16 vehicles were damaged in the violence.

assoc_actor_1: SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India
notes: On June 28, in Dindigul, police resorted to lathicharge to quell clash between two groups over ferrying of cattle at Palani, on Wednesday. Jeer of Sri Chendalankara Senbaga Mannar Jeeyar Trust, Mannargudi way laid a vehicle transporting seven calves to Udumalpet from Manapparai and handed over it to the Palani Taluk Police for taking action against the driver for ferrying the cattle without adhering to government norms. The vehicle was impounded, and cadres of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi (VCK) and left parties laid a siege to the police station demanding immediate release of the impounded vehicle transporting the cattle.

Clashes erupted during a raidin Abu Dis, where Israeli soldiers fired rubber-coated steel bullets, stun grenades, and tear-gas canisters into the town before withdrawing to a nearby Israeli military post.
Israeli forces raided the town of Beit Ummar sparking clashes that left several locals suffering from tear gas inhalation and the window of a house blasted by a tear gas bomb.

The residence of the joint secretary general of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) was allegedly vandalized by Jubo League activists in Ramganj of the district on Tuesday night. At least 10 LDP activists were also injured as they came under attack by the Jubo League men.
A mentally challenged woman was lynched on suspicions of child trafficking at Sekendra village in West Bengal's Murshidabad district.
Running battles reported between NRM supporters and police at Kasangati trading centre after the arrest of Bobi Wine - Kyagulanyi.

Students of Narayana Junior Residential College at Nizampet in Hyderabad allegedly vandalised college premises on Tuesday for reportedly denying outing. Students of second intermediate locked up the staff of the college and pelted stones on the building later damaging windowpanes, ransacking office furniture as well as classrooms over the attitude of college authorities disallowing repeated requests by students seeking permission for an outing. On seeming the mob of students, the college staff alerted police, who reached the college and dispersed them.

On June 27, police party in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar was attacked by locals when they were conducting a raid based on information of cow slaughter in Nagar Kotwali area. Stones were pelted at the police party and their police vehicle was also vandalised.
Clashes between police and Dire youth: 2 wounded.

A Palestinian was on Tuesday injured by Israeli army fire duringclashes which erupted in the village of al-Mughayer after the army notified some of the village's residents of their intention to demolish their homes. The army also banned entry and exit from the village from 6:00pm to 1:00am.

During aviolent raidinto al-Duheisha refugee camp at least eight Palestinians were injured, including six who were shot with live fire in the legs. Clashes erupted between Israeli soldiers and local youth at the entrances of the camp, with Israeli forces firing rubber-coated steel bullets, live bullets, and tear-gas bombs.
In clashes between rioters and police forces in Imzouren around 29 policemen were injured.
A man accused of witchcraft was killed by villagers in the district of Karonga.
Five persons were injured when cadres of Nepali Congress affiliated Tarun Dal and CPN (Maoist Center) affiliated YCL clashed at Sisne Village Council-5 in Rukum district.
On 26 June, a land dispute in Uchahar village with people from Sangramgarh in Raibareli district (UP) left 5 people dead.
Clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Achabal after Eid prayers.
Five policemen, including a senior officer, were injured in Anantnag after rioters took on the security forces in the Janglat Mandi area immediately after Eid prayers.
Clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Kulgam after Eid prayers.

Several people were injured when clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Pattan after Eid prayers. The security forces used tear smoke shells and pellet shotguns to disperse the rioters.
Clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Pulwama after Eid prayers.
Clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Shopian after Eid prayers.

Several people were injured when clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Sopore after Eid prayers. The security forces used tear smoke shells and pellet shotguns to disperse the rioters.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: 2 CRPF trooper were injured, and several rioters, after clashes broke out between rioters and security forces in Srinagar following Eid prayers. The security forces used tear smoke shells and pellet shotguns to disperse rioters.

Five Haredim harassed undercover police officers disguised as soldiers in Mea Shearim. As police officers arrested the five Haredi suspects, a crowd gathered around the policemen and threw objects and eggs at them. There were no injuries.

A septuagenarian man was killed in a clash between two groups of villagers at Bahara village in Moksedpur upazila on Sunday morning.Two groups of villagers -- one led by Sarwar and the other led by Abu Tayeb -- had been at loggerheads over establishing supremacy in the area
Six persons were injured and several vehicles damaged when the meeting of Bhilistan Tiger Sena (BTS) turned violent in with locals of Sagdol village of Karjan tehsil on June 25.
37 people were injured in clashes between CPM and BJM cadres in Belonia that were triggered after police allegedly stopped BJP workers from carrying out a pre-scheduled rally .

Security forces evacuated an unauthorized site in theWest Banksettlement of Yitzhar. Locals arrived at the scene and hurled rocks at security forces, blocked traffic arteries and were aggressive towards security forces, who arrested three.

Four are dead in a "illegal structure" removal operation in a Suleja suburb. It was reported that many [residents] offered "stiff resistance" to the removal, as police fired bullets to push them away.
3 Palestinians threw stones at a Jewish man as he was leaving morning Shabbat prayers at the tomb of Shimon Hatzaddick.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Two Nepali Congress canvassers were injured in a clash with CPN-UML canvassers at Budhiganga Municipality-3 in Bajura.
An unruly mob of examinees vandalized the railway station at the north Bihar district headquarters town of Muzaffarpur after they failed to board a train to take them to their exams.

assoc_actor_2: NSUI: National Students' Union of India
notes: A clash broke out between the activists of NSUI and ABVP inside Ramjas College (Delhi University North Campus) on June 24 while they tried to woo students to join their outfits
Jubilee and KANU supporters clashed during a rally led by Uasin Gishu Governor Jackson Mandago in Kabarnet, Baringo on Saturday.

A number of Palestinians suffocated on Saturday during clashes with Israeli forces in Jenin's refugee camp. Israeli forces stormed the camp, amid heavy firing of rubber-coated steel bullets, live ammunition, tear gas canisters, and stun grenades against the camp's residents, leading to several suffocation cases among them.

At least 25 people were injured during a tripartite clash involving police, Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) and local Jubo League men in the district town on Friday in Chandpur town. The clash ensued following an altercation over the interception. At one stage a policeman allegedly assaulted a BCL man and seized the three motorcycles.
Two TMC factions clashed with makeshift bombs of control of the area in Basanti, South-24 Parganas district, leading to a few injuries.
An irate mob tried to set on fire a guard post in Pulwama but were chased away by the cops on duty who fired shells at them. They returned fired with stones.
Clashes erupted between rioters and security forces in Sopore town after Friday prayers.

A Deputy Superintendent of Police was stripped naked and lynched to death by a mob after he allegedly opened fire at a group of stone pelters who had caught him clicking pictures of them near the Srinagar's Jamia Masjid. Afterwards the mob began targeting empty security pickets erected in the area, following which police reinforcement were rushed in to restore normalcy.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU PF supporters from different factions clashed at a ZANU rally in Macheke, at which Joel Biggie Matiza was supposed to speak. The police intervened to break up the clashes.

A violent incident between refugees living at Um Sangour camp, White Nile, led to seven deaths and four refugees injured at some point between 16-30 June. Local authorities intervened to secure the site and prevent further escalation.

A Palestinian teenager was injured with live fire on Friday as Israeli forces suppressed the weekly march in the village of Kafr Qaddum in the northern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Qalqiliya. Clashes reportedly broke out after the raid.
The shack of a 28-year-old security guard was burnt down by angry residents of Town Two, Khayelitsha, following allegations of child rape.
A group of 30 young members of Lehava beat three Palestinian youths in downtown Jerusalem, sending one to the hospital.

Some unidentified people attacked journalists at a press conference arranged by a faction of Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) on Thursday. The incident took place at the district unit office of the party at Post Office Road in Pirojpur. Around 50 people suddenly attacked them with iron pipes and sticks in the presence of police. They saved themselves by locking the door of the office. Police rescued the journalists after they contacted high officials over phone.

A clash broke out between two groups during a forum held at the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute (SLFI) in Colombo on June 22 over the Southern Asian Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) issue. A medical doctor was injured and admitted to the National Hospital.

Clashes in the town of Bir Lahfey, governorate of Sidi Bouzid, between young people and the police took place. One policeman died of the injuries he suffered during the confrontation. The inhabitants of the region are angry after the death of one of their own in a brawl at the weekly market. The 23-year-old was fatally stabbed to the heart after a dispute with a group of youngsters. Clashes broke out between Awled Youssef and the Frechiches. The police intervened to disperse the crowd. Currently tires are on fire in several streets of the city and clashes are underway with the police.

actor2: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
notes: 1 civilian was killed, and 65 others wounded, when security forces returned fire on stone pelting locals who had targeted security forces to help the trapped LeT militants they were engaged with during an encounter in New Colony Kakapora. The rioting continued after the event had ended, and three militants were killed.

A scuffle broke out between Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Sukhpal Khaira, Simarjeet Singh Bains and Balwinder Bains of Lok Insaf Party with security officials outside Punjab Assembly on June 22 after they were forcibly removed from the building.

One young guy died in a brawl at the weekly market. The 23-year-old was fatally stabbed to the heart after a dispute with a group of youngsters. Clashes broke out between Awled Youssef and the Frechiches. The relatives of the deceased took revenge by setting fire to two dwellings belonging to the opposing group.
On June 22, three people were lynched by locals in Chopra police station area (Uttar Dinajpur, West Bengal), after they were caught stealing cows from a house. [size=large number]
A community attacked and beat up 2 young men in Salvokop in Pretoria.

Clashes occurred on the evening of Wednesday 21 June between street vendors and agents of the Sahel transport company in Bab Bhar in Sousse. The clashes broke out after the a guard was aggressed by a street vendor. The security units intervened and used tear gas to disperse the crowd. Security reinforcements were deployed.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Representatives of the government and MONUSCO had travelled to Kasenyi to hold workshops promoting peace. An angry crowd attacked the delegation's hotel, injuring 2 officials and damaging MONUSCO vehicles.
Two suspected criminals were killed in Mishomoroni by a mob.
Two groups of residents clashed over electricity and water. Both sides blamed each other for initiating the fight.
Israeli soldiers invaded Abu Dis and clashed with local youths, wounding three with rubber-coated steel bullets, and causing twenty-six others to suffer the severe effects of teargas inhalation.

A group of Haredim pelted police with stones, eggs and other objects while officers tried to remove three Israeli soldiers who were being verbally attacked at evening services in Jerusalem neighborhood, Meah Shearim, Wednesday night.
Rocks were allegedly thrown at Israeli settlers' vehicles on Route 375, near the Husan village.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure were trying to force people to 'donate' their harvest to the ruling party. The people in Yaranda rioted against the Imbonerakure's imposition, injuring 3 of the Imbonerakure.
Youths and Hausa traders clash after a tax was demanded of them. It is not clear if the youths were representatives of the government. Two dead and a church was destroyed in the melee.
Settlers early Tuesday attacked Palestinian cars near the settlement of Shavei Shomron.
Clasheserupted between Israeli forces and Palestinian residents in the village of Sair during which an Israeli military vehicle was set on fire.
On 20 June, a group of cow vigilantes assaulted alleged cow smugglers after stripping them and tying them up in Etah town (Uttar Pradesh). [size=no report]

Students from Kirimon Primary School in Samburu West Sub County attacked and injured three female teachers in protest against being punished by female teachers. The school was closed after the attack.
18 people were arrested in Soanierana Ivongo as a angry crowd clashed with members of a christian groups. 12 people were injured and a temple was set alight.

The driver of a Sikkim-bound truck, was severely injured when suspected Gorkha Janmukti Morcha (GJM) supporters set the vehicle on fire on NH 10 at Setijora, about 37 km from Kalimpong on Monday afternoon as the agitation for a separate state of Gorkhaland continued.

Army personel clashed withh locals in Ashtengoo village of Bandipora district after their cavalcade was pelted with stones by locals. The residents alleged that army men broke window-panes of residential houses and damaged several vehicles parked on the roadside.
A youth was injured when a vehicle of security forces passing through Dugbam village in Pulwama was attacked by stone pelters and opened fire in order to secure their way.

At least four houses were torched and shops were looted at Ga-Mothapo village east of Polokwane after a man was stabbed to death at a local tavern. Some of the some residents started throwing stones at the officers.
Two Palestinian minors were shot and injured on Monday, and at least 25 others suffocated duringclasheswith Israeli forces in Abu Dis town to the east of occupied Jerusalem.

Israeli forces shot and injured three Palestinians and detained two others during araid Sunday into Deir Abu Mashaal, which remained under lockdown after three men from the village were shot dead while carrying out anattackin Jerusalem on Friday. Israeli troops stormed the village, sparking clashes with residents.

Settlers from the settlement of Halamish northwest of Ramallah threw stones at a number of Palestinian vehicles, in the presence of Israeli military forces, who did nothing to intervene. No injuries were reported.
Settlers from Yitzhar settlement in the district of Nablus reportedly obstructed Israeli army vehicles and pelted them with stones in two separate incidents.
Clashes between merchants and police forces following a "security operation" by the Safinatoul Amane's Dahira: they threw eachothers teargas and stones. Two merchants wounded.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: CPN-UML cadre Hansa Rawat died when cadres of the CPN-UML and Nepali Congress clashed at Cheddaha Village Council in Bajura district.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
assoc_actor_2: CPN(MC): Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre)
notes: Cadres of the CPN-UML and CPN (Maoist-Centre) clashed in Baijanath of Banke district, apparently after Maoist Centre's cadres started addressing the public near the UML's ongoing assembly venue.

Two policemen were severely injured in a clash between two groups following a land dispute here on June 18. The incident took place in the Putli Ghar area in Amritsar when a local resident Karaj Singh, who was over-seeing construction work on a site, was allegedly assaulted by one Surinder Chaudhary claiming ownership for the same piece of land.
Three are set ablaze in mob action for allegedly stealing mobile phones.
Following the killing of a suspected street gang members, area youths mobilize and burn the house of the suspected perpetrator's father. No human causality reported.

Scuffles broke out between Musaga bus drivers, who wanted to attend the funeral of a fellow bus driver killed in a grenade attack on 14/6, and police and council authorities, who tried to force the drivers to attend community work instead. 4 bus drivers were arrested during the scuffles.

Stones were thrown at an IDF ambulance on Saturday by settlers, after IDF medical staff arrived in the Samaria town of Yitzhar to treat a woman suffering from dehydration. No one was hurt but the ambulance was damaged.
An Israeli assaulted a Palestinian resident of the Wadi Qaddum neighborhood of occupied East Jerusalem on an unspecified date over the weekend at a gas station.
NASA and Jubilee supporters clashed and threw stones at each other during Odinga's rally in Mutuati, in Meru.

source: Palestine News & Information Agency (WAFA); The Times of Israel
notes: Palestinian residents of a Ramallah-area village Deir Abu Mashal clashed Saturday with Israeli soldiers, who cordoned off the village.

Two persons, including a woman, were killed and 15 others injured in a clash that took place between two rival families at Char Sirta village in Sadar upazila of the district on Saturday. There had been a long-standing dispute between Hafiz Uddin and his neighbor Helal Uddin over land use in the area.
Stone-pelting youth clashed with police after an ecounter between security forces erupted in Doniwari village of Budgam district.

A petrol bomb was hurled at the office of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI (M)) in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The culprits are hitherto unidentified. The incident occurred in the early hours of Saturday morning. There were no casualties.
Violence spread out as a debt between prisoners was not paid back. Police intervention brought the situation back to normal.

At least four policemen were hurt during a clash that resulted from a hawker eviction drive in Chittagong's New Market area on Friday afternoon. Police lobbed tear shell canisters and fired rubber bullets. Police tried to evict the hawkers to ease the traffic flow during the rush of Eid shopping. Primarily the cops were outnumbered and the hawkers showered brick chips forcing police to retreat
Supporters of the RJP-N hurled stones at a moving bus carrying police at Golbazar in Siraha district. 1 was arrested.

Two demonstrators were killed, and more than a dozen injured, after armed forces opened fire on a large mob which attempted to disrupt their operation and rescue three trapped militants, including Lashkar commander Junaid Mattu, in Arwani. The demonstrators gathered in the village and raised pro-Azadi slogans, and hurled rocks on the forces who retaliated with pellets, tear-smoke shells and finally bullets.
Clashes between armed forces and rioters erupted in Bandipora after police killed 2 LeT militants, and 2 rioters in Arwani village, Anantnag district.
Clashes between armed forces and rioters erupted in Pampore after police killed 2 LeT militants, and 2 rioters in Arwani village, Anantnag district.
Clashes between armed forces and rioters erupted in Sopore after police killed 2 LeT militants, and 2 rioters in Arwani village, Anantnag district.
Clashes between armed forces and rioters erupted in Srinagar after police killed 2 LeT militants, and 2 rioters in Arwani village, Anantnag district.
Suspected GJM activists torched a power station at Lodhama to retaliate against a police raid on GJM leader Bimal Gurung's office.
O June 16, in Kalimpong, suspected GJM activists torched a forest office at Tarkhola in Kalimpong to retaliate against a police raid on GJM leader Bimal Gurung's office.
117 witchcraft-linked lynching deaths reported to have occurred in Dar in 2017, 33 deaths in Mbeya, 28 deaths in Mara and 26 deaths in Geita.
117 witchcraft-linked lynching deaths reported to have occurred in Dar in 2017, 33 deaths in Mbeya, 28 deaths in Mara and 26 deaths in Geita.

117 witchcraft-linked lynching deaths reported to have occurred in Dar in 2017, 33 deaths in Mbeya, 28 deaths in Mara and 26 deaths in Geita.
A youth was critically injured with bullet wounds when rioters and police clashed in Badgam's Rangreth area. Youth pelted stones on forces who responded by firing teargas shells and bullets.

Clashes erupted at Narapora village of Shopian after a forces patrolling party entered into the village and was stoned by local youth. The clashes in the area continued for more than hour and locals alleged that the government forces damaged the property of inhabitants including vehicles.

Clashes broke out in Turkwangam village of Shopian district after youth pelted stones on a forces patrol party. The forces retaliated by firing some teargas canisters. The clashes continued for nearly an hour in the village.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
