1 officer was injured when the Special Operations Team (SOT) of Meghalaya police clashed with and apprehended Khasi Student Union (KSU) activists who were attempting arson at an unknown location in Shillong.

On June 15, in Singamari, two people were injured when police charged with tear gas and used batons after they were attacked by Gorkha activists with stones and petrol bombs as the police were returning from raiding GJM leader Bimal Gurung's office at Patlebas near Singhmari. A media van was also torched in the riot.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
3 people accused of witchcraft were killed by vigilante militias in Mugina.
Three men sustained critical injuries in a clash between the people of Tunio and Thebo communities in the area of Lalu Raink, Qambar district.

Two people were injured when a clash occurred between police and Rastriya Janata Party-Nepal (RJP-N) cadres at Kadmaha in Saptari district along the East-West Highway. The clash occurred after the RJP-N cadres pelted stones at a bus carrying police personnel deployed for local level elections.
In Mahottari, a group of RJP-N supporters vandalised the party office of Sanghiya Samajbadi Forum Nepal (SSF-N).
Kamwema residents raided Kamwema police to arrack supected livestock thieves. Police fired live bulllets and teargas to disperse the crowd.
Union tribal affairs minister Jual Oram was attacked by eggs and shown black flags by BJD and Congress activists in Kendrapara district where he attended the Sabka Sath Sabka Vikash event.
Trinamool Congress and BJP workers allegedly clashed over the filing of nomination for a co-operative society election in the Omarpur area of Sainthia in Birbhum district.

Palestinian Authority (PA) security forces imposed a curfew in the village of Taffuh in the southern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Hebron on Wednesday night, after a large family dispute left four people wounded. Palestinian police detained at least 39 Taffuh residents involved in the fight, which erupted overnight and lasted until dawn, culminating with the village's municipality building being set on fire.

assoc_actor_2: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: RJP-N cadres vandalized the vehicle of CPN-UML lawmaker Dip Narayan Shah along Bardibas-Aurahi-Jaleswor road, and attempted to attack him before he fled.
RJP-N cadres threw stones at the vehicle belonging to Dr Suresh Kumar Kanodiya, Nepali Congress mayoral candidate for Nepalgunj Sub-metropolitan City, while he was headed home.
Supporters of an independent candidate rioted in Iten prior to the arrival of Kenyatta for a political rally.
Two persons were killed and six others injured in a clash between two groups over a land dispute in Dharsul village of Fatehabad district on June 13.
Angry residents stormed and torched Runga Police Post in Kigorobya Sub-county, Hoima District following the death of a suspect while in police custody.
3-20 people were injured when ABVP and SFI supporters clashed during admission process at Teliamura Degree College. Police later arrived to manage the situation.
Locals surrounded a police team which had gone to check illegal sale of meat in Firozabad district on June 13 and prevented from doing their job. The locals allegedly also manhandled the policemen.

Kanu and Jubilee supporters have clashed in Makutano town in Kapenguria, West Pokot ahead of President Uhuru Kenyatta's visit later today. One person has been injured and rushed to hospital. Police intervened to disperse the crowd.

source: MENA English (Middle East and North Africa Financial Network)
notes: Clasheserupted between Palestinians and Israeli soldiers as soldiers stormed the Jalazoun refugee camp. Israeli soldiers fired live bullets, sound bombs and tear gas canisters against the Palestinians. Several Palestinian youths suffered from severe tear-gas inhalation during clashes.
Political parties clashed in Thika. 1 person was injured.

On June 12, around 50 cow vigilantes targeted officials of the Tamil Nadu government transporting cows from Jaisalmer to their state, pelted stones at a truck and blocked National Highway 15 on suspicion of cattle smuggling in Rajasthan's Barmer district. 4 people were injured.
Villagers resorted to rioting, vandalizing property and torching cars, following a deadly road rage incident on June 12 in Rae Bareli district, UP.
Retired personel from the military rioted in Setif in front of the local representation of the government, leading to an alleged clash with security forces.
A NASA senatorial aspirant is attacked by a crowd and deeply cut by a machete.
A suspected kidnapper is in hospital after a group attacked him after he allegedly tried to kidnap a child at Seshego Zone 1 on Sunday.

One person was killed and others injured in a clash over a land dispute in Osmani Nagar upazila of the district Sunday. One man died during a clash that took place between two rival groups at Dirrai village on Sunday.
15 people were injured in a clash between two rival groups at Mandaruka village in a clash over a land dispute in Osmani Nagar upazila of the district Sunday.

A Haredi man was assaulted in the Old City of Jerusalem Sunday morning by a group of Christians as their procession passed through the Jewish Quarter. The man was assaulted by members of the procession while he was riding on his bicycle near his home in the Jewish Quarter. Passers-by intervened on the man's behalf, pulling him away from the crowd, which had beaten him severely and left him bloodied.

Four police personnel and up to 4 villagers were injured in a Sunday night clash in Aurahi, Mahottari, over a gang rape incident. The locals encircled the police post after police allegedly prioritised rescue of one of the rapists over treatment of the 19-year-old victim.

A clash occurred between workers of the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) during rallies carried out by both the parties in the Chanesar Goth area of Jamshed Town, Karachi.

On June 11, three persons were attacked and injured while returning from the local mosque after their prayers Sunday evening for "wearing" skull caps, in Mubarikpur village in Derabassi. One of the injured was an imam at the mosque.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3,500 couples attended a mass event to formalise their marriages, according to the new law. When they realised that the Imbonerakure had turned the ceremony into a party event and that there was no food, the participants rioted. 3 people were killed in the scuffles between Imbonerakure and rioting newlyweds.

Youth and police officers from Burao clashed at Balidhiig. The authorities were resistant to a meeting organized by Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo. There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties or fatalities.

Clashes erupted between rioters and security forces at Mirbagh village of Pulwama district, after the latter began a cordon and search. The security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi-charge. The rioters pelted stones.
Youths tried to attack Nyando MP Fred Outa at a funeral on Saturday.Some of the locals started heckling speakers, demanding that Governor Jack Ranguma addresses the ceremony in Ahero.

At least 14 people, most of them local residents, were killed on 09/06 as they and soldiers clashed over food aid. The violence began after a group of soldiers tried to steal food intended for the local population. Those waiting for food reacted violently, leading the soldiers to open fire.

source: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
notes: A Palestinian was killed and six Palestinians were injured by Israeli gunfire duringclasheseast of Jabalia.
Two people were killed and three others injured in a clash between two rival groups at Bijoypur in Muktagacha upazila of the district Friday over establishing supremacy.
An ultra-Orthodox soldier in IDF uniform was attacked on Friday by residents in Jerusalem's Mea Shearim neighborhood, with police having to extract him by force and under a hail of stones.

A man accused of sexually assaulting a 4-year-old in Pandav Nagar in Delhi was lynched by a group of locals who allegedly caught him red handed at a park nearby on June 9. The victim succumbed to his injuries.
Rioters and police clashed in Anantnag after Friday prayers.
Youths threw stones at security forces in Hajin town of Bandipora after congregational prayers. Police fired tear smoke canisters to disperse them.
Rioters and police clashed in Kupwara after Friday prayers.
Minor stone pelting was witnessed in the Memender area of Shopian as part of the general unrest following the death of a rioter.
Rioters and police clashed in Pampore after Friday prayers.
Youths clashed with the security forces in Pulwama town, hurling stones and bursting firecrackers, forcing the security personnel to fire in the air to chase away the mob.
Rioters and police clashed in Sopore town after Friday prayers. rioters hurled stones at police, who fired in the air to disperse the crowds.
Clashes between rioters and police occurred in different parts of Srinagar city including Nowhatta, Soura, Noorbagh, Qamarwari, and Batamaloo, after Friday prayers.
Rioters and police clashed in Tral after Friday prayers.

On June 9, A clash took place among activists of the Communist Party of India CPI(M) and the BJP, when they were passing the same area, they threw stones at each other due to which a police officer sustained head injuries near Chirayinkeezhu, Kerala. The police inspector intervened in a bid to restore calm.

Unidentified actors hurled petrol bombs on the house of a Special Sub Inspector of Police (SSI) at Ramanuja Nagar in Mannargudi on Friday. The actors hurled two bottles, filled with petrol on the house of SSI (Crime branch) M.Sadasivam, attached to the Mannargudi police station and fled the spot. No one was injured in the attack.
2 people died in a clash between two groups of Teghani and Bijarani clans in the Katcha area of Khanpur tehsil of District Shikarpur.
Residents of a village in Talwandi Sabo in Bathinda took law into their hands and lynched an alleged drug peddler by chopping off his hand and foot on June 8. The victim succumbed to his injuries.
Two tribal women were injured in a clash between BJP and CPI(M) supporters in Khumulwng, near Agartala.
More than 20 people including police personnel and an employee of Lucknow Development Authority were injured in a clash during an anti-encroachment drive in Aishbagh on June 8.
On June 8, in Darjeeling, at least 50 police personnel were injured in stone pelting by GJM: Gorkha Janmukti Morcha supporters, who began rioting and torching 15 vehicles.

Israeli forces fired tear gas canisters at Palestinians in the east ofGazacity and east of Khan Younis in the southernGazaStrip during clashes, causing many to suffer from tear gas inhalation, including two medics.

Clashes errupted as Israeli forces opened live fire and shot tear gas canisters at Palestinian youths on Thursday east of Jabalia, injuring one Palestinian with a live bullet and causing many others to suffer from tear gas inhalation.
On 8 June, a Boko Haram supporter (civilian) was wounded during an ambush by Vigilante Militia in Gogo-Kossa.
COJER (convergence of republican youth) and supporters of Grand Yoff's municipality Madiop Diop clashed at the Youth Centre.
A man was assaulted in an alleged mob violence incident in Valhalla Park.

Three health officials, including a doctor, were attacked by villagers at an upper primary school at Lala, Hailakandi district, after rumours spread that vaccines they were distributing were causing infertility. They were taken to hospital.
Over 12 policemen were injured in a clash with residents of Ramgarh village in Badshahpur in Gurgaon on Nune 7 during an anti-encroachment drive carried out on land belonging to Ansal builders.

In an apparent retaliatory attack, unidentified actors attacked Communist Party of India (Marxist) Vatakara Area Committee office with stones in this district of Kerala on Wednesday. This could be a sequel to pelting of stones to Bharatiya Janata Party Mandalam Committee office in Vatakara allegedly by CPI (M) men who took out a march to protest attack.
Hindu Sena activists allegedly manhandled CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury at the AKG Bhavan in New Delhi on June 7.

An ugly skirmish broke out at Sathyamurthy Bhavan, the TNCC headquarters in Chennai on Wednesday, even as the state unit launched a membership drive in the state. Supporters of the state Mahila Congress chief Jhansi Rani and national secretary of the wing M Hazeena Syed clashed in the entrance hall.
Five Palestinians were wounded with live fire whenclasheserupted in the Qalqilya during a predawn detentionraid.

assoc_actor_2: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; RSS: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh
notes: A petrol bomb was allegedly thrown at BJP's district committee office in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. Kerala has witnessed several incidents of politically-charged violence, with CPI (M) allegedly at the center of this attack. No injuries were reported.
Angry pupils threw stones at supervisors and teachers during an exam because they did not allow them to cheat. No injuries were reported.

Israeli forces raided the village of Nabi Saleh whereclasheserupted between village residents and Israeli soldiers who fired rubber bullets at Palestinian youths and teargas grenades towards homes causing suffocation cases, especially among children.

assoc_actor_1: BBS: Bodu Bala Sena; Buddhist Group (Sri Lanka)
notes: A shop, owned by a leading Muslim businessman, near Wijerama junction in Akurana (assumed in Kandy district) came under arson attack by Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) members on June 6, in an attempt to create disharmony in the country by fanning racism.
The inhabitants of Eldama Ravine attacked 2 teenage boys and a man who they accused of stealing cattle. One of the boys was lynched and the others were severely injured.

A student was killed and 10 other rioters were injured in a clash between a stone-pelting mob and security forces in the Ganowpora area of Shopian district, following a cordon and search operation by the police. Police initially used smoke shells, but later resorted to open firing.
At least four passengers aboard a train were injured when a mob of students who had failed in the 12th standard examination conducted by
On June 6, villagers from Bareh village assaulted a Dalit family in over the use loudspeakers in the neighborhood during a function.

On June 6 in Nasirpur village post the killing of a Hindu youth, villagers torched the tractor of the accused and also tried to ransack their house. Both communities fought a pitched battle before para-military force was summoned to control the situation.
Israeli soldiers stationed on the borders between southeastGazaStrip andIsraelon Tuesday opened fire and killed one Palestinian and wounded three others during a clash.

Israeli forces raided the village of Beit Ummar sparkingclashesbroke out between Palestinians in the village and Israeli soldiers, resulting in dozens of citizens suffering from fainting and suffocation due to the teargas.
Villagers attacked a team of policemen and damaged their vehicles when they intervened to save two persons accused of practising witchcraft from being lynched in the Town area of Gumla district.
A suspected member of a street gang is lynched by vigilantes.
A man believed to be the murderer and rapist responsible for two bodies found is fighting for his life after he was stoned and beaten by angry NU2 residents in Mdantsane.

Three students of a private university were injured in an attack by their fellow students on the campus in the Telihaor area in Syljhet city on Monday for an unknown reason.The attackers are the members of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL).

Around a dozen policemen were injured when mobs attacked them as they were trying to quell a clash between two communities near Ranchi on Monday night. Nearly half a dozen vehicles were damaged in the violence and prompted heavy police deployment in the area. At least 60 people from both sides were arrested.
An angry mob torched as many as three buses near Hata Chhak in Pipili on NH-316 after a couple going by a moped was run over by a bus.
On June 5, villagers angry over the killing of a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader attacked policemen and burnt a police response vehicle (PRV) at Agra's Mehra Naharganj village.

NASA [National Super Alliance] supporters burnt Jubilee campaign materials in Kisii town on Monday [5 June]. They temporarily blocked the road outside the Capital Hotel roundabout as they burnt the posters on the road.

actor1: Police Forces of Palestine (1994-) West Bank
notes: Palestinian security forces conducted a raid into Balata refugee camp sparking armed clashes with locals that left two injured.
A police officer was injured, and his car set alight when communal clashes continued in North 24 Paraganas district over an "objectionable" Hindu post on Facebook.
Jubilee and NASA supporters clashed at a rally in Kapsabet.
Two Palestinians were injured with live ammunition duringclasheswith Israeli forces that erupted early Sunday afternoon in the village of al-Mughayyir.

Clashesbroke out in the southern border, east of the village of Khuzaa, during which time a Palestinian man was shot with live ammunition in the foot. The Israeli army reported that riots had taken place in several parts of the Gaza Strip, as Palestinians had attempted to damage to Israel's separation barrier.
Detectives were attacked in Meah Sharim in an incident that escalated into a riot. Rioters threw stones at the officers and blocked roads with dumpsters before setting them on fire.
A man suspected of witchcraft was beaten to death by people in his village, Karagara. His house was also burned down.

A young man was killed and five others were injured in a clash at Kanaipur village in Nabiganj upazila on Saturday morning over mosque land dispute. Both groups being equipped with homemade weapons locked into a fierce clash around 10am, which left Sabur dead on the spot and five others injured.
The Manayaweli Mosque at Trincomalee came under arson attack on June 3. The attackers are assumed to be Buddhist due to the recent trend of communal violence in the country.

On Saturday, tension prevailed in Cumbum town in Theni district of Tamil Nadu after people belonging to two communities started pelting stones at each other over a dispute over using water in a tank. A police inspector sustained a head injury in the stone pelting. A large number of police personnel were deployed to bring the situation under control.

actor2: ECOMIG: Economic Community of West African States Mission in Gambia (2017-)
notes: At Kanilai on 3 June the military could be seen patrolling the streets. Armed youth engaged the police in running battles.
A municipal mayor was hospitalized after a group of people beat him up for allegedly firing a gun in Maasin, Iloilo on June 3.

One person was killed and several others injured on Friday in clashes between rival political groups in Bungoma county in Western Kenya. The two groups engaged in violent confrontations after their candidates were cleared by the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) to contest in the Aug. 8 general elections. Police fired teargas to disperse them.
Israeli forces reportedly shot two Palestinians with live bullets duringclasheseast of Khan Yunis in the southern besiegedGazaStrip. Their conditions were described as moderate at the hospital.

An angry mob torched over 100 houses in Langadu upazila on Friday over the killing of a Jubo League leader, leaving four people injured. To avert further trouble, the local administration imposed section 144 in the upazila while the patrol of Army and Border Guard Bangladesh was beefed up.
Two groups clashed in a dispute over sowing of fields assumed in Rasra in Ballia on June 2.

In the centralGazaStrip,clasheserupted east of al-Bureij refugee camp, during which Israeli forces shot a Palestinian man in the foot with a live bullet. The man, who was reported to be in his thirties, was transferred to Shuhada al-Aqsa hospital in Deir Balah for medical care.
During arrests, ultra-Orthodox men gathered around police officers and threw stones at them. They were dispersed by law enforcement agents.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: There were clashes between police and rioting students from the University of Mbandaka.
Following a murder, a vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspect in Ogboko, Ideato South LGA.
Rioters from among the protesters in El-Kamour invaded the office of the hospital director of Remada and forced him to go back home while also harrasssing him and his family at his private home.

On Thursday night, at Dhaka University, a group of BCL activists, led by DU unit BCL vice president Ariful Islam, beat up Ismail Ahmed Mubin, a maters student of Anthropology Department for an unknown reason.

Six farmers, including Coordination Committee of different farmers' outfits 'Kisan Kranti' leader Jayaji Suryawanshi, were injured when numbers of riots were attacked by fruit traders of Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) at Jadhavadi in Aurangabad on Thursday.
A Congress party office was set on fire and three vehicles were damaged by unknown persons in Ri-Bhoi district.

On June 1, Two groups of people quarrelled with each other that led to a clash, they threw stones at each other, two police officers were injured and two vehicles were damaged. The reason behind the quarrel was that youth near Kaatu Pallivasal Road area in Cumbum teased women residing in the area.
Pupils from the Ibn Khaldoun scholary group in Souk Ahras threw eggs at the administrative personel. No injuries were reported.
An Oshakati man succumbed to the injuries he sustained after a mob beat him for allegedly robbing a woman at the Oneshila location in Oshakati.
2 people accused of banditry were killed by a crowd in Mbandaka.
Congress and BJP workers turned violent with both parties pelting stones at each other in Ahmedabad on May 31 over the issue of cow slaughter. The police detained 30 Congress workers.
Half-a-dozen Bajrang Dal activists were injured in stone-pelting when their bus was stopped on Zakir Hussain Road in Sardar Chowk, Hazaribagh.
Looting continued unabated in parts of KwaMashu, north of Durban where mobs fought running battles with thinly stretched police after a break-out of violence linked to xenophobia.

The lynching of an alleged motor thief pushed his friends to go to the street to look for the responsible taxi-drivers for revenge. Police intervention prevented the clashes, although the taxi vehicles were stoned.
A Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) - Madras PhD scholar was allegedly beaten up on Tuesday by right-wing students (BJP) for organizing 'Beef Fest' in the campus.

A clash broke out between supporters of two different groups during the counting process of the zila panchyat samiti elections, held at the Government College for Men, Sector 11,Chandigarh on May 30.Four people were arrested and two vehicles were damaged.

In Bhopal, members of the Hindu community wanted to pray in a temple inside the hospital campus next to the newly discovered minarets. They were not allowed to do so by the administration. The trouble started in Peer gate area in on Tuesday evening and spread throughout the city, which saw intermittent stone pelting for over 3 and a half hours. Two groups clashed and at least 4 vehicles were set on fire near Peer Gate.

A security guard saved the District Forest office at Nongstoin from being razed by flames after unidentified assailants lobbed a petrol bomb at the facility. Incidents of petrol bombings had been on the rise in the state over the past few days.

MP Baijayant Panda faced opposition from party workers at Mahanga of Cuttack district, who threw eggs and stones at him and clashed with his supporters after he came there to inaugurate an overhead water tank project.
At least two are dead during clash among APC members during violent party primaries in Oshodi. Among the dead included a NURTW leader and APC member.

An activist of ruling Awami League was killed and five others injured in a clash between two factions of the party over tender allotting at Charmatha intersection of Bera municipality on Monday night. There was a dispute between two local AL activists Alim Khan and Safi Hossain over allotting tender.Sequel to the dispute, the groups locked into a clash at around 9pm, leaving six people, including Alim, critically injured.

A mob of over 500 tribal's supported by Jungle Jamin Janjivan Andolan attacked the forest team headed by RFOs MR Nadge and Kiran Parmar so as to register their right on the forest land on May 29 at Khedpa village in Dadra and Nagar Haveli.
Supporters of NASA and Jubilee threw stones at each other outside Kenyatta International Conference Centre (KICC) as President Uhuru Kenyatta presented his papers to the electoral body for clearance.

assoc_actor_2: Muslim Group (Sri Lanka); Labour Group (Sri Lanka)
source: Global English (Middle East and North Africa Financial Network)
notes: Members of the Tamil community assaulted three Muslim construction workers on suspicion of raping three minors on May 28 in Peruveli, Mallikaitheevu, Trincomalee.
Residents from Chileka in Blantyre burnt a man suspected to be a thief.

Petrol bombs were hurled and vehicles burnt at the Laban, Nongmynsong, Rynjah, Mawkhar and Lumdiengjri areas of Shillong. Police are unsure of who is behind the attacks, although it is possibly related to the arrest of a KSU leader.
Two groups clashed at a masjid located on the Rahon Road in Ludhiana on May 28. 11 people were injured.

A man was beaten to death allegedly by his cousins over land dispute at Bashpur village in Kashiani upazila on Saturday.Jahangir Khan of the village had an enmity with his cousins-Alamgir and Lutfur - over the ownership of a piece of land. On Saturday, an altercation ensued among them over the issue.
Residents of Hazar Khwani in Peshawar came out of their houses and tried to besiege the grid station, but were thwarted by police. PESCO claims they did manage to damage the grid though beforehand.
An angry crowd attacked a member of the ruling political part (New Forces for Madagascar) in Tsarahonenana accusing him of embezzling money for the district. The man survived.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Anantnag after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.

Chief education officer (CEO) Anantnag Ghulam Rasool Shah was injured when his vehicle came under stone pelting at Bijbehara. People were rioting after the death of an HM commander in a Tral encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Kakapora after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Khanabal after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Kralpora after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Kupwara town after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Pampore after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.
Clashes between rioters and forces erupted in Pulwama after the killing of an HM leader in Tral during an encounter.

In the Ramallah-area village of Nabi Saleh, Israeli forces shot and injured two Palestinians with live bullets, and one with rubber-coated bullets, while an Israeli soldier was injured after a rock thrown by a Palestinian struck her in the face.

One person was injured in a stone-pelting incident on the Guwahati-Silchar special train carrying the BJP office-bearers, supporters, and cadres to a meeting. The incident happened between New Haflong and Mahur, and the injured was taken to hospital.

The Sangrur administration on May 26 put off the auction of 16 acres of village common land reserved for Dalits in Jhaloor village (Sangrur, Punjab) after two groups clashed in the presence of police, leaving two men injured.
Rioters threw rocks at police forces in Ajdir. Security material is stolen by the rioters.
A group of Israeli settlers attacked a number of commercial shops owned by Palestinians on Friday in Hebron district near Israel's Kiryat Arba settlement.

In the northern Gaza Strip a Palestinian was injured with a live bullet in his foot, while 15 others suffered from tear gas inhalation, including six medics, during clashes with Israeli forces. A Palestinian Red Crescent ambulance was also damaged by an Israeli tear gas canister.
A number of Palestinians were injured during clashes that erupted with Israeli forces at a checkpoint in southern Qalqiliya city in the northern West Bank.
Residents of Ruhanza assaulted a couple accused of sorcery. The woman died during the attack, her husband was rescued by neighbours and taken to the clinic.
A mob attacks and kills a man they suspect of murder.

At least seven people were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) of Moulvibazar Govt. College unit on Thursday. Supporters of both the groups locked into a clash and chasing and counter chasing, leaving seven injured.

At least 10 people were injured in a clash between two groups of motor workers over the election of district motor workers union in Shiroil bus terminal area of Rajshahi city early Thursday. The two groups attacked and counter-attacked each other with home made sharp weapons.
In yet another case of mob lynching in Jharkhand, a 20-year-old man was thrashed on the suspicion of child theft in Telco, Jamshedpur. He was taken to hospital by police.

Clashes between members of the Youth Congress and Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha during the siege of the Left Democratic Front on Thursday. Police intervened to disperse the militants using water canons. Day 2

Communal clashes erupted in at Ladia locality in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on May 24 late night. Members of both communities pelted stones at each other. The police had to intervene to bring the situation under control.

Four Palestinians were injured, while others suffered from tear gas inhalation Thursday evening duringclashesthat erupted near an Israeli military checkpoint at the southern entrance of Qalqilya city in the northern occupiedWest Bank.

A group of people allegedly stormed the building and set a section of it alight. The mayor of Ditsobotla Local Municipality in Lichtenburg was held hostage by the community.

Several policemen were injured and several protesters killed in violent clashes that errupted when police tried to enter the al-Fida Square in Diraz. Five persons sustained critical injuries in a clash between the people of Jatoi and Mahar communities in the jurisdiction of PS- Bachal Bhayo, near Chak. The clash erupted over a land dispute, and both sides used sticks and stones.

On Tuesday, two elderly women of Gosaidanga village in Purulia were attacked following the death of a child. A large mob had gathered around the house. 8 people arrested by the police.
An angry mob in a village in Lilongwe has beaten to death a man who wanted to steal goats in the village.
Two factions of the district unit of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) clashed at its office in Karnal on May 23, leaving district unit president Amit Kumar and parliament in charge Anup Sandhu injured.

In Bhopal, the state-level meeting of Samajwadi Party held on Tuesday became a war zone when the members belonging to rival factions assaulted a few other. District presidents of the party came for the meeting, but they were stopped from entering the venue and locked into a clash with supporters of Gauri Yadav.

All India Students' Association (AISA) and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) members clashed at Delhi University on May 23, during the new admission period over the issue of conducting entrance exams online for some courses.
Two groups clashed with each other for hours in the presence of the police in Kullha village near Tarn Taran over the demolition of a poultry farm for the construction of a drain on May 23.
Clashes erupted between members of the upper-caste Thakur community and Dalits at Badagon village in Saharanpur on May 23 following BSP chief Mayawati visit to the region.

Villagers retaliated and set fire to an SUV, two JCB machines and 12 trucks that were lined up to transport the sand. In the melee, another person died. He is said to have been working for the contractors.

A vigilante mob attacked and lynched four land speculators they were suspected of being cult members. The attack caused a fear of reprisal from residents, who later fled the area in large number.
Palestinian youth was shot dead during clashes with Israeli forces in Nabi Saleh on Friday.

As many as four police personnel were injured, a police bike was torched and two other vehicles were damaged in a stone pelting incident that took place during the funeral procession of a murder suspect on Monday. Police on Tuesday apprehended 26 persons for hurling stones. During funeral procession Amer Ali at Sriram Nagar in Borabanda, his relatives and acquaintances allegedly hurled stones at suspect Narender's house. Anticipating violence during the procession, a few policemen were present at the spot. The actors, however, did not withhold themselves from hurling stones at the police personnel and torching the blue colt's bike.

Medical services at Lari Cardiology Centre in the King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow were hit on May 9 after attendants of a patient, who died due to alleged medical negligence, entered into a brawl with resident doctors and allegedly injured one of them. The attendants also damaged hospital property and tried to attack doctors with broken glass pieces.
6 people sustained injuries, including 1 police officer, in a clash between two groups of slum communities in Kolkata. The police had intervened to disperse the mob.
Indigenes of Biogbolo looted and burnt down Igbo traders' shops in the area. They alleged that an Igbo man had recently murdered a girl.

Unidentified persons allegedly hurled six petrol bombs at a BJP functionary's house at Devakottai in the small hours on Tuesday. Muthuraman (65), state secretary of BJP's Tamil development wing, was staying along with his family members at Sarswathi Vasaka Salai in Deevakottai. There were no injuries.
8 men were injured when a clash erupted between two groups of Khoso and Buriro communities over the hunting of birds in village Dars, near Moro.
On May 8, a Congress block leader was attacked by allegedly armed members of AAP in Guru Arjan Dev Nagar in Ludhiana.

A Congress worker was attacked by a few men over an alleged old rivalry case in Ludhiana. A video, dated May 8, showed the men beat up the Congress worker in his house with sticks and a chair. Reports suggest it was allegedly over political rivalry.

At least four people, including two police officers, sustained injuries in communal clashes that broke out in Jharkhand's Chaibasa between Hindu and Muslim communities over a conflict between local teens. The police used force to disperse the crowd after unidentified persons opened fire.

Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf and Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz's workers members started chanting slogans and hurling stones at each other at Karachi Press Club. Police reached the site of contention and brought the situation under control with the help of the local leaders of both the parties.

Israeli forces raided the village of Sabastiya firing tear gas at Palestinians holding a sit-in in solidarity with hunger-striking Palestinian prisoners, causing the sit-in tent to catch fire. Clashes erupted after the fire.

Residents of Madede in Mzimba District burnt to death a 34-year-old man identified as Biko Mhlanga for allegedly breaking into a house of a businessperson where he is alleged to have stolen K600, 000.

IUML men attacked police personnel at Valayam on Saturday while a march was being taken out by the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) workers. They were arrested.

An assistant professor at JNU on Saturday alleged some persons vandalised his car and threw stones at his house for organising an event on the varsity campus to condole the death of jawans in Sukma and Kupwara.
A clash broke out between members of Trinamool Congress and the BJP at Shibpur in Howrah on Saturday evening.
Several people were injured Saturday when they were pelted with stones as two political rival groups clashed in Eldoret town.

Settlers from the illegal Yitzhar settlement attacked Palestinian residents in the village of Urif on Saturday, sparking further clashes between Palestinians locals and the Israeli army forces that raided the area to protect the settlers.

Six persons sustained critical injuries in a clash between two groups of Soomro community in Jhangal village. The clash began as a land dispute, and both sides attacked each other with sticks and stones.
Two persons were killed in a clash over property on Friday night in Bhambhuwali Dhani (cluster of houses) near Hanumangarh.

Supporters of a losing candidate assaulted a government school teacher with iron rods, fracturing his leg, on April 28 for refusing to vote for their candidate in the recently concluded municipal elections in south Delhi's Neb Serai locality in Chhatarpur.
rioters clashed with police and security forces after Friday prayers in Pulwama town. Police and security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi charge. The rioters pelted stones.

rioters clashed with police and security forces after Friday prayers in the Nowhatta area of Srinigar. Police and security forces burst smoke shells and resorted to lathi charge. The rioters pelted stones.

Violence broke out at Allahabad University campus on Friday after the arrest of four students for allegedly disrupting a meeting and violating prohibitory orders. The students allegedly hurled stones at the police personnel, damaging a number of vehicles parked nearby and indulged in arson.
