The commissioner-nominee of Osun State escaped being lynched by crowd while attending a funeral held for a Senator at his country home in Ede. The rioters believed the Senator was complicit the death of the commissioner and demanded that he leave the service.

Police evacuated two Israelis from an Arab neighborhood in East Jerusalem on Sunday night after rocks were thrown at them. The police officers were called to Sur Baher to retrieve the two men, who reportedly went to the area for business. As they left the area, a riot broke out and Molotov cocktails and rocks were hurled at a police car. There were no injuries but the vehicle sustained damaged.
A vigilante mob lynches and nearly kills a suspected human parts dealer in the Adewole area of Ilorin.
At least seven students were injured in a clash between two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) at Dhaka University's Sir AF Rahman Hall on Sunday night.
DP supporters clashed with police forces outside the Tropic Inn Hotel in Masaka. The police used teargas and live ammunition to clear the crowd that gathered outside the police station.
Giridih subdivisional officer and three policemen sustained injuries today when cow vigilantes clashed with them in Bengabad (Giridih, Jharkhand).

Several Palestinians clashed with Israeli forces and suffered from severe tear gas inhalation on Sunday after Israeli troops stormed the outskirts of the southern occupiedWest Bankvillage of Beit Ummar on Sunday.

Israeli forces shot and injured three young Palestinian men, one of them critically, and detained two others duringclashesin the village of Kafr Malik in the central occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Ramallah on Sunday.
Residents of Manga village in Bumba territory burned a woman who they accused of witchcraft. Following the attack they deserted the village for the bush to avoid potential reprisals from the police.

After voting delays in the ODM primary, supporters of MP Badi Twalib and aspirant Dan Aloo clashed outside Kwashee primary school polling centre. Mr Aloo' s supporters claimed the delays were to enable rigging.
A fight broke out between supporters of the DPP and MCP attending the funeral of Chief Lukwa's mother. Some vehicles were smashed and senior government officials had to be rushed to safety.
Three Muslim men were allegedly assaulted by members of People for Animals (PFA), an animal rights group, in Kalkaji area in South Delhi on Saturday night for transporting buffaloes in a truck.

Two groups of liquor sellers clashed over the selling of liquor in each other's area at the premises of the Civil Hospital in Sultanpur Lodhi on Saturday night, leaving eight persons injured. Eye witnesses said the fight continued for over two hours in which hospital property and vehicles were also damaged. Liquor shops are being relocated to residential areas following a Supreme Court order banning the sale of liquor within 500 metres of national and state highways.

Activists of Bajrang Dal, Vishwa Hindu Parishad and other Hindu outfits hurled stones and roughed up policemen at Agra's Sadar Bazaar police station on April 22, demanding the release of five men who had been held for allegedly assaulting people from a minority community.
Residents of Yizhar settlement attacked villages in the occupied West Bank south of Nablus. The army arrived and used anti-riot methods to disperse the Palestinians, injuring four with gun fire.
Youths stormed the Msambweni polling station demanding to know why names were missing from the ODM register.
2 vanilla robbers were killed in a mob attack after they were caught in Ampanefena in the district of Vohemar.

Youths destroy ballot boxes and papers at Kiamugumo Primary School polling centre on 21/04/2017 disrupting the Jubilee Coalition primaries. They arrived to the polling station, when Anne Waiguru was voting, outpowering the police forces securing the station.
A thief was caught by residents, who assaulted him until he lost consciousness. He died in hospital.

A man was killed and 20 others were injured in a clash between two rival groups over establishing supremacy at Khalia village in Sadar upazila on Friday. The newly elected chairman of Jalalabad Union, and his rival Mitul had long been at loggerheads over establishing supremacy.
On Friday, the local Awami League men vandalised the nameplate of the livestock centre named after the minister and beat up the upazila livestock officer.

Residents of Fatehgarh village tied Public Health Engineering Department officials to a pillar at a waterworks office in Dhikadha village of Charki Dadri district on Friday, to protest severe water shortage.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: Forces resorted to teargas shelling after a large number of youths pelted stones on them at Muran Chowk in Pulwama district. The rioting youth targeted police and CRPF vehicles with stones while in retaliation forces fired tear-smoke shells.

Clashes occurred in Sopore when hundreds of rioters took to streets outside Jamia masjid in Sopore after Friday prayers. Security forces deployed in the area burst teargas shells to disperse the rioters, who were pelting stones.

Junior doctors at the Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) at Uma Nagar (Muzaffarpur, Bihar) started rioting, setting on fire some 10 vehicles, including an ambulance, in Muzaffarpur, 70 kms north of Patna on Friday. Police had to resort to baton charge to quell the mob and bring the situation under control. At least 10 persons, including junior doctors, sustained injuries in the violent clash with locals.

One person was killed allegedly in police firing and eight constables were injured in a clash between police and a group of nomads at Silariya village in Nagaur district on Friday evening. The nomads, belonging to the Vanbagariya community, attacked the police with sticks and other weapons when the latter entered the village in the search for a wanted person.

At least 12 students were injured in a clash between two groups of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) at Salimullah Muslim Hall of Dhaka University on Thursday night. Both the groups, equipped with rods, sticks and local weapons, attacked each other, leaving 12 injured from the two sides.
Students took hostage the mayor asking for the withdrawal of the administrative document.
A 34-year-old robbery suspect in the central district of Ntcheu was killed by an angry mob.

A group of people attacked police today after two schoolchildren were killed and 11 others were injured when the auto-rickshaw they were travelling in collided with a truck on National Highway 60 in West Midnapore.

source: Jordan News Agency (Petra); Palestine News Network (PNN)
notes: 18 youth were injured when violent clasheserupted early Thursday between Palestinian youths and the Israeli forces in the Abu Dis town, east of the occupied Jerusalem.
An angry mob of villagers killed an unknown man who was caught stealing goats in Chisikwa village
After a commercial motorcyclist fell and injured during an arrest, a 'mob' attacked members of FRSC in Igbo-Ukwu 'recently.' Source dated 19/04.

assoc_actor_1: UPND: United Party for National Development
notes: UPND cadres armed with pangas caused chaos in the Kamwala Market in Lusaka, before the police intervened and arrested 7 of them.

Kashmiri students studying in Mewar University in Gangrar town of Chittorgarh district were injured when they were beaten up with sticks and bats by locals on Wednesday evening, after the locals got to know that they are from Kashmir. At least six of them were injured.

Communal violence erupted in Seelon Kalan village in Dehlon on Wednesday after members of two groups attacked each other over holding of prayers at a martyrs' place. As many as 10 persons from both groups suffered injuries in the stone pelting. The police rushed to the spot to maintain law and order.
Police officers arresting a teenager caught with drugs in Manenberg came under attack from angry residents, who pelted their vehicles with stones, demanding that the man be released.
Students at Kabale Brainstorm high school rampaged and attacked their cooks as they tried to serve them breakfast and smashed several window panes prompting police to fire teargas to disperse them.
A man from Kabumba was stoned by community members who caught him in the act of robbery.
Supporters for different aspirants for the Jubilee ticket in Ruiru clash.
A group protesting against vote rigging claims attacks a lawmaker's aide at Aberdares Country Club hotel, near Githunguri on the evening of 18/04.
A Jubilee parliamentary aspirant has been admitted at a Eldoret hospital after he was attacked by people said to be his rival's supporters.

Six cars were damaged by people throwing stones in Vuwani during protest action. Two people were killed in Vuwani in Limpopo on when the car they were travelling in crashed into a pipe that was being used to barricade a road (during a protest), and burst into flames.

Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) men clashed with police as they tried to stop the construction work of a swimming pool in Chittagong outer stadium in the city on Tuesday, leaving seven people injured.
Two people were killed and 15 others, including a union parishad (UP) member, injured in a clash between two rival groups over establishing control at Rahimpur in Muradnagar upazila on Tuesday night.

In Janakpur, security personnel clashed briefly with the party cadres as the former attempted to capture the stage. The party's central leaders including Dharmendra Bastola and Ishwori Dahal were scheduled to address the function
On 18 April, an unidentified group set fire to a Catholic church in Lalitpur district. This was the second attack on the house of worship.
A polling agent was injured in a clash between Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) and Pakistan Muslim League - N (PML-N) workers at the union council Thoha Marham khan, Talagang.
BJP men allegedly attacked a police station in Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday night to free a party colleague who had been detained earlier. The men stole also a motorcycle.

Kazigaon Police last night resorted to blank fire and lathicharge to disperse a group of people at the police station under Parbatjhora Subdivision in Kokrajhar district. The incident took place when an unruly group of people tried to enter the police station premises to release four villagers picked up by the police last evening in connection with a witch-hunting case in the area.
A community health centre in Srigouri, in south Assam's Karimganj district, was reportedly vandalised following the death of a 45-year-old patient last evening.
A party office was damaged in Pune during a clash between 2 factions of the BJP on 18 April 2017. Activists clashed over an issue pertaining to nominations.
The tension since morning broke out into a clash between "jote" supporters and those from Trinamool at Aminabad-Shiekpara in Domkal, 40 kilometres from Behrampore town.
A vigilante mob lynches three suspected thieves in Adikpo.

actor2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) Prison Guards
notes: At least 49 convicts were injured during a clash with guards at El Huda prison in Omdurman. The incident occurred after prison guards reportedly insulted the inmates when conducting a personal inspection of the inmates and their luggage upon orders from the new prison director.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Sudan); NCP: National Congress Party; Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) University Police
notes: Clashes between ruling NCP student supporters and Darfuri students at the University of Sennar in Al-Suki area. NCP supporters reportedly attacked the Darfuri students at their hostel and looted their belongings. In parallel, security personnel reportedly injured Darfuri students within the university, and arrested around 11.
On April 18, clashes erupted in the city of Tulkarm between Palestinian youth and Israeli forces.
A man was killed by members of a community, who accused him of stealing cassava.
Students clashed with police outside the Tribunal of Sfax. Several students were injured.
Activists of Bangladesh Agricultural University (BAU) Unit of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) on Monday beaten up a former Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) activist.
On 17 April, unidentified persons set a Nepali Congress liaison office on fire in Gulara (Lamkichuha-6, Kailali district).
People nabbed the man accused of beating and shooting a woman over a land dispute in Mainpuri district on Monday night, and beat him to death in front of the police.
An officer was injured after students and police clashed in Srinagar. Students of S.P. College blocked Maulana Azad Road, and began pelting stones when police tried to disperse them with tear gas.
Several students from Jinja SS, Jinja Progressive Academy, St Peter's SS and Jinja Modern SS have been involved in street fights that have left some hospitalized.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions
notes: At least six labourers received serious injuries in Abohar on Monday in a clash between members of the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) and Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS) over the lifting of wheat bags from the Sadulshehar grain market in Sriganganagar.

Two factions of ODM clash, those loyal to Governor John Mruttu and those of National Assembly Minority Whip Thomas Mwadeghu, at a party meeting over vote tampering. The two sides also became violent on 16/04 over the choice of election clerks.
Supporters of two governor primary candidates (Joseph Ole Lenku and Tarayia Ole Kores) of the Jubilee party clashed on 17/04/2017 in Namanga. Seven people were injured but there were no fatalities.
ODM supporters of John Mbadi clash with those of Caroli Omondi at a party rally in Magunga on 17/04. Two reported injuries.

Israeli troops shot and injured more than 11 Palestinians with rubber-coated steel bullets while 23 others suffered from severe tear gas inhalation duringclashesMonday night in the towns of Abu Dis and al-Eizariya in the Jerusalem district of the occupiedWest Bank.

Israeli troops shot and injured more than 11 Palestinians with rubber-coated steel bullets while 23 others suffered from severe tear gas inhalation duringclashesMonday night in the towns of Abu Dis and al-Eizariya in the Jerusalem district of the occupiedWest Bank.

At least 15 people were injured and three houses vandalised in a dispute between members of a local church and residents in Mokhurumela, outside Senwabarana in Limpopo. Church members started hurling stones at the tavern and tavern owner's house.

assoc_actor_1: BBS: Bodu Bala Sena; Buddhist Group (Sri Lanka)
notes: Four shops owned by Muslims were attacked with petrol bombs in Godapitiya, Porruva on April 16. The extremist Buddhist organisation, Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) led by Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thero, is alleged to be behind the attack.
18 persons have sustained injuries in an altercation that broke out over land issue on Sunday morning at Ghusukpurtol, Ward-7 of Maulapur Rural Municipality.
Four men sustained critical injuries in a clash between the people of Suhag and Markhand communities over a land dispute in Lahori Mohalla, Larkana. Both sides used sticks and stones in the fight.

1 youth was injured when clashes erupted in Heff, Shopian district after forces launched an operation following inputs about the presence of militants. Police fired teargas shells to disperse stone-throwing demonstrators, who were attempting to allow the militants to escape.
Unidentified men pelted stones on the car of BJP legislator from Bhuj Nima Acharya and smashed its window panes near Loriya village of Kutch district on Sunday. Acharya escaped unhurt.

Social women activist who expressing their views on triple 'talaq' and 'halala' were attacked by a group of about 60 persons in Lucknow on Sunday evening who manhandled and abused them and called them anti-Islam.

Two factions of ODM clash, those loyal to Governor John Mruttu and those of National Assembly Minority Whip Thomas Mwadeghu, at a party meeting over vote tampering. The two sides also became violent on 16/04 over the choice of election clerks.
Residents corner and kill a man accused of joining in on a land seizure in which a local was killed.
A man was mobbed to death by an angry crowd in Pleebo Sodoken Statutory District of Maryland County after he was accused of attempting to kidnap a baby for ritualistic purpose.

The Buganda Kingdom Finance Officer hired a militia to evict 50 people from Bugabo Village. The militia drove a tractor through people's fields and used machetes to clear the crops and destroy housing. The angry residents set the tractor alight. Police have subsequently arrested 16 of the militia.
Bajrang Dal men and a few women assaulted a 60-year-old man accused of raping a 12-year-old girl on April 15 when he was brought to district court in Bijnor (UP). The police did not intervene.

Shivraj Raju, reporter of Punjabi daily Ajit posted at Gidderbaha, on Saturday alleged that nearly a dozen Congressmen (including Charanjit Singh Dhillon, president of Truck Operators'Ao Union of Gidderbaha) assaulted him at his office near Bharu chowk and forced him to drink alcohol and urine. He claimed that they made a video clip of the incident and also vandalised his office before fleeing. He sustained injuries on his chest and abdomen.

A youth was shot dead by police during clashes in Batamaloo between rioters and police. After the killing, clashes spread to more areas of Srinagar. Police fired smoke shells, while rioters threw stones.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
In Migori, unidentified youths invaded a rally in Sori Town on Saturday evening, forcing ODM activist Peter Jobando, a licensed firearm holder, to fire in the air several times.
During the year 2017, 66 people were lynched in Mozambique, including 15 in Zambezia, 11 in Tete (3 already coded in dataset) and 9 in Nampula.General area coded as the specific areas not available
"Rampaging youths" run riot, vandalize a local monarch's palace in Igbara Odo over a financial issue. One death reported. Police restored order, imposed a curfew on the town.
One person was killed and three others, including a woman, were injured in a clash between two groups over a land dispute in Jandli Khurd village of Fatehabad on April 14.
Amid cordon, clashes erupted between stone-pelting youth and government forces in uptown area of Tral after congregational Friday prayers. Police were there searching for a militant hideout.

Violence broke out at Munder village under the Mangalor police station in Uttarakhand early on Friday after some posters and banners of Dr B.R. Ambedkar, a Dalit icon, were burnt and torn off. An irate mob pelted stones and injured many policemen and even torched some vehicles.
A student of Abdul Wali Khan University in Mardan killed by a mob comprising of hundreds of students after being accused of blasphemy.
Police used baton charges to disperse the mob of hundreds of students that had formed at Mardan University in order to lynch an alleged blasphemous student.

Minor clashes erupted between youth and forces at the bus stand and main market in Tral during which forces used tear smoke shells on the youth who were throwing stones. They were agitating on the death anniversary of the brother of a slain Hizbul Mujahideen commander who was killed by forces in 2015.
Following clashes between Coptic Christian youth and Muslim groups, anonymous attackers set ablaze houses that were under construction thought to belong to Christians from the community.
Clashes between Muslim and Coptic Christian youth on 13 April in in Kom el-Loufi village of Samalut city, after Copts held prayers.

An angry group of people pelted stones on cars and buses bearing Meghalaya registration number at Byrnihat last night in which Leader of Opposition Donkupar Roy escaped unhurt when his car was also attacked.
Two groups of students coming from different villages clashed in the university of Khenchela. Police had to intervene to disperse the crowds.

Israeli forces raided the town of Abu Dis at noon on Thursday, causing clashes to break out between Israeli forces and Palestinian students at al-Quds University, which resulted in several Palestinians being injured.
ODM nominations in Busia County turned, with Deputy Governor Kizito Wangalwa's vehicle being smashed, its tires deflated and the driver attacked by rioting youth.
The entry of an Army vehicle into Degree College Pulwama sparked a spontaneous demostration and stone-pelting, causing the vehicle to retreat.
In Tharaka-Nithi, two supporters of Governor Samuel Ragwa were injured during the launch of Chuka/Igambangombe MP Muthomi Njuki's manifesto on April 12.
Clashes between NRM and FDC supporters at the Kamuli by-election. A man who was caught bribing voters was beaten up by a crowd of people in Kamuli town.
Sporadic clashes have been reported between police and students in Niamey following violent protests on Apr.10.

Clash between two rival groups over an alleged phone theft at the Agbogbloshie Yam Market in Accra left 2 people dead, eight others injured and caused severe property damage. Police later arrested five suspects.
Community members caught a man who had killed a child in Soweto and assaulted him but did not kill him.
Angry residents chased police to protest their late arrival at the scene of an armed robbery that left a person with a gunshot wound. Police fired shots in the air to disperse them.
A woman was killed, allegedly from the smoke of tear gas, when security forces and rioters clashed in Tahab, Pulwama.

An angry group of people vandalised a police station and a block office at Tekari in Gaya district of south Bihar, setting on fire two vehicles. The incident took place after two persons, including a minor, were injured allegedly in police firing, on Tuesday morning. Later, the police fired several rounds in the air and used baton charge.

Several officers of Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) and policemen were injured, two seriously, after a mob attacked them with 'lathis' when they had gone to Naroda to remove cattle from roads on Tuesday morning.
Two communities clashed during Hanuman Jayanti celebrations on Tuesday in Ranchi.
Rioters vandalised a Tasmac outlet in Chinnaperambattu, a village in Vellore, on 11 April 2017.
On April 11, Hindu groups took out a procession to celebrate Ram Navami-Hanuman Jayanti in Jhalda area. Some people threw stones at them, triggering further clashes.

The killing of about 200 animals(swine) by youths in Kafinkoro village, Paikoro Local Government Area of Niger State, reportedly led to a violent melee that resulted in the death of five villagers. The violence was preceded by a peaceful protest against the act.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: 2 ZANU PF factions clashed over a land dispute at Caledonia Porter Farm. No injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_1: APRC: Alliance for Patriotic Re-orientation and Construction
notes: Clashes between APRC and UDP supporters in Lamin, Kombo north, following legislative elections.

At least five persons, including police officials, were injured after two groups of revellers clashed while pulling Bhairav's chariot as a part of the Bisket Jatra at Taumadhi of Bhaktapur on Monday evening.

Two people received critical injuries when railway police allegedly thrashed some 10 passengers, including women and children, over a parking issue at the Rawalpindi Railway Station. Railway police also alleged that their officers were injured in the clash.
Groups of youths stoned security personnel in Anantnag town as part of the anti-election violence erupting in several districts.
Stone pelters and security forces clashed near the Government High School Khiram. Locals alleged that forces fired teargas shells, which landed in one of the cowsheds, triggering a fire.

Clashes erupted between youth and forces in the Natipora area of Srinagar. Forces used tear smoke shells to disperse the youth who were throwing stones on them. Violence related to the bi-election had erupted in several districts.
A local was killed when his vehicle was attacked by stone pelters while driving from Bemina towards Hyderpora. He lost control of the vehicle and crashed.
A vehicle of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) youth wing leader was set ablaze in the Charar-e-Sharif area of Badgam.
Fresh violence erupted in some areas earlier this week after talks failed to resolve the row triggered by alleged abusive remarks on social media against a particular community.
A man who was discovered to have been stealing a goat was beaten to death by inhabitants.
Hundreds marched angrily in Alexandria after a blast that targeted the local cathedral and killed at least 17 people. The news report cited clashes but gave no details.
An angry mob rioted and torched a truck after it killed a young woman in a New Karachi locality.
Two persons were killed in a clash between two groups over a piece of land in Mundogarhi village in Gharaunda block on Sunday.
A polling booth at the Government High School in Arihal Pulwama was set ablaze by rioters, as anti-election violence occurred across several districts.
On 9 April, anti-election violence erupted in Badran during polling. (No further details reported.)
1 man was killed when security forces opened fire on rioters in the Barsoo area of Ganderbal after anti-election violence erupted during polling.
On 9 April, anti-election violence erupted in Charari Sharief during polling. (No further details reported.)
A polling station was vandalised, and a vehicle set on fire in Doniwari village of Chadoora, Badgam.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: Around 12 CRPF troopers were kept hostage by rioters inside a State-run school in Galwanpora after rioters stormed the building as part of district-wide election violence.
1 teenager was killed when security forces fired on rioters in the Baroosa area of Ganderbal district after anti-election violence erupted during polling.
A school which was turned into a polling station was severely damaged by rioters in Hardulatinu Beerwah, after anti-election violence erupted across the district.

assoc_actor_1: JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: A civilian was brought to the hospital in critical condition after allegedly being thrashed by NC workers at a polling booth in a school near Jalsheri. The NC members also manhandled other voters.
1 man was killed, and at least 17 police injured when security forces fired pellet guns on stone-pelting rioters in Magam after anti-election violence erupted during polling.
On 9 April, anti-election violence erupted in Nasrullahpora during polling. (No further details reported.)
A government upper primary school being used as a polling station in Paderpora, Shopian, was set ablaze by rioters.
2 people were killed, and 4 injured when security forces opened fire on rioters who stormed a polling station near Pakherpora, Badgam, and vandalised a building housing a polling booth.
Polling stations were closed in Pymas after youth clashed with police and paramilitary personnel deployed to curb election violence.
1 man was killed when security forces opened fire on rioters in the Ratxuna Beerwah area after anti-election violence erupted during polling.
1 teenager was killed when security forces fired on rioters in Sogam after anti-election violence erupted during polling.
Twenty rioters were hit by pellets during clashes in Soibugh village of Budgam district, after anti-election violence erupted across the district.
Polling stations were closed in Sozieth after youth clashed with police and paramilitary personnel deployed to curb election violence.

2 youths were critically injured after rioters clashed with police and paramilitary personnel deployed to keep order during election polling in the Soura, Nowhatta, and Habak areas of Srinagar. Youth pelted stones on forces near the polling stations in the area.
A 35-year-old was injured after being hit by a bullet during election related clashes between rioters and police in Chek Wanihama village, Badgam.
On 9 April, anti-election violence erupted in Zainakote during polling. (No further details reported.)

Communal tension gripped Araria district headquarters town of Forbesganj in north-eastern Bihar and Bhagalpur in south-eastern Bihar, following a clash between two groups over an alleged incident of eve teasing on Sunday.

assoc_actor_1: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
assoc_actor_2: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
notes: On Sunday, two persons were seriously injured in a clash between the two AIADMK groups in R K Nagar assembly constituency, where bypoll is scheduled for April 12.

BJP leader Sanjay Tyagi, accompanied by party workers, clashed with the police in Meerut on Sunday over Tyagi'Aos son being challenged for driving a jeep with tinted film. Ankit Tyagi was later detained.
Sunday saw a near-peaceful polling for the South Contai Assembly seat in East Midnapore, barring some stray incidents of clashes between the ruling Trinamool Congress and Opposition - Left and BJP.

A clash ensued between police personnel and Madhesi Morcha cadres at Lahan in Siraha district on Saturday. The clash erupted after the Morcha cadres tried to foil the CPN-UML's party joining programme.

A Palestinian youth was injured with live fire by Israeli forces during clashes with some 200 Israeli settlers overnight between Thursday and Friday. Clashes began in Kobar and moved to Jibiya village, only to be surrounded by youths from the two villages. Israeli forces then arrived to the Jibiya village to protect the settlers, opening live fire, rubber-coated steel bullets, tear gas, and stun grenades, injuring one youth with live fire.

A group of nearly 30 women set a liquor vendor on fire in Bhungarka village under Nangal Choudhary police station in Mahendragarh district on Saturday. The shop's salesman suffered burn injuries in the incident and he was admitted to Civil Hospital in Narnaul. Liquor shops are being relocated to residential areas following a Supreme Court order banning the sale of liquor within 500 metres of national and state highways.
Poll-related violence was reported at Borisana in Kadi tehsil of Mehsana district where a clash between two groups left four people injured on Saturday.

Two groups of villagers clashed at Dubari village in Madhuban police station area of Mau district on Sunday over fish catching from a pond. The police had to open fire in the air to disperse the violent mob. Four policemen were injured in brick batting.

On April 8, inter-communal violence (assumed between Hindus and Muslims) erupted at Baghmundi market (Purulia, WB). Shops and houses, mostly belonging to Muslims, were set afire near the market. A huge contingent of policemen - including Rapid Action Force personnel - was deployed in the area to maintain peace.
A mob harassed personnel of the national fire service and vandalised fire tenders after fire gutted five shops at Gomoa Buduburam camp in Winneba. Police intervened to disperse them.
ANC demonstrators outside Luthuli House in Johannesburg grabbed and attacked one of three people, believed to be DA supporters, who ran into their march with a banner that read: "You must be joking".
Three people were injured after locals clashed with police at Sakranti Bazaar in Atharai Rural Municipality on Friday.

assoc_actor_1: APRC: Alliance for Patriotic Re-orientation and Construction
notes: Report of clash between APRC and UDP supporters in Diabugu Bapata, Sandu district in the Upper river region. Police was deployed to maintain peace.

Bhadrak, the coastal Odisha town today witnessed fresh communal violence as mobs set ablaze shops and attacked police vehicles, forcing the authorities to impose curfew. Soon after, VHP and Bajrang Dal activists started blockading traffic on the main roads and gheraoed a police station.

Ten people were arrested on Saturday after violence erupted in the Muslim-dominated Telinipara area in Hooghly district the previous night. Several houses and shops were gutted and some people suffered minor injuries. Police later brought the situation under control and deployed a strong force in the area.

A clash between members of the BJP's youth wing and members of another community took place last night at Kidderpore in the southwestern fringe of the city, one of the Muslim-dominated pockets of Kolkata.
One person is feared dead and scores injured after supporters of Funyula MP Paul Otuoma and Busia Governor Sosepeter Ojamoong clashed in Funyula over the ODM primaries
Police fired rubber bullets and tear gas at ANC supporters outside luthuli house in violent clashes. Several people were injured in the violence.

assoc_actor_1: APRC: Alliance for Patriotic Re-orientation and Construction
source: Freedom Newspaper; The Daily Observer (Banjul); FOROYAA Newspaper (Serrekunda)
notes: Clash between APRC and UDP supporters in Sibanor, Foni region, former president Jammeh's stronghold, as APRC won legislative polls, leaving at least two injured and causing property damaged. APRC supporters reportedly harassed supporters of opposition parties after they won elections. Police later arrested 26, including 24 APRC supporters and 2 UDP.
A child was injured in a crude bomb explosion in Ganka, Chapai Nawabganj, on 6 April 2017.

At least five students of AF Rahman Hall of Dhaka University were injured in a clash between two groups of activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League over watching Bangladesh-Sri Lanka second T20 International cricket match. They stated fighting with iron rods and wooden sticks. Hall Chhatra League president Hafizu Rahman, however, refused to consider the incident as a factional clash, rather terming it a misunderstanding among students.

In Atanga Sub-county, the FDC mobiliser in charge of the North and his agent were attacked by suspected NRM supporters. He was severely beaten up in Lacekocot by these individuals who were travelling aboard a tipper lorry.

A father and his son clashed with two police officers in Panchang village, Central River Region North, as the son refused to join the queue at the polling station and the father intervened to prevent the officers from arresting him. One officer was injured.
In Angagura Sub-county, the LCI chairman and his wife were beaten up at their garden in Kalawiny village. They were wearing NRM T-shirts when they were attacked by unidentified persons.
Bhadrak in Odisha saw communal violence on Thursday.

assoc_actor_1: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
assoc_actor_2: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
notes: Several people got injured after a clash broke out between the members of Sasikala and O. Pannerselvam factions of AIADMK on Thursday in R K Nagar area, where by-polls are set to be held on April 9.

Shia community members clashed with Sunni community members in Kotwali Thana locality of Aligarh on Thursday allegedly over a dispute regarding the siding of the Shia leaders the BJP on contentious issues such as triple talaq (divorce) and ban on cow slaughter.

Minor clashes broke out between Hindus and Muslims in Bengal's Purulia district over the last one week in the wake of the Ram Navami-Hanuman Jayanti celebrations. The clashes began on April 6, while chief minister Mamata Banerjee was holding an administrative meeting in the district.

A UDP supporter was injured by an independant candidate in the Brikama North legislative elections after he lost in the elections. The independant candidate reportedly attempted to disperse a crowd of UDP supporters celebrating their candidate's victory in front of his home with a stick, injuring the UDP supporter in the process. He was later arrested by police and released shortly after.

actor2: Police Forces of Liberia (2006-) Prison Guards
notes: 21 prisoners escaped from Gbarnga central prison compound in Bong County after a clash with prison guards that left at least one of them injured. A brief curfew was subsequently imposed in the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: At least 4 people were killed, including a police officer and 3 civilians, during clashes between residents near Kapolowe in the Kambove area and security forces which started over alleged extortion by the members of the security forces.

A group of people from the Ram Navami procession burned a truck carrying cows at Tenduni under Bikramganj police station area in Rohtas district. They also attacked the house of local RJD MLA Sanjay Yadav and damaged the windowpanes. Police resorted to lathicharge.
Rioters pelted stones at vehicles in Adanur on 5 April 2017 against land acquisition. Police detained 10 rioters.

Communal tension arose after members of one community allegedly started throwing stones at members of another community during a Ram Navami procession at Badhapur village in Akbarpur area in Kanpur Dehat on Wednesday night. Five people and some policemen were received minor injuries during the incident.
About 400 community members clashed with police outside the Richmond Magistrate's Court. Police retaliated with stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse the unruly crowd

Israeli forces raided several houses in Deheisha camp, causing clashes to erupt between Palestinian youth of the camp and Israeli forces who opened live fire at youth, injuring a man with three bullets.
Two suspected robbers were burnt to death and two others were injured in Ga-Kgwete near Mecklenburg in Limpopo.
On 4 April, residents set ablaze a liquor shop in Itaunja area of Lucknow city (UP) after a 10-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a drunkard.

A mob of residents attacked 3 people believed to have mugged a member of the community. The police fought the mob to rescue the alleged muggers and arrested them. The crowd then attacked the police station and had to be dispersed with teargas.

Communal tension prevailed in Nawada as two groups clashed after cut-out of Lord Ram was found damaged on Tuesday, day before Ram Navami. Meanwhile, former JD (U) MLA from Govindpur Kaushal Yadav accused Giriraj of adding fuel to the communal fire by allegedly calling upon Bajrang Dal activists to teach a lesson to "anti-national" elements in the minority community.
Villagers of Khandrai village in Gohana subdivision of Sonipat district set a local liquor shop on fire on Tuesday, to express their anger over the unauthorised sale of liquor from the old vend.

A Dalit groom was assaulted, allegedly by a group of upper-caste youth, as he was riding a mare to reach the bride's place at Sanjarwas village of Charkhi Dadri district on Tuesday night. The groom and some other members of the marriage party were taken to hospital.
Locals torched a liquor shop in Samba Kheda area on Rae Bareli road in Lucknow city on Tuesday.
2 youths suspected of a robbery were lynched by a mob in Gao. One was killed while the other was injured.

Clashes between two displaced men and two assaillants who tried to steal their motorcycle near Kassab IDP camp in Kutum, North Darfur, left two dead and one of the displaced injured. When other residents of the camp came to his rescue, they seized and and severely beat the remaining assaillant. Both the displaced man and the assaillant later died of their wounds.

Factions of the APC clash outside the state secretariat in Ibadan. The violence stemmed from a disagreement over an appointment in Akinyele Local Government Area of the state. Injury extent not known. Attempting to protest earlier in the day, one of the factions was stopped by the NURTW at Moniya. It was gathered that the NURTW members allegedly acted on the orders of state chairman, Alhaji Taofeek Oyerinde (Fele), to prevent them from holding their protest.
Factions of ODM members clash during a rally. He groups were divided over support of Governor Zachary Okoth Obado and gubernatorial candidate Ochillo Ayacko.
A crowd of residents beat and stoned a man to death. He had been caught in the act of robbing an elderly woman.
Nine persons were injured in Baghkhor, district headquarters of Dadeldhura, when a clash erupted between Nepal Police and temporary police candidates on Sunday.

Late Sunday evening, locals pelted stones at a police team of Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) that tried to remove a makeshift shop at Sundar Nagar kachi basti in Amanishah Nullah area under Vidhyadhar Nagar police station in Jaipur City (Rajasthan). Three constables were injured.

A communal clash broke out with members of two communities pelting stones at each other in Faizabad on Sunday after a dispute over establishing a religious place on public land. Police had to use force to control the mob. A dozen people and some policemen were injured.
Two Administration Police officers were attacked and set ablaze in Voi at the weekend when they were mistaken to be thugs.

Violent clashes erupted in Srinagar's Lal Chowk and adjoining Budshah Chowk and Maisuma areas following rumours about the arrest of a suspected militant, who later turned out to be a mentally-challenged youth from Nawab Bazar area of the old city. Rioters threw stones at police, who fired tear gas and charged with batons.

A 16-year-old youth was killed in a group clash allegedly over a property-related issue which took place at a religious function in the intervening night on Saturday and Sunday at Chadgaoan village in Mathura.

source: Ma'an News Agency; The Times of Israel
notes: Israeli settlers Wednesday night entered into the Palestinian village of Kifl Haris in the northern occupied West Bank district of Salfit, sparking clashes with locals youth. Reports said that the settlers entered the village in their private cars, and went to pray at a Jewish holy site in the area. During the visit, suspects threw rocks at the worshipers.

A number of Palestinian youths suffered asphyxiation early Saturday during confrontation with Israeli occupation forces in theWest Bankcity of Jenin and its camp. The Palestinian Red Crescent Society said in a statement that the occupation forces raided the city and its camp sparkingclasheswith Israeli soldiers who fired stun grenades and tear gas at Palestinian youths.
